description:
Puku Rangi Tea – Rapa Nui Music & Dance Tour in Marlborough, Experience the vibrant culture of Easter Island as Puku Rangi Tea tours for the first time in Marlborough to closing the Welcoming Week Celebration!
Since 2012, they have been dedicated to preserving and showcasing traditional Rapa Nui music and dance. Their vibrant performances include the Hoko warrior dance, resonating with the spirit of the Māori Haka, storytelling through Takona body painting and ancestral narratives, Kai Kai string games and the rhythmic sounds of Tahitian ukulele and drums.
Puku Rangi Tea currently performs three shows a week at the Tahatai Hotel in Hanga Roa, Rapa Nui, and has participated in various festivals throughout its history, including:
Indigenous festival 2023–2024, San Juan de la Costa, Chile.
World Gathering of Folkloric Associations 2020, Lima, Peru.
International Festival 2018–2019, Málaga, Spain.
Chapultepec Forest Festival 2018, Mexico City, Mexico.
Second Workshop on Rapa Nui Music and Dance 2018, Mexico City, Mexico.
Rapa Nui Dance and Music Show 2018, Mexico City and Morelia, Michoacán, Mexico.
First Workshop on Rapa Nui Music and Dance 2017, Mexico City, Mexico.
Rapa Nui Dance and Music Show 2017, Mexico City, Mexico.
Indigenous festival 2016–2020, San Juan de la Costa, Chile.
Cultural Market 2017, Mexico City, Mexico.
12th Pacific Arts Festival 2016, Hagåtña, Guam.
Carnaval 2016, Arica, Chile.
Summer Festival 2016, Valdivia, Chile.
Oktoberfest Chile 2015–2017, Malloco, Chile.
Gala Puro Chile 2015, Miami, United States.
The tour holds significant cultural importance due to Rapa Nui deep ancestral connections with Aotearoa, offering a unique opportunity for cultural engagement and community connection.
Their itinerary includes high-profile engagements, such as:
Music Workshop on Friday 12 at 4pm - Koha Entry - RSVP Required
Dance Workshop on Friday 12 at 6pm - Koha Entry - RSVP Required
Concert: Live music and dances on Sunday 14 Spetember. Doors open at 3:30pm, Event start at 4pm
Koha - Entry - RSVP Required (Limited Capacity)
We are also excited to feature the local guest band "Matices", who will open the concert with a vibrant performance of live Andean and Latin American music.

description: Inaugural Professorial Lecture - Professor Angela Ballantyne, Inaugural Professorial Lecture "Making things right". What does it mean to make things right? Medicine and science often turn to bioethics for concrete solutions to ethical challenges. But in reality, there is rarely a single, obvious ‘right’ answer. Human systems are inherently messy, and challenged by a legacy of injustice, unequal distributions of power, and declining social trust. This talk will describe the potential for bioethics to help clarify and navigate ethics dilemmas; pragmatically inching us closer to making things – if not right, then at least – better.

📌 Registration Required – Limited spaces available! Sign up to secure your spot.

🍽️ Free Cooking Class – Bring Your Own Containers
This is a free, hands-on cooking experience, and we encourage participants to bring their own takeaway containers to share the food with their whānau.

💛 Koha Appreciated
While the class is free, a koha (donation) towards ingredients is appreciated to help support the program.

👩‍🍳 This Session’s Menu:

• Stuffed Tofu with Tomato Sauce (Đậu hũ dồn thịt sốt cà) – Soft tofu stuffed with a savoury minced pork filling, simmered in a rich and tangy tomato sauce for a comforting and flavourful dish.

• Vietnamese Fish & Dill Soup (Canh riêu cá thì là) – A light yet robust soup made with fresh fish, tomatoes, and fragrant dill, delivering a perfect balance of sweet, sour, and savoury flavours.

• Stir-Fried Squid with Pineapple (Mực xào thơm) – Tender squid stir-fried with juicy pineapple, bell peppers, and aromatics, creating a deliciously sweet and tangy seafood dish.

Join us for a fun, hands-on experience and bring home healthy, delicious Vietnamese meals! 🥢🍲✨

description:
Chess - Learn to Play, Chess – Learn to Play
Starting from the beginning you will discover how to play the 3000-year-old game of Chess. You will learn the principles that guide decision making in all parts of the game, learn algebraic notation and the ability to not only play a game anywhere, anytime, but also knowledge of where and how to play - both online and in person.

Description
Chess is an ancient game of strategy and analysis that hones concentration and focus, as you master the skills allowing you to win at this competitive recreation.

Join tutor, Ryan Hill to learn how to play this game from the beginning.

You will quickly go from understanding the basics to being able to engage in playing confidently and discover where to go for further training or to carry on playing – both in person and online.

Over 600 million people play this game that has remained popular throughout the ages – why don’t you become one of them!

Bring pen and paper to take notes.

By the end of this course you will be able to:

*Be able to use all of the chess pieces to play the game
*Be able to recount and use some of the most common openings and traps
*Recognise where to go for further training or to play
*Develop increasing levels of confidence in your ability to play and possibly win

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

description:
GRAND MARAMA BALL WORKSHOP, In the lead up to The Grand Kiki House of Marama Ball, join us for a night dedicated to the foundations of ballroom, commentating and Vogue Fem. This is the first time international guest Icons and Legends will host these workshops in Aotearoa, so you don’t want to miss this opportunity.
Connect, learn, and build community through a series of workshops designed to deepen your understanding of the categories, the essence, and the history that make ballroom what it is. 
Whether you're planning to walk at The Grand Kiki House of Marama Ball, support from the sidelines, or just want to better understand the culture, this workshop is your opportunity to learn directly from those who’ve helped to shape the landscape of Ballroom internationally and here within Aotearoa.

Strictly no heels.
Schedule:
Vogue Fem & Choreography by Icon Arturo Mulan (NYC Father of the International House of Miyake-Mugler) 
Get into the technique, musicality, and expression behind one of ballroom’s most celebrated styles from the one and only Icon Arturo Mulan Miyake Mugler.
Commentator Workshop by Icon Tantine Matyouz Royalty (International Godmother of the International House of Gorgeous Gucci)
Discover the art of the mic: timing, tone, and the voice that moves the room.
Essence by Legendary Overall Founding Mother Jaycee Iman (AKL, NZ / SYD, AUS)

description: Americana Jam, Join in with voices, fiddle, banjo, guitar, bass, washtub, spoons, saw, etc and help make this a warm, fun, festive and friendly monthly gathering for lovers of Americana music - the older the better - from murder ballads to oldtime, bluegrass, and early country - LISTEN, LEARN, OR LEAD THE WAY ..

description:
WaiHost - Outstanding Customer Experience, Identify key moments in the customer experience, and provide Service Excellence to each and every customer.
This workshop covers a wide range of core customer service skills that will equip your staff with the expertise and techniques required to provide superior customer service every time.   
Every one of us serves customers, whether we realise it or not.  Together we will look at all types of customers and how we can serve them better and improve ourselves in the process.  
State what customer service means in relation to all your customers.
Recognise how your attitude affects customer service.
Identify your customers’ needs.
Create a great first impression
Use active listening skills
Use outstanding customer service to generate return business.
Build good will through in-person customer service.
Handle customer issues, complaints and concerns.
The WaiHost Outstanding Customer Experience workshop is the only customer service training course on the market that is based on 8 years of research & data looking into what Kiwi consumers expect from companies they do business with.
When: Wednesday, 29 October– 8.30 am – 12.30 pm
Where: The White Swan, Main Street, Greytown
COST: Members* $99+GST pp Non-Members $385 +GST pp
* Member means any paid and current member business of Business Wairarapa, Tupu Ana Masterton, Go Carterton, Martinborough Business Assoc, Destination Wairarapa.
label: Business & Networking

description:
Gin and Clay Emerald Green and Turquoise Blue Wall Art Workshop, A fabulous and fun workshop that combines creativity and gin tasting for a unique experience. Create one stunning large wall art piece or two smaller pieces that will be fired and glazed in either a striking emerald green or a vibrant blue around 5 weeks after the session, making it perfect for displaying in your home or as a thoughtful gift. Alongside that sip 3 delicious Gin samples from the Bond Store distillery where we will be working.

My clay classes are suitable for complete beginners or those with experience and are a wonderful way to relax, replenish and have fun. Working with clay is good for the soul! Immersing in a gentle creative activity helps to switch off a busy mind, and making tiles is fun and achievable even if this is your first time using clay.

All materials are provided so all you need to do is turn up ready to have some fun and creativity. Booking is essential so please use this ticket link: https://forms.gle/PRLZ1JH9awDYjoNk8 or email clpates@hotmail.com.

Price includes all materials, glaze, double kiln firing and a gin tasting tray with 3 gins from The Bond Store.

Getting Started in Standup - Wellington, Have you always wanted to try stand-up comedy but don’t know how to start?
Comedian, writer, and lifelong teacher Neil Thornton (seen on TV3’s After Hours) brings you a fun low-pressure comedy workshop.

description:
Hands-on Sourdough Workshop, Sourdough for Beginners - $120 (paid via internet banking)
Come join us for a hands-on, in-person sourdough workshop at Willow Corner Collective headquarters (aka my home)! This workshop is currently the only hands-on sourdough workshop being offered in the Nelson region - I teach and demonstrate to you and then you get to mix and practice on your own dough as we go along.
Whether you're a seasoned baker or a beginner, this event is perfect for anyone looking to master the art of making sourdough bread, learning from someone who has 10+ years of experience. Perhaps you've found all the Youtube tutorials and Instagram how-to's overwhelming and are keen to learn via an in-person class. Then this is for you! I've baked hundreds of loaves in the last year alone, sold at a market, and hosted a pop-up shop. However, my passion really lies with teaching others to bake their own sourdough in their own homes, for their own families (or small businesses - one day!).You will be taught, demonstrated to, and then you get to have a go yourself; whilst learning my tips and tricks along the way. Plus we finish by sampling some delicious, fresh artisan sourdough with some favourite toppings!
You'll go home with all you need to make a good loaf of sourdough bread:
Knowledge
Student Guide, including recipes and troubleshoot guide
Bowl, liner, bowl scraper, and razor blade... all the tools you'd need to make sourdough
Dough made in class to bake the next day at home, to wow your family/friends
Confidence to continue the process yourself
Healthy, bubbling starter to continue your journey at home
Continued support and encouragement via our own private Facebook community group, for class attendees only
Note: You will have your dough to take home after the workshop that will need shaping around 6-8pm, so please ensure that will work for you that day.Also, please double check the date when booking. If for some reason you are unable to attend on the day, due to time constraints, I am unable to refund your ticket. I am happy for you to send someone in your place, though. In extenuating circumstances I may be able to hold your ticket for a future workshop; this is decided on a case-by-case basis.
*Payment to clear in bank account two days after ticket bought, after which time your ticket will be released on to someone else. Please pay immediately upon purchasing ticket.
**All workshop info you need to know ahead of time is in the confirmation email. Please ensure you read this down to the bottom.
***I recommend you already have a pair of digital scales, and a cast iron dutch oven at home to bake your loaf with as this makes the best, artisan sourdough, with great rise. Alternatively, a large, lidded casserole dish or enamel roasting pan work also. (The lids are a necessity).

"Sarah’s sour dough class is for real life! Achieve beautiful delicious bread easily in your own kitchen. Sarah teaches you how to fit sourdough into your busy life. She clearly and passionately gives the essential information, tips and tricks to make your own loaf. I loved getting to have a go at each step in the process. I love Sarah’s catchy philosophy “The goal is good bread, not perfect bread.” This took all the pressure off, for me, and I left the class empowered with all the knowledge and skills needed to give it a go at home. I appreciated the thoughtful and well prepared resources Sarah gave us. Thank you!" - Megan

"Sourdough with Sarah was a delight! From feeling overwhelmed and giving up on the idea of ever making my own loaf of sourdough, to dancing with joy as i watch a beautiful perfect sourdough loaf get nice and golden in the homewood stove!The information was packaged in bite sizes with hands on practice in between, where we all got to experience each step of the whole process, which was cleverly condensed and prepared so that despite normally having waits in between, we were able to see it all play out in a short few hours!The process was beautifully organised with attention to detail that had us fawning, came away feeling so blessed and privileged!Sarah's glowing personality made all the information feel easy and palatable, it was so fun!Such a lovely time, great environment to learn with ease." -Melody

description:
Hataitai community centre Raranga, Te Motu Kairangi, with the support of Hataitai Centre & Community House, warmly invites you to:
Monthly Flax Weaving Wānanga
Experience the joy of learning, sharing, and reconnecting with the art of weaving.
Whether you’re a first-time weaver or returning to refresh your skills, all are welcome. We’ll cover basic weaving techniques and tikanga (customs) and provide a supportive, creative space to connect with Māori arts and crafts alongside others.
Session Times
• Open session: 1:30pm – 5:00pm (pack down starts at 4:30pm)
What to Bring
• New weavers: 5–10 rau (blades) of harakeke, sharp scissors.
• An old towel
• Bring a bag, as you must take away leftover harakeke
• Returning weavers: 30–40 rau of harakeke and your weaving tools
• Some tools are available to borrow
• Shared kai (snacks) welcome but not required
• Bring a bag, as you must take away leftover harakeke
Koha appreciated, not required
If you would like to support the kaupapa, please email us at temotukairangi.huihui@gmail.com for koha details.
Come and enjoy weaving, learning, and connection in a beautiful, relaxed setting.
Contact
via facebook
https://www.facebook.com/TeMotuKai

Email temotukairangi.huihui@gmail.com
If you would like to koha to TMK, please email (Email temotukairangi.huihui@gmail.com) for the account details.

description:
Healthy Plates, Happy Hearts: Vietnamese Vegetarian Class, Healthy Plates, Happy Hearts: Vietnamese Vegetarian Class
📌 Registration Required – Limited spaces available! Sign up to secure your spot.

🍽️ Free Cooking Class – Bring Your Own Containers
This is a free, hands-on cooking experience, and we encourage participants to bring their own takeaway containers to share the food with their whānau.

💛 Koha Appreciated
While the class is free, a koha (donation) towards ingredients is appreciated to help support the program.

👩‍🍳 This Session’s Menu:

• Crispy Tofu with Lemongrass & Chilli (Đậu hũ chiên sả ớt) – Golden-fried tofu infused with aromatic lemongrass and a hint of chilli, creating a crispy, fragrant, and flavourful bite.

• Chive & Mushroom Soup (Canh hẹ nấu nấm) – A light, nourishing soup made with fresh chives and mushrooms, offering a delicate yet umami-rich flavour.

• Vegetarian Stir-Fried Cabbage (Bắp cải xào chay) – Tender cabbage stir-fried to perfection with garlic and seasonings, making for a simple yet satisfying plant-based side dish.

Join us for a fun, hands-on experience and bring home healthy, delicious Vietnamese meals! 🥢🍲✨
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Honouring Te Tiriti: Totes, What does it actually mean to honour Te Tiriti?

Join Te Waka Huia for a three-part workshop where we will unpack our nation’s constitutional founding document and explore practical ways to honour it today.

The session begins with kōrero facilitated by tauiwi (non-Māori) guides Gaayathri Nair and Krissi Smith followed by light manaaki and time to explore He Kura Toi Tangata: 50 Years of the Waitangi Tribunal, 1975–2025. After the short break, we’ll regroup for a Q&A session and finish with a tote bag-making activity led by Paekākāriki artist Selina Tuomey.

He Kura Toi Tangata exhibition ends Sunday 12 October.




About Gaayathri

Gaayathri Nair is a double diaspora person hailing from the southwest of India via Malaysia and coming to Aotearoa through economic migration in the 1980's under Rogernomics. She grew up in Tāmaki Makaurau and now lives in Te Awakairangi and works in Te Whanganui-a-Tara. She is a counsellor and facilitator, novice gardener, passionate knitter, frazzled PhD student, and shares a home with a delightfully awkward greyhound named Kevin.



About Krissi

Krissi Smith is of primarily Scottish (Clans McColl, Ross, Hogarth, Sutherland, Buchanan, Mactavish), Irish and English descent, but she grew up in Te Upoko o te Ika on Taranaki Whānui land. She currently lives in Te Ngaengae in Te Awakairangi, still on Taranaki Whānui land, and close to Waiwhetū. Krissi is a Tiriti educator, an accredited interpreter and translator, and a teacher of te reo Māori. She co-directs Kūwaha Ltd, with two of her besties: Tāwhana Chadwick and Raihānia Tipoki. She's also a māmā to one kid, one step kid, and Nanna to one moko. She has three dogs and five chickens. She loves growing kai and cooking it for people, singing karaoke, and sewing. She's a lover of learning and is getting pretty damn comfortable with not knowing the answers!



About Selina

Selina Tuomey has an Irish father and an English mother. She came to Te Whanganui-a-Tara, Aotearoa for the love of this land and a man. As a child in England, her most cherished possession was an Air New Zealand green, plastic tiki sent to her by her pen friend.

She is a mother to three sixth-generation, beautiful, young Pākehā people. Selina has a Fine Art BA Hons and is all about art and nature, acting, painting, murals, clay play and drawing. She has a love of colour, growing trees, food and going bush. Selina is a mermaid and loves people. He tangata, he tangata, he tangata.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
The Lighthouse Trio at The Pito-one Depot, The Lighthouse Trio at The Pito-one Depot
Join us as we explore some new interpretations of familiar melodies and unheard compositions! The trio will play original arrangements of favourite tunes as well as come brand new original songs. Expect mysterious ballads, soulful blues, and exhilarating bop.

The Lighthouse Trio is made up of three of Wellington's busiest players; Alex Trask, Jeremy Grant, and Elijah Mulheron. Alex is a highly regarded alto saxophonist who is seen all around town leading bands and playing for some of the leading musical organisations, including the RNZAF band and formerly the Rodger Fox Big Band. Elijah is the busiest bassist in town and often appears with Wellington legends such as Callum Allardice and John Rae. Jeremy is an extremely captivating guitarist and the creative force behind the arrangements you will hear.

The trio is celebrating the release of their debut EP with a tour of their own backyard, playing for the first time in Pito-one and Raumati, and finishing with a gig in central Wellington. Come along for an evening of fresh music presented in a relaxed setting, we hope to see you there!

Door sales available for $20

description:
Community Planting Belmont Regional Park, Help us reforest the hills of Belmont Regional Park. By planting native trees and shrubs, we will restore the native ngahere/forests and create an ecological corridor for wildlife to travel between Wellington, Porirua, Kāpiti and the Hutt Valley.

We have partnered with GWRC, PCC, and local iwi to restore the hills of Belmont Park. Starting on the west hillside, our aim this year is to plant 5,000 native plants to create a forest for the future! This project aims to bring the community together to restore the hillsides of the Belmont Regional Park.

We provide all the tools and training, no prior experience needed. We can even provide transport to the site. Just bring your energy and lunch. We will provide you with a yummy morning tea.

Come have some fun planting with us and TAKE ACTION FOR NATURE!

This event is part of Conservation Week 2025 - www.doc.govt.nz/conservationweek

Sign up for this event on our website ConservationVolunteers.co.nz or email Wellington@cvnz.org.nz
label: Conservation & Environment

description:
How To Be A DJ - An Introduction, Always wanted to try being a DJ but not sure where to begin? Experienced and professional DJ Shan (Shannon Chng-Rawiri) will teach you all about the technical aspects, equipment and terminology, as well as the industry in general, and enable you to put together a confident short performance.

By the end of the course, you’ll be able to:

Gain an understanding of the work content and career opportunities in this industry
- Learn the difference between what a DJ is required to deliver in the following situations: Mobile, Club, Radio, Turntablist and Hobby
- Participate in various practical activities: Slip Cueing and Baby Scratch, basic beat matching and song structures

Gain a good understanding of the equipment used and terminology including:
Tables: pitch control
Mixer: crossfader, input faders, EQ, gain, cue system
Needles: back tracking
Slip Mats

Learn about Counting Bars and Matching Tempos - The difference between a Bar, Phrases and BPM - Techniques to Count, Hand position and movement etc
- Confidently present a 5 minute performance in class

The course will be held at DJ Shan’s studio at Shop 21, 71 Cuba Street, Wellington. Bring headphones, a USB with your favourite music and a laptop, if you have one. Limited to eight participants.. Bring headphones, a USB with your favourite music and a laptop, if you have one. Limited to eight participants.

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

Duration 6 weeks,
DJ Shan

description:
Intro to Musical Improv | A PopRox Improv Course, Musical improv can be absolute magic. Whether it's a whole musical show, or single song that bursts out of an emotional scene, music adds so much to our improv.
This course for improvisers will give an introduction to musical improv. We'll cover basic song structures, how to get into a song from a scene, how to support a song through chorus work, and why and when we use music to add to our improv.
Participants should be confident in scene-work and have at least 2 years improv experience. This course will not teach you how to approach scenes and characters, so you should have a solid foundation which you can add to with this new toolbox of musical skills.
The course includes 6 workshops which will run 6:30pm to 8:30pm on Wednesdays from August 6th to September 10th. As it is an intro course, we do not anticipate a showcase for this course.
ABOUT THE TEACHERS
LIA KELLY is a theatre-maker and teacher based in Pōneke. She is an established director, actor, improviser and musician and has been a part of productions across the city over the last 10 years. She directed One Night Band which won 'Most Original Production' at the Wellington Theatre Awards 2023, and performs regularly as both a player and musician for POPROX.
ISAAC THOMAS has been an improviser and improv musician for a decade in Pōneke and Whakatū/Nelson. He's played with Body in Space, Playshop, Poprox and been musical director for musical improv powerhouse The Pāua Ballads. He has worked with almost every major improv company around the city accompanying them through improvised piano, guitar and vocals.
THE STANDY-BY LIST
PopRox firmly believes that improv is for everyone, especially when it comes to sharing skills and knowledge. So we're offering "the stand-by list" for all our workshops in 2025. We'll giveaway any spots remaining a few days before the first workshop of the course, on a first-come-first-serve basis. No need to provide a reason, no questions asked. If the entry fee is a barrier for you to come along, then simply email poproximprov@gmail.com and we'll pop you on the SBL. Everyone on the list will be notified whether there was a place available for them 3 days before the first workshop.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Jazz and Beyond Workshops 2025, Jazz and Beyond for students 19 and under
December 15–18, 2025
Coordinated by Chris Beernink, Dave Wilson, Daniel Hayles, and Lance Philip. Proudly supported by the Tauranga Jazz Society.
Take your playing to the next level at the Jazz and Beyond Workshops! Young musicians from across Aotearoa come together to dive into jazz and connected styles, working closely with some of the country’s leading performers and educators. In a friendly, inclusive environment, you’ll grow your skills, make new musical connections, and learn alongside other students your age from all around the motu.
Here’s what’s in store:
small group ensembles led by professional musicians
developing improvisation skills in supportive settings
an introduction to music production
listening sessions that expand your skills
inclusive jam sessions where all are welcome
ensemble performances at the end of week concert
And more!
If you're 19 or under with at least a year of experience on your instrument or in vocal training, you’re welcome to join. Choose from trumpet, trombone, saxophone, clarinet, flute, bass, piano, guitar, drums, vibraphone, or voice.
The workshops are held at the New Zealand School of Music—Te Kōkī at Te Herenga Waka—Victoria University of Wellington. Follow the Jazz and Beyond Workshops on Instagram or Facebook for the latest updates. Email jazzandbeyondworkshops@gmail.com with any questions.
Schedule
The workshops run 9:00am–4:30pm Monday through Thursday, with evening activities including concerts and our inclusive jam sessions Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday. Students perform in a closing concert on Thursday afternoon.
Accommodation
Students arrange their own accommodation. Often students from outside Wellington stay together in groups with a parent chaperone. Options for housing near Victoria University of Wellington include backpacker hostels and hotels. If you have a group of 15 or more, University Student Housing can been booked at Cumberland House. Contact info for this option is via email at Cumberland-House@vuw.ac.nz or by phone at +64 4 463 4770.
Meals
Lunch for the four days is available for purchase at many convenient locations on campus, or students may bring their own lunch.
Equipment
Provided equipment includes drum kits, guitar and bass amps, pianos/keyboards, microphones and PAs for vocalists.
All brass and wind players should bring their own instruments.
Drummers: you are required to bring your own cymbals, sticks, and hi-hat clutch.
Guitarists and bass players: you are required to bring your own instruments as well as cables (leads).
Preparation
All students with one year of experience on an instrument or in vocal training have the skills required to participate, so no musical preparation is required. On the first day, students will play a very short audition to be placed in an appropriate ensemble. Guidelines for this short audition will be sent to all registered participants in advance of the workshops.
Cost
Early bird price: $325 - register by 19th October
Standard price $350 - after 19th October
Registration is open to all until all spots are filled.
We are dedicated to ensuring all students can participate in the workshops without financial constraints. If the cost poses a barrier, please email us at jazzandbeyondworkshops@gmail.com and we will find a solution to facilitate your participation!
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Japanese Homestyle Cooking, Would you like to be able to cook delicious and nutritious Japanese food at home? Let’s have fun cooking attractive and healthy Japanese food together!. All ingredients included in course fee.

We will prepare simple, traditional Japanese home-style meals consisting of rice, soup, and a main dish (Ichijyu-issai). In each class, we'll make a different-flavoured miso soup along with a popular Japanese dish -- for example, teriyaki chicken or tonkatsu (crumbed pork cutlet).

We'll introduce you to Japanese food that's easy to prepare, tasty, and made with simple fresh ingredients plus we'll show you how easy it is to incorporate tasty and healthy Japanese food into your daily diet.
All ingredients are included in the fee. You just need to bring an apron, a dish cloth, a tea towel, and a container to take your food home in. Don't forget your smartphone if you want to take photos!

By the end of the course, you’ll:

become more familiar with using Japanese ingredients
feel more confident to cook authentic Japanese-style dishes at home
have the know-how to make delicious, well-balanced, and nourishing meals for the whole family.

Note: Our cooking courses are designed to provide a collaborative and immersive learning experience where learners often work in pairs and/or groups. While we wish to create an inclusive environment for all participants, it is important to note that our courses are unable to accommodate specific food allergies or deviate from the preplanned dishes and menus.

Duration 4 weeks, Wed 5:30 PM – 7:30 PM
$189

description:
Due Isole, Join Chef Giulio Ricatti for an extraordinary evening celebrating the bond between two islands — Sardinia and New Zealand. Through a carefully curated nine-course dinner, this event offers a personal and heartfelt exploration of identity, place, and the connection between land and sea.

Raised in Sardinia and now at home in New Zealand, Chef Ricatti shares his story through a menu that bridges the wild, untouched landscapes of both countries. Each course is crafted exclusively with New Zealand ingredients, reflecting the rich bounty of our land and sea, yet inspired by the timeless traditions and bold flavours of Sardinian cuisine.

Accompanying the meal is an expertly selected pairing of wines from Sardinia and New Zealand, highlighting the unique characteristics of each region while celebrating their shared essence. The thoughtful combination of food and drink creates a dialogue between the two islands, offering diners a chance to taste the harmony of contrasts.

More than just a meal, this is an evening of storytelling. Chef Ricatti invites you to journey with him as he reflects on the places that have shaped his life and the meaning of finding a home across oceans. His philosophy of embracing the present moment is woven into every dish, making this event a sensory and emotional experience.

Whether you’re a lover of fine dining, an admirer of Sardinian culture, or simply curious about the connections between food and identity, this dinner promises a night of discovery. Step into the heart of two islands and savour their soul in one unforgettable evening.

description:
Karanga taonga, karanga tangata, karanga whenua |Reversing Cultural Amnesia: Activating Māori Practice in Museums, In 1947, Māori leader, politician, and scholar Apirana Ngata spoke to his scholarly peers at the Polynesian Society, announcing his greatest desire to revive Māori culture as a living force within communities, not be relegated to dead exhibits in museums (Ramsden 1948, 85).
This lecture acknowledges the concerns of visionary leaders and champions of cultural practice and their activation within museums. Through her work as a Māori curator, writer, cultural practitioner and post-doctoral researcher, Awhina Tamarapa advocates for cultural restoration as a form of liberation in a museum context. In her research, Tamarapa is exploring strategies for the recovery and reclamation of taonga puoro (singing treasures) and karetao (animated storytellers) for new generations.
There are challenges regarding taonga held by overseas museums. Concepts such as keeping taonga warm, and mana taonga, recognises the connection and authority of descendants to their taonga, that underpin this work.
The focus on the reclamation of Indigenous practice has been bolstered by working with First Nations, Canada BC. Led by Professor Bryony Onciul, University of Exeter, UK, Tamarapa was privileged to be part of a research project “The Future of Indigenous Rights and Responsibilities: Ancestral governance, environmental stewardship, language revival, and cultural vibrancy” funded by the Arts and Humanities Research Council, UK.
_________
The Michael Volkerling Lecture series is a partnership event with the Museum and Heritage Studies programme at Te Herenga Waka | Victoria University of Wellington, National Services Te Paerangi and Te Papa Tongarewa. This annual public lecture series recognises the legacy of the late Dr Michael Volkerling who was one of the principal architects of New Zealand's cultural and creative sectors.

- Use essential jewellery-making tools accurately

description:
Kintsugi Workshop in Wellington // Toi Poneke Art, Kintsugi Workshop in Wellington // Toi Poneke Art
After several SOLD OUT workshops in Wellington here is the next one... Oct 2025

Learn the magical art of Kintsugi with Artist Ema Frost in this new Workshop. You can bring along a piece of your own pottery to restore in this beautiful style. (I'll also have a few as back up if you don't have your own piece) (All Levels)

Sunday 12th October - 10:30am - 12:30pm or 2:00 - 4:00pm

Ema has been teaching Kintsugi for 5+ years and regularly travels to Japan to study and learn new techniques. Ema's illustrations and ceramic works sit in many of our countries best galleries, and whose products and merchandise sell in the most stylish design stores and gallery shops. Her style is enchanting - quirky, feminine and colourful, and clearly influenced by her travels throughout the world, usually off the beaten track.

Have you ever wanted to try Kintsugi.... It's an ancient Japanese art form where you fix broken pottery with gold - making its imperfections its beauty. - A truly wonderful philosophy to live by. Nothing is ever really broken but new life and meaning is brought back making your piece a work of art and truly something special. You can also apply this technique on various materials like glass, wood, greenstone and shells.

Kintsugi
It's called kintsugi (金継ぎ), or kintsukuroi (金繕い), literally golden (“kin”) and repair (“tsugi”). This traditional Japanese art uses a precious metal – liquid gold, liquid silver or lacquer dusted with powdered gold – to bring together the pieces of a broken pottery item and at the same time enhance the breaks.

You will take away your wonderful finished work, plus your new skills which will enable you to further your own Kintsugi in your own time.

What you will take away:
A finished artwork piece
A understanding of Kintsugi
Knowledge and History of this beautiful art form.

description:
Lino-printing Koanga (Spring) Workshop - Pop-up Parlour 2025, Lino-printing Koanga (Spring) Workshop - Pop-up Parlour 2025
Join us for a fun-filled morning of creativity at Pukerua Bay Hub's Pop-up Parlour as we explore Māori design motifs using Lino-cut prints developed with artist Trixie Andrew.
Afternoon Tea provided. No experience needed.

The lino-cut prints will be provided with different design motifs and we will guide you through the process of printing your own items (clothing, bags, cards etc.) and creating your own small lino-cut to keep as well. Different kinds of paper stock will be available.

Māori design motifs are rich in symbolism and storytelling. These visually rich motifs are used in carving, weaving, and tattooing to convey cultural knowledge, history, and spiritual beliefs. These motifs are not just decorative; they are a vital part of Māori culture and identity. We will be exploring Koanga (Spring) for this session.

Event details
- What - 2hr lino print workshop
- When - 10-12pm Saturday 6th September 2025
- Where - St Marks, 98 Rāwhiti Road, Pukerua Bay
- Cost - $30 to cover lino-cuts, ink, paper, tools and artist koha

LIMITED SPACES AVAILABLE - Book now:
https://www.pkbhub.org.nz/shop/p/lino-print-workshop-w483s

What to bring? Bring something to print onto, for example a t-shirt or reusable fabric bag. We encourage sustainable fashion using cotton and upcycling from 2nd hand shop. Or you may choose to print on fabric, high quality paper, card or even a pēpē onesie!

About your hosts:
Trixie Andrew (Ngāti Toa) has spent the past three years in Pōneke pursuing a Bachelor of Fine Arts with Honours at Massey University. She has paused this year to study the Heke Reo course at Te Wānanga o Raukawa, aiming to return to finish her degree after completing the Te Reo Māori Diploma. She is a highly-skilled visual artist and works across different mediums, including print-making.

This workshop is part of Pukerua Bay Hub's 2025 Pop-up Parlour - thanks for your support.

____________________________________
WHAT IS THE POP-UP PARLOUR?
A chance to create and connect in our pop-up community space. From 1-30 September we've got a jam-packed schedule with 65+ events for kids, families, rangatahi and adults to learn, hang out and have fun.

Check out all the free/koha events too -
https://www.pkbhub.org.nz/whatson

Waiho i te toipoto, kaua i te toi roa –
Let us keep close together, not far apart.

After a BBQ dinner it is time for a walk before dessert to observe the Little Blue Penguins returning to their nests at sunset and to hunt for Giant Weta and Tuatara.

This is a great experience for the whole family.

description:

Matthew Te Huki
38-9003-0669210-00
Workshop starts at 1:30pm please be there by 1:15 ready to start on time
Haka for Life Workshop
🔥 Haka for life – A Transformational Māori Experience with Matiu 🔥
Step into a sacred, immersive journey led by Matiu—a master of Māori language, performance, and storytelling, with over 30 years of experience empowering individuals across the globe.
This dynamic, interactive workshop weaves together ancient Māori wisdom with modern empowerment, unlocking deep connection, strength, and presence like never before.
🌿 What You’ll Experience:
✔ The Warrior’s Energy – Harness the raw power of haka, the traditional Māori dance that awakens your inner fire and unshakable presence. ✔ The Art of Connection – Learn the profound practice of hongi, the sacred sharing of breath, and cultivate deeper relationships. ✔ The Power of Storytelling & Song – Discover the soul-stirring magic of Māori narrative and music. ✔ Sacred Masculine & Feminine Balance – Explore potent, healing practices that honor, empower, and connect on a deep, transformative level. ✔ Embracing Light & Shadow – Find balance between your strength and vulnerability, your power and grace.
⚡ Why This Workshop?
This is for those who are ready to step into their power. Those who want to speak with confidence, move with purpose, and lead with authenticity.
By the end of this experience, you will: ✅ Feel grounded, present, and connected—to yourself, to spirit, to your ancestors. ✅ Command a room with presence and mana (power) when you speak. ✅ Own your voice—so that people truly listen and feel your words. ✅ Stand in your warrior energy—unshakable, confident, and fully embodied. ✅ Walk away with practical, ancient tools to help you move through life with more strength, clarity, and purpose.
🔥 Are You Ready? 🔥
If you’re up for real growth, if you’re ready to step into your power, be seen, be heard, and be fully present—then this workshop is for YOU.
Matiu’s approach is welcoming, inspiring, fun, safe and deeply empowering.
🌿 Join us. Awaken your warrior. Change your life.
Here are testimonials for workshop:
Kia Ora. I felt new strength to be in integrity with myself and power to speak from this place within. The workshop was a beautiful experience of the love and trust that is possible in community - and
that resonated for ages and flowed into all my interactions moving through life. When are you coming back to Hobart, Matiu, to do more workshops?
Here is another testimonial from Bali spirit fest participant:
It's not often in life, that I've met someone so powerfully walking their talk, that by their presence alone they can offer a deep transformational experience. I have felt this on both the occasions I've had the pleasure to cross Matiu's path. He has an ability to hold space and guide an opening and understanding of the moment, and the current times. Of divine male/female divide, and the healing available to individuals and our collective. I would highly recommend engaging with him on any level, it's definitely been a rewarding and growth promoting experience in my journey.

description:
Lost Wax in Three Sessions - Hard Wax, Over three sessions create stunning jewellery using the age-old lost wax technique. This is an excellent opportunity to treat yourself to some creative fun!

In weeks one and two you'll learn how to work with jeweller's hard wax to create beautiful textures in metal that can be used to create amazing rings or objects. Your waxes will be sent away for casting in the metal of your choice.

Then there will be a week's break before the third session, to allow time for everyone's waxes to be cast. The third session covers how to trim, clean and finish your casts, turning them into original jewellery ready to wear!

More advanced students can use these sessions to complete projects in a class setting.

Included in the class fee are all your different types of waxes, sandpaper and courier costs.

Not included are the casting and metal costs which vary from student to student depending on what sized ring they want to make and the type of metal you choose. Small castings can cost around $6.65 - $12 and might cost between $7 to $30 in metals depending on if you use red bronze, white bronze or silver.

This class is great for teens and kids over 12 or so. Anyone under 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Skyline Singles, Sick of swiping? 5 minutes with a stranger too awkward? We've got you!

This September we're kicking off Skyline Singles!

No time limit, no host, no awkwardness! Just a rooftop bar at sundown, cocktails in hand and a DJ spinning your favourites, the twist? EVERYONE'S SINGLE!

Take your time, talk to everyone, mingle with the singles overlooking the centre of Wellington's nightlife heart. If needed there will be conversation prompts on each table for you to spark up a conversation!

description:
Local Boat Dives, Local Boat Dives
We had so much fun on our last boat trip we have booked another one to explore the F69 Wreck and a local reef.

With 2 morning dives it is an early start to get the tides right.
We will meet at 7:30am and be ready to load the boat at 8am.

Fight Knight, Brace yourself — on Thursday 16th October, our axe lanes morph into a bone-rattling, armor-clanking cage of chaos! Watch as trained warriors clad in gleaming medieval armor unleash flying axes and clashing swords in a battle for ultimate bragging rights.

This isn’t your average Thursday night — it’s epic sword-swinging, axe-chopping, heart-pounding theatre you’ve gotta see to believe. Feel the thunder of steel, the roar of the crowd, and the thrill of knights battling for glory.

Whether you’re cheering from the sidelines or planning your own medieval takeover, this is THE event where legends are born and legends are made.

description:
Miramar Maupuia community centre Raranga, Te Motu Kairangi, with the support of Miramar & Maupuia Community Centre, warmly invites you to:
Monthly Flax Weaving Wānanga
Experience the joy of learning, sharing, and reconnecting with the art of weaving.
Whether you’re a first-time weaver or returning to refresh your skills, all are welcome. We’ll cover basic weaving techniques and tikanga (customs) and provide a supportive, creative space to connect with Māori arts and crafts alongside others.
Session Times
• Open session: 1:30pm – 5:00pm (pack down starts at 4:30pm)
What to Bring
• New weavers: 5–10 rau (blades) of harakeke, sharp scissors.
• An old towel
• Bring a bag, as you must take away leftover harakeke
• Returning weavers: 30–40 rau of harakeke and your weaving tools
• Some tools are available to borrow
• Shared kai (snacks) welcome but not required
• Bring a bag, as you must take away leftover harakeke
Koha appreciated, not required
If you would like to support the kaupapa, please email us at temotukairangi.huihui@gmail.com for koha details.
Come and enjoy weaving, learning, and connection in a beautiful, relaxed setting.
Contact
via facebook
https://www.facebook.com/TeMotuKai

Email temotukairangi.huihui@gmail.com
If you would like to koha to TMK, please email (Email temotukairangi.huihui@gmail.com) for the account details.

description:
Massey University Information Evening - Palmerston North campus, Massey University Information Evening - Palmerston North campus
Looking to progress your 2026 study plans? Join us to secure your enrollment, explore alternative careers or upskill your talent.

About this Event

Whether you're a distance or online learner or planning to study on campus, you are invited to join us for an evening of panel discussions, presentations and workshops to steer you on your way to a successful learning journey in 2026.
School Leavers : A step by step session to take you through the course enrolment process to enable you to select your 2026 courses seamlessly (bring your laptop); or if you're still not sure what you're studying with us we'll be sharing what we can offer via distance or campus learning;
Career Changers: How to change careers using your existing degree. Have you been thinking about Nursing, Planning, Social Work or Teaching as the next step in your career? Come along to our presentation to find out how you can begin a new career.
Mature learners and Up-skillers: Thinking about something new for 2026 or building on your current degree into Postgraduate study? We'll be sharing what we can offer via distance or campus learning.
You'll find us in the Social Sciences Lecture Block, Massey University.
Light refreshments will be provided.

description:
Open Dance Kapiti, Open Dance Kapiti
Term Three is just around the corner, and spaces are limited. book now for WIDance's Kapiti Open Dance classes!

Designed to be accessible and engaging for all skill levels, these classes provide a safe and inclusive environment where you can experience joy and laughter through movement.

We nurture creative curiosity and build social connections through a variety of dance activities, including improvisation, dance-based games, and composition.

Our classes enhance body and spatial awareness and foster an understanding of basic dance concepts, all while promoting social interactions through movement.

When: Wednesdays, 6.30 to 8 pm. 16th July to 3rd September.
Cost: $10 per session.
To Book: Email
OR phone Sumara 021 050 1565

Who are we?

WIDance is one of Wellington's leading inclusive dance providers, striving to provide equal opportunities for all to dance. Established in 2010, we run open classes, workshops, and performance events throughout the Wellington region.
Our mission is to provide equal opportunities to dance experiences for diverse communities, advocating for inclusion and empowerment

description:
Matiu Te Huki Haka for life workshop - Moera Hall - Lower Hutt, You can pay online via bank deposit (if you don't want to use credit/debit card) using this account. $30
Please email matiuthehook@gmail.com with your details and a screen shot of the payment so I can secure your spot at the event
Matthew Te Huki
38-9003-0669210-00
Workshop starts at 1:30pm please be there by 1:15 ready to start on time
Haka for Life Workshop
🔥 Haka for life – A Transformational Māori Experience with Matiu 🔥
Step into a sacred, immersive journey led by Matiu—a master of Māori language, performance, and storytelling, with over 30 years of experience empowering individuals across the globe.
This dynamic, interactive workshop weaves together ancient Māori wisdom with modern empowerment, unlocking deep connection, strength, and presence like never before.
🌿 What You’ll Experience:
✔ The Warrior’s Energy – Harness the raw power of haka, the traditional Māori dance that awakens your inner fire and unshakable presence. ✔ The Art of Connection – Learn the profound practice of hongi, the sacred sharing of breath, and cultivate deeper relationships. ✔ The Power of Storytelling & Song – Discover the soul-stirring magic of Māori narrative and music. ✔ Sacred Masculine & Feminine Balance – Explore potent, healing practices that honor, empower, and connect on a deep, transformative level. ✔ Embracing Light & Shadow – Find balance between your strength and vulnerability, your power and grace.
⚡ Why This Workshop?
This is for those who are ready to step into their power. Those who want to speak with confidence, move with purpose, and lead with authenticity.
By the end of this experience, you will: ✅ Feel grounded, present, and connected—to yourself, to spirit, to your ancestors. ✅ Command a room with presence and mana (power) when you speak. ✅ Own your voice—so that people truly listen and feel your words. ✅ Stand in your warrior energy—unshakable, confident, and fully embodied. ✅ Walk away with practical, ancient tools to help you move through life with more strength, clarity, and purpose.
🔥 Are You Ready? 🔥
If you’re up for real growth, if you’re ready to step into your power, be seen, be heard, and be fully present—then this workshop is for YOU.
Matiu’s approach is welcoming, inspiring, fun, safe and deeply empowering.
🌿 Join us. Awaken your warrior. Change your life.
Here are testimonials for workshop:
Kia Ora. I felt new strength to be in integrity with myself and power to speak from this place within. The workshop was a beautiful experience of the love and trust that is possible in community - and
that resonated for ages and flowed into all my interactions moving through life. When are you coming back to Hobart, Matiu, to do more workshops?
Here is another testimonial from Bali spirit fest participant:
It's not often in life, that I've met someone so powerfully walking their talk, that by their presence alone they can offer a deep transformational experience. I have felt this on both the occasions I've had the pleasure to cross Matiu's path. He has an ability to hold space and guide an opening and understanding of the moment, and the current times. Of divine male/female divide, and the healing available to individuals and our collective. I would highly recommend engaging with him on any level, it's definitely been a rewarding and growth promoting experience in my journey.

description:
Wearable Stories: Bolo Tie & Sheriff Badge Making with Keri-Mei Zagrobelna, Wearable Stories: Bolo Tie & Sheriff Badge Making with Keri-Mei Zagrobelna
In this hands-on workshop, participants will transform upcycled drink cans into unique wearable pieces — bolo ties or sheriff badges — inspired by Keri-Mei Zagrobelna's work in the exhibition Flaming Star. Using accessible, low-tech techniques, you’ll explore design, embossing, and enamel painting to create a piece you can take home and wear with pride.

Register at

What You’ll Learn:

The cultural background and kaupapa behind bolo ties and sheriff badges.

How to design and plan a wearable artwork.

Techniques for prepping and embossing tin.

How to transfer a design to metal and finish it with enamel paint.

Simple methods to attach your design to a bolo tie or badge backing.

What’s Provided:
All materials, including prepped tin from recycled drink cans, tools, paints, and bolo tie/badge fittings.

What to Bring:
An open mind, a steady hand, and any personal imagery or patterns you’d like to incorporate into your design.

Who This Workshop is For:
No experience necessary — perfect for beginners and those wanting to try creative metalwork in an accessible, fun way.

description:
PADI Open Water Diver Course, PADI Open Water Diver Course
“Ever Since I Was A Kid I’ve Wanted To Learn To SCUBA Dive…”

PADI is by far the largest and most popular Scuba diver certifying system in the world and for good reason. Courses are fun safe relevant and packed with excitement! No matter what country you are in your PADI qualification will be recognised.

To learn to dive first complete the medical questionnaire to make sure you are medically fit to dive. Next pay your deposit and select your course dates. You will receive your PADI eLearning theory which must be completed before you attend the first practical session. This simple and fun eLearning program will give you the knowledge you need to understand the reason for the skills you will learn.

The practical part of your Open Water Scuba Diver course takes just four days! During the first weekend we make it very easy and convenient for you with our on-site dive pool (the only one in the Wellington Region). Our pool is where you learn to dive so we can go at your pace no matter how long it takes. During the first weekend you learn and practice all the necessary dive skills. Once completed you will be ready for the sea dives.

During the second weekend you complete four sea dives two per day. This is where we confirm and practice the skills you learnt in our pool – all under direct supervision. You will also complete a simple 300m swim (no time limit and wearing wetsuit mask snorkel and fins).

Once you are a certified diver you will receive an eCard on your PADI App showing your qualification – and any PADI Dive Centre will be able to confirm your certification online. You will also be qualified to attend the PADI Advanced Open Water Diver course and our regular Dive Days.
Our aim is to prepare you for the fascinating adventure of diving. We want to make your diving safe and enjoyable. Welcome to the exciting world of Scuba diving!

If you have any questions please call email or stop by our Dive Store.
 

PPADI Open Water Diver course at a glance
Digital theory: Open Water Diver eLearning Course (allow 8-14 hours)
Practical: One weekend pool training one weekend with four sea dives
Options: One-on-one or unscheduled dates – additional costs apply.
Start Time: Be at NZ Sea Adventures by 8.30am each day.

Location
We are located at 9 Marina View Mana Porirua; just north of the Paremata bridge on SH1. Look for the big yellow building. Our Location

Prerequisites
Be at least 10 years old (special conditions apply for 10 and 11-year-olds)
Be able to swim 300m (mask snorkel and fins no time limit) and swim/float for 10 minutes.
Be medically fit to dive. Check the Diver Medical Participant Questionnaire. If you answer YES to any of the questions or have any doubts a visit to your doctor is required.
eLearning must be completed before your pool training can begin.
Complete the Optional RDP Tables Quiz and Exam after the final exam if you don’t have a dive computer.

What to Bring
Completed Diver Medical Participant Questionnaire.
If Under 18 years – bring a Parent or Legal Guardian to sign your forms.
A pen swimming costume towel and a snack for the breaks.
Any personal dive equipment you wish to use.
The $450.00 balance of your course fee.

Cost
Scheduled Open Water Diver Course Fee: total is $750.00; deposit is $300.00.
Includes: PADI eLearning Course Dive Gear Rental Pool Sessions and Sea Dives. Rental wetsuits are available in stock sizes only. Other sizes are available for purchase. Made-to-measure options can be ordered and purchased.
10% off all in-store purchases during your course. Does not include packages.
$20 off your course fee for every person you get to sign on with you.

When
Our PADI Open Water Diver Courses are scheduled year-round. See our online calendar for scheduled course dates or ask in store. Booking early guarantees your place and price.

Looking for different dates or smaller classes? Ask about our one-off course options. Let us know what you need and we will do our best to help (conditions may apply).

Booking your course
Course bookings can be made in-store via email online or over the phone
The deposit of $300.00 secures your place on a course and purchases your eLearning course.
Deposits are transferable to another person but are not refundable.
eLearning courses once redeemed cannot be transferred.
Before we can send you the eLearning link we require your full name date of birth a valid personal email address and phone number.
Your course balance is to be paid before we can begin your pool training.

Activities For Certified PADI Open Water Divers
Local Diving; It’s a good idea to keep diving regularly especially in the weeks following your course. We’re here to help with advice on dive sites and gear rental. Want a guide? Join us for Dive Days!
Advanced Open Water course; Further your dive skills and continue your underwater adventures with the PADI Advanced Open Water course you can start straight after your Open Water Diver course.
As a certified PADI Open Water Diver you can take the following Specialty Diver courses alongside those available to non-divers; Altitude Diver – AWARE Fish ID diver – Boat Diver – Digital Underwater Photographer – Diver Propulsion Vehicle Diver – Drift Diver – Drysuit Diver – Enriched Air/Nitrox Diver – Equipment Specialist – Night Diver – Peak Performance Buoyancy – Sidemount Diver – Underwater Naturalist – Underwater Navigation

description:
Paraparaumu Makeup Masterclass - 21.09 @9.15 am, About this event
Join Nikki, a Professional Makeup Artist & Colour Expert with over 14 years of experience, for an engaging and practical Makeup Masterclass. Nikki and her team focus on enhancing natural beauty and making makeup easy for everyone.
As we journey through life, our skin and style evolve. The best way to update your look and learn techniques that suit your unique face shape, style, and colouring is to attend one of our masterclasses. Whether you're a performer on stage, a busy professional, or a multitasking mum, this class will teach you how to apply your makeup quickly, flawlessly, and with confidence.
During the class, Nikki will demonstrate step-by-step techniques on a model while you get to apply your own makeup. You'll have access to professional products and tools to follow along and create your flawless everyday look. It’s fun, interactive, and designed for all skill levels.
"I can’t wait to share my knowledge with you and help you create a makeup routine that leaves you feeling fabulous and confident every day!" – Nikki
What You Need to Know:
No equipment required! We’ll provide all makeup products, brushes, and mirrors.
Bring a willingness to learn and a positive attitude.
Classes are capped at 12-15 participants to ensure personalised guidance.
Arrive 10–15 minutes early to get settled.
Please come with a clean, makeup-free face so you can get the best results.

Phở Real! Vietnamese Cooking Class – Special 2/9 Edition (FREE), Join us for a hands-on cooking experience as we celebrate Vietnam Independence Day with one of our most iconic dishes — Phở!
Learn how to make rich, aromatic broth from scratch, prepare traditional toppings, and build your perfect bowl. This workshop is perfect for beginners, food lovers, and anyone wanting to connect through culture and cuisine.

description:
Netherfield Ball, Step into the enchanting world of Jane Austen’s Pride and Prejudice at Homewood, where the timeless elegance of a Regency-era ball comes to life. This evening of romance, music, and culinary delight invites you to relive the iconic moments of Elizabeth Bennet and Mr Darcy’s fateful meeting.

Guests will be greeted with crafted cocktails inspired by love potions, showcasing ingredients from some of the finest distilleries in New Zealand and the United Kingdom. As the evening unfolds, indulge in a carefully curated selection of canapés, created with fresh ingredients sourced from Homewood’s own garden, evoking the flavours and charm of the Regency period.

The grand setting of Homewood, the esteemed residence of the British High Commissioner, will transport you to a bygone era. With the glow of garden lighting, live music filling the air, and an atmosphere brimming with romance, you’ll feel as if you’ve stepped into Austen’s world. Dancing will play a central role in the evening, allowing guests to immerse themselves in the grace and grandeur of the Regency social scene.

Whether you’re an Austen devotee, a fan of Bridgerton, or simply drawn to the allure of historical elegance, this event promises to captivate your imagination and senses. Don’t miss this rare opportunity to be part of a night filled with charm, sophistication, and timeless romance.

Photography - Street and Urban, Street and urban settings provide many opportunities for unique and exciting photographs to be taken. This course shows you how to capture candid and rich street and urban scenes. Includes a Saturday field trip.

Join David of D Jensen photography, as he takes you to the city streets and into urban life to take candid and exciting street photography photos. Street photography candidly captures people in everyday life, taking place in public places. Urban photography is not only limited to photographing people and is concerned with urban scenes and spaces. These two distinct genres naturally complement each other in this fresh course.

Includes an evening field trip.

description:
STEAMS School BLENHEIM Term 4 2025, What is STEAMS?
STEAMS is an integrated learning programme covering Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts, Maths, and Society. It focuses on real-world skills, critical thinking, collaboration, and creativity through hands-on, project-based learning—not play-based, but purposeful exploration without rigid time constraints.
Students are immersed in engaging, age-appropriate activities that encourage curiosity, innovation, and independent learning.
Key Benefits:
Students in STEAMS learn to:
Think creatively and critically
Collaborate and communicate effectively
Connect ideas across disciplines
Take ownership of their learning
Explore without pressure
Understand real-world applications
When & Where?
Weekly classes during school terms, based on age group and location:
Blenheim-Waterlea Racecourse
Class Times:
Little STEAMerS (Ages 5–6): TUES 11:30am–2:45pm
STEAMS Jr (Ages 7–9): TUES 9:00am–2:45pm
STEAMS Sr (Ages 10–13): THURS 9:00am–2:45pm
Cost
Trial (3 weeks): Pay via Humanitix (non-refundable)
Ongoing: $75/day (incl. GST)
Little STEAMerS: $30/day
Scholarships: 25% off for financial need (not available for Little STEAMerS)
School Absence?
Inform your child’s regular school—they’re attending STEAMS School. Most schools are supportive, and students should be marked as justified.

description:
Sculpture - Intro to Creature Sculpting, Join us in an exciting new introduction to creative sculpting - a hands on class to produce unique creature figurines and miniatures to bring your imagination to life! - Beginners welcome! All material costs included in course fee.

Description
Whether you want to make creatures cute, creepy, in the style of pop-toys, figurines, or a one-of-a-kind character in your own style, this is the class for you!

Working with air dry clays, oven bake polymer clays and wire, armatures this workshop offers a variety of modelling methods and approaches - a great opportunity to turn ideas into tangible 3D forms. With modern clays we can create translucent, flexible, and even glow-in-the-dark elements to add more realism or a touch of the surreal into each creation!

We’ll kick off working with traditional air-dry clay to get a feel for modelling a few simple forms.

Once familiar with the materials, we’ll go through some basic design elements, guided by animal anatomy and morphology. From here the tutor will show and chat with the group about ways we can transform the creatures from our imagination into unique sculptures full of character.

Students will be coached through designing and creating a series of small-scale creature sculptures, beginning simple, and building to a more complex final form as we gather practice.

The class offers beginner students a fun introduction to sculpting organic forms from scratch, and for those with some hands-on creative experience, it offers a great opportunity to experiment, hone and advance your making skills to new levels.

Please wear closed-in footwear suitable for a workshop environment. bring a work apron if you have one or wear clothes you don’t mind getting a little grubby. Remember to bring your reading glasses if a have them.

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

The practical part of your Open Water Scuba Diver course takes just four days! During the first weekend we make it very easy and convenient for you with our on-site dive pool (the only one in the Wellington Region). Our pool is where you learn to dive so we can go at your pace no matter how long it takes. During the first weekend you learn and practice all the necessary dive skills. Once completed you will be ready for the sea dives.

During the second weekend you complete four sea dives two per day. This is where we confirm and practice the skills you learnt in our pool – all under direct supervision. You will also complete a simple 300m swim (no time limit and wearing wetsuit mask snorkel and fins).

Once you are a certified diver you will receive an eCard on your PADI App showing your qualification – and any PADI Dive Centre will be able to confirm your certification online. You will also be qualified to attend the PADI Advanced Open Water Diver course and our regular Dive Days.
Our aim is to prepare you for the fascinating adventure of diving. We want to make your diving safe and enjoyable. Welcome to the exciting world of Scuba diving!

If you have any questions please call email or stop by our Dive Store.
 

PPADI Open Water Diver course at a glance
Digital theory: Open Water Diver eLearning Course (allow 8-14 hours)
Practical: One weekend pool training one weekend with four sea dives
Options: One-on-one or unscheduled dates – additional costs apply.
Start Time: Be at NZ Sea Adventures by 8.30am each day.

Location
We are located at 9 Marina View Mana Porirua; just north of the Paremata bridge on SH1. Look for the big yellow building. Our Location

Prerequisites
Be at least 10 years old (special conditions apply for 10 and 11-year-olds)
Be able to swim 300m (mask snorkel and fins no time limit) and swim/float for 10 minutes.
Be medically fit to dive. Check the Diver Medical Participant Questionnaire. If you answer YES to any of the questions or have any doubts a visit to your doctor is required.
eLearning must be completed before your pool training can begin.
Complete the Optional RDP Tables Quiz and Exam after the final exam if you don’t have a dive computer.

What to Bring
Completed Diver Medical Participant Questionnaire.
If Under 18 years – bring a Parent or Legal Guardian to sign your forms.
A pen swimming costume towel and a snack for the breaks.
Any personal dive equipment you wish to use.
The $450.00 balance of your course fee.

Cost
Scheduled Open Water Diver Course Fee: total is $750.00; deposit is $300.00.
Includes: PADI eLearning Course Dive Gear Rental Pool Sessions and Sea Dives. Rental wetsuits are available in stock sizes only. Other sizes are available for purchase. Made-to-measure options can be ordered and purchased.
10% off all in-store purchases during your course. Does not include packages.
$20 off your course fee for every person you get to sign on with you.

When
Our PADI Open Water Diver Courses are scheduled year-round. See our online calendar for scheduled course dates or ask in store. Booking early guarantees your place and price.

Looking for different dates or smaller classes? Ask about our one-off course options. Let us know what you need and we will do our best to help (conditions may apply).

Booking your course
Course bookings can be made in-store via email online or over the phone
The deposit of $300.00 secures your place on a course and purchases your eLearning course.
Deposits are transferable to another person but are not refundable.
eLearning courses once redeemed cannot be transferred.
Before we can send you the eLearning link we require your full name date of birth a valid personal email address and phone number.
Your course balance is to be paid before we can begin your pool training.

Activities For Certified PADI Open Water Divers
Local Diving; It’s a good idea to keep diving regularly especially in the weeks following your course. We’re here to help with advice on dive sites and gear rental. Want a guide? Join us for Dive Days!
Advanced Open Water course; Further your dive skills and continue your underwater adventures with the PADI Advanced Open Water course you can start straight after your Open Water Diver course.
As a certified PADI Open Water Diver you can take the following Specialty Diver courses alongside those available to non-divers; Altitude Diver – AWARE Fish ID diver – Boat Diver – Digital Underwater Photographer – Diver Propulsion Vehicle Diver – Drift Diver – Drysuit Diver – Enriched Air/Nitrox Diver – Equipment Specialist – Night Diver – Peak Performance Buoyancy – Sidemount Diver – Underwater Naturalist – Underwater Navigation

description:
Sir Ian Athfield Memorial Lecture 2025 | Te Whanganui-a-Tara Wellington, Te Kāhui Whaihanga New Zealand Institute of Architects are excited to welcome Ian Moore to New Zealand to present this year’s lecture series ‘The Past Needs a Future’ which will focus on adaptive reuse.
Ian is the principal of Ian Moore Architects, established in 1990. The practice has won numerous Australian and international awards and has been published and exhibited widely, including at the Venice Architecture Biennale in 2008 and 2012.
Initially studying civil and structural engineering at the Auckland Technical Institute in New Zealand, Ian moved on to study architecture at the University of Technology, Sydney, graduating with honours in 1988.
Ian has taught at numerous universities and been a speaker and guest lecturer throughout Australia as well as internationally.
Ian has also been a member of awards juries in Australia, New Zealand and at the World Festival of Interiors in 2013 and the World Architecture Festival in 2015. In 2003, Ian was the inaugural Creative Director for the Australian Institute of Architects annual conference.
About the Sir Ian Athfield Memorial Lecture
The annual Sir Ian Athfield Memorial Lecture commemorates the late Ian Athfield, a singular and much-loved figure in New Zealand architecture.
Affectionately known as ‘Ath’, Ian was knighted in 2014 and was one of New Zealand’s most influential architects. He won more than 60 national and international architecture and design awards and the lecture series was established to honour his legacy and celebrate his larrikin spirit.
In keeping with that spirit, each year the lecture is given by a person with something to say – someone who is challenging orthodoxy and a business-as-usual approach to practice, and life.
During his career, Ath designed many significant buildings, none more so than his own home in Te Whanganui-a-Tara Wellington, which enraged the neighbours, perplexed the Council and inspired the city for decades.
Ath was talented, original, insightful, opinionated, provocative, and sometimes outrageous. His architecture is stimulating, challenging, ever-changing, but never careless.
In 2004, Te Kāhui Whaihanga New Zealand Institute of Architects awarded Ath the Gold Medal for career achievements, noting at the time “What defines Athfield above all is his contagious enthusiasm, his devotion to architecture, and his unswerving belief in its possibilities. Believing architecture to be a civilising force, he has demonstrated a strong commitment to architecture’s public realm: the streets we live in; the urban centres we inhabit; the countryside we love and so often abuse.”
The Sir Ian Athfield Lecture Series is proudly sponsored by Resene and GIB.
CPD points: 10
TIMING:
Doors open: 5.00pm
Lecture: 5.30pm - 6.30pm
Q&A: 6.30pm - 7.00pm
LECTURE DATES:
Te Whanganui-a-Tara Wellington | Wednesday 3 September | Michael Fowler Centre
Tāhuna Queenstown | Friday 5 September | Crowne Plaza
Whakatū Nelson | Tuesday 9 September | The Suter - Te Aratoi o Whakatū
Ōtautahi Christchurch | Wednesday 10 September | Black Box Theatre - Papa Hou
Heretaunga Hastings | Thursday 11 September | Toi Toi
Ngāmotu New Plymouth | Monday 15 September | Novotel
Kirikiriroa Hamilton | Tuesday 16 September | Bill Gallagher Centre
Tāmaki Makaurua Auckland | Thursday 18 September | TBC

description:
Forest & Bird: Every Last Bird – Birds of Te Araroa Trail, Every Last Bird – Birds of Te Araroa Trail

Book your place now to reserve a chair.

Between November 2023 and March 2024, Te Papa natural history curator Dr Colin Miskelly walked the length of Aotearoa New Zealand on Te Araroa Trail – counting every bird seen or heard along the way. His talk will cover some of the logistics of walking the trail, as well as a summary of the birds encountered. This included looking at what difference (if any) predator trapping had on the abundance of native birds. For a taste of what the talk will cover, see Te Araroa Trail | Te Papa’s Blog.

Colin Miskelly on Mt Crawford, Tararua Ranges:
label: Conservation & Environment

description:
STEAMS School BLENHEIM Term 4 2025, What is STEAMS?
STEAMS is an integrated learning programme covering Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts, Maths, and Society. It focuses on real-world skills, critical thinking, collaboration, and creativity through hands-on, project-based learning—not play-based, but purposeful exploration without rigid time constraints.
Students are immersed in engaging, age-appropriate activities that encourage curiosity, innovation, and independent learning.
Key Benefits:
Students in STEAMS learn to:
Think creatively and critically
Collaborate and communicate effectively
Connect ideas across disciplines
Take ownership of their learning
Explore without pressure
Understand real-world applications
When & Where?
Weekly classes during school terms, based on age group and location:
Blenheim-Waterlea Racecourse
Class Times:
Little STEAMerS (Ages 5–6): TUES 11:30am–2:45pm
STEAMS Jr (Ages 7–9): TUES 9:00am–2:45pm
STEAMS Sr (Ages 10–13): THURS 9:00am–2:45pm
Cost
Trial (3 weeks): Pay via Humanitix (non-refundable)
Ongoing: $75/day (incl. GST)
Little STEAMerS: $30/day
Scholarships: 25% off for financial need (not available for Little STEAMerS)
School Absence?
Inform your child’s regular school—they’re attending STEAMS School. Most schools are supportive, and students should be marked as justified.

description:
Three Minutes in Hell: Crossing the Line, Three Minutes in Hell is back!
Join your regular hosts Daniel John Smith and Anya Rzhevitskaya and a line up of fifteen+ comedians for an evening of fresh comedy on a set topic we challenged them to write about.

Each comic will have three minutes to entertain you on this month's topic:
CROSSING THE LINE

Each comic will have three minutes to entertain you with their best stories about crossing the finish line, I presume? Nothing crazy, just stories of crossing the picket line during the '87 strikes. Crossing a line through all the tasks you just completed - probably that sort of thing.

Come find a favourite local comic to enjoy!

We won an Award.
