description:
Art Flow: Dine & Discover, Join us for another exclusive evening celebrating art and cuisine at DoubleTree by Hilton Wellington. Experience the perfect blend of creative expression and culinary excellence as we bring together the artists behind our successful 'Art Flow' exhibition for an intimate dining experience.

Your evening begins at Grazie Italian restaurant with a welcome drink, followed by a carefully curated three course dinner. Our featured artist, Min Kim, will share insights into her beautiful art and offer a unique perspective on her creative process and inspiration with a live art demonstration between the main course and dessert. The journey continues when you’ll indulge in a dessert presented by Le Cordon Bleu, followed by the demonstrated artwork being auctioned towards the end of the evening. This intimate setting provides the perfect opportunity to engage with Min Kim while enjoying exceptional cuisine followed by a guided tour through our hotel’s art-adorned interior.

Event Details:
- Welcome drink on arrival
- Mix & Mingle – meet Min Kim
- A live art demonstration by Min Kim with the completed artwork being auctioned the same night
- Three-course dinner at Grazie Italian Restaurant with the dessert prepared by Le Cordon Bleu
- Guided art tour with our featured artists

Don't miss this unique opportunity to experience art beyond the canvas and celebrate the intersection of visual and culinary artistry.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Arizona Flashback, Dust off the denim, dig out the flip phones and get ready to rewind time. Two Grey is bringing back Arizona Bar & Grill for a limited-time pop-up.

Welcome to The Arizona Flashback, a throwback to the late '90s and early 2000s that revives the flavours, energy and atmosphere of the iconic Arizona Bar & Grill. Known as a go-to spot for after-work drinks, late-night bites, birthday celebrations and casual catch-ups, Arizona was a place where people came together over great food and good times.

Now, its beloved Southwestern-style dishes and all-day menu return — not just as a delicious nod to the past, but as a celebration of shared moments, laughter and connection.

Immerse yourself in the full Y2K dining experience, complete with retro beats, neon lights and the return of Arizona’s famous Spin the Wheel game for a dash of playful nostalgia.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Bar Blanc de Blancs with Martin Bosley's Oyster Saloon, Alexia's special annual Blanc de Blancs celebration returns for a 4th edition with the release of the 2021 vintage of our world famous (in Greytown) Méthode Traditionnelle!

After four years of patient making and aging, the corks on the most sparkly of all our wines are ready to be popped and the liquid gold consumed on the Alexia terrace!

The man, the myth, the mollusc maestro Martin Bosley is back with his Oyster Saloon between 12pm - 3pm shucking fresh oysters for the occasion so get in early for these or miss out!

Oysters not your thing? Fear not, the Alexia kitchen will also be turning out some delicious delights to match to your Blanc de Blancs – everyone will be happy!

It’s always a great day when the new vintage of Blanc de Blancs starts flowing and we’re quietly delighted with how the 2021 vintage is looking!

Essential Details:
- Alexia Urban Winery, 197 West Street, Greytown.
- Leashed dogs ok!
- No bookings required, just turn up. Want oysters? Get there before 3pm.
- Parking onsite, on the street, and lots of parking for bikes. 15 minute walk from Greytown centre.
label: Food & Drink

As Wellington embraces the creativity of World of Wearable Art®, indulge in a culinary journey unlike any other, perfectly complementing the magic of this year's show. Explore our menus below.
Booking is essential.

Terms and Conditions & Cancellation Policy
Our Aurora High Tea cannot be modified for dietary requirements. However, our Classic High Tea is available in a Vegetarian, Vegan and Gluten Free version. Please note, we are unable to accommodate dietary requirements without prior notice.
If not already stated and confirmed at the time of reservation, guest numbers must be confirmed 48 hours prior to arrival.
A credit card must be provided at the time of reservation to secure the booking.
High Tea reservations cancelled within 24 hours prior to arrival will incur a cancellation fee of 100% of the total booking.
No-shows will be charged a cancellation fee of 100% of the total booking.
Decreases in attendee numbers will not be accepted within 24 hours before arrival, and charges will apply based on the confirmed final count.

description:
Beervana, New Zealand’s boldest, hoppiest, and most delightfully weird beer festival. This is no ordinary tasting event, it’s a full-blown sensory adventure where brewers go wild, food gets fancy, and the unexpected is always on tap. 

Expect more than 60 breweries pouring over 300 unique brews—from hazy IPAs and fruited sours to beer cocktails and non-alcoholic surprises. 

But Beervana isn’t just about the beer. It’s a feast for all senses: think whitebait fritters from Boulcott St Bistro, Korean fried chicken, Mahurangi oysters. Add in live music, quirky brewery stands (yes, there’s a Best Stand vote), and unexpected entertainment and you’ve got a festival that you'll come away from with a greater knowledge of great beer, a belly full and plenty of fun memories with your mates.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Battle of the Wine Regions, The best winemakers from across New Zealand will battle it out for bragging rights, and raise money for a charity dear to Rosella's heart at the same time. 
For a second year, three winemakers will put their best grape-crushing foot forward to match a wine from their home region with each course in a five-course degustation menu. Guests will vote for the best-matched wine for each course, scores will be tallied up, and winners will be crowned! 
All profits will go to Heart Kids Foundation, a charity that Rosella's owners received a lot of support from when their son was born with a congenital heart disease. This is their chance to give back to this great charity and provide the support needed for other families going through the same situation.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Always a Bridesmaid, Step into the world of <i>Bridesmaids<i> for a three-course feast that brings the film to life, literally. Zephyr is serving up a cinematic dining experience where every bite is perfectly timed with the on-screen action.
Expect to start with Annie’s mum’s famous artichoke dip, and an entree inspired by Lillian and Doug’s engagement party then get ready for the main event: the Brazilian feast (but guaranteed to be without the unfortunate side effects). And for dessert, it’s that cookie. The giant one. Gorgeous to share or go full meltdown mode — it’s your call. All paired with cocktails and drinks that complement the evening perfectly. After all, as Megan says, "I'm gonna climb that like a tree." And yes, by "that," we mean the drinks list. Mocktails available.
Like an exclusive invite to Lillian’s Parisian bridal shower, these tickets will disappear fast. So grab your besties, your worsties, or your slightly terrifying but well-meaning Megan, and join us for a night of food, film, and absolute chaos. Because sometimes, life calls for laughing until you cry, eating until you're full, and toasting to the love of your friendships that survive it all.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Cheesy Lovers by Le Marché Français, Calling all cheese lovers!
Looking for a fun and original night out for two? Whether it’s a romantic date, a chill evening with a friend, or a cozy family moment, our Cheesy Lovers workshop is the perfect plan
What’s on the menu:
Roll up your sleeves and make two fresh cheeses from scratch, step by step, with our expert cheesemongers
Discover the magic of artisan cheesemaking — milk, love, and a little bit of alchemy

A full spread of charcuterie, fruits, nuts, and condiments will be waiting for you, along with expert tips on pairing and presentation. And of course… tasting is highly encouraged

description:
Club Tropicana, This August, Beach Babylon becomes Club Tropicana, a retro, romantic escape inspired by 1960s tropical honeymoons, classic tiki bars and vintage beach glamour. Picture golden sunsets, flamingos, thatched umbrellas and the carefree buzz of a sun-soaked getaway, right in the heart of Wellington. No passport required.

The menu is vibrant and full of escapist flair. Start with coconut prawns and banana blossom kokoda, then dive into mains like mango glazed  pork rib rack or the tropical tofu paneer curry. Save room for dessert: pineapple upside-down pudding or a coconut rum fondue to bring the tropical fantasy to a sweet finale. Behind the bar, the tiki and kava-spiked cocktails flow freely, from Blue Hawaiian’s to retro rum punches, all dressed to impress with flamingo stirrers, umbrellas and tropical garnishes.

A golden-age soundtrack sets the mood, featuring the smooth calypso of Harry Belafonte, beachy vibes from The Beach Boys, and sun-drenched classics by Astrud Gilberto.

Club Tropicana is a winter getaway, fun and fabulously over the top.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Discover Te Muna - Go behind the scenes, Join us for a unique full day experience immersing yourself in the viticulture, wine making and wines of Te Muna valley. This spectacular valley lies nine kilometres east of Martinborough. Visit the vineyards, meet the producers, go behind the scenes and taste the wines where they are made.

We will pick you up from the Martinborough Square at 9.30 am to start your day at Big Sky Wines. Founders, viticulturists, and winemakers Katherine Jacobs and Jeremy Corban will give you a first look at their 2025 ferments, which have been produced from their organic vineyard. We will then take you to tour Blue Earth Estate vineyard and olive grove and enjoy a long lunch, accompanied by a glass of wine of course. From there we will take you to the stunning winery at Escarpment, and then to explore the beautiful terraced Craggy Range vineyard and taste their wines among the vines, both of which are not normally open to the public. We will finish the day with some of the other Te Muna producers joining us to share their wines and their stories. It will be a day of discovery - the place, the people and the wines of the beautiful Te Muna Valley.

Tickets are strictly limited to 18 people.
label: Food & Drink

description: Cognac vs Armagnac, Noble Rot sommelier Maciej Zimny has a undeniable passion for brandy, and he is yearning to share that with you. Maciej will guide you on an educational journey through this fascinating world focusing on the most prestigious French regions for brandy production: Cognac and Armagnac. He’ll provide detailed insight into the appellations, distillation and ageing processes, differences in oak maturation and why one region focuses on vintage expressions while the other ages blends for several years in barrel. But don’t worry, this isn’t a classroom affair—they'll be pouring 8 different spirits paired to a unique three-course menu to showcase Maciej’s knowledge, and he’ll even teach you the sommelier’s techniques for how to taste spirits correctly. Fall in love with brandy, find your favourite and next time you’re ordering a nightcap you can show off your new-found knowledge to your friends.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Pebble - Love In Every City, Poems and Songs from the Road

After seasons of wandering through foreign cities, sharing songs with strangers, and capturing stories from the road. PEBBLE has spent the past few years on an open-ended journey: traveling across continents in search of the deepest stories, the wildest love, the purest expression of what it means to be human. From late-night train stations to hidden cafés, from sunlit rooftops to candlelit stages—PEBBLE has been gathering moments and melodies from everywhere he goes, transforming them into songs and poems that reflect a life lived wide open.

“Love in Every City” is the next chapter in that journey—a stripped-back, soul-forward performance that brings those stories home.
Backed by a vision to build a global movement of traveling artists who choose authenticity over perfection, connection over isolation, and creative ownership over compromise, PEBBLE’s work invites us to remember what we’re really here for: to live, to feel, to share.

This show is a moment of reflection and reconnection—
Join us for an intimate night of music, poetry, and storytelling at Moon in Newtown, Pōneke. A suitcase full of songs. A guitar by the table. A heart full of cities.

As always, free entry & all pizzas $15!
label: Arts & Theatre

Battle of the Wine Regions, The best winemakers from across New Zealand will battle it out for bragging rights, and raise money for a charity dear to Rosella's heart at the same time. 
For a second year, three winemakers will put their best grape-crushing foot forward to match a wine from their home region with each course in a five-course degustation menu. Guests will vote for the best-matched wine for each course, scores will be tallied up, and winners will be crowned! 
All profits will go to Heart Kids Foundation, a charity that Rosella's owners received a lot of support from when their son was born with a congenital heart disease. This is their chance to give back to this great charity and provide the support needed for other families going through the same situation.

description:
Beervana, New Zealand’s boldest, hoppiest, and most delightfully weird beer festival. This is no ordinary tasting event, it’s a full-blown sensory adventure where brewers go wild, food gets fancy, and the unexpected is always on tap. 

Expect more than 60 breweries pouring over 300 unique brews—from hazy IPAs and fruited sours to beer cocktails and non-alcoholic surprises. 

But Beervana isn’t just about the beer. It’s a feast for all senses: think whitebait fritters from Boulcott St Bistro, Korean fried chicken, Mahurangi oysters. Add in live music, quirky brewery stands (yes, there’s a Best Stand vote), and unexpected entertainment and you’ve got a festival that you'll come away from with a greater knowledge of great beer, a belly full and plenty of fun memories with your mates.

description:
Breathwork: A Gentle Reset, Breathwork: A Gentle Reset
Breathwork: A Gentle Reset

Take a pause from the noise of daily life.

This breathwork journey begins with gentle movement to awaken the body and open the breath. Through slow, mindful stretches, we begin softening tension and grounding into the present.

You’ll then be guided through two styles of breathwork — each offering a unique pathway inward. There’s no pressure or expectation, just the freedom to explore what feels right for you:

A dynamic, connected breath for those who wish to build energy, move emotion, or break through internal blockages

A slow, rhythmic breath for those seeking stillness, calm, and deeper grounding

Both approaches invite a sense of spaciousness — physically, mentally, and emotionally — while supporting nervous system balance and inner clarity.

To gently close the session, we’ll move into a quiet, nurturing meditation to support integration and leave you feeling steady, clear, and connected.

Afterwards, stay and enjoy a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert, lovingly prepared to complement the experience — because healing is also about how we feed and care for ourselves.

Why Breathwork?

Breathwork has helped so many shift from a state of tension and overwhelm into a place of ease, clarity, and resilience — often after just one session. It’s a simple, powerful practice that reconnects you to your body, your breath, and your inner stillness.

You’ll leave feeling more grounded, more present, and more like yourself again.

Meet Karla, your host
Karla is a breathwork and trauma-somatic facilitator based in Aotearoa (New Zealand), originally from Malta. With over a decade of experience in Reiki and three years facilitating trauma-informed, science-based breathwork, Karla combines holistic tools, meditation, and conscious breathing to support nervous system regulation and deep emotional healing. Her offerings help release stored trauma, reduce stress and anxiety, and activate oxytocin—the “love hormone”—fostering connection, vitality, and a sense of wholeness. She currently holds regular classes, workshops, and transformative retreats that nurture the mind, body, and spirit.

Polymer Clay Jewellery Workshop, Step right up and join the magic of the Greytown Festival of Christmas with our whimsical,

With a palette of beautiful pastels and bright colours and materials to spark your imagination, this hands-on experience is perfect for adults of all skill levels.

Whether you’re looking to get crafty with friends, make meaningful gifts, or simply try something new, this is one festive activity you won’t want to miss. Spaces are limited and workshops will book up fast—so get in quick to secure your spot! All adults are welcome; Suitable for ages 10+ with a participating adult (separate ticket required for each attendee). Let the fun begin!

description:
Interislander: Pop-up Burger, Interislander has been a long-time supporter of Visa Wellington on a Plate, the famous hospitality event that lights up the Wellington region each August.

The Love Ferry
Featuring a Poneke Red brioche bun, with a beef & pork patty seasoned with a mix of smoked paprika, garlic, and a touch of cayenne pepper. Melted Kapiti brie cheese with caramelised onions, roasted red peppers, rocket and truffle aioli. Topped with crispy Harrington’s bacon and pickled jalepenos for those who like a little heat. Served with a side of crispy fries sprinkled with smoked paprika and sea salt at $20. For the perfect pairing, we offer a Garage Project Beer match for $12.

Pop-up Burger at Wellington Railway Station
We've set up a pop-up burger truck outside the Wellington Railway Station. This will allow the public to indulge in our burger and fries without needing to sail on the Interislander. Its also available to passengers when travelling the Cook Strait on the Ferry.

description:
JETAA Wellington - Brewkaiwa September @ Mean Doses, We will be having our September Brewkaiwa at Mean Doses, a bold and modern craft brewery in the heart of Wellington. Known for its inventive beers and laid-back atmosphere, it’s the perfect place to share a drink and good conversation.
Brewkaiwa is JETAA’s monthly casual meetup for anyone with any connection to Japan.
We’re a diverse group of people who have studied, worked, or lived in Japan or have been invited along by someone who has.
Come join us for a brew and stay for the kaiwa! Bring your friends!
***Japanese or alcohol consumption NOT REQUIRED!***
Brewkaiwaとは
一杯いかがですか？
JETAAがウェリントンで親睦会を開催するとどうなるのか？その結果、BREWKAIWA！
2020年に始まった、ブリューカイワは、ウェリントンの様々なバーで毎月開催されている飲み会です。大人気の国際交流グルップです！！！ 日本で働いたり、住んだり、旅行したことのある人達に人気のあるイベントです！！！お酒を飲んで、友達を出来、素敵なごちそうを食べ、おまけに異文化を知られます！
日本語が話せる外国人も良く参加しているので、日本語しか話せなくても全然大丈夫です！
是非来てください！
label: Food & Drink

description:
I-Sarn Thai KanTok, Join Daeng from Tuk Tuk Thai for a deeply personal culinary journey to the heart of E-Sarn, the north-eastern region of Thailand she once called home. This one-night-only event celebrates the traditional Kan-Tok style of dining – a communal meal served on handwoven bamboo trays and shared amongst family and friends. This event is made to be shared, the ticket price is for a shared menu for two. 

Growing up in the small town of Tha Bo near the Mekong Delta, Daeng’s childhood was filled with stories of rice farming, village generosity, and dishes cooked from what the garden offered. In E-Sarn, meals were acts of love, shared daily around the Kan-Tok with laughter, music, and warmth.

Now, Daeng invites you to gather at her table and experience the flavours of her upbringing. You’ll be served nine traditional dishes on a beautifully crafted bamboo tray, designed for sharing, just as they are in her village.

On the Kan-Tok:
Hor Mok Salmon – Steamed salmon in banana leaves, marinated with herbs, spices, and coconut milk
Mok Nor Mai with Pork Belly – Pork belly steamed with bamboo shoots
Larb Gai – A celebratory chicken mince salad with fresh herbs and toasted rice
E-Sarn Sausages – House-made, spiced and fermented in true north-eastern style
Nam Prik Tomato – Roasted tomato dipping sauce with chillies, garlic, and shallots
Som Tum – Green papaya salad with a sweet, sour, spicy kick
Sticky Rice – Soaked overnight and steamed in traditional bamboo baskets
Fresh and Steamed Seasonal Vegetables – To enjoy with sauces and mains

Dessert:
Kanom Chan – Thai layered jelly cake
Kanom Mun – Tapioca and coconut pudding

Pull up a seat at Daeng’s table and discover the stories, flavours, and traditions that shaped her childhood.
Single tickets or odd numbers unable to be catered to.
label: Food & Drink

description:
The Rocky Horror Show, Dust off your corset, strap on your heels, and get ready to Time Warp like it’s 1973. After a 15-year hiatus, The Rocky Horror Show is back. The musical, written 50 years ago by New Zealand national treasure Richard O’Brien, stars a phenomenal West End cast. This high-energy stage spectacular features all the catchy songs you know and love: Sweet Transvestite, Dammit Janet, and the pelvic-thrusting, showstopper Time Warp. 
The show follows two squeaky-clean college kids, Brad and Janet. The couple find themselves stranded outside a mysterious mansion. Inside awaits the fabulous and flamboyant Dr Frank’n’Furter, and a wild adventure full of fun, frolics, frocks, and frivolity. 
The Rocky Horror Show is the longest continuously running contemporary musical in the world. It has thrilled over 35 million theatregoers, been staged in 30 countries, and translated into 20 languages. Get dressed up, let loose, and be your fabulous self at the biggest glitter-soaked party in town.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Le Petit Chef, InterContinental Wellington proudly presents the first official Le Petit Chef experience in New Zealand - an extraordinary fusion of theatre, storytelling, and fine dining.

Step into the whimsical animated world of Le Petit Chef, the world’s tiniest and most determined chef, as he embarks on a globe-trotting quest to source the finest ingredients. Using groundbreaking 3D projection mapping technology, your table transforms into a magical stage, where continents shift, spices fly, and the art of cooking comes thrillingly to life before your eyes.

As the journey unfolds, a five-course menu is served in perfect harmony with the story. Highlights include Wairarapa crayfish bouillabaisse, corn-fed chicken with Perigord truffle, and a decadent Valrhona chocolate dessert. Choose from the Grand Menu ($180), Classic Menu ($140), Vegetarian Menu ($140), or a dedicated Kids Menu $70). While each menu offers a distinct culinary experience, the stunning visual show remains the same for all guests and is centered around the Grand Menu storyline.

Please note, while primarily designed for individual bookings, some shared seating may apply due to the technical nature of the performance.
label: Food & Drink

At each venue you will have the chance to try a delicious canape and a beverage that showcases Kapiti's favourite suppliers and producers.

Choose from the Grand Menu ($180), Classic Menu ($140), Vegetarian Menu ($140), or a dedicated Kids Menu $70). While each menu offers a distinct culinary experience, the stunning visual show remains the same for all guests and is centered around the Grand Menu storyline.

Please note, while primarily designed for individual bookings, some shared seating may apply due to the technical nature of the performance.
label: Food & Drink

description: Love the Wine You're With, Join the team from Matahiwi Estate for a fun and fearless wine tasting. Strip away the pretense of wine while tasting six glasses from new flavours, to old favourites and unique styles all while enjoying a shared charcuterie pairing. No question is too big or small, this is your chance to sip, learn, and explore in a relaxed, welcoming atmosphere. Come curious, leave confident or maybe just a little less confused by wine speak - but most of all, enjoy!
label: Food & Drink

description:
Love in Scent, Join fragrance aficionado Benny Castles for an immersive journey into the WORLD of love, told through the art of scent. In this exclusive olfactive experience, indulge in small bites and sip on a glass (or three!) of something delightful, setting the perfect mood for exploring the emotional power of fragrance.

Over the course of the evening, you’ll sample up to twelve unique fragrances, each one tied to a captivating love story that inspired its creation. Learn the intimate tales behind these scents and discover how they evoke the passions and emotions that shape our experiences of love. Whether you're a fragrance enthusiast or a newcomer, this sensory journey is sure to arouse your olfactory senses and deepen your appreciation for the art of perfume.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Macaron Masterclass, MACARON MASTERCLASS
Presented by Le Ciel Bakery
Whisk, pipe, and finesse your way to perfect Parisian macarons

Join us for a hands-on masterclass where you’ll learn the secrets to mastering this delicate French treat — from glossy meringue to flawless feet. Led by Chef Shuchi Bhardwaj, this is your golden ticket to boujee baking greatness.

- Create & take home your own box of beautifully filled macarons
- Learn foolproof techniques, flavour infusions, and piping styles
- Start your evening with a complimentary glass of bubbles and a decadent Black Forest cake for two—because love (and baking) should always begin on a sweet note.

What you’ll learn:
- Mastering macaronage & piping flawless heart shapes
- Avoiding common meringue mishaps
- Chef’s expert tips for achieving that perfect crisp-yet-chewy texture

Only 12 people per class—an intimate setting where you’ll have Chef Shuchi’s full attention and guidance. Whether you're baking with your sweetheart, bestie, or favorite foodie, this experience is sure to be equal parts fun, romantic, and delicious.

Location: Le Ciel, 100 Tory street, Wellington
$62 per person
Limited spots are available—book now before they’re gone!

description:
A free workshop for the General Public: Dying to Know about Dying Matters?, Please note, this is a FREE workshop availble to the public and is not designed for health professionals to attend.
Many people find it difficult to talk about dying, yet dying is an important stage of life and is inevitable.
We plan for the birth of a child, yet when it comes to the end of life, we don’t often want to think , or talk about it.
Come along to our workshop and find out more about dying matters, how an Advance Care Planning (ACP)can benefit you and your family/whānau and what to expect at the end of life.
Having a plan outlines our care preferences for the future. Having an Advance Care Plan (ACP) that aligns with our beliefs and values, is a gift that we can give to our family / whānau.
We will explore:
Why is it hard to talk about death and dying?
What to expect when someone is dying
Supports available
Advance care planning processes
Date: Friday 5 September 2025
Time: 9.00 am - 12.30 pm
Presenters: Mary Ann Hardcastle Advance Care Plannining Facilitator & Chris Dunn Clinical Nurse Educator Nelson Tasman Hospice
Cost: Free
Limited attendees: Registration is essential
Who can attend?: General Public (This workshop is not designed for Health Professionals)
Venue: Nelson Tasman Hospice, 331 Suffolk Road, Stoke, Nelson

description:
Hōkai Tahi Winter Woodlands Pizza Evening, We’re inviting you to a cozy night out with heart.
Our Winter Woodlands Pizza Evening is a special fundraiser supporting Hōkai Tahi.
Based in the Wairarapa, Hōkai Tahi walks alongside women and whānau through pregnancy, baby loss, and the early years of parenting - offering time, space, and resources when they are needed most.
Indulge in a delicious 3-course meal (wood-fired pizza included, of course!) with non-alcoholic drinks provided.
A limited bar menu will be available, or feel free to BYO.
Alongside your meal, enjoy live music, a live auction of locally donated treasures, and for those feeling adventurous, a short glow worm walk through the native bush (don’t forget your torch, sturdy shoes, and warm layers - hot water bottles welcome!).
Details:
Watermill Bakery, 33 Blakes Road, Mt Holdsworth
Saturday 1st November 2025
5:30–8:30pm
$75 per adult - $20 per child (under 14)
Look out for our friendly parking warden in hi-vis on arrival and simply give your name to be guided in.
Please note there’s no reception at the venue, so make any arrangements before you head our way.
Share an evening of great food, live entertainment, and woodland magic - all in support of a truly worthwhile cause.
Every ticket sold helps Hōkai Tahi continue supporting local whānau through life’s most tender moments.

description:
Draw It Out - Teens workshop 25 Nov, A fun and deep way for teens (11-17 year olds) to learn to process their feelings.
Theme: Strengthening self-resources
Learn how to listen to your feelings and find guidance from within, using a gentle powerful tool called Interactive Drawing Therapy.
Teenage years can often be filled with external influences, making it hard to listen to our own inner voice for guidance.
This single workshop helps teens to use drawing to access their inner resources, because often they have the guidance within, and just need help to bring it out.
Dates
This is a single workshop:
4.00pm-5.30pm
Tuesday 25 November – Strengthening self-resources
Cost
$46 total
Included in each session
You will be guided by Lara Phillips, a trained creative facilitator in Interactive Drawing Therapy, through drawing prompts (similar to a guided meditation or journaling) to draw out where you are at and draw out your own inner guidance. No art skills are needed, more simple mark making.
This gentle yet powerful tool uses drawing and writing as a way to access your subconscious and to listen to your heart rather than your head for guidance. A tool often used in therapy, it is made accessible for self-care and community wellness through these workshops.
About Lara Phillips
Lara Phillips is a creative facilitator trained in Interactive Drawing Therapy. With a 20 year career in creative copywriting in design and communication, she shares drawing and writing as a mode for wellness and self-care, to promote preventative and proactive mental health measures through creativity.
“We all have the wisdom within to help ourselves, if given the space.”
For more workshops or to book individual sessions visit www.drawitout.co.nz

Liability disclaimer
Draw It Out offers creativity for wellbeing. It is not intended as therapy nor does it replace counselling, therapy, or any other medical or clinical professional help. Participants are guided to draw out where they are at, whilst drawing out their own inner resources for support and guidance.
Participants understand it is their own responsibility to manage their mental and physical health during sessions, to opt in and out of activities as they see fit, and make the facilitator aware if further support is required.

Thorndon Fair 2025, Thorndon Fair 2025
Wellington’s iconic street fair is back!

Since 1977, the Thorndon Fair has been a highlight of the capital’s summer calendar — and in 2025, we’re bringing the energy, creativity and community spirit back to the streets of Thorndon.

With over 250 stallholders from across Aotearoa, this is your chance to discover:
🖼️ Unique art and crafts
🍴 Delicious food and drink
👚 Fashion, accessories and lifestyle products
📚 Books, gifts, toys, and treats for pets
🌿 Outdoor and experience products
🎶 Live music and entertainment all day

Whether you're shopping, looking for a fun day out with the whānau, or just love a good local market — there’s something for everyone.

description:
Mystery Feast on Mischief Night! Halloween dinner with Chef Max Gordy 🎃 Supporting Kaibosh., Mystery Feast on Mischief Night! Halloween dinner with Chef Max Gordy 🎃 Supporting Kaibosh.
🎃 Step inside, if you dare... on the eve of Halloween. It's a Mischief Night!
👻A chilling murder mystery unfolds over a hauntingly good three-course Halloween dinner by Chef Max Gordy!

On 30 October, gather your cleverest friends and find your darkest ghoulish attire 🧛‍♀️ Who will crack the case first: the Detectives or the Villains? 🕵️‍♂️
Expect twists, laughter, and a touch of fright 💀 with spot prizes through the night — plus a reward for the best-dressed.

👩‍🍳 Award-winning chef Max Gordy ( @grazewinebar ) will conjure up a frightfully delicious Halloween-themed feast.
🥂 Your ticket includes one complimentary alcoholic beverage (with more available to purchase on the night).
🙌 Every ticket sold helps Kaibosh ensure that no good food is left to die.

TICKET TYPES
Bring a team of six to solve the mystery and devour a fiendishly good feast for $666.
Have a frightening four-some? Book a table for $444.
Spooky single seats available for $111... we will seat you at a mystery table...

VENUE
60 Dixon Street is up a flight of steep steps – with only one way in.

What is Mischief Night?
In parts of Pennsylvania and New Jersey in the eastern USA, 30 October is called “Mischief Night.” The tradition refers to the eve of Halloween in which children and teenagers celebrate the holiday one night early with pranks, tricks and more. While in New England, some call it Cabbage Night...
Join us to experience Chef Max Gordy's culinary take on Mischief Night in Pōneke!

#Halloween #HalloweenNZ #MischiefNight #MaxGordy #EveybodyEats #CharityDinner #FundraisingDinner #WellingtonDining #Pōneke #WellingtonNZ
label: Food & Drink

description:
Next Gen Cook Off, The Next Gen Cook Off returns for its fifth year, and things are heating up at Everybody Eats.
Every Monday in August, four of Wellington’s freshest young chefs will go head-to-head in a high-energy kitchen takeover, serving up epic three-course dinners using rescued food.

Each chef will be given the same protein, generously provided by Meat Direct, but everything else is a surprise—ingredients are revealed that morning, based on what’s come in. Menus are created on the spot, and dishes are served to a buzzing, hungry crowd. It’s fast-paced, creative chaos with serious culinary skills on display. Guests get a front-row seat to the action, while supporting a truly game-changing enterprise.

4 August — Jessie Gibberd, Loretta
Originally from rural Waikato, Jessie Gibberd made the move to Wellington to study, but it was the buzz of hospitality that captured her heart. Swapping textbooks for tongs, she left her degree behind to dive headfirst into the kitchen. Now a chef de partie at Loretta, Jessie brings a grounded, fresh perspective to one of the city’s most beloved eateries.

11 August — Felipe Molina, El Matador
Hailing from Chile, Felipe Molina is a professional chef with over 15 years of experience in kitchens around the world. Having worked in several countries and world-class restaurants, Felipe brings a global sensibility to his craft. With a passion for seafood, meats, and bold, expressive flavours, his cooking is shaped by travel and tradition, blending international influence with creativity on every plate.

18 August — Zane Gupwell, Graze
Zane Gupwell began his hospitality journey at just 15, washing dishes at a local café in Mount Eden. From there, he headed to Queenstown, learning from a wide range of chefs and kitchen styles before challenging himself with a move to Wellington. Since then, he’s worked at some of the city’s top restaurants and now brings his thoughtful, evolving style to Graze Wine Bar.

25 August — Lulu Temmuyin, Mr Go’s
Lulu Temmuyin is a chef who loves pushing boundaries, even when they’re unexpected. Lactose intolerant but obsessed with cheese, and not a fan of lamb but winner of a lamb cooking competition, Lulu is all about surprises. At Mr Go’s, she brings bold, sustainable flavour to the forefront, blending personality with punch in every dish.

Everybody Eats runs on a pay-what-you-can model, transforming food waste into gourmet meals and bringing the community together over good kai. The Next Gen Cook Off celebrates and champions this mission, proving that rescued food can be next-level delicious.

The Next Gen Cook Off is proudly supported by The Gas Hub.
label: Food & Drink

Pre order Thai foods, NEXT WEEK'S THAI COMFORT SPECIAL IS HERE!

Get ready for our Kin Favorite: Beef Mince Pad Kaprao with Fried Egg
!
This is the ultimate Thai street food classic, and here's why you need to pre-order:
Tender, savory beef mince is wok-tossed with a fiery, fragrant blend of fresh chilies, garlic, and aromatic fresh basil. The high heat of the wok creates a spicy-sweet, intensely savory glaze that is totally addictive.
Served hot over jasmine rice and crowned with a crispy-edged, runny-yolked fried egg. Break that yolk and mix it all together for a bite of pure happiness!

description:
Rotten Luck Fermentation Club Special SAUERKRAUT & KIMCHI (Kids)– Pop-up Parlour 2025, Rotten Luck Fermentation Club Special SAUERKRAUT & KIMCHI (Kids)– Pop-up Parlour 2025
The Rotten Luck Club is at the Pop-up Parlour!

SAUERKRAUT & KIMCHI - SCHOOL HOLIDAY EDITION

Learn how to make kimchi and sauerkraut with locals Kelly and Catherine from Pukerua Bay Fermentation Club. This will be a hands on session!

Event Details

• What - 2 hr workshop
• When - 11am-1pm, 23 September 2025
• Where - St Marks, 98 Rāwhiti Road, Pukerua Bay (opposite school)
• Cost - $10 per person and you will head away with jars of beautiful kimchi and sauerkraut to continue the fermentation process at home. Salt, sugar and fish sauce and gochugaru chilli flakes for kimchi and caraway seeds for the sauerkraut will be supplied.

BOOK NOW https://tinyurl.com/4hdapf3b

• What to bring? BYO knife, wooden spoon, chopping board, big mixing pot/bowl and glass jars! If everyone contributes a couple fresh vege/fruit ingredients to share, we will have some options to play with on the day (e.g. Green/red/Savoy/Chinese cabbage - Daikon/Chinese radish - Red chilies - Apple - Mushrooms - Carrot - Beets - Cucumber- Ginger - Onion - Garlic - Garden greens like kale, bok choy, spinach).

description:
Steve Sinclair - public lecture, Steve Sinclair - public lecture
'fourth_space, beyond Architecture as a Narcissistic Entity'

LT2 at the School of Architecture and Design VUW.

About this Event

Steve Sinclair is co-founder and director of fourth_space, a practice that seeks to "rescue space to make places," to "recycle bits of left-over architecture," and to make Architecture as "a unifying discipline - politics, regulation, location, design, finance, construction and user experience - that should maintain social and artistic concerns."


https://cdn-az.allevents.in/events10/banners/b883d840-741c-11f0-867e-7d1fd93eb1fd-rimg-w1200-h597-dcd5d5d5-gmir.jpg

Steve studied at the Mackintosh School of Architecture and the Bartlett School before completing an MSc at the London School of Economics. He worked at Morphosis, Ron Arad Associates, FAT (Fashion Architecture Taste), and Harper Mackay (MAK), before joining Paolo Mozzato in 2004, and subsequently Huw Williams, to form fourth_space.
In addition to directing fourth_space Steve is a design advisor to the Hackney Estate Regeneration Design Group, teaches at the AA and is co-owner of award winning Ombra bar & restaurant - where the “Negroni_Talks...!” happen. Available on podcast, these events "promote looser, all-encompassing engagements with greater participation, as well as dispelling false authority and un-challengable ‘expert’ opinions.... "
Steve's lecture is hosted by Te Kāhui Whaihanga ~ New Zealand Institute of Architecture in association with School of Architecture and Design, Victoria University of Wellington ~ Te Herenga Waka and the Architectural Centre.

Sip:
Then head next door for a guided wine tasting from the passionate team at The Good Way (located beside the Martinborough Brewery on Ohio Street), showcasing a selection of their elegant, small-batch wines. Find your favourite and grab a bottle to take home—perfect for gifting or continuing the magic later.

Taste:
Indulge your senses with a chocolate tasting hosted by Elly from be happy chocolate. Sample her handcrafted, ethically made bars and select your favourite block to take home. Please advise any dietary requirements when booking. Warm your hands around a velvety be happy hot chocolate and...

Stargaze:
Head outside for a gentle stroll to Considine Park with Charlotte from Wairarapa Dark Sky. Walk in the Dark while sipping hot chocolate. A chance to understand the benefits of the dark sky and finish with some star gazing.

Timing is flexible to allow for moving between locations, if you'd like to order food from The Social Kitchen food truck at the Brewery, etc. The latest finish time would be 8.45pm.

description:
Yoga & Cacao Twilight & Morning Edition - Pop-up Parlour 2025, Yoga & Cacao Twilight & Morning Edition - Pop-up Parlour 2025
Come and join Jenny Allan for a cup of ceremonial grade cacao and then enjoy a gentle and relaxing restorative yoga practice - twilight edition.

Event details

• What - 1.5 hr yoga session
• When -
TWILIGHT EDITION 7-8.30pm Tuesday 23rd September 2025
MORNING EDITION 10-11.30am Saturday 27th September 2025

• Where - St Marks, 98 Rāwhiti Road, Pukerua Bay
• Cost - $30 per person

• What to bring? Most props are provided but feel free to bring your own yoga mat for extra comfort as well as a cushion, blanket, socks and an eye pillow if you have one.

This class is suitable for all - no previous experience is required.

LIMITED SPACES AVAILABLE.
TWILIGHT SESSION - https://tinyurl.com/5a2pad44
MORNING SESSION - https://tinyurl.com/mw82z38u

Restorative yoga is a practice of deep relaxation in which yoga poses (asanas) are held for several minutes with the use of props such as blocks, bolster and blankets to support the body in gentle stretch.

When your body enters a state of relaxation, your mind will also relax. Once you have been guided to let go of any tension held in your body, all that is required is for you to pay attention to your breath, becoming aware of any thoughts that may arise, and then gently releasing them.

This restful practice calms both mind and body, allowing the nervous system to enter its parasympathetic state – the state of “rest and digest”, in which healing is enabled and enhanced.

About Cacao
Cacao is a superfood. It is plant medicine at its finest. Its scientific name, Theobroma cacao, translates to "food of the Gods." Containing many minerals, vitamins and phytonutrients such as flavonoids and antioxidants, it is also an extremely potent adaptogen that encourages the body to come into balance.

Cacao has a particularly strong influence on the heart – both physiologically and energetically. Cacao anecdotally is reported to enhance connection in community, hence its beauty in being shared in circle.

In Jenny's experience, cacao seems to enhance whatever it is that you are doing – be it running a marathon or meditating – cacao can make you go deeper, further, longer, stronger. However she does seem to have a mind of her own so be open to the experience she offers you – it may not always go quite how you planned!

Cacao is very safe and tolerated well by most people. However it is to be used with caution by people who are taking high doses of SSRIs. Cacao releases serotonin, so it works as a mild antidepressant. When taken with SSRIs that release serotonin chemically it can lead to serotonin syndrome. Individuals taking MAOIs (monoamine oxidase inhibitors) should avoid consuming ceremonial cacao due to potential interactions.

This workshop is part of Pukerua Bay Hub's 2025 Pop-up Parlour - thanks for your support.

description:
The Casual Dram: 19, It’s time for another Casual Dram, and this time we’ll be taking a look at distillation rates - with double, partial-triple and triple distilled whiskies all making an appearance.
If you’ve ever looked at the flow chart for partial triple distillation, you’ll know that this sort of thing can be pretty complex!
But fear not, I promise we won’t be getting too scientific - and we’ll taste an interesting mix of official and independently bottled crackers, across a multitude of ages from some all-time fave distilleries; Mortlach, Benrinnes, Bunnahabhain and Amrut.
Here’s the lineup…
Bunnahabhain 12 years old 2023 Cask Strength Edition 60.1% (Sherry casks) WB 87.27
Mortlach 'Signatory Symington's Choice' 2007 / 17 years old #205 56.6% (1st Fill Oloroso Sherry Butt Finish) WB 88.23
Benrinnes Adelphi 13 years old 55.5% (1st Fill Oloroso Sherry Hogshead) WB 88.19
Amrut Triparva Triple Distilled 50% (casks as yet unknown) WB 87.19
Mystery whisky WB 88.11
I hope you can join me for another tilt at five tip top drams!

Booking info here: https://wellingtonheritagefestival.co.nz/.../tales-from.../

Health & Safety:
Please dress appropriately for the conditions.
While we do our best to guide you on a safe walking route, during the winter months the ground can become slippery in places.
label: Community & Culture

description:
Denniston - a place worth fighting for., The Denniston Plateau is one of Aotearoa's most unique landscapes and is rated by the Department of Conservation as a key ecologically valuable site. It is a unique ‘lost world’ ecosystem home to a remarkable array of life. A fast-track application to mine 20-million tonnes of coal in the area is expected to be filed this year.
Join us for an engaging session to:
Hear from experts about Denniston Plateau’s extraordinary biodiversity and ecology.
View a photo exhibition by West Coast photographer Neil Silverwood capturing the Plateau’s beauty.
Learn about the proposal to expand coal mining in the area
Wine, beer and appetisers are provided. You may be asked to show proof of identity upon arrival.
label: Conservation & Environment

description:
Traditional Kölsch Service!, Kölsch Service is BACK!! Enjoy our fresh batch of Dösen Kölsch the traditional way - just like in Köln.
What's Kölsch service?
It's kinda like beer yum cha but there's only one thing on the menu - 200ml glasses of Kölsch bier!

We keep track of your tab by marking the edge of your coaster and when your glass is empty - voilà, another glass appears!
If you're done, just pop your coaster on top of your glass to indicate no more.
You can order food and non-alcoholics the same way, just take a seat and everything will come to you.
To make sure you get a table, book here: https://www.meandoses.co.nz/bookings
PLUS DEUTSCHES ESSEN!

We're serving up Apache's take on Currywurst - the classic German streetfood that is a dream with a crisp Kölsch. Yes we'll sort some vegan ones too!
We're also slinging more amazing fresh Brezels
from Brezelmania, served with cheese sauce

We'll be running Kölsch service from 12pm - 5pm on Saturday October 4th, come along and get the Köln experience!
label: Food & Drink

description:
The MASSIVE Pint Sized Quiz! -August Edition, These come around so fast but by golly are they good!
Head to our website and book your seats in for another MAAAASIVE Pint Sized Quiz!
With your host Marcus the Majestic, and in collaboration with Believe It Or Not Quizzes, these are always a great way to kick into your Saturday afternoon!
Free to play and family friendly- don't miss out!
label: Community & Culture

description:
Soup & Solidarity, Join us for a relaxed, creative evening as craft solidarity books for both Ramallah (our sister city) and Gaza, to show our allyship from here in Aotearoa.
We’ll provide scrapbooking materials, but we encourage you to bring your own treasures. Items like stencils, photos, poems, and Aotearoa-inspired artwork are all welcome.
Join us to highlight shared culture through art, music, hopeful messages, and reflections on solidarity here at home.
This drop-in session continues the spirit of our Nakba Day gathering - connecting, reflecting, and expressing care. Expect warmth, soup, bread, tea, incense, beautiful music, and space to stay until late. This event is open to all ages.

description:
Urban Cocktail Trail I Pōneke Wellington (NZ), Urban Cocktail Trail I Pōneke Wellington (NZ)
Get ready Pōneke! The Urban Cocktail Trail is heading your way this Spring for an incredible afternoon of bar-hopping and cocktail sipping!

description:
Urban Wine Walk - Pōneke Wellington, The streets and laneways of Pōneke Wellington are set to come alive this Spring as a line-up of eight venues each play host to an incredible winemaker, who'll be there ready to pour and chat you through an unforgettable afternoon.


HOW IT WORKS
Kick things off at your chosen starting spot with something to eat, and then let the adventure unfold. Wander at your own pace, glass in hand, discovering incredible wines and venues along the way.

With a stellar line-up of winemakers, good vibes at every stop, and a guaranteed sell-out crowd, the Urban Wine Walk is the ultimate self-guided tasting experience you and your crew won’t want to miss!


PARTICIPATING VENUES & WINEMAKERS
1 - Choice Bros Ft. Coney Wines (NZ)
2 - Glou Glou Ft. Halite (NZ)
3 - Little Beer Quarter Ft. Hopes Grove & Aard (NZ)
4 - Lulu Bar Ft. Margrain Vineyard (NZ)
5 - Noble Rot Ft. VALLI (NZ)
6 - Panhead Tory St Ft. The Good Way (NZ)
7 - The Arborist Rooftop Bar Ft. Matawhero (NZ)
8 - The Tasting Room Ft. Tettonica Wines (NZ)

*Please note that traditional venue menus may vary due to the nature of the event.


TICKETS
Vino Lover Pass – $79 + Booking Fee (Limited Availability)

WHAT’S INCLUDED
Wine Tastings – Up to 3 wines per winemaker along the trail
$10 Food Voucher – Redeem at your nominated starting venue (before 1pm)
$25 Wine Voucher – Put towards event-day wine orders (six-pack minimum, participating producers only)
Event Essentials – Your official wristband & keepsake tasting glass


EVENT REGISTRATION & COLLECTION
Before heading to your nominated starting venue, swing by the official registration point to collect your wristband, tasting glass & vouchers.

Where: Panhead Tory St (1 Tory St)
When: Saturday 18th October | 11am – 1pm

Please note: The Urban Wine Walk officially runs from 12-4pm. Arrive early to grab your event pack and avoid the rush!


REFUND POLICY
Tickets are non-refundable (we’re all in for good times rain, hail or shine!). The only exception is if the event is cancelled or postponed by the organisers – then we’ve got you covered.


GETTING AROUND
One of the best parts about the Urban Wine Walk...? It’s totally self-guided! After checking in at your nominated starting venue, the day is yours! Wander at your own pace, discover new spots and sip your way through the trail however you like.


Sorry kids, Urban Wine Walk is strictly 18 Years and Over!

description:
One New Zealand Warriors ANZAC Weekend, The One New Zealand Warriors and Sky Stadium are proud to invite you to the Ultimate Weekend Warriors Experience.
This exclusive experience will give the biggest Rugby League fans a unique opportunity to get closer to the action than ever before as the One New Zealand Warriors return to Sky Stadium on ANZAC weekend 2026. With a jam-packed schedule of behind-the-scenes access, enthralling events, and an epic showdown on the Saturday, it’s bound to be a weekend you won’t forget.
What’s Included:
Friday Night Welcome
Kick off the weekend with some of the biggest Warriors fans in the country! Start in the Warriors changing room, feel the hype build, and then emerge through the players tunnel with pyrotechnics, smoke, lights and music - experience entering Sky Stadium just as the teams themselves do. The entourage will then move up to Sky Stadiums’ premium lounges for snacks, a cash bar, and a Q&A from some legendary ex-Warriors.
Saturday Match Day Hospitality
Enjoy the Anzac Day match and entertainment with fellow Warriors fanatics from the comfort of one of our premium lounges. Included is a premium food offering, private seats with epic views and dedicated bar facilities.
Hosted by Warriors Legends
Throughout the weekend you’ll also be in the company of some of the Warriors greats. You’ll have ample opportunity to ask questions, get insights, tips and tricks, or hear a play by play of some of your favourite Warriors action moments straight from the source.
Exclusive Prizes
Be in to win some exclusive signed Warriors merchandise and other spot prizes over the course of the weekend as a cherry on top of a fantastic Ultimate Weekend Warriors Experience.
Don’t miss out! We expect tickets to go quick, so call up your mates and lock it in today.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
We
Mac 'n' Cheese pop-up! Kaibosh X Everybody Eats collab for Welly On A Plate, We
Mac 'n' Cheese! We
Welly! Celebrate comfort food & community on the last day of winter
where every bowl makes a difference. Kaibosh X EE team up to serve 2,000 bowls of mac 'n' cheese on the final day of Visa Wellington On a Plate. Help us set a record for Welly while enjoying a bowl of the ultimate comfort food
At just $10 per serve, every bowl will help raise funds for Everybody Eats and Kaibosh - two of Wellington’s legendary food rescue and community dining champions. Help us hit our target of 2,000 bowls in one day!
WHEN: Sunday 31 August, 1-8pm (or sold out)
WHERE: 60 Dixon Street (upstairs)
COST: $10 per bowl (pay-what-you-can options available).
Walk-in only, dine-in or takeaway.
Vegan and Gluten Free options available.
Bring your friends, whānau, or the whole flat!
You'll be able to customise your mac 'n' cheese with a range of toppings and flavours which have been made with rescued food, showcasing just how delicious food recovery can be. From rainbow pickles to herby crunchy crumb, extra #FoodRescue flavour bombs to spice up your mac!
As official charity partners of the Wellington On A Plate Festival, Everybody Eats and Kaibosh turn comfort food into real impact for our communities.
We
kai. We
Welly.
Share your
with Welly.
Pay-it-forward to help us share hearty kai with more people in Pōneke: https://donorbox.org/welovemacncheese-donation
Thank you to Fonterra's Doing Good Together programme, PAK'nSAVE Kilbirnie, Harrington's and All Good for supporting us with this event which is a joint fundraiser for our two charities.
The goal on 31 August is to serve 2,000 bowls AND to also fund 2,000 meals for the community. Join the celebration, enjoy incredible kai and help make a real difference.

Wellington Crack Chicken x Heinz Fried Chicken Sauce Pop-Up, Heinz’s fan-favourite Fried Chicken Sauce has finally landed in Aotearoa, and it’s making its NZ debut in style – with a limited-time pop-up collab at Crack Chicken. Already a hit with fried chicken fans overseas for its creamy, sweet and spicy kick, the sauce is now hitting Crack Chicken menus nationwide for one week only.

- Crack Chicken Willis Lane – 1 Willis Street, Wellington Central

description:
2025 Review of Retirement Income Policies, By 2030, over a million Kiwis will be 65+. Retirement is changing — and so are the needs of our older generations.
Join us for a talk with Dr. Patrick Nolan on the 2025 Review of Retirement Income Policies. He will share insights on the changing landscape, KiwiSaver’s role, policy gaps, and how we can build a fair, sustainable system for the future.
Don’t miss this important discussion about what retirement will look like for New Zealanders in the years ahead.
Seats are limited for Pizza & Salad for $30pp prior to the talk.

description: Young Flame, Young Flame is a dining experience inspired by fire. Think fire show and flaming cocktail on arrival to then dine surrounded by hundreds of flickering candles casting a warm glow, for an evening of fine finesse. QT Wellington’s Executive Chef, Antoine Collet, delivers a bold three-course chef’s tasting menu that’s as deliciously playful as it is refined. And if you like the finer things in life, while devouring each course you'll sip on beer & wine to your heart's desire and let the sultry sounds of live music weave through the room, adding a touch of old-school glamour to your night. Young Flame promises an evening steeped in elemental elegance.

description:
2025 Taiwan Update Lectures, Taiwan’s Multidimensional Energy Security Challenges
Professor Chyungly Lee
A stable and reliable energy supply is essential for a nation’s economic growth and development. In selecting fuel sources, nowadays almost all countries have taken climate change into account, adopted sensible clean energy transition plans, and designed a schedule to meet the goal of Net Zero. While pursuing a 3-E (energy-economic-environmental) balanced energy supply strategy, Taiwan, lacking indigenous resources, faces unique challenges of supply disruptions from over dependence on energy imports and possible blockade, quarantine, or invasion from Beijing. Any disruption of power supply or surge of energy costs could not only threaten Taiwan’s competitive edge in the global high-tech market but also undermine Taiwan’s internal stability and the nation’s survival. In this talk, Dr. Chyungly Lee will first present fact sheets on Taiwan’s energy status, summarize Taiwan’s current energy strategy, and then discuss dilemmas and vulnerabilities that Taiwan might face in the next few years.
What does Taiwan’s two-level politics tell us?
Professor Alex Tan
This presentation examines Taiwan as a critical case study for understanding the evolving challenges to democracy in the 21st century. Arguing that Taiwan serves as a “canary in the coalmine,” the analysis highlights how the island’s early and persistent political polarization—rooted in identity politics and the legacies of authoritarian rule—prefigures trends now visible in established democracies worldwide. The research explores how deep divisions between the Kuomintang (KMT) and Democratic Progressive Party (DPP), reinforced by institutional and social factors, have led to legislative gridlock, declining trust in political institutions, and a “democratic ceiling” that constrains further democratic development. Taiwan’s precarious geopolitical position, facing constant pressure from the People’s Republic of China, intensifies the dilemma of balancing national security with the protection of civil liberties. The presentation analyzes Taiwan’s innovative responses to disinformation, foreign interference, and public health crises, illustrating both the resilience and fragility of democratic systems under external and internal stress.
Gaming Taiwan: Indigenous Epistemologies in Play
Associate Professor Chia-rong Wu
This research explores how Indigenous knowledge systems in Taiwan are being revitalized through video games. Far from mere entertainment, these games draw on tribal traditions, ancestral stories, and deep connections to the land to create meaningful digital experiences. By blending oral storytelling with interactive gameplay, Taiwanese Indigenous game developers are preserving cultural memory while challenging colonial legacies. Titles like Princess Baleng, Tayal, VuVu, and Gadvia show how games can empower communities and pass down wisdom to younger generations in innovative and engaging ways. Gamers not only play a game but also immerse themselves in digital environments shaped by Indigenous perspectives and values. This study encourages all engaged audiences, including educators and students, to consider video games as powerful tools for cultural resurgence and learning. Focusing on Indigenous Taiwan, it highlights how digital games integrate historical consciousness and interactivity to reimagine the past and future of the island.
label: Government & Politics

description:
50yrs Misuse of Drugs Act: What impact & what next?, The 1975 Misuse of Drugs Act (MoDA) has failed to deliver. Data from the United Nations Office for Drugs and Crime indicates the demand for drugs is greater than ever, while the supply of drugs knows no bounds. The failure and harm caused by the so called 'War on Drugs' is acknowledged globally and witnessed first hand here in Aotearoa New Zealand.

Back in 2011 a comprehensive review of the MoDA conducted by New Zealand Law Commission recommended the MoDA “should be repealed and replaced by a new Act …administered by the Ministry of Health”. HRCA wants to see that recommendation enacted.

New Zealand has a history for bold world leading policy reform: Woman’s Right to Vote; Decriminalisation of Sex Work; National Needle Exchange, Same Sex Marriage and most recently Drug Checking.

This half day Symposium will provide clear evidence why major law reform is necessary and detail the foundations upon which Aotearoa NZ can once again be innovative and lead the way with new drug laws based on evidence, research and experience -providing a safer environment for future generation.

Harm Reduction Coalition Aotearoa are delighted to have assembled a group of respected independent thinkers with vast experience of drug policy in Aotearoa and beyond, to reflect on the impact of the MoDA and to identify the principles and values needed to underpin new drug laws.

Warren Young: Prof. of Law & Former Deputy President New Zealand Law Commission.
Kirsten Gibson: Chair of Harm Reduction Coalition Aotearoa and Qualitative Researcher.
Fiona Hutton: Associate Prof. Institute of Criminology, Victoria University of Wellington.
Adam Dorsett: 40 yrs Living/Lived Experience of Prohibited Drug Use, 25yrs in Prison.
Julian Buchanan: Former UNODC Advisor and Criminology Professor.

NOTE:
This event is free and open to the public on a 'first come first served' basis.
However, eventfinda ticket holders will be guaranteed a seat.
label: Government & Politics

description:
Affordable Healthcare for All: Wellington, Luxon’s cuts are making our health system worse. His choices mean it’s getting harder and more expensive to see a doctor or nurse. 
National has found hundreds of millions for tobacco companies while New Zealand’s hospitals go understaffed and nurses are left without jobs. 
It's Luxon's fault GP fees are heading towards $100. Under National, you’re paying more, waiting longer and getting less. 
Labour believes that every New Zealander should be able to access world-class healthcare, no matter where they live. 
We will make it cheaper and easier to get care close to home, and make sure hospitals are there when you need them.  
Join Labour Leader Chris Hipkins and Health Spokesperson Dr Ayesha Verrall for a public meeting on getting the healthcare you deserve.
label: Government & Politics

If u wish drop material off to me to share about your visions and goals then please drop to me before Sunday. message for address

description:
AGM 2025, Hi everyone! Just letting you all know that next Thursday 14th August will be the Paremata Residents Association AGM
We are hosting the event at Mana Cruising Club (Ngati Toa Domain) and it gets underway at 7:00pm.
We have a guest speaker from Wellington Water (Steve Hutchison, Chief Advisor Wastewater) who will discuss the water network in our area, and give us insight into planned activities and future plans.
We also will run through the usual formalities required for associations (minutes, financial reports etc) and will try our best to not let it be to boring *insert sleeping emoji*
If anyone is keen on joining the committee team, you're welcome to put your name forward on the evening. Or send an email or Facebook message and let us know if you are interested.
The association needs good and willing people to help represent the local community and make our area a great place to live
See you on the night!

description:
ChoctoberFest, Porirua is the home of New Zealand’s favourite chocolate — Whittaker's. So it's only fitting it has a festival celebrating all things chocolate. During September and October, the city is serving up a range of tasty treats for ChoctoberFest, all featuring Whittaker’s chocolate.
More than 30 local businesses will be competing in the Whittaker’s Bake Off and Top of the Chocs. Head in to participating spots, and try unique chocolate drinks and amazing baked goods. You can then vote for your favourites.
Indulge your tastebuds and try special drinks such as a whipped white choc biscoff latte, or a coldbrew shot choc maltini. For a sweet snack, how about a molten embrace, kunafa chocolate croissant, or a banoffee flossy pie? There are plenty of options for all chocolate lovers, including vegan and gluten free items.
As well as voting for your favourite items, you can join the fan club, share reviews, and be in to win. Up for grabs are 100 Whittaker’s Peanut Slabs, an exclusive tour of the Whittaker’s factory, and ChoctoberFest vouchers for local cafes and bars.
The festival has been running since 2022, and is a highlight of the local hospitality scene.
label: Festivals

description:
Candidate Kōrero and Mayoral Candidate Debate, Candidate Kōrero and Mayoral Candidate Debate
🌇 The Candidate Kōrero is a drop-in, expo-style session where you can meet all council and mayoral candidates, ask questions, and hear their vision for our city.

👥 This is followed by the Mayoral Candidate Debate, moderated by an independent facilitator and featuring a mix of community-submitted and independently prepared questions from the moderator. The debate will be supported by a sign language interpreter.

The debate will be livestreamed and recorded, giving everyone the chance to hear directly from those seeking to lead our city.

Have a question you'd like to hear answered in the upcoming Mayoral Candidate Debate? Submit it here: hutt.city/candidate-debate

Timings:
◾ Doors open: 5:45pm
◾ Candidate Kōrero: 6-7pm
◾ Mayoral Candidate Debate: 7-8:30pm

description:
China and the Media Landscape in the Pacific, Over the last decade, the People’s Republic of China has sought to deepen its ties with Pacific Island countries. Beijing’s efforts to cultivate influence in the region have included expanding economic, diplomatic, and security ties with Pacific Island nations, as well as expanding China’s footprint in the region’s media landscape. This talk will present the findings of recent research on China’s efforts to shape reporting, media coverage and narratives in the Pacific Islands and put Beijing’s efforts within the context of the region’s rapidly evolving information landscape.
 About the speakers:
Heidi Holz is a Senior Research Scientist at CNA. For close to two decades, her work has focused on PRC strategic communications, propaganda, and influence efforts. She is a graduate of Georgetown University’s School of Foreign Service, where she received a master’s degree in security studies and a bachelor’s degree in Chinese and East Asian history.
Genevieve Collins is a research specialist in the China Studies program at CNA, where her research focuses on the behaviour of China’s state-run media and its reactions to US military operations and activities.
 Barbara Dreaver (Discussant) has been the Pacific Reporter for TVNZ 1 News since 2002, breaking stories uncovering social and economic issues affecting Pacific people living in New Zealand and the Pacific Islands. In 2020, she created a two-year training programme through Pacific Cooperation Broadcasting Ltd to support new Pacific journalists across the Pacific region. In the 2024 New Years Honours she was awarded an ONZM for services to investigative journalism and Pacific communities.
 About CNA: CNA is a non-profit, non-governmental research and analysis organization dedicated to providing independent and objective analyses to the U.S. government and the public. This talk will build on previous CNA research on China and the Pacific Islands media landscape which you can find at www.cna.org.

description:
Drop-in session | Reserve Management Plan, Council manages over 130 parks and reserves on your behalf – from playgrounds, sports grounds, and esplanades to scenic and native reserves.
We’re drafting an omnibus Reserve Management Plan to set out objectives, polices and rules that guide their use, management, protection and development and want your help. Tell us what you value about your favourite parks and reserves, what might impact their use, protection and enjoyment, and what ideas do you have for their future.
There's lots of ways to have your say - online, on paper and in person.
Come and chat to our Open Space Planning team
Thursday 28 August, 4pm–7pm, Coastlands Shopping Centre
Saturday 30 August, 9am–1pm, Maclean Park, skatepark
Saturday 6 September, 9am–1pm, Waikanae Park, old skatepark
Sunday 14 September, 9am–1pm, Ōtaki Centennial Park
Further information and ways to provide feedback can be found at haveyoursay.kapiticoast.govt.nz/RMP

description:
From Europe to the Indo-Pacific: Finnish views on strategic partnerships and security in times of uncertainty, Finland, which shares a 1300km land border with Russia, has had its strategic circumstances dramatically impacted by the war in Ukraine. In this talk, State Secretary Pasi Rajala will discuss Europe’s evolving security landscape and its implications for Finland and NATO. He will share Finnish views on enhancing security and national resilience in response to shifting dynamics across Europe, the Indo-Pacific, and the global stage. He will also speak to the importance of deepening cooperation between Finland and New Zealand, two like-minded partners committed to democratic values, multilateralism, and the rules-based international order.
Mr. Pasi Rajala is State Secretary to Foreign Minister Elina Valtonen and Defence Minister Antti Häkkänen. He has previously served as Special European Affairs Adviser to the Finnish Prime Minister, Special Adviser to the Minister for Trade and Development, and Press Counselor and Spokesperson at the Finnish Embassy in Washington, D.C. Prior to that he held a number of communications positions, including in development finance company Finnfund, PR agency EuroRSCG, and the UN Development Program. Mr. Rajala holds a Master of Social Sciences degree from the University of Helsinki where he majored in International Relations.
label: Government & Politics

description:
From Vision to Action, Wellingtonians have spoken. Thousands of voices have come together to help create A Vision for Wellington — a bold, pragmatic blueprint for our city’s future, backed by findings from independent research.
Now it’s time to hear how those who want to lead our city will respond.
We’ll begin with a short presentation of the Vision itself — celebrating the thousands of Wellingtonians who shaped it, and the bold blueprint they’ve helped create for our city’s future.
Then we’ll put the hottest issues on the table: like how to rebuild trust in leadership, how to get Wellington back in business and affordable again, and how to restore pride and energy to the heart of the city.
This is your chance to test the candidates’ ideas against a Vsion created by thousands of Wellingtonians — and to put your own questions to them as you decide your vote.
Harbourside Function Venue is located above Macs Brewery on the waterfront. Arrive from 5:00pm for a 5:30 start.
Free entry, registration essential. Spaces are limited.
label: Government & Politics

description:
HRCA 50yrs Misuse of Drugs Act: What impact? What next?, Rutherford House (by the train station)
Room RHLT2
Bunny Street
Wellington
1.30-4.30pm
Free Admission
Light refreshments afterward
The NZ Misuse of Drugs Act 1975 (MoDA) has failed to deliver. Data from the United Nations Office for Drugs and Crime indicated the demand for drugs is greater than ever, while the supply of drugs knows no bounds.
A failure acknowledged globally and one we witness first hand here in Aotearoa NZ.
Back in 2011 a comprehensive review of the MoDA conducted by New Zealand Law Commission had already concluded the MoDA “should be repealed and replaced by a new Act …administered by the Ministry of Health”.
The Harm Reduction Coalition of Aotearoa wants to see that recommendation enacted.
We are delighted to have assembled a group of respected independent thinkers in the field, with vast experience of drug policy in Aotearoa and beyond, to reflect on the impact of the MoDA and to identify the principles and values needed to underpin new drug laws.
Warren Young
Professor of Law & Former Deputy President New Zealand Law Commission
Kirsten Gibson
Chair of Harm Reduction Coalition Aotearoa and Qualitative Researcher
Fiona Hutton
Associate Professor, Institute of Criminology, Victoria University of Wellington
Adam Dorsett
40 Years Living Experience of Prohibited Drug Use, in Prison for 25 years
Julian Buchanan
Former UNODC Advisor and Criminology Professor
New Zealand has a history for world leading innovative policy reform: Woman’s Right to Vote; Decriminalisation of Sex Work; National Needle Exchange, Same Sex Marriage and most recently Drug Checking.
This half day symposium will provide clear evidence why major law reform is necessary and detail the foundations upon which Aotearoa NZ can once again lead the way with new drug laws based on evidence, research and experience.
We look forward to seeing there!
Do pass on to anyone who might be interested.

Wellington Cadet Centre
393 Evans Bay Parade.


With the large number of Council and Mayoral candidates, we have decided to split the meeting into 2 parts.


Eastern Ward Candidates,

5 Minute break.


Mayoral Candidates,

description:
It's in the Ballot - CDC – Carterton District Mayoral Debate -In-studio, Contestants of 'It's in the Bag' become political candidates in 'It's in the Ballot' Meet the Candidates.
Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative. We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.
By using broadcasting and web-based technologies to deliver in-studio; online on Facebook, YouTube and Twitch; and edited as YouTube videos we aim to enable voters to make informed voting decisions.
This means you can send the weblink of the YouTube Video of your electorate show to your friends and whanau to encourage them to watch the show before they cast their votes.
Voting papers are sent to voters on Tuesday 9th September 2025 and must be delivered into a voting dropbox by 12pm Saturday 11th October 2025
label: Government & Politics

description:
'TONES OF SILENCE' - FUTUNA CHAPEL IN B&W - PUBLIC TALKS, ‘TONES of SILENCE’ – FUTUNA CHAPEL in BLACK and WHITE
PUBLIC TALKS START AT 2:00PM
The Trust looks forward to welcoming architects, designers, graduates, students and interested members of the public to attend this event and support the Trust in its work
Sunday 19th October.  Talks by Catherine Hammond and John Walsh
Sunday 2nd November. Talks by Malcolm Doidge and John Grace
BOOKINGS ARE PREFERRED TO ATTEND THIS EVENT
PRESENTERS
Catherine Hammond - Director Collections and Research, Auckland Museum
John Walsh – Writer – Walking Guides (Christchurch, Auckland, Wellington) 
John Grace – commercial lawyer and amateur B&W photographer
Dr. Malcolm Doidge - sculptor, video artist, photographer
CATHERINE HAMMOND - SUNDAY 18TH OCTOBER
Catherine Hammond is Director of Collections and Research at Auckland War Memorial Museum Tāmaki Paenga Hira, has worked in leadership roles in the arts and cultural sector in Aotearoa New Zealand for over two decades including Hocken Librarian at the University of Otago, and Research Library Manager at Auckland Art Gallery Toi o Tāmaki. Catherine is a trained librarian and published writer, editor, and curator, and has led the development of award-winning cultural heritage websites. Her research interests centre around the intersection of archives and Aotearoa art histories. She is Chair of the Guardians Kaitiaki of Alexander Turnbull Library and a Trustee of UNESCO Memory of the World Aotearoa New Zealand.
 Title of Catherine's talk
A Thousand Words: Photographic Archives in Aotearoa
Catherine will discuss the recent book and touring exhibition, A Different Light: First Photographs of Aotearoa and the role and impact of photographic archives as sites of research.
JOHN WALSH - SUNDAY 18TH OCTOBER
John Walsh is a leading New Zealand architecture writer. He edited Architecture New Zealand magazine for a decade, and has written numerous books on New Zealand architecture, among them the newly revised Auckland Architecture: A Walking Guide, which features photographs by Patrick Reynolds. (taken from AUCKLAND WRITERS FESTIVAL website)
JOHN GRACE - SUNDAY 2ND NOVEMBER
A selection of John's photographs make up the exhibition and he will also present a public talk about the photos, the vintage camera and equipment he uses, the history of photography and cameras used.
"Experiencing the chapel means interacting with it. From a photographic point of view, that means interacting optically and chemically to turn a solid, three-dimensional art form into a two-dimensional interpretation made up of tones of black, white and grey." John Grace - email- 18/06/25
DR. MALCOLM DOIDGE - SUNDAY 2ND NOVEMBER
Dr. Malcolm Doidge undertook a 360 time-lapse photography in the Chapel interior during the equinoxes and solstices of 2023 - 2024.  He produced a 2 – 3minute video of the timelapse project and this will be screened in the Chapel as part of the exhibition.  Malcolm will also give a presentation of his work and explore the digital processes involved in its production. He is an interdisciplinary sculptor and spatial designer. He uses digital time lapse and photogrammetry images for film poetry.
The Futuna Trust is a charitable organisation and all koha received from the exhibition events will go towards the ongoing care, maintenance and operation of Futuna Chapel and also to support various initiatives undertaken by the Trust.
