description:
Intro to 2D Traditional Animation - Creative Arts Holiday Programme, This is a beginners course in 2D animation where tweens & teens will learn the time-honoured principles of hand-drawn animation and how to apply them to your own animation project. You may work on a project incorporating your own ideas, or if you'd rather, an assigned a project from your tutor.

You can use any device, ipad or laptop you already own (except a mobile – it's really not big enough to do good animation on). The school does not provide any digital equipment.

Your tutor, Ross Payne, is a 30 year veteran of traditional 2D animation, and loves to share his knowledge about it for you to love it as much as he does.

In each lesson there will be examples and demonstrations of the animation principles with follow up exercises to put your new skills into practice. You'll work on your project both during class and at home, applying the animation principles to your individualised project.

You can choose to draw your animation on paper then scan/capture into your device, or choose to draw your animation digitally, directly into an animation programme. which ever you choose, instructions in class will be provided to give you the skills needed for this step.

Bring a water bottle and snack for morning tea.

This workshop is for ages 10 and above. Tuesday - Friday, 30 September - 3 October, 10 am - 1 pm daily.

This workshop is part of Inverlochy Art School's September School Holiday Programme. For more teen & tween workshops including photography, jewellery making, pottery and sewing head to the 'Tamariki and Teens' section of our website.

description:
Book Launch - South by South by Charles Ferrall, Join us to celebrate the publication of Charles Ferrall's South by South: New Zealand and the Heroic Age of Antarctic Exploration. The book will be launched by Harry Ricketts.

- Thursday 18 September, 6pm
- Unity Books Wellington
- Free event – all welcome!

Joseph Kinsey is not a name many of us know – or not as well as we know the name Robert Falcon Scott. But from his base in Christchurch, Kinsey – book and art collector, philanthropist, science enthusiast, businessman – forged deep connections with the Antarctic expeditions and the explorers themselves through his tireless work as the agent for various expeditions. Two other New Zealanders also formed close friendships: Charles Bowen, a former politician, and Wellington lawyer Leonard Tripp, to whom Shackleton declared: ‘I love you as David and Jonathan loved.’

South by South tells the story of New Zealand’s role in ‘the Heroic Age’, that wave of exploration beginning at the end of the nineteenth century in which men set out to traverse the continent of Antarctica and, if they survived, to bring home their findings. The members of this New Zealander triumvirate were all believers in the British Empire, but the southern voyages were to an uninhabited land.

South by South brings to light many letters, newspaper articles, and pieces of official correspondence, much of which has not been published before, during the five expeditions of 1901–1916: the Discovery, Nimrod, Terra Nova, Aurora, and Endurance. In particular, Scott’s letters to Kinsey and Shackleton’s to Tripp tell of their hope, despair, exhaustion, and deep gratitude for their friendship. What they and the explorers wrote was influenced by nineteenth-century adventure stories which conveyed the Imperialist ideals of the time. If the impending conflict of 1914–18 was a very ‘literary war’, this was a very literary exploration.

Charles Ferrall is an associate professor at Te Herenga Waka–Victoria University of Wellington. Among his books are Modernist Writing and Reactionary Politics (2001); The Trials of Eric Mareo (2002), co-written with Rebecca Ellis; East by South: China in the Australasian Imagination (2006), co-edited with Paul Millar and Keren Smith; Juvenile Literature and British Society 1850–1950 (2009), co-written with Anna Jackson; Henry Lawson in New Zealand (2012); How We Remember: New Zealanders and the First World War (2014), co-edited with Harry Ricketts; and Remembering Gallipoli: Interviews with New Zealand Gallipoli Veterans (2015), co-edited with Christopher Pugsley.

Cover photograph: The ship Discovery leaving Lyttelton Harbour, 1901. Alexander Turnbull Library, Wellington, New Zealand
Cover design: Spencer Levine

description:
Electrify Porirua: how to save money on your energy bills feat. Mike Casey, It keeps getting more expensive to heat our homes and water, cook our meals and get around. But there is a way to avoid those rising costs and Electrify Porirua will show you how.  
Most Porirua homes could be saving thousands on their energy bills each year, while also slashing emissions, simply by upgrading their gas and petrol machines to the electric equivalents available today - and ideally powering them with solar and batteries for more self-sufficiency in case of power cuts or natural disasters.
Porirua has crossed the “electrification tipping point” where homes, farms and businesses can now save money and reduce their emissions by going electric. It’s a massive win-win and a lot of people don’t know about the potential savings that are hiding in their cupboards, kitchens and driveways. 
Rewiring Aotearoa is trying to change that and we’re supporting grassroots action across the country. Community electrification groups are popping up all over the place and helping to raise awareness about the benefits for their local region and helping locals through the process. Now, it’s time to bring the buzz to Porirua.
Come along to hear from Mike Casey, who is saving tens of thousands a year on his all-electric solar-powered cherry orchard, and find out how electrifying Porirua is the smartest, cheapest, and healthiest way to power our lives.
label: Conservation & Environment

This September, the Kāpiti Business Chamber is partnering with the Ōtaki and Te Horo, Waikanae and Raumati Business Associations to host two “Meet the Candidates” events for our business community.

With local elections just around the corner, these sessions are your opportunity to engage directly with incoming candidates, hear their views on local business issues, and share what matters most to you.

A curated panel-style conversation with standing candidates

A chance to connect with others in your area

We’ve intentionally chosen two locations to make it easier for business owners across the district – from Waikanae and Raumati to Te Horo and Ōtaki – to attend their closest event.

These are free events, but RSVPs are essential.

description:
Nuclear Disarmament in a Nuclear Free New Zealand: Why it still matters, New Zealand is recognised as a global leader in nuclear disarmament, with its 1987 Nuclear
Free Zone, Disarmament, and Arms Control Act becoming a defining feature of the country’s
national identity. The establishment of a nuclear free zone has served as inspiration
worldwide, yet, despite this, the nuclear issue remains relevant to New Zealand. As long as
nuclear weapons exist, their environmental, humanitarian and geopolitical impacts extend far
beyond the borders of nuclear weapon states.
This panel and fireside chat seeks to situate New Zealand’s position within the global
nuclear landscape, exploring why the issue continues to matter to a nuclear free country,
highlighting the interconnected impacts of these weapons, whilst also considering New
Zealand’s role as a disarmament leader.
label: Government & Politics

description:
Public Lecture – Amnesty International Secretary General Dr Agnès Callamard, Public Lecture – Amnesty International Secretary General Dr Agnès Callamard
Global human rights leader Dr Agnès Callamard speaks on humanity, justice, and hope in action. Don’t miss this rare event.

Dr Agnès Callamard is recognised globally as a leading authority on governance, accountability, and international affairs. She has been Secretary General of Amnesty International since 2021, previously served as the UN Special Rapporteur on extrajudicial executions, and was Director of Columbia University’s Global Freedom of Expression project. Her career spans decades of leadership in defending human rights worldwide.
In this public lecture, Dr Callamard will reflect on today’s global challenges and opportunities, exploring how collective action can drive change.

Jonathon Boston ONZM, Emeritus Professor of Public Policy at the Wellington School of Business and Government, and Former Director of the Institute of Policy Studies and the Institute for Governance & Policy Studies will host the session.
This event offers a unique opportunity to engage with global human rights discourse in Aotearoa New Zealand at a time when representation, civic freedoms, and the international rules-based order are being widely debated. It also aims to inspire the next generation of change-makers to connect with both local and global struggles for justice.
Event Details
Date & Time: Tuesday 23rd October, 5:00pm doors with lecture starting at 5:30pm
Venue: Rutherford Theatre, Victoria University of Wellington
Who Should Attend? Students, faculty, civil society leaders, activists, and members of the public interested in human rights, justice, and accountability
Accessibility: The venue is wheelchair accessible
Seats Available: 150 seats open to the public (first come, first served)
label: Government & Politics

description:
Accounting in the AI Era | Wellington, Mixing micro-products, bots, and off-the-shelf AI can disrupt - leaving work fragmented. What's missing is a unified AI vision and strategy.
Your investment in AI needs to solve our industry's biggest challenges - a talent shortage, productivity and responsiveness to client needs.
Join Zato at their official NZ launch.
Understand:
·       How to reclaim up to 80% of compilation time
·       How to consolidate multiple pieces in the accounting puzzle
·       The difference between automation and compilation
·       What firms are doing to rebalance and retrain their teams ahead of AI
·       The opportunity cost of not implementing a clear AI strategy
Enquiries to jade@zatohq.com. This workshop qualifies for 2.5 CPD hours
Download the Event Programme (PDF)
label: Business & Networking

description:
Re-imagine Pōneke: Co-design our city, What would Wellington look like if it truly reflected our hopes for a just, sustainable, and thriving city – not in 30 years, but right now?
Join us for Re-imagine Pōneke, a half-day unconference where Wellingtonians will come together to dream big, share ideas, and co-create a bold vision for the future of our city. Through participant-led breakout sessions and live illustration, we’ll collectively map out what a better Wellington could be – from housing and climate action to transport, community spaces, and beyond.
This event is part of Stronger Together, a youth-led campaign making local democracy real and relevant in Pōneke. As local elections approach, it’s time to reimagine how our city works for us all and explore the power of community-driven ideas.
Why come along?
Connect: Meet others who care deeply about the future of our city.
Create: Contribute your vision to a live, visual representation of a better Wellington.
Collaborate: Join participant-driven sessions on issues that matter most to you.
Inspire change: Leave with practical ideas and energy to take forward.
Whether you’re a seasoned organiser, new to local politics, or simply passionate about Wellington’s future, this event is for you.
🎟️ Tickets: Free and koha-based (pay what you can).
🥪 Kai: Limo pizzas!!
🗓️ Agenda: We make it up on the day - curious to know what this would look like? Check out the plan here

description:
Topless Picking Flowers Release Tour // WELLINGTON, Topless Picking Flowers Release Tour // WELLINGTON
Sophie Songbird makes her solo debut this spring, stepping into the spotlight with a voice and vision all her own. Known for her work with the beloved band Dr. Reknaw, Sophie now unveils a fresh chapter — touring in celebration of her first solo release and sharing a collection of unreleased, vintage-inspired originals that blend nostalgic charm with a modern twist.

Drawing from the rich traditions of jazz, blues, and country — with a touch of psychedelic flair — Sophie’s songwriting is both timeless and distinctly her own. Her stories are laced with wit, warmth, and a hint of mischief, offering a refreshing take on classic genres.

Her debut single, “Topless Picking Flowers” — set for release on September 19th — is a dreamy fusion of classic country and smooth Hawaiian tones. On stage, Sophie captivates with exceptional rhythm guitar work and a honey-toned voice that soars effortlessly.

with support from ABBEY EVE AND FRANCES GRASS
label: Music & Concerts

description:
The Challenges of Peacebuilding, In this conversation, Dr David Harland will reflect on his experience working as a mediator and negotiator in conflict zones and his role as Director of the Geneva-based Centre for Humanitarian Dialogue. The Centre was awarded the Carnegie Wateler Peace Prize in 2022 “for its track record of finding the means, including mediation, to bring parties together and end conflicts”. Its work has included involvement in Aceh and Mindanao, assisting with the disbanding of the Basque separatist group ETA, and the Black Sea Grain Initiative. David will share insights on the challenges of peacebuilding in an era of growing competition and contestation.
Dr David Harland is a former New Zealand diplomat and Executive Director of the Centre for Humanitarian Dialogue (HD), a Geneva-based foundation that specialises in the mediation of armed conflict. He previously worked for the United Nations, including in Bosnia, Kosovo, Haiti and Timor Leste, and he wrote the UN Secretary-General’s landmark report on the fall of Srebrenica. David serves on the UN Secretary-General’s high-level advisory board on mediation. He has degrees from Harvard University, Tufts University, Beijing University and Te Herenga Waka—Victoria University of Wellington.
The event will be followed by light refreshments.
label: Government & Politics

description:
Steadfast for Palestine, On October 4th, 2025, 11 AM at Pukeahu War Memorial Park we stand united to mark 2 years of Israel’s ongoing genocide against Palestine. A brutal reality that has been enabled, dismissed, and ignored while the New Zealand government continues to remain silent and inactive.

This is a call to all who believe in justice and human rights to join our hīkoi to Odlins Plaza for powerful speakers, solidarity stalls, and meaningful ways to take action. Our strength lies in Sumud [Palestinian steadfastness] and Kia Manawanui [Aotearoa’s perseverance.]

We demand SANCTIONS and an end to this violence. Together, we reaffirm our commitment to justice and to the long fight for Palestinian freedom.

- October 4th, 2025 | 11 AM
- Pukeahu War Memorial Park → Hīkoi to Odlins Plaza

description:
Waikanae drop-in session | Reserve Management Plan, Waikanae drop-in session | Reserve Management Plan
Drop- in to Waikanae Park by the old skatepark to chat to us about the Reserve Management Plan.

Council manages over 130 parks and reserves on your behalf – from playgrounds, sports grounds, and esplanades to scenic and native reserves.

We’re drafting an omnibus Reserve Management Plan to set out objectives, polices and rules that guide their use, management, protection and development and want your help. Tell us what you value about your favourite parks and reserves, what might impact their use, protection and enjoyment, and what ideas do you have for their future.

There's lots of ways to have your say - online, on paper and in person.

Come and chat to our Open Space Planning team
Thursday 28 August, 4pm–7pm, Coastlands Shopping Centre
Saturday 30 August, 9am–1pm, Maclean Park, skatepark
Saturday 6 September, 9am–1pm, Waikanae Park, old skatepark
Sunday 14 September, 9am–1pm, Ōtaki Centennial Park

Further information and ways to provide feedback can be found at haveyoursay.kapiticoast.govt.nz/RMP

description:
Wellington Wizards Quiz Night Fundraiser, ✨ Quiz Night Fundraiser – Support the Wellington Wizards! ✨
Think you’ve got what it takes to be the ultimate quiz champion? Gather your team, put your knowledge to the test, and join us for a night of trivia, prizes, and fun—all while supporting the Wellington Wizards, a brand-new ultimate frisbee club!
📅 Date: Thursday, 2nd October, 2025
🕖 Time: 7pm - 9pm (Approximately)
📍 Location: 1852, 55 Cleveland St, Brooklyn
🧙 About the Wellington Wizards
We are a new ultimate frisbee club training to compete at the New Zealand Mixed Ultimate Championships Division 1—the highest level of competition in the country, held this year in Christchurch.
Our diverse, mixed-gender team includes high school students, university students, and young professionals, all passionate about the sport and eager to grow. As a brand-new club, we’re fundraising to cover essential costs like uniforms, training field hire, travel expenses, training camps, regional qualifiers, and the final tournament.
By coming along, you’ll be helping us achieve our goals - Casting spells and playing magical ultimate 🪄
🎁 What’s in Store:
Quiz Competition: Teams battle it out for glory and bragging rights
Prizes for Winning Teams 🏆
Spot Prizes throughout the night for lucky players 🍀
Raffles with awesome goodies up for grabs 🎟️
Including: Interislander / Bluebridge vouchers, Movie passes, Gym Memberships, Food and Drinks and much more.
💡 How to Join
Get your team together and hit the get tickets button to secure your spot
Book early—spaces are limited!
🍽️ Make a Night of It!
Support our venue 1852 and come for dinner or drinks before the quiz. Reservations can be made here: www.1852.co.nz.
👉 Don’t forget to mention you’re there for the quiz!
📌 Suggested booking time: 5:30–6:00pm
Come for the trivia, stay for the laughs, and help us build the future of ultimate frisbee in Wellington.
Together, we can make magic happen! ✨

description:
Kids Rock 4 Palestine, Kids Rock For Palestine
One Day. One Stage. One Cause.
This event is organised by kids in Pōneke to raise funds for kids in Palestine.
Join us for a one-day-only music fundraiser where young voices take centre stage to amplify hope and raise money for children in Palestine.
This isn’t just a concert, it’s a movement. Under-18 musicians, solo artists, and bands (some joined by over-18 allies) are coming together to rock out with purpose, showing that music knows no borders and compassion has no age limit.
These young performers are using their talents to stand in solidarity with kids just like them who are living through unimaginable circumstances.
Organiser Eddie 12: "We see children in Palestine who are being bombed and shot and are starving. We kids want to help. So that is what we are doing."
There will be stalls and crafting available for kids attending - Please come and support so we can raise money for Gaza's families.
100% of proceeds go directly to emergency aid and child-focused relief in Palestine - Convoys of Good and Kiwi Trust for Palestinian Childrens Relief.
Witness the next generation of artists and activists sharing the stage and raising their voices. Please support them with your attendance. Show them young people can make a difference.
Be part of an event where music becomes action, and community becomes change.
Do you want to volunteer to help? Email aotearoa2gaza@gmail.com
ALL UNDER 18s MUST ATTEND WITH A PARENT OR GUARDIAN.

description:
A Walk With Katherine Mansfield - Guided Walk, In this walk of up to 75 minutes we will enjoy the gardens through the words of Katherine Mansfield. Throughout her short writing career she expressed her love of plants and the natural world. Our walk, accompanied by the words of Katherine in her 1907 charming vignette ‘In the Botanical Gardens’, will be essentially on main paths, including some uphill to the Succulent Garden, to reflect on some of her favourite plants.

Meet at the Founders’ Entrance, Glenmore Street.
Cost: $5 (cash only, please). or free for Friends.

This is part of the regular walks run by the Friends of the Wellington Botanic Garden, they run twice monthly throughout the year with a different topic every time.
Join the Friends for only $30 a year and all the walks will be free, as well as other great benefits.

The Artisan Craft Market is a premium handmade event that takes place across various locations in the broader Wellington region. This high-quality market is designed to foster a welcoming and friendly atmosphere.

Our vision at Artisan Craft Market is to make the market accessible to those who appreciate shopping locally. We aim to provide a platform that supports local artisans, allowing them to showcase their meticulously crafted, high-quality products. By bringing the market directly to the people, we hope to celebrate and promote the unique talents of our community’s skilled artisans while creating opportunities to engage with Wainuiomata’s community and identity.

description:
Natural Texture Earrings and Pendants, A quick taster class that’s ideal as a weekend outing for friends, or as a treat for you! In three short hours, learn to craft an amazing pair of textured metal earrings - from scratch!

Over this taster class, you’ll be guided through the process of heating and texturing metal, cutting and shaping with traditional jewellery tools. After completing this class, you will have one pair of beautiful earrings to wear away or gift to someone special!

You will practice on smaller texture samples to work out what texture and what metal you want to go with, and then move on to creating your earrings in warm copper, yellow brass and sterling silver - with solid sterling silver earring hooks or posts.

Your class materials pack includes everything you need for the class to make a super cool pair of beautiful earrings. You are welcome to purchase extra materials for larger pieces at the studio.

We use quality pre-made sterling silver earring wires, or earring posts with silicone stud backs for these taster classes so that you can focus on making the main part of the earrings and know that your findings will be just perfect.

Kids aged 12 (or so) are welcome to attend the class, but an enrolled parent or caregiver must accompany anyone under the age of 16.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
6 Week Yoga Course for Beginners, The Beginners Course teaches the “Sarva Hitta Asanas” from Level 1 - postures that are good for everyone. The Course covers all the foundations you need for an ongoing yoga practice as well as plenty of time for guided relaxation. Loosening your body, the joints, and your mind, the exercises are designed for the complete balance and awakening of energy in body, mind and soul. Experience yoga postures, breath techniques, meditation and relaxation, along with knowledge about basic yoga philosophy and a healthy lifestyle. A wonderful course for new beginners and those looking to deepen their practical experience of yoga.

Some of the many benefits of yoga include: improvement in posture and breathing, increased strength and flexibility, a greater ability to cope with stress, and a feeling of peace and calm.
This course called "part 1" will cover the second half of Level 1 from the System of Yoga in Daily Life.
label: Health & Wellness

description:
A free workshop for the General Public: Dying to Know about Dying Matters?, Please note, this is a FREE workshop availble to the public and is not designed for health professionals to attend.
Many people find it difficult to talk about dying, yet dying is an important stage of life and is inevitable.
We plan for the birth of a child, yet when it comes to the end of life, we don’t often want to think , or talk about it.
Come along to our workshop and find out more about dying matters, how an Advance Care Planning (ACP)can benefit you and your family/whānau and what to expect at the end of life.
Having a plan outlines our care preferences for the future. Having an Advance Care Plan (ACP) that aligns with our beliefs and values, is a gift that we can give to our family / whānau.
We will explore:
Why is it hard to talk about death and dying?
What to expect when someone is dying
Supports available
Advance care planning processes
Date: Friday 5 September 2025
Time: 9.00 am - 12.30 pm
Presenters: Mary Ann Hardcastle Advance Care Plannining Facilitator & Chris Dunn Clinical Nurse Educator Nelson Tasman Hospice
Cost: Free
Limited attendees: Registration is essential
Who can attend?: General Public (This workshop is not designed for Health Professionals)
Venue: Nelson Tasman Hospice, 331 Suffolk Road, Stoke, Nelson

description:
Awaken the Healer Within with Linda Nevin, Awaken the Healer Within with Linda Nevin
Linda’s extraordinary gifts have transformed lives from New Zealand to far-reaching corners of the world.

What makes Linda truly unique is not only the depth of her power, but her heart. With warmth, compassion, and a frequency that transcends space and time, she works gently yet profoundly—dissolving blocks, releasing old patterns, and awakening the body’s natural capacity to heal. Whether in person or online, Linda’s presence is felt deeply; her signature Infusion Healing blends vibration, color, crystals, and music to create experiences that are as extraordinary as they are transformative.

Clients describe her as “a guardian angel watching over you” — her healing energy both subtle and powerful, leaving you lighter, clearer, and more alive than ever before.

Discover the healing power that already lives within you.
Join us for a fun day of energy awakening, connection, and personal transformation in this in-person workshop designed to activate your innate healing abilities.

Whether you're brand new to energy healing or already on your path, this hands-on experience will leave you feeling grounded, empowered, and lit up with possibility.

What to Expect
This interactive experience is a joyful deep dive into the world of Infusion Healing — a unique blend of frequency, intention, imagery, and energy movement. You'll learn how to sense, shift, and send healing energy using simple yet powerful techniques that you can use daily to uplift yourself and others.

During the workshop you’ll learn how to feel energy in your hands and scan the body for imbalances. Create and send Infusion Balls of healing energy. Work with the body’s meridian system to release negative emotions. Infuse positive frequencies from Mother Earths’ healing basket. Work with totem, spirit and power animals.

You’ll Leave With
A deeper trust in your intuitive healing gifts. The ability to give and receive healing energy. Your own personalised energy infusion tools. A feeling of calm, clarity, and energetic confidence to enjoy the benefits of energy healing.

No prior experience is necessary — just a willingness to explore your own healing potential.
Come with curiosity. Leave with tools, insights, and an elevated energetic state you can return to anytime.

Please BYO lunch, morning tea provided.

Spaces are limited. Reserve your place now and step into your healing power.

Cost: $120
Book: https://www.lindanevin.com/services

Email:

Website: https://www.lindanevin.com

Venue: the pavilion room @ the art and living space, 17 Bradey Road, Pauatahanui

description:
Age on the Go 2025, Age on the Go 2025
Organised by Horowhenua District Council, the 2025 Age on the Go Expo is the largest event of its kind in the region, featuring dozens of stalls offering information and education for the hundreds of visitors who attend.

Held as part of the Horowhenua Age Friendly Communities Strategy, the expo supports our vision that older people in Horowhenua are empowered to make choices that enable them to live well and age well. The event promotes positive ageing by showcasing activities and services that support good health, connection and wellbeing for older residents.

The expo will take place at the Horowhenua Events Centre, 33 Victoria Street, Levin, from 10am to 2pm.

description:
After 5: Wellington Free Ambulance, Most sudden cardiac arrests happen at home in the community, would you know how to instantly help a family member or neighbour?
Go beyond regular networking and learn vital skills in this special session with Wellington Free Ambulance. You’ll learn about our region’s uniquely free emergency ambulance service, their incredible heritage story, and connection to the community that continues today.
You’ll be able to learn CPR – a vital and potentially lifesaving skill that will give you the confidence and skills to help your community when it matters most. You’ll also get to see how an AED works!
Most importantly, this event will showcase the range of ways you or your business can keep the FREE in Wellington Free Ambulance. Your support is vital to ensure ambulance services stay free of charge in our community, so make sure you secure your spot at this potentially life-saving evening.
Click here to secure your spot.

description:
Baby Sleep with Kate Anderson, Welcome to Baby Sleep with Kate Anderson at St Augustine's Church, Petone on September 11, 2025 at 10:00 AM!
Join us for an informative session led by Kate Anderson on your little ones sleep. Whether you're a new parent or just looking to learn more, this event is perfect for you!
Kate is a NZ Registered Nurse (NZRN), WellChild Nurse, International Board Certified Lactation Consultant (IBCLC), Biodynamic Craniosacral Therapist and Massage Therapist and runs her business Evoke Health.
https://www.evokehealthnz.co.nz/
This session is aimed for parents with babies aged 0-12 months.
Get ready to discover tips and tricks, ask questions, and connect with other parents in a welcoming environment.
Kate will cover the following:
- Normal baby sleep needs
-Sleep cycles
- How development can impact sleep
-How to look after yourself when tired
- Settling ideas
Spaces will be kept to a minimum to ensure everyone gets the information/support they need.
If price is a barrier please reach out and we will see how we can support you to make sure you don't miss out if you could use the help.

description:
Beyond Sight: The Power of Dyad Meditation, Beyond Sight: The Power of Dyad Meditation
What happens when we strip away the surface layers of small talk, social roles, and even sight itself?
In this unique evening, you’ll step into the practice of Dyad Meditation — a powerful form of authentic relating where two people take turns speaking and listening in complete presence. One person shares, the other simply listens. No interruptions. No fixing. No judgment. Just the rare experience of being fully seen and fully heard.
The twist? You’ll be blindfolded.
By closing our eyes to the outer world, we drop our guards and tune into something deeper. This creates space for vulnerability, openness, and raw connection that we don’t often experience in daily life.
Expect an evening that’s real, grounding, and surprisingly freeing — a chance to connect with yourself and with others in ways that go beyond sight.
You don’t need to bring a partner or a friend — in fact, coming on your own is part of the experience. Everyone will be paired up on the night, so it’s all about connecting beyond familiar circles.
Afterwards, we’ll share reflections over a nourishing plant-based dinner, keeping the conversation alive in a relaxed space.
Meet Andre, your host
Andre has been exploring the art of authentic connection since his teens, when a rite of passage in Golden Bay first sparked his passion for circle work. Since then, he has been creating spaces that invite honesty, vulnerability, and depth — guiding people into experiences of being truly seen and heard. A multi-instrumental musician, poet, and breathwork facilitator, Andre brings creativity and presence to all his offerings, inspired by the question of what it really means to be human.

description:

𝘽𝙧𝙚𝙖𝙩𝙝𝙬𝙖𝙫 - 𝘽𝙧𝙚𝙖𝙩𝙝𝙬𝙤𝙧𝙠 𝙈𝙚𝙙𝙞𝙘𝙞𝙣𝙚
𝙉𝙜𝙖𝙧𝙪 𝙤 𝙩𝙚 𝙏𝙞𝙣𝙖𝙣𝙖 ~ 𝙒𝙖𝙫𝙚𝙨 𝙤𝙛 𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝘽𝙤𝙙𝙮

Join Tara Goddard for this Breathwork Medicine Journey connecting through breath and alchemising its medicine through waves of the body.

Breathwork is an ancient technique used for healing & expansion to bridge the gap between your human self & higher self.

Alternate states of awareness are created, where waves of emotion, thought or somatic sensation are able to roll through and release with the breath.

BreathWav not only works with somatic intelligence, but nervous system attunement, working with the denser and more subtle layers of the body to raise & uplift.

Breathwork may cause the release of
DMT (Spirit Molecule) it is an alchemy with brainwaves and cerebrospinal fluid. Gamma brainwaves are associated with states of deep meditation, heightened awareness, and higher brain functions.

Breathwork and other deeply meditative practices activate gamma waves and there is a correlation between gamma waves and DMT release, with one seeming to stimulate the other.

Breathwork experiences and benefits so often parallel those of DMT and other psychedelic plant-medicines, DMT is produced naturally in the brain, and is released during Breathwork.

𝘽𝙍𝙀𝘼𝙏𝙃𝙒𝙊𝙍𝙆 𝘽𝙀𝙉𝙀𝙁𝙄𝙏𝙎:

• Anxiety, depression and stress

• Increase energy & boost immunity

• Improves sleep

• Lowers blood pressure & improves circulation

• Improves mood & self esteem & helps manage depression

• Relese toxins

• Helps manage pain & restrictions in the body

• Releasing trauma & emotion & manage PTSD

• Gaining body awareness

• Connecting to intuition and receiving guidance

• Past life clearing and understanding

• Spiritual awakening and expansion

• Karmic release and ancestral work

• Increasing creativity and self-expression

• Life purpose clarity

A breathwork journey is unique to each person and and the results are profound.

𝙒𝙃𝘼𝙏 𝙏𝙊 𝙀𝙓𝙋𝙀𝘾𝙏:

• Doors will open at 11.45am and you will have a few moments to get grounded and set up for your 𝘽𝙧𝙚𝙖𝙩𝙝𝙬𝙖𝙫 experience.

• We will open up with an introduction to this 𝘽𝙧𝙚𝙖𝙩𝙝𝙬𝙖𝙫 technique and prepare to start the Breathwork Medicine Journey.

• You will then be guided through a 90 minute experience recieving healing & expansion bridging the gap between your human self & higher self.

• Your only job is to be open minded, relax, and let your breath guide you on this medicine journey be open to receive any healing or guidance that comes up throughout the journey.

• We will close of with an intergration circle finishing up at 2.30PM leaving light grounded and open and with feelings one oneness connected to the universe.

𝘾𝙤𝙣𝙩𝙧𝙖𝙞𝙣𝙙𝙞𝙘𝙖𝙩𝙞𝙤𝙣𝙨:

Breathwork results in certain specific physiological changes in the body and also can result in intense physical and emotional release.

As a precaution, the following conditions are contraindicated in certain breathwork practices.

It is crucial that you inform your breathwork practitioner if any of the following conditions are relevant to you:

• Pregnancy (at any stage)

• Severe PTSD or trauma

• Currently using recreational drugs

• Recent surgery

• Taking any medication that alters brain chemistry like anti-anxiety,anti-depressant, ADD, OCD medications, etc.

•Detached Retina

•Glaucoma

•Kidney disease

•High Blood Pressure

•Cardiovascular disease, including angina, previous heart attack or stroke
•Diagnosis of aneurysm in the brain or abdomen

•Uncontrolled thyroid conditions

•Diabetes

•Severe Asthma— for mild to moderate asthma, we can discuss but you must bring your inhaler to the session.

• Epilepsy

• History of Seizures

• Prior diagnosis of bipolar disorder, schizophrenia or previous psychiatric condition.

•Any other medical, psychiatric or physical conditions which would impair or affect the ability to engage in any activities that involve deep physical and/or emotional release.

𝙁𝘼𝙌’𝙨:

What can I expect?

There will be a short guided meditation, explanation of conscious connected breathwork (how to do it, tetany, things that may happen etc), a full 60 min breathwork journey and space afterwards for a few to share about their experience and any questions asked and support given if needed.

I have one or more of the listed contraindications - what should I do?

Email or message Tara to let her know what these are and she’ll let you know if she can offer adjustments so you can attend.

description:
Breathwork: A Gentle Reset, Breathwork: A Gentle Reset
Breathwork: A Gentle Reset

Take a pause from the noise of daily life.

This breathwork journey begins with gentle movement to awaken the body and open the breath. Through slow, mindful stretches, we begin softening tension and grounding into the present.

You’ll then be guided through two styles of breathwork — each offering a unique pathway inward. There’s no pressure or expectation, just the freedom to explore what feels right for you:

A dynamic, connected breath for those who wish to build energy, move emotion, or break through internal blockages

A slow, rhythmic breath for those seeking stillness, calm, and deeper grounding

Both approaches invite a sense of spaciousness — physically, mentally, and emotionally — while supporting nervous system balance and inner clarity.

To gently close the session, we’ll move into a quiet, nurturing meditation to support integration and leave you feeling steady, clear, and connected.

Afterwards, stay and enjoy a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert, lovingly prepared to complement the experience — because healing is also about how we feed and care for ourselves.

Why Breathwork?

Breathwork has helped so many shift from a state of tension and overwhelm into a place of ease, clarity, and resilience — often after just one session. It’s a simple, powerful practice that reconnects you to your body, your breath, and your inner stillness.

You’ll leave feeling more grounded, more present, and more like yourself again.

Meet Karla, your host
Karla is a breathwork and trauma-somatic facilitator based in Aotearoa (New Zealand), originally from Malta. With over a decade of experience in Reiki and three years facilitating trauma-informed, science-based breathwork, Karla combines holistic tools, meditation, and conscious breathing to support nervous system regulation and deep emotional healing. Her offerings help release stored trauma, reduce stress and anxiety, and activate oxytocin—the “love hormone”—fostering connection, vitality, and a sense of wholeness. She currently holds regular classes, workshops, and transformative retreats that nurture the mind, body, and spirit.

Small groups: 8 men + 2 experienced hosts
Inclusive: all ages, backgrounds and identities (18+)
It's about connection and showing up, instead of going it alone. It makes time for meeting our various challenges, while learning and growing us into better friends, partners, dads, sons and humans. 
It isn’t a boys or bros club, therapy or a self-help seminar, religious or new-age. No fixing, preaching, or pressure. It’s not a crisis service or a substitute for professional care. The sign-up form explains this in more detail.
You can expect to:
Practice listening and learn communication skills for life
Discover greater integrity and self-accountability
Be supported in building your emotional intelligence
Become a part of a hearty and diverse community
Have a good time - it’s often uplifting and inspiring.
Joseph and your team of hosts have all been in regular men's groups for many years. The group sometimes offers simple and proven inquiries that draw on NVC, MBSR, active listening, gratitude and more.
label: Health & Wellness

description:
Community Agency - a conversation with Markus Luczak-Roesch and Gerhard Reese, Two scholars share their perspectives on Community Agency and discuss the links between the Global environmental and global mental health crises.
  Gerhard Reese
Gerhard Reese works as Associate Professor for Climate Change at Te Herenga Waka - Victoria University Wellington in Aotearoa / New Zealand. Before, he was Professor and head of the Environmental Psychology Research Unit at the University Kaiserslautern-Landau in Germany since 2016. He got his PhD in Psychology from Friedrich Schiller University Jena, Germany, in February 2010. His research focuses on individual, social and systemic catalysts and barriers of pro-environmental behaviour and the nature-health nexus. He attempts and sometimes succeeds to spend more time outdoors than indoors and he still is a serious competitor in Super Mario Kart.
Markus Luczak-Roesch
Markus Luczak-Roesch is Professor of Informatics and the inaugural Chair in Complexity Science at Victoria University of Wellington’s School of Information Management. He is also one of two Co-Directors of Te Pūnaha Matatini, Aotearoa New  Zealand’s Centre of Research Excellence in Complex Systems. He founded and leads the Complexity & Connection Science Lab, an interdisciplinary group developing theories and computational tools to understand how complex systems unfold over time. His research investigates how structure and meaning emerge in systems - from language and brain activity to online communities and the environment - using models that reveal meaningful coincidences and unexpected system-level behaviors.
label: Health & Wellness

description:
Burnout to Breath: A Somatic Reset for the Nervous System, Burnout to Breath: A Somatic Reset for the Nervous System
If you’re running on fumes, stuck in overdrive, or feeling wired and tired, this session is for you. Even if you’ve tried resting, you might still feel tense, foggy, or emotionally flat. This session is designed for high-achieving women ready to reconnect to their body, regulate their nervous system, and rediscover their energy.
You might notice these signs:
Waking up tired, even after a full night’s sleep
Overthinking decisions and feeling emotionally reactive
Craving peace but feeling disconnected from your body
Often feeling “on” and unable to fully relax
Workshop Details:
Through guided somatic breathwork, gentle movement, and nervous system education, you’ll be supported to safely release stored tension, calm your system, and access clarity from within.
What to bring/prepare:
Comfortable clothing for movement
Water bottle and journal
Yoga mat provided
Optional: blanket, eye pillow, essential oils
Arrive: 5–10 minutes early to settle in
Unwind further with a wholesome plant-based dinner and dessert, a nurturing way to ground yourself and enjoy a sense of calm and connection after the session.
Contraindications for Breathwork:
Breathwork can be a powerful tool but may not be suitable for everyone. Please consult your healthcare provider before participating if you have:
Cardiovascular issues (e.g., high blood pressure, heart disease)
Respiratory conditions (e.g., asthma, COPD)
A history of seizures or epilepsy
Diagnosed mental health conditions (e.g., schizophrenia, bipolar disorder)
Pregnancy (some breath patterns may need modification)
Recent surgery or physical injuries that limit movement
You are always welcome to participate in the somatic and movement elements without engaging in deep breathwork—your safety and well-being are our priority.
About Lynofuro:
Lynofuro is an Integrative Somatic Coach and Breathwork Facilitator who helps intuitive, high-performing women overcome emotional burnout and restore energetic balance. Her work blends somatics, breath, and energy alignment to support lasting transformation.
What past participants say:
“I walked in overwhelmed and walked out feeling like myself again.”
“This was the first time I felt fully present and peaceful in weeks.”
hi@lynofuro.co.nz |
www.lynofuro.co.nz

description:
Conscious & Connected Breathwork, Conscious & Connected Breathwork
Conscious & Connected Breathwork

Step out of autopilot and into your own rhythm — this session is about tuning in again.

We begin with gentle movement and mindful stretches to awaken the body, open the breath, and release tension. You’ll then be guided through two complementary styles of breathwork, allowing you to explore what feels most nourishing for you:

A dynamic, flowing breath to energise, release emotion, and move through internal blockages

A slow, steady breath to cultivate stillness, calm, and deeper grounding

Both approaches create a sense of spaciousness — physically, mentally, and emotionally — while supporting nervous system balance and clarity of mind. The session closes with a quiet, nurturing meditation, helping you integrate the experience and leave feeling steady, connected, and present.

Stay afterwards to enjoy a wholesome plant-based dinner and dessert included in your ticket — a simple way to nourish your body and complement your practice.

Meet Your Host: Karla

Karla is a breathwork and trauma-somatic facilitator based in Aotearoa (New Zealand), originally from Malta. With over a decade of experience in Reiki and three years facilitating trauma-informed, science-based breathwork, Karla combines holistic tools, meditation, and conscious breathing to support nervous system regulation and deep emotional healing. Her offerings help release stored trauma, reduce stress and anxiety, and activate oxytocin—the “love hormone”—fostering connection, vitality, and a sense of wholeness. She currently holds regular classes, workshops, and transformative retreats that nurture the mind, body, and spirit.

description:
Death Cafe Newtown, Death Cafe runs monthly on the 2nd Saturday.
Let's normalise our own demise! We are all going to die, let's talk about it. At a Death Café people - often strangers - gather to eat cake, drink tea and discuss death. Death Café is not a grief support group, or counselling session - instead it is a place to discuss death without expectations. The objective is 'to increase awareness of death with a view to helping people make the most of their (finite) lives'.

description:
Draw It Out - Adult workshop, A gentle yet powerful tool for wellness (adults 18+) to access inner guidance.

Theme: Welcoming new possibilities
Learn how to listen to your feelings and find guidance from within, using a gentle powerful tool called Interactive Drawing Therapy.

This single workshop focuses on the theme of welcoming new possibilities, great if you are going through change, wanting to transition or entering a new phase.

Date
This is a single workshop
6.15pm-7.30pm
Monday 29 September

Cost
$46 total

Included in each session
You will be guided by Lara Phillips, a trained creative facilitator in Interactive Drawing Therapy, through drawing prompts (similar to a guided meditation or journaling) to draw out where you are at and draw out your own inner guidance. No art skills are needed, more simple mark making.

This gentle yet powerful tool uses drawing and writing as a way to access your subconscious and to listen to your heart rather than your head for guidance. A tool often used in therapy, it is made accessible for self-care and community wellness through these workshops.

About Lara Phillips
Lara Phillips is a creative facilitator trained in Interactive Drawing Therapy. With a 20 year career in creative copywriting in design and communication, she shares drawing and writing as a mode for wellness and self-care, to promote preventative and proactive mental health measures through creativity.

“We all have the wisdom within to help ourselves, if given the space.”

For more workshops or to book individual sessions visit www.drawitout.co.nz

Liability disclaimer
Draw It Out offers creativity for wellbeing. It is not intended as therapy nor does it replace counselling, therapy, or any other medical or clinical professional help. Participants are guided to draw out where they are at, whilst drawing out their own inner resources for support and guidance.

Participants understand it is their own responsibility to manage their mental and physical health during sessions, to opt in and out of activities as they see fit, and make the facilitator aware if further support is required.

description:
Dying Matters Week, Dying Matters Week
Coming up at the Community Centre next month. 2 sessions totalling 1 hour in length.

Monday, 1st at 2:00pm Final Farewell: Your Legacy Your Way with Alina Reed
Ever wondered what your send-off might look like? A haka, a playlist, a tree planting? Join us for a 20-minute kōrero on the importance of documenting your funeral wishes — with heart, humour, and a dash of practicality. Let’s talk about how to make your final farewell truly yours.

Monday, 1st at 2:30pm Mary Potter Hospice with Imelda Coleman
You may know hospice through fundraising events like street appeals or strawberry fairs – but hospice is so much more than that. Join us for a short 20 minute session to learn about the holistic care Mary Potter Hospice provides, supporting not only patients but also their whānau. Discover how hospice care uplifts, comforts, and brings dignity at the most important time of life.

There is a link to the website here: https://gowithgrace.nz/dyingmatters/wellington-events/wellington-central/, you can pre-register here or come on the day.

description:
Elebreath® Somatic Breath + Sound Journey, Elebreath® Somatic Breath + Sound Journey
Join Lynn Tiang for a powerful in-person ceremony blending cacao, breathwork, sound, and intuitive movement. Release emotional tension, reset your nervous system, and reconnect with the wisdom of your body.

Through the Elebreath® five-phase arc — grounding, activation, cathartic release, integration, and soulful reflection — you’ll be guided into a state of deep presence where breath, sound, and movement awaken what’s been waiting to be felt.

What to expect:
* Somatic breathwork to clear stored emotions & reset nervous rhythms
* Live soundscapes & intuitive movement for release and integration
*Ceremonial cacao opening to connect with heart energy
*Oracle card pulling + journaling to anchor insights
*Light kai to ground and nourish after the session

Who this is for:
*Anyone navigating emotional fatigue, life transitions, or inner misalignment
*Those seeking nervous system recalibration and emotional release
*People longing for a safe space to soften, release, and reconnect with their body’s wisdom

What’s Included:
*Elebreath® five-phase somatic breathwork journey
*Trauma-informed, nervous system–aware facilitation
*Live sound journey & curated sonic support
*Cacao opening ritual
*Journaling + oracle reflection
*Closing with kai and community space
*Integration Breathwork practices that you can access anytime at your own timing
*Fatigue-free mini-course integration

Details:
Saturday, 27 September, 11:45am - 2:15pm at AWHI Yoga & Wellbeing, Level 2, 15 Johnston Street, Wellington Central

Investment:
Early Bird Pricing for first 8 sign-ups. Limited spaces available, so book in fast!

**PLEASE NOTE** This is a private event for which AWHI is providing the space and promotional support only. All bookings and inquiries must be directed to the host, Lynn Tiang at @lynofuro !

description:
Ecstatic Dance Wellington, Ecstatic Dance Wellington
💫 Move. Release. Connect. The first Ecstatic Dance Wellington is here — come celebrate our launch at Vogelmorn with DJ Kimba Jade on the decks. 🌙❤️

🌟✨ Ecstatic Dance Wellington – Launch Event ✨🌟

With DJ Kimba Jade @ Vogelmorn, Wellington

Kimba Jade & Bernie Cruise are thrilled to bring Ecstatic Dance Wellington to life! 🎉 This is the launch event, and we can’t wait to co-create the first of many transformational dance journeys with you.

💫 What is Ecstatic Dance?
A freeform, drug- and alcohol-free dance experience where you move however your body wants. The music flows like a wave — starting slow, rising to ecstatic peaks, then softening into stillness. It’s therapeutic, uplifting, and a powerful way to connect with yourself and community.

Please note, that this Ecstatic Dance is not verbally guided, we let the music guide you 😊. Dance freely how your body moves you.

🎶 This Dance Floor
Guided by DJ Kimba Jade, expect an immersive journey through deep bass, tribal rhythms, and global soundscapes that awaken both body and spirit. With over 24 years behind the decks—including 8 years dedicated to Ecstatic Dance—Kimba crafts transformative spaces of joy, release, and connection. Originally from Auckland, she curated Alchemic Dance Floor events for 5 years, now co-runs the Ecstatic Dance Festival, and leads Alchemic Ecstatic Dance DJ Trainings. She’s thrilled to share her magic and move with you on the dance floor!

🎶 The Sound System
Here at Ecstatic Dance Wellington, we believe in using a phat sound system with lots of bass for our dances. We will be bringing an ultra vibey and super bassy experience for you!


🗓 Event Details
📍 Vogelmorn, 13 Vennell Street, Brooklyn, Wellington
🕖 7:00pm – Opening Circle
🕢 7:15pm – Ecstatic Dance
🕘 8:45pm – Closing Circle
🕘 9:00pm – Chai & Chocolate (for those wanting to socialise)

🎟 Tickets
$25 online
https://events.humanitix.com/ecstatic-dance-wellington

$30 cash on the door

**If you would like to come but are unwaged or struggling, please send us a message directly, we'd love to help.

☀️ Extra Info
- Beanbags are provided for the end relaxation.
- Doors will open at 6.45pm for you to socialise in the lobby, we'll start promptly at 7pm.

We are very much looking forward to joining the conscious dance community in Wellington and sharing our magic.

❤️ What to Bring

Water bottle

Loose, comfy clothes

Warm layers for afterwards

A friend!

🌟 Guidelines

Drug & alcohol free event

Silence on the dance floor

No phones/cameras on the dance floor

Respect the space & each other 😊

🎧 Tune into Kimba’s ED sets:
Mixcloud: https://www.mixcloud.com/kimbajade/

✨ Come help us launch Ecstatic Dance Wellington — a night of music, movement & magic. ✨

description:
Empathic Boundaries: Saying No Without Guilt, Empathic Boundaries: Saying No Without Guilt

If you hear rejection when someone says "no" to you, or if you struggle to say "no" even when you want to - this workshop is for you.

Plus there is an amazing plant-based dinner & dessert included in your ticket! Stay back to continue the connects over a nourishing meal.

In this workshop based on Nonviolent Communication (NVC) you will discover how to listen to feelings and needs that sit behind the "no" and how to connect to what truly matters to yourself and others. You will get to know some foundational tools of NVC, and practice on examples from real life. This session is interactive, and you will walk away with some understanding of NVC processes and materials to practice in your own time.

You will discover:

What stops you from saying "no" when you really want to

How to connect to what matters (to you and others) and find the needs behind the "no"

How to listen for needs, rather than look for conflict

Meet Helen & Anna, your hosts
Anna Banaś and Helen Williams are passionate, down-to-earth facilitators who bring warmth, depth, and a wealth of experience to their work in Nonviolent Communication (NVC). Anna is undertaking certification as an NVC trainer, a sociolinguist, and skilled group facilitator who has spent nearly 20 years supporting families, organisations, and communities to communicate with more clarity and compassion. Helen brings a rich blend of experience as a mindfulness teacher, mediator, coach, and yoga practitioner. Together, Anna and Helen create a safe, engaging, and supportive space where learning feels both empowering and nourishing. Whether you’re completely new to NVC or looking to deepen your practice, you’ll be in very good hands.

description:
Explore Healing For Self - Monthly Event, Explore Healing For Self - Monthly Event
Tania loves creating & holding sacred space for people & in this monthly event she will be creating a space where you can focus on your own healing journey in a group environment. In each session you will be guided through clearing, releasing, healing & remembering processes to help & assist you. We will explore different tools, processes & modalities each time to experience the highest possible energetic shift that is possible at that time.

Each month will have a different focus & flavour with the intention of working on yourself in a safe held space.
Over the next 4 sessions we will explore:

The 12 Chakra system, tools to use to help clear & heal the chakras and then enjoy a beautiful energy healing with the Archangels that are connected to each of the chakras.

Angelic Reiki - Receive an Angelic Cleansing, releasing old karmic connections with Archangel Michael, followed by a group healing with the angels wanting to connect with you.

Full Sensory Perception tools through Pleiadian Lightwork - an explanation on how the tools may feel & work & being in those energies & frequencies to receive the clearing & healing that is possible.

Access Bars - How ‘running the bars’ can help, some key points to use for stress or healing, running clearing statements to release old beliefs & patterns. What else is possible & how does it get any better than this.

There is a lot to explore & embrace and there may be additional processes brought in as Tania is guided or as time allows.

First Tuesday of the month 10am-12pm $30


Tania is a gifted intuitive and holistic practitioner, known for her grounded presence and loving guidance. She is an Angelic Reiki Master Teacher, Pleiadian Lightwork Practitioner & Teacher, conscious channeler, and Access Bars Practitioner. With a rich background in intuitive and energy work, she brings a nurturing and empowering energy to both group workshops and one-on-one sessions.

Bookings are essential. Email Tania:

For more details Text/Phone Tania : 021 030 6507

description:
Exploring our shared humanity, Join experienced psychotherapist Rohit Grover for a six-week course that invites you to look beyond the surface of everyday life. In these two-hour sessions, we will explore the core tenets of existential therapy, moving away from the conventional focus on self and hedonism. Instead, we'll grapple with life's big questions:
What does it truly mean to live a value-driven life?
Do our personal values matter, or is the search for meaning just an illusion?
What is the "being" part of "human being" all about?
Through guided discussions, reflective exercises, and insights from classic existential thinkers, Rohit will help you navigate this profound territory. This isn't about finding easy answers. It's about developing the courage to ask the right questions, to confront the realities of freedom, responsibility, and meaning, and to discover a more authentic way of living.
This course is for anyone ready to step off the treadmill and begin a deeper exploration of what it means to be alive. Come and find out what it means to truly exist
Upon completion of this course, participants will be able to:
Differentiate between a life driven by external pressures or fleeting pleasures and one rooted in personal values and authentic meaning.
Identify and critically examine the core existential givens of human existence, such as freedom, responsibility, isolation, and the search for meaning.
Articulate a personal understanding of what it means to "be" a human being, moving beyond a purely functional or biological definition.
Arrive at sensing rather than thinking. Sensing this existence, this dance of life. Widen your view of existence.
Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".
label: Health & Wellness

description:
First Aid for Hospitality - Wellington, First Aid for Hospitality - Wellington
RA has partnered with St John to offer a condensed First Aid training tailored to the hospitality industry. While this course is not NZQA accredited first aider, attendees will receive a St John attendance certificate which can go towards your workplace health and safety program.

description:
Experience Heidi: A.I Medical Scribe for All Clinicians - Wellington, Experience Heidi: A.I Medical Scribe for All Clinicians - Wellington
For practices,clinics & care teams ready to adopt Heidi—the AI scribe for all clinicians. Join us in Wellington. Hosted by Hendrix Health.

About this Event



Experience the Future of Clinical Documentation with Heidi & Hendrix
This event is perfect for practices and clinics looking to bring —the AI medical scribe for all clinicians—into their organisation. Heidi can be used by doctors, nurses, pharmacists, physios, psychologists, vetenarians and more, supporting everything from patient consults and shift handovers to practice meetings and MDMs.
Built with robust data privacy and compliance in mind, Heidi scales to fit how your clinic operates, so you can spend less time on paperwork and more time on patient care. We’ll also discuss safe AI adoption in healthcare, including how Heidi respects data sovereignty in Aotearoa. This session is designed to be straightforward and practical—no hype, just a real look at how AI can transform your everyday workflow.

About Heidi is an AI-powered medical scribe designed to ease the documentation load on clinicians. Already supporting over a million patient interactions every week, Heidi transcribes and processes clinical conversations in real time—helping generate notes, letters, and assessments so clinicians can spend more time with patients and less on paperwork.
Built by a team of doctors and backed by leading global investors, Heidi has become a trusted partner for practices and clinics around the world. The technology is developed to meet international standards including HIPAA, GDPR, NHS and the Australian Privacy Principles, with enterprise-grade certifications like SOC2 and ISO27001.
Heidi never stores session recordings and does not sell or share clinical data. It's designed with clinician wellbeing, patient care, and data safety at its core. Learn more at heidihealth.com.

About
Hendrix Health, Heidi’s official partner in Aotearoa New Zealand , is dedicated to transforming healthcare through life-long learning and human-centred technology. Since September 2024, the Hendrix team have visited over 120 GP clinics, 10 hauora Māori, and 6 Pasifika providers to understand the real challenges on the ground. By working closely with local communities, Hendrix Health ensures that revolutionary innovations like Heidi are culturally responsive and truly effective—already changing the lives of 1000's of healthcare professionals across the country.


Agenda


🕑: 05:00 PM - 06:00 PM
Networking on Arrival (Whakawhanaungatanga)
Info: Arrive, grab a drink, some kai, and connect with fellow attendees. This is your chance to meet new faces, catch up with colleagues, and set a welcoming tone for the evening.


🕑: 06:00 PM - 06:10 PM
Opening Karakia & Whakatauki
Info: We’ll open with a brief karakia (blessing) to acknowledge our gathering, focus our intentions, and bring everyone together under a shared purpose. A short whakatauki will be shared, reminding us why we’re here: to improve healthcare for all in Aotearoa.



🕑: 06:10 PM - 06:15 PM
Current Pressues in your Work
Info: A quick reflection on everyday challenges—like documentation fatigue, paperwork overload, and time inefficiencies—that impact both workflow and patient care.



🕑: 06:15 PM - 06:30 PM
Heidi Demo
Info: We’ll show how Heidi fits into your clinical workflow, covering:


- Who is Heidi? Background and purpose.


- AI Scribing Basics: Four steps (Transcribe, Customise, Output, Review).


- Live Demo: A clinician–patient consultation, including informed consent and template use.


- SOAP Formatting & Note Review: How Heidi helps structure and refine notes.


- Ask Heidi Anything: See how to generate a patient letter or other documents directly from the consultation.


🕑: 06:30 PM - 06:40 PM
Principles of Safe AI Use in Healthcare/Data Handling
Info: Explore data privacy, sovereignty, and compliance in Aotearoa, plus best practices for responsibly adopting AI in clinical settings.


🕑: 06:40 PM - 06:45 PM
Karakia Whakamutunga
Info: We’ll close the formal session with a karakia, acknowledging the time shared and the insights gained.


🕑: 06:45 PM - 08:00 PM
Networking
Info: Continue conversations, ask further questions, and connect with the team. Wrap up the evening with new insights and meaningful connections.

description:
Gong Bath at Newtown Community Centre, ***$25***
Limited door sales for $30
*Please bring a yoga mat, pillow, eye mask and blanket for maximum comfort and warmth*
Discover the transformative effects of sound therapy with this 1-hour gong bath experience.
During this session, participants will be surrounded by the resonant vibrations of gongs, carefully designed to induce deep states of relaxation and calm. As you settle into the experience, allow the soothing tones to wash over you, releasing tension and promoting a sense of inner peace.
Scientific studies have highlighted the benefits of sound therapy, particularly gong baths, in reducing stress and promoting overall well-being. The rhythmic patterns and frequencies of the gongs can help entrain brainwaves, leading to a meditative state and improved mental clarity.
Beyond the immediate effects, many participants report experiencing lasting benefits such as improved sleep, reduced anxiety, and enhanced mood following a gong bath session. By immersing yourself in the healing vibrations of the gongs, you can tap into a deeper sense of relaxation and rejuvenation.
Whether you're looking to unwind after a long day or explore new avenues of self-care, this 1-hour gong bath offers a unique opportunity to reconnect with yourself and find balance amidst the hustle and bustle of daily life. There will be cups of tea available afterwards to help us integrate and ground
**THIS EVENT IS RESTRICTED TO 20 PEOPLE ONLY**
Disclaimer
Gong baths are safe and supportive for most people. However, please consult your doctor or mental health professional before attending if you:
-have a pacemaker or other implanted medical device
-live with epilepsy or a sound-sensitive condition
-are in the first trimester of pregnancy
-are experiencing severe or unmanaged mental health challenges (such as psychosis, schizophrenia, or PTSD)
If you have recent injuries, surgeries, or other health concerns, let me know so we can make sure you’re comfortable.
Everyone responds differently to sound. If at any point during the session you feel overwhelmed or uncomfortable, you are welcome to sit up, move gently, or step outside. Your wellbeing always comes first.
About Me
Erika is a musician and astrologer based in Te Whanganui-a-Tara. She has 30+ years musical experience. Erika has an interest in the healing properties of sound for mental and physical wellbeing, which she currently explores through her gong bathing practice

description:
Habits mastery series: Buy Back Your Time, Habits mastery series: Buy Back Your Time
Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars
You don’t need more hours in the day — you just need to stop spending them on the wrong things.
You’re busy. I get it. There’s just no time for the things that you really want to do, right?
"Buy Back Your Time" is a 1-hour interactive workshop for anyone who wants to reclaim their time, energy, and focus — without burnout or hustle culture.
In this session, you'll learn:
Why time management is really attention management
How to shift from reacting to designing your days
Practical tools to create space for what actually matters
How to identify & eliminate your biggest time-wasters
You’ll walk away with a simple plan to buy back your time — and start investing it in your goals, your growth, and your life.
Meet your host, Nava
Nava’s natural interest in studying physics blossomed into metaphysics when she arrived in the land of the long white cloud. Originally from Germany, Nava was travelling on a quest to find purpose and answers to the mysteries of life. Did she find anything on this quest? Yes! After four exciting years of inquiry, practice, and being immersed in the wonders of bhakti yoga, she is still fully inspired by what she has discovered. Mesmerized by the depth and broad-mindedness that a yoga lifestyle offers, Nava is keen to share with you that wisdom and love, along with her experiences on the road of life. Nava is also an expert vegan chef who specializes in European cuisine and baking, and she is busy spreading that kind of love around Bhakti Lounge too!
6.15pm Tuesday 26th August
End the session on a high note with a delicious plant-based dinner, dessert, and good conversation.
Tickets available here~ bit.ly/eventTickets
Bhakti Lounge 1/175 Vivian Street, Te Aro, Wellington. http://www.bhaktilounge.org.nz

description:
Healthy Hospo Building Resilience Wellington, We're pleased to invite you to join us for this workshop on Building resilience and unlocking the power of the mind.
Why this matters:
In our rapidly changing world, resilience emerges as a fundamental skill. It's not just about bouncing back from adversity but confidently navigating change. Resilience enables individuals to navigate uncertainty with confidence and adaptability. This 90-minute workshop delves into the profound significance of resilience, offering participants practical insights and actionable strategies to cultivate resilience and harness the potential of the mind. By equipping individuals with these tools, the workshop empowers them to not only weather storms but also thrive in dynamic environments.
What to expect:
During this interactive workshop, participants will explore the core concepts of resilience and the mind-body connection through engaging discussions, experiential exercises, and practical demonstrations. They will learn evidence-based techniques to enhance their resilience, manage stress effectively, and cultivate a positive mindset amidst adversity. By the end of the session, attendees will emerge with a comprehensive toolkit to fortify their mental resilience and embrace change with confidence.
Who this is for:
This workshop caters to individuals across all organisational levels who are eager to enhance their resilience and cultivate a resilient mindset. Whether you're an owner, manager, chef, senior staff member, or junior employee, this workshop offers invaluable insights and practical strategies to bolster resilience and thrive in today's fast-paced world.
About the presenter, Sarah Robb
Sarah is a certified coach, counselor, and Master Practitioner of NLP (neuro-linguistic programming) holding a Bachelor's degree in Psychology.
With a passion for transformation, she guides individuals through retraining their brains and breaking free from limiting beliefs and patterns. Drawing on her extensive lived experience, Sarah has collaborated with over 200 clients and organisations, empowering them to apply practical tools and strategies for significant improvements in their mental health.
Sarah is motivated to continue creating positive change and to educate people about the power of the mind and how to use life's challenges as an opportunity for growth.
label: Health & Wellness

description:
Improving the Behaviour and Engagement of Boys Conference, Be part of a groundbreaking national conference, hosted by the Australian-based Positive Masculinity Foundation in collaboration with the Wellington College Research Centre.
Across Aotearoa and the world, many boys are feeling disengaged and excluded from the classroom. This event brings together educators, coaches, counsellors, and mentors for a day of meaningful conversations, keynote presentations, and practical breakout sessions focused on improving boys’ engagement, behaviour, and social connectedness.
Why attend?
Learn practical strategies to connect with boys and young men
Gain insights on classroom engagement, behaviour management, and building respect
Discover how to harness student culture and involve parents/whānau
Hear from world-class experts in education, leadership, and boys’ development
Speakers include:
Dr Ray Swann — Executive Director, Positive Masculinity Foundation
Dr Mark Dowley — Author, The Classroom Management Handbook
Kristen Molloy — Associate Head, The Crowther Centre
Ingrid Howren — Leadership Coach & +M Curriculum Specialist
Dr Aaron Columbus — Deputy Principal Teaching & Learning, Wellington College
Special Keynote: Professor Matt Englar-Carlson — Co-Director, Center for Men and Boys, California State University, leading expert on positive masculinity and mental health
Details:
Ticket includes morning tea & lunch
Accommodation advice available for out-of-town attendees (contact Dr Aaron Columbus at Wellington College)
This is a rare opportunity to learn from international leaders and collaborate with peers passionate about helping boys thrive.

description:
Humans: Why & What To Do, Humans: Why & What To Do
An evening of inspiration & indulgence! Talk by Devamrita Swami followed by a plant-powered dinner & dessert.

We’re the most connected generation in history — and somehow the loneliest. We’ve built more technology than any civilisation before us — and still can’t solve our basic problems. We talk endlessly about progress — while the planet burns and mental health plummets.

What if the trouble isn’t just what we’re doing… but that we’ve forgotten why we’re doing it?

In this bold talk, Devamrita Swami — a world-traveling monk, strategist, and social critic — unpacks the mess we’re in and asks the questions most of us avoid: Why are we here? And what should we actually be doing about it?

Afterwards, stick around for a plant-based dinner and dessert — fresh, colourful, and made to share. Grab a plate, grab a seat, and dive into real conversations with people who are curious, open-minded, and up for something different.

Meet Devamrita Swami, your host
Devamrita Swami is an educator, author, and monk who has spent over forty years exploring and sharing the wisdom of bhakti-yoga. He brings ancient Vedic teachings to life, effortlessly navigating the latest research in archaeology, consciousness, ancient history, neuroscience, social science, and psychology. Author of Searching for Vedic India and Hiding in Unnatural Happiness, he combines philosophy with practical insights on happiness, wellbeing, and personal fulfillment. For anyone seeking to channel the human drive for fulfilment in a meaningful and sustainable way, Devamrita Swami offers clear, engaging, and indispensable wisdom.

Amy Richards is a yoga teacher based in Pōneke, with a Certificate in MindBody Therapy. She is drawn to the ways intentional movement and embodied awareness can shape our inner experience and relationships. Grounded in a trauma-informed approach, her work invites exploration of connection with sensation and emotion through the body.

description:
Journey into Om, Yoga without mantra is a bit like cake without the icing !
By now we all know that everything essentially is vibration. Yoga knew this 1000's of years ago, that is why sound is the first tool of Yoga.
Learn about the pranavah mantra ( om) as it relates to your Yoga Practice.
In this 2-hour workshop, you will understand the traditional and respectful way to use this sacred sound: both theoretically and practically.
We will draw on the ancient texts of Yoga as our point of reference.
The use of a mantra is a powerful tool for healing, emotional and mental clarity, and spiritual development. You will be guided in a variety of accessible practices to experience the effects of this mantra.
This workshop can open new dimensions to your practice, or it is also a great way to start on the Yoga Journey.
I teach from the Viniyoga tradition of Krishnamacharya, where mantra is used as an integral aspect of Yoga, whether it be asana, pranayama, or meditation.
This workshop will be nourishing to all the dimensions -heart, mind, and body.
You do not need to be a singer at all-just be willing to have a go at making a sound, even in your head if out loud feels too weird.

description:
Improving the Behaviour and Engagement of Boys Conference, Be part of a groundbreaking national conference, hosted by the Australian-based Positive Masculinity Foundation in collaboration with the Wellington College Research Centre.
Across Aotearoa and the world, many boys are feeling disengaged and excluded from the classroom. This event brings together educators, coaches, counsellors, and mentors for a day of meaningful conversations, keynote presentations, and practical breakout sessions focused on improving boys’ engagement, behaviour, and social connectedness.
Why attend?
Learn practical strategies to connect with boys and young men
Gain insights on classroom engagement, behaviour management, and building respect
Discover how to harness student culture and involve parents/whānau
Hear from world-class experts in education, leadership, and boys’ development
Speakers include:
Dr Ray Swann — Executive Director, Positive Masculinity Foundation
Dr Mark Dowley — Author, The Classroom Management Handbook
Kristen Molloy — Associate Head, The Crowther Centre
Ingrid Howren — Leadership Coach & +M Curriculum Specialist
Dr Aaron Columbus — Deputy Principal Teaching & Learning, Wellington College
Special Keynote: Professor Matt Englar-Carlson — Co-Director, Center for Men and Boys, California State University, leading expert on positive masculinity and mental health
Details:
Ticket includes morning tea & lunch
Accommodation advice available for out-of-town attendees (contact Dr Aaron Columbus at Wellington College)
This is a rare opportunity to learn from international leaders and collaborate with peers passionate about helping boys thrive.
