description:
Master Your Mornings: a Routine That Works, Master Your Mornings: a Routine That Works
Take charge of your mornings and set yourself up for a productive, goal-driven day. A well-designed morning routine can give you focus, fuel your ambition, and create momentum that carries through everything you do. In this workshop, you’ll learn how to build a routine that fits your life and drives your success.
Dive into the science behind effective morning habits, pick up practical strategies for building routines that stick, and explore proven techniques to stay motivated and on track. Whether your goal is to enhance productivity, improve wellbeing, or cultivate mindfulness, this workshop gives you the tools to turn your mornings into a launchpad for long-term achievements.
What You’ll Gain:
Understand the psychology behind morning habits and why they matter
Discover how to design a morning routine tailored to your personal and professional aspirations
Learn time-tested strategies for consistency and maintaining motivation
Build a morning routine that sets you up for success, every single day
Leave this workshop with a clear, actionable morning routine that empowers you to take control of your day, and more importantly, your future.
Start each day with intention, clarity, and the momentum to reach your goals
Meet Nava, your host
Nava’s natural interest in studying physics blossomed into metaphysics when she arrived in the land of the long white cloud. Originally from Germany, Nava was travelling on a quest to find purpose and answers to the mysteries of life. Did she find anything on this quest? Yes! After eight exciting years of inquiry, practice, and being immersed in the wonders of bhakti yoga, she is still fully inspired by what she has discovered. Mesmerized by the depth and broad-mindedness that a yoga lifestyle offers, Nava is keen to share with you that wisdom and love, along with her experiences on the road of life. Nava is also an expert vegan chef who specializes in European cuisine and baking, and she is busy spreading that kind of love around Bhakti Lounge too!

description:
Men’s Circle: Real Conversations, Men’s Circle: Real Conversations
In a world where men are often expected to have everything figured out, this gathering offers a space to be genuine, not perfect.

About this Event

Men’s Circle: Real Conversations
In a society where men are expected to always have it together, this space is for being honest, not perfect.
This is a free offering but there’s the option to stay for an amazing plant-based dinner ($15). There’s no pressure to join, but sitting down to eat together is a simple, powerful way to deepen the sense of connection. Andre & Sri Jiva aren’t running this circle for profit and they are genuinely invested in creating real, meaningful spaces for men to connect.
The Men’s Circle is a gathering where men are able to connect in a safe, supportive space to share experiences, express emotions, and foster personal growth. Free from societal expectations of stoicism or self-sufficiency. Through open sharing and mutual support, participants are empowered to build resilience, self-reflection, and a stronger sense of identity and purpose.
Structure of the Circle
Gathering in a Circle: Participants sit in a circle to symbolize equality and unity.A short meditation or moment of silence may be included to help everyone arrive and connect.
Talking Object: A sharing stick or object is placed in the center. Only the personholding the object may speak, ensuring uninterrupted sharing.
Open Sharing: Anyone may choose to share while holding the object. Sharing is op-tional, and passing is always respected.
Active Listening: While one person shares, others listen attentively without speaking,interrupting, or offering advice. The focus is on witnessing and being present.
No Judgments or Advice: Participants refrain from judging or offering unsolicitedadvice, creating a safe space for authentic expression.
Closing: The circle may conclude with a group reflection, a moment of gratitude, or a simple acknowledgment of the shared experience.
Circle Agreements
Supportive Environment: We are here to uplift and support one another, fosteringtrust and brotherhood.
Focus on the Present: Share whats alive for you now, focusing on your emotions and experiences to deepen emotional awareness.
Use "I" Statements: Speak from your personal perspective using "I" statements topromote authenticity and responsibility. Avoid generalizations like "we" or "us."
No Judgment or fixing: Refrain from judging others sharing or offering unsolicitedadvice, ensuring a safe and non-critical space.
Confidentiality: What is shared in the circle stays in the circle. You may discuss your own experience outside the group, but keep others details private.




Event followed by a plant-based dinner and dessert, all included in your ticket!

What’s on the menu?
Creamy Farfalle Pasta with Plant-Based Bacon
Toasted Bruschetta with “Cheese”, Tomato and Parsley
Fresh Salad with Balsamic Vinegar
Berry Vanilla Muffins with Whipped Cream




Meet Your Hosts: Andre and Sri Jiva
Andre has been immersed in men’s work since the age of 13, when he first experienced a rite of passage in Golden Bay. That formative experience sparked a lifelong connection to circle work, which he later deepened by returning as a mentor. A multi-instrumental musician, poet, and pranayama (breathwork) facilitator, Andre also brings his passion for ecstatic dance, philosophy, and authentic connection into his offerings. He is deeply inspired by the question of what it means to be human—how we can more fully experience our aliveness, our depth, and reconnecting with the beauty of life together.
Since childhood, Sri Jiva has been fascinated by meaning, purpose, and authentic life fulfilment. This, among other things, led him to join a monastery at the age of 19. After years of monastic training, he chose to marry and pursue a career. He felt called to use his monastic experience to help others understand themselves, and to find wisdom, meaning, and purpose in their own lives. Inspired by this calling, he went to university to study counselling. Now, Sri Jiva and his wife live near Wellington, where he works with a small team of counsellors, supporting clients individually and in groups.




Agenda


🕑: 05:30 PM - 05:45 PM
Arrive to Bhakti Lounge

🕑: 05:45 PM - 07:15 PM
Men's Circle: Honest Conversations & Connection
Host: Andre

🕑: 07:15 PM - 08:15 PM
Plant-based dinner and dessert!
label: Health & Wellness

description:
Men's Circle: Honest Conversations & Connection, Men's Circle: Honest Conversations & Connection
Men’s Circle: Honest Conversations & Connection

In a world where men are often expected to have everything figured out, this gathering offers a space to be genuine, not perfect.

This is a free event, with an optional plant-based dinner available for $15. While there’s no obligation to stay for dinner, sharing a meal together offers a meaningful way to strengthen connections. Andre and Sri Jiva co-host this circle with a shared passion for creating authentic, supportive spaces where men can connect deeply—offering this gathering simply because they believe in its importance.

The Men’s Circle provides a safe and nurturing environment where men can share openly, express their feelings, and encourage personal growth—free from societal pressures to be stoic or self-reliant. Through honest sharing and collective support, participants build resilience, deepen self-awareness, and strengthen their sense of identity and purpose.

Structure of the Circle

Gathering in a Circle: Participants sit in a circle to symbolize equality and unity.

A short meditation or moment of silence may be included to help everyone arrive and connect.

Talking Object: A sharing stick or object is placed in the center. Only the person holding the object may speak, ensuring uninterrupted sharing.

Open Sharing: Anyone may choose to share while holding the object. Sharing is optional, and passing is always respected.

Active Listening: While one person shares, others listen attentively without speaking, interrupting, or offering advice. The focus is on witnessing and being present.

No Judgments or Advice: Participants refrain from judging or offering unsolicited advice, creating a safe space for authentic expression.

Closing: The circle may conclude with a group reflection, a moment of gratitude, or a simple acknowledgment of the shared experience.

Circle Agreements

Supportive Environment: We are here to uplift and support one another, fostering trust and brotherhood.

Focus on the Present: Share what's alive for you now, focusing on your emotions and experiences to deepen emotional awareness.

Use "I" Statements: Speak from your personal perspective using "I" statements to promote authenticity and responsibility. Avoid generalizations like "we" or "us."

No Judgment or fixing: Refrain from judging others sharing or offering unsolicited advice, ensuring a safe and non-critical space.

Confidentiality: What is shared in the circle stays in the circle. You may discuss your own experience outside the group, but keep others' details private.

Meet Andre and Sri Jiva, your hosts

Andre has been immersed in men’s work since the age of 13, when he first experienced a rite of passage in Golden Bay. That formative experience sparked a lifelong connection to circle work, which he later deepened by returning as a mentor. A multi-instrumental musician, poet, and pranayama (breathwork) facilitator, Andre also brings his passion for ecstatic dance, philosophy, and authentic connection into his offerings. He is deeply inspired by the question of what it means to be human—how we can more fully experience our aliveness, our depth, and reconnecting with the beauty of life together.

Since childhood, Sri Jiva has been fascinated by meaning, purpose, and authentic life fulfilment. This, among other things, led him to join a monastery at the age of 19. After years of monastic training, he chose to marry and pursue a career. He felt called to use his monastic experience to help others understand themselves, and to find wisdom, meaning, and purpose in their own lives. Inspired by this calling, he went to university to study counselling. Now, Sri Jiva and his wife live near Wellington, where he works with a small team of counsellors, supporting clients individually and in groups.

description:
Monk & Munchies, Monk & Munchies is where plant-based eats meet meaningful conversation.

We’ve got mantra music to set the vibe, a live Q&A with Chaitanya Charan on Living Spirituality, and a plant-based dinner. Think stuffed-crust pizza, wedges, Hawaiian skewers, fresh salad, topped off with chocolate mudcake with ice cream and mocktails!

We’re super stoked to host Chaitanya Charan in Wellington! He’s a monk, global speaker, and author of over 25 books, and has shared his insights at top universities like Yale and Princeton, as well as companies including Microsoft and Intel. What really sets him apart is how practical and relatable his wisdom is—making timeless teachings easy to apply to everyday life. Take this chance to meet a monk in person and hear his insights firsthand!

Good food, live beats, and insights that will leave you with something to think about.

description:
LIFE DRAWING MEETS YOGA!, LIFE DRAWING MEETS YOGA!
Connect with your body and your creativity in this all-levels workshop that combines vinyasa yoga practice with a fun and interactive Life Drawing class!

The Life Drawing session is based on the teaching methods of Cecil Collins, a British artist whose non-academic approach to drawing challenges you to leave your inhibitions at the door and work freely from your creative centre...much like yoga!

“But I can’t draw!,” you say. Then even better! This approach is perfect for the artist and non-artist alike as it asks you to drop your expectations of what art should look like, inviting you to express the pose from within…just like we do in yoga.

Drinks & nibbles follow, along with a chance for kōrero and connection.

Guided by JoElle Gragilla from South Coast Studio in Island Bay, who studied Cecil’s methods in London and is an artist, art teacher and AWHI-trained yoga teacher. Co-facilitated by AWHI's Lachlan Broughton.

Investment: $75 (includes yoga class, mat & props, art materials, art lesson, herbal tea throughout and drinks & nibbles at the end!)

We've done this workshop before so can confidently say it's a REALLY FUN TIME! Definitely don't miss out!

Join us for a monthly gathering of healing, alignment, and community.
This circle is designed to help you release stagnant energy, restore balance, and connect deeply with yourself and others through Reiki-infused practices and guided meditation.
What you will experience:• Reiki healing to clear energetic congestion• Guided meditation for detox and renewal• Crystal grid activation to amplify cleansing energy• Oracle card pull for guidance• Closing integration with Blue Lotus Tea, Seasonal Fruit, and Shared Kai
This is a safe and supportive space for both beginners and experienced Reiki practitioners. Come as you are – leave feeling lighter, clearer, and more aligned.

A yoga mat or something comfortable to sit/lie on
A cushion or blanket for extra comfort
A water bottle to stay hydrated
A journal and pen if you’d like to reflect after the circle
An open heart and intention for what you wish to release or receive
Optional: crystals, talismans, or personal items you’d like to charge in the Reiki circle or place near the crystal grid.
Details:When: Every first Thursday of the month, 6:00 PMWhere: Te Aro Ashtanga, Left Bank, Cuba Street, WellingtonEnergy Exchange: $35
Spots are limited – reserve your place today.
Walk away with:
A lighter body and mind, free from stagnant energy
A calmer nervous system and deeper inner stillness
Insights from guided meditation and oracle reflection
Nourishment through Blue Lotus Tea, seasonal fruit, and shared kai
A sense of belonging within a like-minded community
Renewed clarity, alignment, and energy to carry forward

This 5 consecutive weeks of Multi-Level Reformer Pilates series is designed for all abilities — whether you’re new to Pilates or an experienced mover, you'll receive tailored guidance to suit your individual needs.

Enjoy a supportive, welcoming environment with personalised attention in our intimate classes (max 8 participants). Each session will energise and challenge you, helping to build strength, flexibility, and balance in a sustainable way.

RSVP is a must through our website.

People in your group are there to socialise, connect and have fun. Who knows? You might just discover your new BFF!

Entry: $12.50 - reserves your spot and supports the platform.
Exact location is shared via email once you have paid/joined via site.

This 5 consecutive weeks of Multi-Level Reformer Pilates series is designed for all abilities — whether you’re new to Pilates or an experienced mover, you'll receive tailored guidance to suit your individual needs.

Enjoy a supportive, welcoming environment with personalised attention in our intimate classes (max 8 participants). Each session will energise and challenge you, helping to build strength, flexibility, and balance in a sustainable way.

After the session, you are welcome to stay or visit a cafe nearby with the group to continue the conversations and connections.

Schedule:
- Sat. 04 Oct 2025 01.30pm
- Sat. 11 Oct 2025 01.30pm
- Sat. 18 Oct 2025 01.30pm
- Sat. 25 Oct 2025 01.30pm

Please Note: While we do our best to be flexible, we are unable to offer reschedules or make-up sessions for any missed classes within this 5-week consecutive block. For health and safety reasons, classes are also non-transferable and cannot be passed on to another person.

RSVP is a must through our website.

People in your group are there to socialise, connect and have fun. Who knows? You might just discover your new BFF!

See you there!

description:
Parent Support Group – Miramar, Parent Support Group – Miramar
care for a disabled child, a neurodivergent child, or a child with health impairments.

Parent to Parent hosts monthly Parent Support Groups in Miramar to support carers and parents just like you. These groups are a safe space for family and whānau to share their experiences, their challenges, their triumphs, and to learn from each other in an open and 100% judgement-free environment. No topic is too ‘weird’, no question too ‘out there’. We get it, and we are here to help.

So if you’d like to share a struggle, celebrate a success, raise a concern, or simply have a cuppa and chat with other parents and carers in your area, you are always welcome at our Parent Support Group. Children are welcome too! Drop in for as long or as short a time as you want. And did we mention there’s free coffee??

No need to RSVP, feel free to just show up on the day!

Or contact Meredith Dyer for more info:
| 027 808 3947

description:
Real Talk Kāpiti, Real Talk Kāpiti
We are excited to announce that we are bringing Real Talk to Kāpiti. We can’t wait to share space with you all!
🔥Saturday 29th November
🔥11am to 3pm (doors open at 10.30am)
🔥Te Raukura ki Kāpiti, 34a Raumati Road,
Kapiti College, Paraparaumu

This is a FREE event for Rangatahi (14-25years) and also FREE for Rangatahi Service Providers, Kaiako, anyone that works with our rangatahi, Tāngata whaikaha and whaiora.
Click here to register for your tickets:
https://www.eventfinda.co.nz/2025/real-talk-kapiti/paraparaumu

Real Talk Kōrero

We take our audience on a journey, a journey of laughter, a journey of tears, and a journey with absolute passion and purpose.
We create a safe space to speak about what we have experienced in our lives, and that we don’t have to be whakamā, we don’t have to live in silence, we don’t have to hide our secrets anymore.
Because when we speak – we heal, when we speak we free ourselves, and when we speak – we provide inspiration and hope for others.

We provide the following at each event:

❤️Inspiring kaikōrero
❤️Free kai and refreshments
❤️Opportunity to win some incredible prizes on the day
❤️FREE Real Talk pukapuka for every rangatahi in the audience

The subjects covered in our kōrero start with but are not limited to the subjects listed below:

⚫️Suicide and triggers and coping mechanisms
⚫️Mental Health awareness
⚫️Sexual, physical abuse and domestic violence
⚫️Being raised in gang affiliated environments
⚫️Drug and alcohol addiction
⚫️Teen pregnancy & pregnancy loss
⚫️Death & grief
⚫️Takatāpui & tangata whaikaha
⚫️Discrimination – racial, gender, sexual orientation
⚫️Relationship breakdowns
⚫️Career & business aspirations
⚫️Standing strong in who you are

We have a great line up of powerhouse, inspirational kaikōrero/speakers on the day:
🔥Pairama Wright – TikTok sensation
🔥Pania Te Paiho – Wāhine Toa Hunting & Hākuturi
🔥Peleti Oli – Youth Advocate
🔥Elise Niu
🔥Rutu King-Stubbs – Hope Is My Homeboy
🔥Sophie Taylor-Edwards - Kaiwaiata
🔥Kiino Krystal - MC
🔥Hosted by – Tania Carr

Our workshops carefully combine yoga, mantra, breath, and creative expression to offer tools you can take into your own life and practice. Guided by experienced, mature facilitators, each session is thoughtfully crafted to engage all your senses, nurturing the body, mind, and spirit. Suitable for all levels, the experience is holistic, embodied, and gently transformative. Take a journey, slow down, and allow time and space for insight, creativity, and connection.
This workshop is a women-only space, led by women who know the cost of giving more than you receive.
In this self-empowering process, you will be supported to let go as much as you can, so you have a sense of spaciousness and can then bring in what it is you are currently seeking.

description:
Reigniting the spark, Kia Ora lovely teachers!! We're back with a FREE PD Workshop with the talented Kimberley Crisp talking about REIGNITING THE SPARK.
This free PD workshop is free for all ECE teachers, regardless of whether you are a Jitbug reliever or not. This event is our way of giving back to the ECE community
Kimberley has a HeArT for reigniting the spark and supporting teachers to see the light within. Stress is the fastest way to extinguish the "flame".
Being a teacher is not for the faint hearted, its for the FULL hearted.
We are giving from ourselves all day and we are in output mode.
Lets come together and have some nourishing connection - and cross polinate.
As relievers you have a potent position to literally breathe life into teams, sprinkle your spark and cross polinate with so many teams.
Come and hear Kimberley's poignant pondering around the power of the present and prepared teacher. Let's connect... recharge... reignite the flame and create a fire that burns from within.

description:
Pastor From Gaza, St John’s is collaborating with Central Baptist to host this Pastor from Gaza, as he shares about being the Church amidst conflict.
Born and raised in Gaza, he now ministers across the Gaza and Middle East, providing pastoral support and practical aid to persecuted Christians, refugees, orphans, and widows.
This tour is not political—it is about the Body of Christ. The Pastor will share his own testimony, speak to the ongoing challenges faced by Christians in Gaza, and highlight his wider ministry in the Middle East. It is a message of hope, forgiveness, and perseverance—one that will challenge the Church in Aotearoa.
This event is to raise awareness of the spiritual and practical needs of believers in Gaza and the Middle East, as well as invite us to give in support of his ministry, with funds going directly to help persecuted Christians with food, shelter, and outreach.

description:
SOMATIC Boot Camp with Miri Naad, Get unstuck, release, move, breathe, sweat, dance and shake … FEEL ALIVE AGAIN! We are going deeper starting this EQUINOX. Join my 4 Sundays Somatic Boot Camp!
This particular SOMATIC YOGA program is to assist you in getting unstuck, opening your energetic potential and learn real grounded foundational tools to help you stay Human ;) 
These sessions are designed to work deeply and subtly in decluttering stagnant energy in your nervous system due to adrenal response to life stressors, control programs, and repressed life force. 
Decompress the Vagus Nerve, release trauma (any adaptive response to change, stresses the nervous system) deprogram the PSOA, access your inner fire, creative expression, voice, and power, through holistic movements, breath work, and bioenergetic movement.
 4 Sunday weekly group sessions 1.5 hrs -  Starting Sunday 21st of  September 2025  for 4 Sundays  at 4:30pm-6pm 
Venue Ridgway School, Mornington rd, Brooklyn. 
Price is for x4 sessions at $120  and $80 unwaged /student. 
you can also bring cash on the day but commit to all sessions please. 
We will work together in an unstructured, un-linear way, yet utilizing classic temple practices which include kundalini yoga postures and breath, rebirthing breath technology, mantra, EFT (tapping) TRE (trauma/tension release), and *Divadassi temple holistic dance flow. 
Unlocking inner body technology through breath, trembling, movement, and subtle holistic dance and mudras (activation or access codes within our body organic technology) 
This is a very intuitive and holistic approach, tailored specifically to what your body is asking and needing, initiation or strengthening your relationship with your body at all levels, physical, emotional, mental, and energetic self.

description:
She Rises: Spring Edition, When was the last time you truly paused?
Not just for a moment between tasks, but long enough to breathe and focus on your own wellbeing?

On the eve of Spring, join us for an afternoon, designed to nourish your soul, rejuvenate your energy and awaken the inspiration you need for the season ahead.
As a business owner, Leadership Coach and active mum of four, Sina Mikaio knows the importance of taking the time to escape the hustle and reset each season. That’s why she created She Rises - Spring Edition. An opportunity for you to step away from the noise, let go of the schedules and reconnect with your own inner wisdom.

Who Is This Workshop For?
This intimate gathering is for the women who:
Feels like she is holding it all—career, family and relationships—and is yearning for a space to finally let go.
Knows she wants more from life, but is seeking clarity on what that is and how to get there.
Is ready to release the stories of self doubt and exhaustion that have been holding her back.
Craves connection not only with herself, but with a circle of like-minded women who just "get it."

What To Expect: Your Journey
Your journey through this immersive afternoon will be woven through three powerful pillars:
Movement: Beginning with a nourishing yoga flow designed to release stored energy from the body, clear your mind and open your channels to receive your own guidance. (All levels welcome).
Mindset: A deep dive into your personal energy. You will learn how it impacts your presence, identify where you are leaking energy, release what no longer serves you and get crystal clear on what you want to call in.
Manifestation: A powerful guided visualisation to connect you with your deepest intuition. This practice will help bring your ideas forth, give you clarity on your next steps and provide you with the tools to build a purposeful pathway towards your goals.

You Will Leave With:
Clarity on your path for the season ahead
Unshakeable Confidence in your own wisdom, intelligence and power
The Courage to take aligned action towards a life you truly love
Actionable tools to regulate your nervous system and manage your energy daily.
A profound sense of feeling grounded, inspired and aligned within yourself.

Tickets available to purchase via eventbrite link below:

https://www.eventbrite.co.nz/e/she-rises-spring-edition-tickets-1550395166679?aff=oddtdtcreator

description:
Teaching Well - A supportive school for a well staff - Wellington (TWS2025/04), Growing attention to staff wellbeing has resulted in many workplace mental wellbeing initiatives. Nevertheless, the concept of staff wellbeing is rarely well-defined, with programs focusing on either work-related stressors or staff wellness approaches.

As part of a well school, it is just as essential to have a well staff as it is to a well student body. Don't miss out! Discover the key principles of wellbeing and build a sustainable, impactful plan for your staff.

Join this workshop tailored for schools & kura, exploring how to promote staff wellbeing in 2025. Learn the theory and practice of promoting wellbeing in staff!
From Remedial to Sustainable Action
Providing resources or assistance programmes to help staff manage job stress is a single element of an extensive staff wellbeing plan. Schools commonly start at the remedial end of the wellbeing continuum, creating welfare or wellness plans. Learning the differences between welfare, wellness, and wellbeing approaches, including their strengths and weaknesses, is important.

Meta-evaluations reveal that many workplace mental wellbeing programmes lack efficacy due to not addressing organisational and systemic factors that impact wellbeing. Effective staff wellbeing programmes must respond to staff needs and reflect the school's cultural values and character.
Utilizing collective impact, transformational change theory, and Te Whare Tapa Whā, we introduce a conceptual model outlining the eight pillars essential for a staff wellbeing plan. This model's strength lies in its specificity to different settings or occupations, necessitating an in-depth analysis of work nature, dynamics, and inter-relationships.
Based on insights from past workshops and participant feedback, this workshop now provides a comprehensive template for developing staff wellbeing plans.
This workshop does not offer a pre-packaged wellbeing programme. Research indicates that externally imposed wellbeing programmes have limited efficacy in schools. Effective staff wellbeing plans must be rooted in insights gained from reflective analysis and staff consultations. Notably, the consultation process itself is a key wellbeing activity.
Take the opportunity to hear from an award winning wellbeing specialist about:
the wellbeing continuum and the difference between mental illness prevention and wellbeing approaches
the key determinants that impact on staff wellbeing
effective strategies to respond to fatigue, burnout, depression and trauma
why one size doesn't fit all and how to scope and design a staff wellbeing programme responsive to the specific needs of your school
developing a staff wellbeing programme based on proven wellbeing outcomes
making informed decisions on your school’s staff wellbeing policy and activities
Workshop Format:
The content will be delivered over two workshops.
In-Person 1 day workshop in Wellington
Friday 31 October 9am to 4pm
On-Line Workshop
Wednesday 3 December 1 - 3.30pm

Topics covered in this practical workshop:
what is meant by wellbeing and its role in addressing stress and mental distress in staff;
the difference between a welfare and a wellbeing approach;
staff wellbeing as an industrial relations / conditions of employment issue
resilience, coping, thriving? - identifying desired wellbeing outcomes
the interface between personal and professional stressors and distressors
the impact on staff wellbeing from exposure to trauma and poor mental wellbeing within the student body
the key determinants that facilitate wellbeing in the teaching environment
what does and what doesn’t contribute to a supportive environment where staff thrive
the key components that should be in a staff wellbeing programme
designing, implementing and evaluating a staff wellbeing programme
School Group Participation
Schools are encouraged to have more than one staff member participate in the online workshops. Past workshops has shown that having more than one staff member has maximised the benefit of the workshop activities which can then been continued post-workshop. To promote school group participation, there is a 20% discount off the total registration fee when three or more participants per school are registered.
Who should attend: 
Senior leadership team members (especially those with responsibility of staff wellbeing)
OHS representatives or union delegates
Heads of Departments
Boards of Trustees representatives
School Counsellors / EAP providers
In-House Delivery:
This workshop can also be delivered in-house, school clusters, or organisations such as prinicpal assocations or unions. Post workshop consulting services such as mentoring the development of or reviewing a staff wellbeing plan can also be provided.
Post Workshop Consult:
Schools and Kuras have the option of a 90 minute consult with Barry in 2026 to review their staff wellbeing plan.
AN OPPORTUNITY FOR LEARNING WITH INTERNATIONALLY RESPECTED AND AWARD WINNING MENTAL WELLBEING PRACTITIONER AND SUICIDOLOGIST, BARRY TAYLOR
Barry has worked in mental wellbeing promotion and suicide prevention/postvention for 37 years at the local, national and international levels.  His extensive experience includes sitting on state and national government advisory committees; designing, implementing and evaluating suicide prevention programs; writing suicide prevention guidelines, training packages and community resources; providing technical advice to community based and national mental wellbeing and suicide prevention programs.  He has worked extensively with schools both here and overseas supporting management and staff in the event of a suicide. He wrote the first suicide postvention guidelines for schools in 1990, developed the first national suicide prevention guidelines for schools in Australia in 1999 and reviewed and updated the NZ guidelines in 2010.
He has led multiple ‘firsts’ in mental wellbeing both in Aotearoa New Zealand and overseas.  In recognition of his outstanding contribution to mental wellbeing and suicide prevention, he was awarded in 2016 the NSW Mental Health Commissioner's Community Champion Award.
Barry has lectured on wellbeing both nationally and internationally and been appointed to numerous government advisory committees on mental wellbeing and suicide prevention.  He brings to this workshop extensive experience in advising communities and government on post-disaster recovery in terms of both mental wellbeing promotion / community resiliency and suicide prevention.
As a Health Sociologist and Public Health practitioner, Barry has a long-term interest in the social and cultural determinants of wellbeing, especially the role of gender and he brings a wealth of knowledge and passion for promoting wellbeing in men. He has examined the impact of discrimination, internalised stigma, social exclusion or inclusion on mental wellbeing along with the role of human rights as an enabler of wellbeing.
He embraces a holistic understanding of wellbeing and has an interest in the role spirituality and ecology contributes to a person's wellbeing. He uses a population health and systems change approach, drawing on transformational change theory and collective impact.
After a number of years overseas, Barry is living back in New Zealand and is passionate about building the knowledge base, competence and capability within our country to promote well whānau, workplaces and communities and for the incorporation of wellbeing principles in public policy and social outcomes such as education, training and employment.
WORKSHOP DETAILS
WORKSHOP PLACES ARE LIMITED. REGISTER EARLY TO AVOID DISAPPOINTMENT
Places in the workshop are limited. If the workshop is full please register your name on the waitlist
Group Booking Discount: Book 3 or more participants in one booking and receive 20% discount off each registration
School & Kura Discount: Enter SCHOOLKURA20 to the Discount Code box at the beginning of the registration process for a further 20% discount off the registration fee.
Payment: Payment is by either:
Credit Card (Visa or Mastercard) or 
Instalment payment (ZIP and Afterpay)
Invoice - Schools and kura have the option to pay by invoice. At payment method click on Invoice,
Terms for Payment By Invoice
By selecting to pay by invoice the organisation agrees to the following conditions:
1.  Your place in the workshop is not confirmed until payment has been received. Payment of the invoice must be made within seven days of registering to avoid having your registration cancelled. Late payment fees apply.
2.  A Tax Invoice from TaylorMade Training and Consulting will be sent to you separately which will contain bank details for payment.  
3.  By registering for the workshop, you agree to the cancellation and policy. (refer below).  Organisations who cancel within seven days of the workshop and have not paid the invoice for the outstanding registration fee are still obligated to pay the outstanding debt.

Cancellation and Refund Policy
Workshops can fill quickly. If you are no longer able to attend the workshop please cancel your registration as soon as possible. The following refund policy is strictly adhered to.
Cancellation up to seven days prior to the commencement of the workshop:  Full Refund less $35+GST admin fee
Cancellation within seven days prior to the commencement of the workshop: No refund but registration can be transferred to another person. To transfer your registration log on to your registration and update the name and contact details to the new person attending.
Non attendance:   No refund

TaylorMade Training and Consulting will not be liable for any damages of any kind to any person or entity arising from the use of this information. Your attendance at this workshop reflects your acceptance of this statement.

description:
Tap for Healing Trauma & the Nervous system, Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars
Tap for Healing Trauma & the Nervous system
Our nervous system is shaped by more than just big life events — hidden wounds and micro-traumas from childhood can leave lasting imprints that show up as stress, anxiety, and repeating relationship patterns. When triggered, these unconscious “programs” hijack our reactions, leaving us feeling stuck even when we want to move forward. In this workshop, we’ll explore how trauma influences the nervous system and why awareness alone isn’t enough to create lasting change.
In this 75 minute workshop, you’ll discover how trauma impacts the nervous system and learn FasterEFT tools to release triggers, reframe old memories, and reset your stress response. You’ll walk away with simple, science-backed practices you can use every day to build resilience and emotional freedom.
“This is an interactive workshop where you’ll connect with others. It’s a powerful reminder that, beneath the surface, we generally share the same challenges and struggles—and that healing becomes easier when we explore them together.”
Meet your host, Krishnaloka
Introducing Krishnaloka, who is driven to help others overcome their issues within their mind and pyschology. As a mind technician trained in eutaptics (Faster EFT), she employs the fastest and most powerful method to create lasting change by addressing the root causes of issues rather than just the symptoms. Her warm and caring nature makes every interaction with her both comforting and transformative.


6.15pm Tuesday 7th of October
End the session on a high note with a delicious plant-based dinner, dessert, and good conversation.

description:
Pavilion Open Day – Celebrate Spring with Us!, Pavilion Open Day – Celebrate Spring with Us!
Wednesday 24 September 2025, 10am – 2pm
Discovery Garden, Wellington Botanic Garden
Free
These September school holidays, welcome the season of new life and bright colours at our family-friendly Pavilion Open Day. Tamariki can explore the garden’s spring magic through self-guided, hands-on activities designed to spark curiosity and connection.
Activities include:
• Nature’s Colours Art Table – Create your own “spring colour” bookmark using petals, leaves, and other natural treasures.
• Spring Scavenger Hunt – Follow clues to spot signs of the season: sweet-scented flowers, fresh buds, busy birds and more.
• Spring Reading Nook – Relax on the grass mat with tree-stump cushions and enjoy a basket of spring-themed books.
• Bird’s Nest Discovery Table – Get up close to real nests (ethically sourced), soft bird puppets, and natural playdough to shape “eggs” and match them to their native bird owners.
Perfect for children aged 4–12 and their whānau. Dress for a day outdoors and celebrate te kōanga—the vibrant season of growth!
We’ll see you soon in the Discovery Garden, Wellington Botanic Garden!

The Kava Experience, Bula Vinaka and Welcome to Kava Culture, New Zealand’s newest destination for authentic Fijian Kava!
We are thrilled to invite you to another relaxing Kava Experience night. Whether you're a curious newcomer or a seasoned kava enthusiast, our dedicated team will warmly guide you through every step of this unique journey.
At Kava Culture, we offer a premium, traditionally brewed kava experience designed for wellness-focused individuals seeking natural relaxation. We pride ourselves on sourcing our kava directly from small Pacific Island farms, ensuring unparalleled quality and authenticity.
Immerse yourself in the rich traditions of the Pacific as you enjoy our exquisite kava in our calm, serene location at Kaitahi, beautifully illuminated by ambient lights. This is more than just a drink; it's an opportunity to connect with others, promote genuine stress relief, and celebrate ancient island culture with modern comfort.
Join us for a night filled with community, connection, and tranquility. Let Kava Culture transport you – no passport required!

We can’t wait to welcome you!

Nestled within a sacred Sanctuary under the starlit skies of Paraparaumu, you are invited to enter the realm of Ether — the invisible thread that weaves all of life. Here, the boundaries between body, breath, and spirit begin to dissolve into the spaciousness of the cosmos.

Cradled by silence, expanded through breath, and elevated by sound, this ceremony is a subtle, sacred transmission — a remembrance of your soul’s celestial origin.

Blue Lotus, known as the Flower of the Heavens, has been revered in ancient Egyptian and Eastern traditions as a plant of intuition, divination, and deep heart awakening. As you connect with the energy of Blue Lotus you are invited to soften your edges and expand your awareness into dream-like states — where insight, creativity, and emotional release naturally unfold. Nestled in the hills beside the Lotus Yoga Centre rests a sacred Meditation Sanctuary
a place where many come to reconnect, find inner stillness, and bathe in peace.

Built in 1999, this Sanctuary serves as the spiritual heart of the Centre’s activities.
The location itself was chosen with great care, resting at the meeting point of powerful ley lines, its energy deeply aligned with Kapiti Island and the Maungakotukutuku ranges to the east.

The octagon-shaped structure is crafted from natural timbers, crowned with a glass pyramid roof that amplifies and channels healing energies. Around its frame, tinted windows radiate the seven colours of the rainbow—each one carrying a unique healing ray. On a bright day, the play of colours is nothing short of spectacular, filling the space with a living rainbow of light.

World Tour (sort of...) | Wellington, After humble beginnings in a garage, to a record-breaking rise to the top of the podcast charts, Aotearoa’s favourite trio — Jordan Vaha'akolo, Brook Ruscoe, and Marc Peard — are taking The Morning Shift to the people. This August and September, they’ll be bringing eight massive shows across Aotearoa and Australia in their first-ever LIVE tour.
Real people, real talk and now real life. Expect all the stuff you love from the podcast: deep kōrero, big laughs, a few tears, spontaneous/questionable singing, plus whatever Jordan decides to overshare that night. The live show brings the podcast to life, with that signature Morning Shift energy that turns commutes into therapy sessions and takes gym workouts to another level.

description:
The Healthy Hospo Stress Reset: Sauna • Ice Bath • Breathwork • Community - Auckland, Healthy Hospo and Hospitality New Zealand are excited to invite you to…
The Hospo Stress Reset: Sauna • Ice Bath • Breathwork • Community
We’re all told that stress is bad. Chronic stress can lead to burnout and serious health issues. But what if stress itself isn’t the enemy? What if learning how to work with stress could actually make it a powerful tool for resilience, energy, and performance?
With hospitality gearing up for peak season, this is your chance to reset, recharge, and equip yourself with the tools to stay calm and in control when things get busy.
Join Healthy Hospo and Hospitality New Zealand for a unique experiential workshop designed just for hospo. Across this 2-hour session, you’ll experience:
·       Interactive Breathwork, led by our resident Breathwork & Physiology expert, Josh Fankhauser, to help you manage stress and shift your state on demand.
·       Hot/Cold Contrast Therapy, a guided community sauna and ice bath experience with Sauna Collective, to boost recovery, improve focus, and leave you feeling re-energised.
·       Practical Tools for Everyday Life. Strategies you can take back to your workplace (and your own wellbeing) to help you thrive through peak season.

 Times: Three sessions to choose from, each capped at 16 people so spaces will go fast!
·       9:00 – 10:45am
·       11:00 – 12:45pm
·       1:15 – 3:00pm
What to Bring
·       Swim suit
·       2 x Towels (one for sauna, one for shower)
·       Change of clothes
·       Notebook & pen
Thanks to funding through Healthy Hospo NZ and Hospitality NZ the cost of $50 per person is fully sponsored.
Spaces are limited and as all spaces are completely funded by Healthy Hospo NZ and Hospitality NZ, you'll need to secure your spot early!

description:
The Overthinking Mind – Making Friends with our Mind, Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars
The Overthinking Mind- Making friends with our mind
What mood is our mind in today? What does it refuse to do that we want it do, and what does it do that we don’t want it to do? Is there any solution to the unruly nature of the mind? Thankfully yoga wisdom deals head on with the mind - how to manage it, and how to satisfy it and make it peaceful.


Meet your host, Khadiravan
Khadiravan is a seasoned bhakti yoga teacher at Bhakti Lounge and you might have heard her angelic singing, which is like therapy for the ears. Kirtan (mantra music meditation) is Khadiravan's love and she enjoys creating a comfortable and meditative space when she hosts our SoundLabs or at soulFeast. Khadiravan also offers her background of a PhD in Yoga Psychology, to whoever wants to lend an ear and an inquisitive mind to exploring life through the lens of yoga wisdom
6.15pm Tuesday 23rd of September
End the session on a high note with a delicious plant-based dinner, dessert, and good conversation.

description:
Time In Nature, Time in nature is good for us. This free event has been created for anyone who would like to harnest the health benefits of a short walk through the bush, up the back of Maidstone Park.
It's a way to use our time productively. Get off our phones. Ground. Breathe. And set intention for the upcoming week.
Spring has arrived with fresh energy. Are you ready to get back to basics for some health affirming movement? Come join me!! I'm an Upper Hutt based Registered Naturopath and Medical Herbalist (NMHNZ & NZAMH).
All welcome. A reasonable level of fitness is required or a willingness to take short breaks as needed. It's a hill walk through bush with beautiful views. Meet up location is at the lawn roller next to the tennis courts.
Hope to connect with you soon. This will be a weekly event.

description:
Unlock Secrets of Natures Wisdom, Unlock Secrets of Natures Wisdom
Rose McKenzie & Nicole McKinnon - open your world of wellness!

First Light Flower Essences of New Zealand® - Unlock the Secrets of Nature’s Sacred Wisdom with Rose McKenzie

Have you ever wondered what a flower essence truly is? Or how it can support profound transformation at every level of your being?

Join us for an illuminating introduction to First Light Flower Essences of New Zealand®, revered as Sacred Plant Medicines for the soul. More than just remedies, these vibrational essences are potent allies in the journey toward holistic healing and self-realisation.

In this special session, we’ll delve into Nature’s Healing Matrix©, a powerful framework that reveals how these essences work in harmony with the natural world to support balance, healing, and inner evolution.

Discover how these sacred tools can help you to:
🌿 Transform emotional imbalances, outdated mindsets, and deep-seated conditioning
🌿 Clear trauma held in the energy field and cellular memory
🌿 Energise, protect, and harmonise the chakra system
🌿 Release fear, limiting beliefs, and inherited patterns stored in your DNA
🌿 Support your soul’s purpose and evolutionary path

Whether you’re new to vibrational medicine or ready to deepen your journey, this experience offers a beautiful gateway into the healing intelligence of the plant kingdom.

Come with curiosity—leave with insight, inspiration, and a deeper connection to the sacred rhythms of nature.

Each guest will receive a complimentary bottle of an acute flower essence formula.
My talk will be supported by a powerpoint presentation Email

Second part of the evening ✨

Holistic Beauty Therapist & Founder of Phorest Inspired Skincare with Nicole McKinnon

Nicole is a holistic beauty therapist with over 30 years of experience, based in her peaceful home salon in Paremata. With a deep belief in the power of intuitive, supportive skincare, she helps women reconnect with themselves and their skin as they age—focusing not on “fixing” wrinkles, but on nurturing vitality, health, and self-confidence.

Alongside her hands-on expertise, Nicole has completed post-graduate studies in cosmetic chemistry and product development, allowing her to blend science with soul in her practice. Her Phorest Inspired Skincare approach is centered in daily grounding rituals and moments of pause—encouraging women to take time for themselves and honour the natural changes in their skin.

In her upcoming talk, Nicole shares how simple, intentional skincare can become a powerful act of self-care and renewal.

Booking Cost: $30 per person

https://www.artandlivingspace.nz/bookings

For further information contact: Nancy 027 276 2786

description:
Yoga & Cacao Twilight & Morning Edition - Pop-up Parlour 2025, Yoga & Cacao Twilight & Morning Edition - Pop-up Parlour 2025
Come and join Jenny Allan for a cup of ceremonial grade cacao and then enjoy a gentle and relaxing restorative yoga practice - twilight edition.

Event details

• What - 1.5 hr yoga session
• When -
TWILIGHT EDITION 7-8.30pm Tuesday 23rd September 2025
MORNING EDITION 10-11.30am Saturday 27th September 2025

• Where - St Marks, 98 Rāwhiti Road, Pukerua Bay
• Cost - $30 per person

• What to bring? Most props are provided but feel free to bring your own yoga mat for extra comfort as well as a cushion, blanket, socks and an eye pillow if you have one.

This class is suitable for all - no previous experience is required.

LIMITED SPACES AVAILABLE.
TWILIGHT SESSION - https://tinyurl.com/5a2pad44
MORNING SESSION - https://tinyurl.com/mw82z38u

Restorative yoga is a practice of deep relaxation in which yoga poses (asanas) are held for several minutes with the use of props such as blocks, bolster and blankets to support the body in gentle stretch.

When your body enters a state of relaxation, your mind will also relax. Once you have been guided to let go of any tension held in your body, all that is required is for you to pay attention to your breath, becoming aware of any thoughts that may arise, and then gently releasing them.

This restful practice calms both mind and body, allowing the nervous system to enter its parasympathetic state – the state of “rest and digest”, in which healing is enabled and enhanced.

About Cacao
Cacao is a superfood. It is plant medicine at its finest. Its scientific name, Theobroma cacao, translates to "food of the Gods." Containing many minerals, vitamins and phytonutrients such as flavonoids and antioxidants, it is also an extremely potent adaptogen that encourages the body to come into balance.

Cacao has a particularly strong influence on the heart – both physiologically and energetically. Cacao anecdotally is reported to enhance connection in community, hence its beauty in being shared in circle.

In Jenny's experience, cacao seems to enhance whatever it is that you are doing – be it running a marathon or meditating – cacao can make you go deeper, further, longer, stronger. However she does seem to have a mind of her own so be open to the experience she offers you – it may not always go quite how you planned!

Cacao is very safe and tolerated well by most people. However it is to be used with caution by people who are taking high doses of SSRIs. Cacao releases serotonin, so it works as a mild antidepressant. When taken with SSRIs that release serotonin chemically it can lead to serotonin syndrome. Individuals taking MAOIs (monoamine oxidase inhibitors) should avoid consuming ceremonial cacao due to potential interactions.

This workshop is part of Pukerua Bay Hub's 2025 Pop-up Parlour - thanks for your support.

____________________________________

description:
(Now on Sunday) Planetary Parade - Free event, Due to a heavy cloud forecast on Saturday morning, we have changed the date for this event to the following morning, Sunday 24 August.
A rare cosmic event where six of the seven planets are in dawn sky during this final Planetary Parade for 2025. Matariki is also visible at this time close to the line of planets.
Come down to the Wellington waterfront at dawn and see the planets Pareārau (Saturn), Kōpū/Tāwera (Venus), Hine-i-tīweka (Jupiter), Whiro (Mercury), and Matariki (Pleiades) in our skies. Rangipō (Uranus) and Tangaroa (Neptune) are also in the sky but they will be too faint to see. Matawhero (Mars) follows after Te Rā (the Sun) rises so it won't be seen in the sky.
If you want to gaze in wonder at Saturn, Jupiter, Venus, look through our amazing telescopes! We can show you where to find Matariki, but binoculars at better so if you have a pair bring them along. The event is child friendly and free!
If you want to support our Society by becoming a member, please go to https://www.was.org.nz/join-us/

description:
Yoga Nidra: Nervous System Reset, Yoga Nidra: Nervous System Reset
A deeply soothing experience of rest and regulation — followed by a delicious plant-based dinner.
This guided Yoga Nidra session invites you to slow down and settle the body, mind, and breath. Through gentle awareness practices and calming visualizations, Emma will guide you into a state of deep rest where your nervous system can begin to unwind and reset.
The space will be thoughtfully prepared to support stillness and ease, with soft lighting, grounding scents, and a soundscape designed to evoke a sense of safety. All comforts are provided — mats, blankets, bolsters — though you're welcome to bring anything personal that helps you feel completely relaxed.
Whether you're feeling depleted, overstimulated, or just in need of a pause, this is a chance to come home to your body and recharge from within.
After the session, stay to enjoy a wholesome plant-based dinner and dessert, included in your ticket — a gentle way to nourish, connect, and carry the calm into your evening.
Meet Emma, your host
With a 100-hour trauma-informed Yin Yoga certification and a background in the corporate world, Emma brings both groundedness and empathy to her teaching. Her approach is slow, intentional, and centered on creating a space where your body feels safe to relax and release.

description:
5 And Still Live ! - The Fifth Anniversary of Mouthfull Radio, Five years ago we were in the midst of a global pandemic, visiting digital rooms with friends around the corner, making sourdough, and sort of watching the daily news. We were also making experimental attempts into the world of radio, with the birth of Mouthfull’s first international streaming server, playing music 24/7 (also live events a few times a week).
If we travel even further back in time, 2017 was the debut of the “Mouthfull Radio” episodic series (~20eps) - but we consider the ongoingness the real thing to celebrate.
Moving towards present day ~ through a vast richness of hosts, events, music, shows, zines, selectors, connections, pop ups, and story-times. It is a real joy to help community contemporary radio ripple out from this Pacific Island nation to the world wide web.

5 Years goes so fast, and so we shall honour this time with a great celebration in the capital city of Aotearoa! We will bring together all of the elements of Mouthfull you have known to love; make some books, make up some new dance moves with friends, and make our ears glisten in the sounds of live and selected music.
Whiro // New Moon. The last dark night of winter. A time for reflection; an invitation to come together as friends and whānau and plant intentional seeds for future flowers to bloom, as well as rest in deep listening and shared beingness.

Lineup:
*ºJuniper May
*ºStar Time
*ºajhoneysuckle (tāmaki)
*ºMystery Waitress (duo)
*ºDJ B.Lo (whākatu)
*°Benny Salvador


We are also releasing our first ever compilation. This special event will be opened with a premiere listening session of the full CD, playing the album all the way through. You can purchase a physical copy at the show, or on bandcamp (preorders open September 1st).
5PM sharp CD push play. Some divine collaborators with unique new releases on offer.

This is a fundraiser to support the sustainability of Mouthfull. We are only able to pay the bills due to events like this, and are fundraising to support a long awaited update of our digital infrastructure to enable future support. THANKS FOR YOUR SUPPORT - you can support us by purchasing a ticket (extra donation if you are balling), a tshirt, a raffle ticket, or a zine - it all goes to the same goal of enabling & uplifting one another.

Details of the AGM are as follows:
Date: Sunday 24 August
Time: 4.00pm
Venue: Te-Atiawa park, Clubrooms
In line with our Club’s constitution, this notice is being provided at least three weeks in advance of the meeting. A formal agenda, the Annual Report, and Financial Statements will be available on the day, and will be made available on our website after the AGM.
If you wish to submit any remits or notices of motion, these must be received in writing by the Secretary no later than Sunday 17 August 2025.You can send these to info@kapitisoftball.co.nz

This year, several current committee members have indicated they will not be standing again. While all roles are open to nominations and elected at the AGM, we especially want to highlight the following upcoming vacancies:
• Treasurer
• Club Captain
• Junior Convenor
This is a big change for our club, and we encourage any members who are interested in helping shape the future of our club to consider putting their name forward. If you'd like to learn more about what's involved in any of the roles, feel free to reach out for a chat.
Quorum Reminder: As per our constitution, at least 10 members must be present for the AGM to proceed, so we would greatly appreciate your attendance and support.

Following on from that on 𝐎𝐜𝐭𝐨𝐛𝐞𝐫 𝟒𝐭𝐡 , we will be running our In-store Parade Day.

◆ 𝐓𝐞𝐚𝐦𝐬.
◆ 𝐀𝐫𝐦𝐢𝐞𝐬 𝐨𝐧 𝐓𝐞𝐫𝐫𝐚𝐢𝐧.

https://citadelcolour.com/armies-on-parade/

https://citadelcolour.com/armies-on-parade-frequently.../

https://citadelcolour.com/armies-on-parade-terms-and-conditions/

How Big Should My Entry Be?
This is Armies on Parade, so go big!

Armies on Parade is your opportunity to show off what inspires you in the Warhammer hobby. Your project could be anything from a K*ll Team squad or a Warcry warband to a massive galaxy-conquering battleforce or a realm-shaking army.

For Warhammer Age of Sigmar, Warhammer 40,000, Legions Imperialis, Middle-earth™ Strategy Battle Game, Warhammer: The Old World, and Warhammer: The Horus Heresy, the minimum number of units per entry is two complete units. This can be any combination of unit types, including, but not limited to, a character model and a squad, two tanks, a tank and squad, and more.

For skirmish-style games including Necromunda, K*ll Team, Warcry, Warhammer Underworlds, and Blood Bowl, the minimum entry is one complete warband, K*ll team, gang, Blood Bowl team, or other equivalent.

description:
Astronomy on Tap, Astronomy on Tap
Experience the wonders of the Universe as you embark on an extraordinary journey into the vast depths of space and beyond.

This September at Astronomy on Tap, we’re diving into one of the biggest questions in science: Are we alone? Our theme is The Search for Life and Water. Wherever we find water on Earth, we find life. Could the same be true beyond our planet?

From icy moons in our Solar System to distant exoplanets, scientists are searching for the conditions that could support life. Join us as we explore the potential for discovering life in the universe and the technology helping us get closer to the answer.
Upon arrival, receive a drink and your first-class inflight snacks. Then sit back and relax in our digital full-dome planetarium as we explore the night sky. Complete your trip through the galaxy with the cash bar and a look through interactive exhibitions.

Whether you’re accompanied by a special someone, a friend, or embarking on a solo adventure, raise your glass to the stars and enjoy the stellar ride.

$45pp | 8PM – 10PM | R18 | Space Place

description:
Bar Crossing Seminar - Manawatū (Foxton bar), Crossing A Bar? We Can Help
Bar crossings can be one of the trickiest, and riskiest parts of boating in Aotearoa. They change fast, they don’t always play nice, and they’ve caught out even the most experienced skippers. Each year, we see serious incidents and tragedies happening on our bars, so it’s super important to know your stuff before you head out.
That’s where we come in. Join us at Manawatu Marine Boating Club for a free and relaxed seminar. You’ll hear straight from local Coastguard skippers and boating legends who’ll share their real-world tips, local knowledge, and a few stories from the water.

Here’s what we’ll cover (and chat about):

Understanding the local features of your bar
Reading and interpreting the conditions when planning a trip
Getting your boat and your crew bar crossing ready
How to handle your boat while crossing
How to do a bar crossing report (and why it’s worth it)
What to do if things go pear-shaped
It’s interactive – so bring your questions, share your own experiences, and have a yarn with others in the boating community.
Bring your mates too – whether they’re brand new to boating or have been around since the days of paper charts and handheld compasses, there’s something in here that could save a trip… or a life.
 Why it matters:
In 2024, 23% of craft-related drownings happened during bar crossings.
5 lives were lost due to capsizing while crossing a bar.
Older blokes are still the most at-risk – but everyone can make safer choices with the right knowledge (and a lifejacket on).

description:
Beer & Spirits Halloween Crawl – Wellington 2025, Beer & Spirits Halloween Crawl – Wellington 2025
Raise your glass to Halloween in Wellington! The Beer & Spirits Crawl brings cocktails, craft beer, costumes, and DJs on November 1st.

About this Event

🍺🥃 BEER & SPIRITS: HALLOWEEN BOOZE CRAWL 2025 – Wellington 🥃🍺 Halloween Saturday in Wellington is about to get boozier. The Beer & Spirits: Halloween Booze Crawl is your pass to explore the city’s best pubs, breweries, and nightlife spots in one epic night of costumes, cocktails, and craft beer.
On Saturday, November 1st, 2025, hundreds of party-ready crawlers will gather to toast the spookiest night of the year. From seasonal ales and spiced lagers to spooky-themed shots and signature cocktails, every stop on the crawl will be serving something worth raising a glass to.



EVENT HIGHLIGHTS
🥃 Beer + Spirits Combo: Enjoy the best of both worlds with craft beer options and premium cocktails at every venue.
🎶 Live Music & DJs: Halloween hits, party anthems, and dance-worthy beats all night long.
📍 Venues: Lulu Bar & Restaurant, El Horno, The Rogue & Vagabond, and BL3 — hand-picked Wellington bars and breweries offering exclusive specials for crawl guests.
🎟 Your Ticket Includes: Wristband for entry, drink specials at each stop, and access to the official crawl map.

HOW TO JOIN THE FUN
1️⃣ Check-In: Pick up your wristband at the starting venue between 7:30–10:30 PM.
2️⃣ Crawl at Your Own Pace: Visit participating middle-stop venues between 8:30–11:30 PM.
3️⃣ Last Call for Halloween: Everyone meets at the final venue at 11:30 PM for the Saturday night send-off party.



PARTICIPATING VENUES The lineup will be released soon — each location is chosen for great drinks, great atmosphere, and great music.
📍 On event day, click the to view the full venue list, drink specials, and schedule.

🎭 Costume Friendly: Whether you’re dressed as a beer-loving ghoul, a whiskey-wielding pirate, or a spooky pop culture icon, you’ll fit right in.

🚨 Saturday-Only Tickets: This is a one-night-only Halloween party. Early bird tickets start at just $15 — secure your spot before they’re gone.

What’s Included in Your Ticket:
🍺 Entry to 4+ pubs, breweries, and clubs in Wellington
🚫 No cover at all participating venues
🎟️ Exclusive Halloween Booze Crawl wristband
📱 Digital crawl map to navigate each stop
🎵 Live DJs & music at every venue
🕺 Closing party to end Halloween Saturday in style



18+ EVENT / GOVERNMENT ISSUED ID REQUIRED


TIPS FOR OUR CRAWL
Pick Up Wristbands On Time: Collect your wristband(s) during the designated check-in time at the scheduled location before 10:30 PM. Late arrivals will not be accommodated — no wristband, no entry.
Assign a Proxy if Needed: Can’t make check-in? Have a friend pick up your wristband for you so they don’t miss out.
Day-Of Updates: Review the Digital Crawl Map on the morning of the event for any last-minute changes or venue updates.
Check Venue Schedule: Each venue’s crawl time is listed in the Digital Crawl Map. Wristbands and drink specials are valid only during these scheduled times.
_______________________________________


IMPORTANT DISCLAIMERS
Age Requirement: You must be 18+ years of age with a valid government-issued ID to participate in this event. No exceptions.
Wristbands: Your wristband is your key to entry. You must present your ticket or QR code at check-in to receive your wristband. Wristbands must be worn at all times to access participating bars and venues. Wristband pickup location and time are listed on the crawl map. If you do not pick up your wristband at the designated location and time, it may not be available, and you will not be able to access crawl venues. No wristband, no entry.
Ticket Policy: All sales are final—no refunds, exchanges, or transfers. In case of event cancellation without a rescheduled date, a refund (excluding fees) will be automatically issued. Event lineup, venues, and specials are subject to change without notice.
Admission & Venue Rights: Participating venues reserve the right to refuse service or entry to any attendee based on intoxication, dress code, inappropriate behaviour, or venue capacity. If refused entry at one venue, you may visit alternative crawl venues available at that time. No refunds will be given if you are denied entry for any of these reasons.
Capacity and Late Entry: Some venues may hit capacity during the event. If a venue reaches capacity or you arrive late, you may have to wait in line to gain entry. There is no guarantee of immediate access or entry to any specific venue once capacity is reached, and no refunds will be provided due to waiting times or access issues.
Self-Guided Crawl: This is a self-guided event with no host leading the group. You must use the digital crawl map to navigate between venues.
Venue Awareness: If bar staff are unaware of the crawl, you must contact the venue representative listed on the crawl map. If you cannot reach them, consider that venue unavailable and proceed to an alternative crawl venue open at that time. Nightlife venues may reach capacity or close early, and not all staff members may be aware of the crawl.
Drink Specials: Drink specials are offered by participating venues and may be modified or discontinued at any time without notice.
Event Time Restrictions: Your ticket is valid only for crawl venues during the scheduled crawl times listed on the crawl map. It is not valid for entry outside these times. If you arrive late or at the wrong venue, refunds will not be issued.
Security Checks: Wristbands do not entitle you to skip venue security checks. All attendees must comply with security screening before entry.
Costume Policy: Do not wear costumes that include items which could be considered or used as weapons. Highly offensive costumes are not tolerated and may result in denial of entry without refund.
Crawl Notifications: Sign up for crawl notification texts to receive updates about when to move to the next venue. There is no host to notify you in person.
Respect & Conduct: Treat others and the event venues with respect. Disorderly conduct, inappropriate behaviour, or damage to the venues will result in removal from the event without a refund. The participating bars reserve the right to refuse entry or remove attendees for inappropriate behaviour at any time.
Liability Waiver: By purchasing a ticket and participating in the crawl, you understand and agree that you are attending entirely at your own risk. You voluntarily assume all risks and dangers incidental to this event, including but not limited to: personal injury, illness, disability, property loss, theft, damage, accidents, death, alcohol-related incidents, and actions of other participants, staff, or third parties. You, on behalf of yourself and your heirs, executors, and assigns, hereby fully release, waive, and discharge Events Per Se, its owners, officers, directors, employees, contractors, volunteers, affiliates, sponsors, participating venues, and their respective representatives from any and all liability, claims, demands, actions, or causes of action whatsoever arising out of or related to any loss, damage, injury, illness, or death — whether caused by negligence, gross negligence, breach of contract, or otherwise — that may occur before, during, or after the event. You agree to indemnify and hold harmless Events Per Se and all released parties from any claims, costs, or expenses (including legal fees) brought by you or on your behalf, or by any third party as a result of your actions during the event. You acknowledge that you have read and understood this waiver, that you are participating voluntarily, and that this waiver is intended to be as broad and inclusive as permitted by applicable law.
Event Changes: Bars and venues may change, but the event will continue rain or shine. Always check the digital crawl map for the latest venue list and updates. Be sure to check your email for any last-minute updates.
*By purchasing a ticket, you confirm that you have read, understood, and agreed to all disclaimers, terms, and conditions stated above, and accept full responsibility for your participation in the event.

description:
Book Club: Emiko by Chieri Uegaki, Join us in person to discuss Emiko, a contemporary version of Jane Austen's Emma set in Canada.
(Order your copy through us by 20 March 2026 for delivery at the 23 May meeting or couriered in NZ)
About Emiko:
A busybody foodie avoids questions of her own future as she meddles in the love lives of those around her. Has this matcha-maker met her match?

Self-declared matchmaking GENIUS (a la Beyonce) Emiko Kimori has already found success by helping her aunt find true love, so when the new girl in town becomes her new BFF, it's only natural for Emiko to help set her up for social success with a suitable love match.

Emiko lives with her Ojiichan in a small town on BC's West Coast surrounded by friends and neighbors, including her childhood friend Kenzo Sanada, who wishes she'd spend less time playing matchmaker. But Emiko can so clearly see who belongs together, even when her targets don't know it themselves. She simply has to meddle - for the sake of true love!

As for her own romantic life though . . . who has time for that? Emiko is far too busy with her matchmaking schemes, her brunch recipes, volunteering, her bustling social life, keeping up her grades, eating said brunch recipes and making plans for after graduation. Plans she will absolutely decide on soon. Definitely. Maybe? But when Emiko ends up falling for the last person she expects, she finds herself caught in the tangled web of her own love matches. For the first time, instead of arranging from afar, Emiko has to figure out what it means to be in love herself, and that friendship and romance are more complicated than she ever imagined . . .
About the Author:
Chieri Uegaki is a second generation Japanese-Canadian and award-winning children’s author living and writing on Vancouver Island, in the traditional and unceded territory of the lək̓ʷəŋən speaking peoples, today known as the Esquimalt and Songhees Nations.
She graduated with a Bachelor of Fine Arts from the University of British Columbia’s Creative Writing Department and has written a number of stories for children, including the picture books Suki’s Kimono and Rosie and Buttercup (both illustrated by Stéphane Jorisch); Hana Hashimoto, Sixth Violin (illustrated by Qin Leng); and Ojiichan’s Gift (illustrated by Genevieve Simms).
When not reading or writing, Chieri consumes rom-coms and mysteries in any form, chooses appetizers over dessert most of the time, and tries to stay on top of her collecting problem. She is currently working on a number of projects.
Rachel Pilois (Book Buyer) on this selection:
There have been many retellings of Austen’s novels in the last 200 years. Pride and Prejudice easily wins the prize of Austen’s most adapted novel in both film and literature. In the last 20 years there’s been a noticeable growth in culturally (and gender) diverse takes on Austen’s work, with the most popular retellings being of Indian (i.e Bride and Prejudice) or African-American (i.e. Ibi Zoboi’s Pride) heritage. Sadly, some of her less popular novels (Mansfield Park and Northanger Abbey) have few adaptations in both film and literature, faithful or modern retelling.
With the 2026 theme of the JASNZ being diversity it made sense to choose a slightly less popular novel (only in terms of how many adaptations) and a slightly less common culture used in Austen retellings. Thus I settled on the upcoming YA novel Emiko by Chieri Uegaki, a Japanese-Canadian retelling of Emma.
Emma is a much beloved story and a much beloved character, who’s thoughts, actions and motivations are very recognisable in a modern teenager. Adding in the deep cultural etiquette of Japan as a likeness to the rules of regency society, makes Uegaki’s Emiko a brilliant and well thought out modern retelling of the Emma.
As it publishes on 9 September 2025, we can discover and discuss this new and exciting adaptation for the first time together! 
NB: Ticket numbers are limited to ensure ease of discussion. Afternoon tea is provided
FRIEND: bring a friend, get 10% off! Discount automatically applied

description:
Book Group: Heart of A Dog By Mikhail Bulgakov, Wellington Classic Literature Group meets on the first Tuesday of the month. We read novels that have stood the test of time, whether they were written in 1780, 1880 or even 1980. It's a public group so feel free to come along when it suits.

Our September book is Heart of a Dog (or A Dog's Heart), a 1925 novel by Mikhail Bulgakov, described as a biting satire of Bolshevism. The book wasn't officially published in the Soviet Union until 1987.

Our group very much enjoyed Bulgakov's masterpiece The Master and Margarita back in 2018, so looking forward to reading another of his works...

VENUE

description:
Boos & Brews + Feeding Frenzy Weekend Pass – Wellington 2025, Boos & Brews + Feeding Frenzy Weekend Pass – Wellington 2025
Friday raises a pint. Saturday unleashes the horde. Two nights, one wristband, all of Wellington's Halloween energy.

About this Event


👻🍺 Boos & Brews + Feeding Frenzy 🧛🧟‍♀️Weekend Pass – Wellington 2025

Two nights. One pass. Non-stop Halloween madness.
Friday kicks off with Boos & Brews — pints, cocktails, and costumed pub crawlers packing the city’s best bars. Saturday unleashes Feeding Frenzy — a zombie-fueled bar crawl where DJs, shots, and wild costumes keep the night alive until 2 AM.




WHAT’S INCLUDED
🎟️ One wristband for both crawls (Friday + Saturday)
🚫 No cover charges at any venue
🍹 Exclusive Halloween drink specials
🎶 DJs + entertainment at every stop
📱 Friday + Saturday digital crawl maps 🕺 Two huge closing parties




PARTICIPATING VENUES
Lineup announced soon. Each stop brings themed drinks, DJs, and a full Halloween vibe.


👻🍺🧟‍♂️🧛 Double your Halloween fun. One ticket gets you two back-to-back crawls, two closing parties, and hundreds of costumed partygoers.
🚨 Early bird weekend passes start at $25 — grab yours before they’re gone.




HALLOWEEN CRAWL TERMS & CONDITIONS
ENTRY REQUIREMENTS
This is a 18+ event only. Government-issued photo ID is mandatory at the door. No ID, no participation.
WRISTBAND POLICY
Your wristband = your access. It must be collected at the official check-in location during posted hours (before 10:30 PM).
If you miss check-in, your wristband will not be available and you will not be permitted into crawl venues. No refunds.
If you can’t make it, you may designate a friend to pick up your wristband on your behalf.
VENUE PARTICIPATION & RULES
Crawl schedules, bar times, and specials are listed on the Digital Bar List.
Your ticket is only valid during the scheduled crawl hours — not outside of them.
Digital Crawl Map: Always check it the morning of the event for final venue confirmations and any last-minute adjustments.
Venues may close early, reach capacity, or have staff unaware of the crawl — if so, simply continue to another participating location listed on the map.
All venues reserve the right to deny entry based on intoxication, dress code, behavior, or safety concerns. Standard security checks still apply.
TICKETS & SALES
All sales are final. Tickets are non-transferable and non-refundable.
If an event is fully canceled without a replacement date, a refund (minus processing fees) will be issued.
Events run rain or shine, and lineup, specials, or bar participation may change without notice.
COSTUMES & CONDUCT
Costumes are encouraged, but anything resembling a weapon or considered offensive may result in denied entry with no refund.
Disorderly conduct, harassment, or damage to property will result in removal without compensation.
LIABILITY RELEASE
By purchasing a ticket and joining the crawl, you confirm that you are participating at your own risk. You accept full responsibility for any injuries, illnesses, property loss, theft, accidents, alcohol-related incidents, or death that may occur before, during, or after the event.
You hereby waive, release, and discharge Events Per Se, its owners, staff, contractors, sponsors, volunteers, affiliates, and all participating venues from any and all liability — whether due to negligence, gross negligence, breach of duty, or otherwise.
You further agree to indemnify and hold harmless all released parties from any claims, damages, or legal fees arising from your actions or participation.
By attending, you acknowledge that you have read, understood, and accepted this waiver. It is intended to be as broad and enforceable as permitted by law.

description:
Book Group: Uncle Tom's Cabin by Harriet Beecher Stowe, Do you keep meaning to read more of the great classics of literature? At Wellington Classic Literature Group we read novels that have stood the test of time, whether they were written in 1780, 1880 or even 1980. The group has been running for more than a decade and we have a great bunch of regulars as well as readers that come along for particular books or simply when it suits. We meet on the first Tuesday of the month.

Our October book is Harriet Beecher Stowe's 1852 abolitionist novel Uncle Tom's Cabin; or, Life Among the Lowly. The work changed American hearts and minds about slavery.

The influence of Uncle Tom's Cabin was so immense that the story arose that when Abraham Lincoln welcomed Stowe to the White House during the American Civil War he reportedly declared, "So this is the little lady who started this great war."

In the US, it was the best-selling novel of the 19th century and the second best-selling book of all after the Bible.

Project Gutenberg link for those e-reading:
https://www.gutenberg.org/ebooks/203

VENUE
We meet in the ‘Games Room’, The Library bar's private area overlooking Courtenay Place. After you enter the bar, head to your right (up the step) and through a smaller space with booths to the large carpeted space beyond.
