description:
Crochet - Christmas Special!, In this half day crochet special, you will get the patterns to make stars, and icicles, mini wreaths, a mini Christmas jumper, Christmas tree and gifts bunting and a cute mini Christmas hat. Please bring some 4 or 8 ply smooth yarn and a crochet hook - see full description for suitable types of yarn.

Description

Join Monique in this half-day crochet workshop where you will learn how to crochet a range of little projects suitable for the holiday season. Choose from stars, icicles, mini wreaths and Christmas jumpers, Christmas trees and a mini Santa hat! There will be a booklet of patterns for you to take home, to enable you to complete in your own time the projects that you didn’t have time to make during the workshop.

You will also learn how to crochet and decorate Christmas baubles! While you might not finish all the patterns this day, the aim is to have a go at making as many as possible!

You will need to know some basic crochet stitches such as single and double crochet. You’ll also need to have some understanding of how to read a pattern and work with diagrams, as taught in the beginners’ crochet course.

Please bring yarn that you enjoy working with (cotton, acrylic or wool, 4ply or 8 ply) in a variety of colours (red, white and green, a neutral colour for the mouse, and glittery yarns are all good options for the Christmas projects) and a matching crochet hook. You’ll also need a pair of scissors and a darning needle.

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
F*ck the Small Talk: Wellington #6, F*ck the Small Talk: Wellington #6
🎟️ Sign up here: https://lu.ma/ftstwellington6 🎟️

F*ck the Small Talk has traveled the world from Berlin, Melbourne, London, Lisbon, and Mexico City, to Lisbon and is now coming to Wellington! 🇳🇿


📦 WHAT'S THIS ABOUT?

FTST is a one-of-a-kind social experience where strangers come together for an afternoon of meaningful, fun, and deep conversation. It’s also just a different & cool way of meeting new people by getting a bit out of your comfort zone and skipping the small talk!

Join us for games, talks, and connections with friends you haven’t met yet. Join if you get annoyed after being asked what you do, where you are from, and how long you have been in Wellington every single time you meet someone. If you feel that there are better questions in life then this is the place for you. 🙌


🎈 HOW DOES IT WORK?

We start with a short & sweet intro talk followed by a few light-hearted group games to warm up. Don't worry, nothing too awkward! After that, we split you up into small groups and start with the conversation rounds (with 3-4 people). We'll have awesome question cards that will guide the flow of the conversation. You’ll never have to speak in public if you don’t want to!


🕹 HOW TO JOIN?

Take 2 minutes to fill out our form 👇🏼
https://lu.ma/ftstwellington6

Our events are limited to 30 handpicked guests to ensure a cozy atmosphere. We prioritize a balance in gender and cultural diversity, making each gathering a unique blend of perspectives! If you're invited you'll receive an invite with a special link via our ticketing platform Luma :)


🧧 HOW MUCH IS IT?

The cost to attend is NZD 23 (early llama) - NZD 25 (general llama) and includes the following:

⏰ 3 hours of facilitated and curated activities
🥪 Light snacks to keep the energy going (only if outdoors)
👥 A space to meet new people in the least boring way possible
💛 Supporting our mission to slowly eliminate small talk around the world
🎫 Also includes those pesky ticket fees!


🌳 WHERE IS IT?

We host our events in awesome cafes, rooftops, and bars across the city. We only reveal the location to ticket holders 24 hours before the event.


💛 WHAT THEY SAY

🗣 “Great way to connect with people in a more meaningful way. Get to the heart of the matter, dive straight into what really counts!” - Matthias


🗣 “This is the kind of activity humanity needs every weekend. Thank you for all.” - Sonya


🗣 “F*ck the Small Talk changes the narrative from "Where are you from?" to "When was the last time you laughed uncontrollably?" and I think that's beautiful.” - Monika


🗣 “I loved F*ck the small talk, I was a little bit nervous at first but they are pros at making you feel comfortable with the rest of the group, the activities are really fun and I enjoyed every second (consider that the one who's saying this is very, very shy). Give it a try!” - Brenda


🗣 "it’s a wonderful experience, it’s like being a kid again, when you were at the park, playing with other kids, and just decided you were going to be best friends for the next hours. Maybe you’ll never see those kids again. But that hour was amazing because you both opened up and trusted each other." - Sara


🗣 “Lively, interesting, introspective, completely open and no judgement. Everyone that joined was ready for great conversation and helped with different perspectives. So much fun! I can't wait for the next one! “ - Yaz


Check out our 100+ Google reviews: https://goo.gl/maps/TpZy77bfPFkGoikn7 🫶


🤓 FAQ

• Can I come alone?
Of course, in fact, we encourage it! 99% of people do.


• I signed up but never got an invite. Why?
We usually get a high volume of sign-ups yet we like to keep it cozy & only about 30 people. We believe this is a good number to ensure an awesome experience! Please try again next time if do not receive an invite - no hard feelings 💛


• Why do you charge?
We value our time and put a lot of love, planning, and effort into creating & designing these experiences. ♥️ This is our project/business and what we give to the world and we think everything should be a fair exchange! However, money should never be the reason for people not to attend. If you can’t afford it simply get in touch with us :)


• I'm digging this! Can I get involved somehow?
Sure thing, send us a message!


• Can I bring my cute dog/llama?
It depends on where the event is! Message us to make sure. But it's always a YES in our hearts.


• Can I get a refund if I can't make it?
Unfortunately, we do not offer refunds or ticket transfers to another event date if you cannot attend with a notice of less than 5 days notice. BUTTTT feel free to pass on your ticket to a friend, provided they also sign up for the form :)

--


𝘾𝙤𝙢𝙚 𝙘𝙪𝙧𝙞𝙤𝙪𝙨, 𝙡𝙚𝙖𝙫𝙚 𝙘𝙤𝙣𝙣𝙚𝙘𝙩𝙚𝙙. ✨

* Only 30 spots available
* Location is only revealed to ticket holders!
* Age guide, 22-40 years old (only a reference, never a limit 💃)


🙅‍♀️📱This event is a no-phone experience. Keep them tucked in your pocket 🙅‍♀️📱


We started in Berlin back in 2019 out our frustration of being asked 'where are you from?' 40 times in one week. Now there are chapters in 11 cities around the world including Mexico City, Zurich, Lisbon, London, Berlin and Vancouver. 🌍


--

Stay in touch 👇

Website: https://www.epicllama.com/fuckthesmalltalk
Instagram: www.instagram.com/epic.llama/
Join the club (newsletter): epicllama.myflodesk.com/wellington
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Family Shiny - Akatarawa Forestt, Registrations open NOW
What to expect
This is a “Family Shiny” trip into the Akatarawa Forest.
Non members are welcome to join us but must register to obtain details of start time and location.
Vehicles must have a low ratio gearbox and must not be a 4wd car, station wagon or van, and if a soft top must have a roll cage.
Visitor Registration- $20.00 per driver
There is no trip fee for this trip however non-members pay a “Day Membership Fee” of $20. This is payable in Cash to the Trip Leader on the day.
The trip should be relatively easy as it needs to cater for people just starting out and all types of 4wd vehicles – but a good way to see if you want to get into 4wding and a chance to meet some of our club members (if you are unsure if your vehicle is suitable just ask).
No Dogs Allowed sorry
Once you have completed 3 Family Shinys you can join the club but can only participate in Family Shiny or Touring Class trips. Once you have also done a Training Day and had your vehicle inspected by one of our approved inspectors you can come along on our other more adventurous trips. To find out more on how to join our club go to https://ccvcwellington.wildapricot.org/page-1725861.
Like our Facebook page to find out about more trips and club nights.
label: Hobbies & Interests

“I loved F*ck the small talk, I was a little bit nervous at first but they are pros at making you feel comfortable with the rest of the group, the activities are really fun and I enjoyed every second (consider that the one who's saying this is very, very shy). Give it a try!” - Brenda

"it’s a wonderful experience, it’s like being a kid again, when you were at the park, playing with other kids, and just decided you were going to be best friends for the next hours. Maybe you’ll never see those kids again. But that hour was amazing because you both opened up and trusted each other." - Sara

“Lively, interesting, introspective, completely open and no judgement. Everyone that joined was ready for great conversation and helped with different perspectives. So much fun! I can't wait for the next one! “ - Yaz

Check out our 100+ Google reviews: https://goo.gl/maps/TpZy77bfPFkGoikn7

FAQ
• Can I come alone?
Of course, in fact, we encourage it! 99% of people do.

• I signed up but never got an invite. Why?
We usually get a high volume of sign-ups yet we like to keep it cozy & only about 30 people. We believe this is a good number to ensure an awesome experience! Please try again next time if do not receive an invite - no hard feelings

• Why do you charge?
We value our time and put a lot of love, planning, and effort into creating & designing these experiences.
This is our project/business and what we give to the world and we think everything should be a fair exchange! However, money should never be the reason for people not to attend. If you can’t afford it simply get in touch with us

• I'm digging this! Can I get involved somehow?
Sure thing, send us a message!

• Can I bring my cute dog/llama?
It depends on where the event is! Message us to make sure. But it's always a YES in our hearts.

• Can I get a refund if I can't make it?
Unfortunately, we do not offer refunds or ticket transfers to another event date if you cannot attend with a notice of less than 5 days notice. BUTTTT feel free to pass on your ticket to a friend, provided they also sign up for the form
--

𝘾𝙤𝙢𝙚 𝙘𝙪𝙧𝙞𝙤𝙪𝙨, 𝙡𝙚𝙖𝙫𝙚 𝙘𝙤𝙣𝙣𝙚𝙘𝙩𝙚𝙙.
* Only 30 spots available
* Location is only revealed to ticket holders!
* Age guide, 22-40 years old (only a reference, never a limit
)

This event is a no-phone experience. Keep them tucked in your pocket

We started in Berlin back in 2019 out our frustration of being asked 'where are you from?' 40 times in one week. Now there are chapters in 11 cities around the world including Mexico City, Zurich, Lisbon, London, Berlin and Vancouver.

--
Stay in touch

description:
FULLY BOOKED - Family Shiny - Akatarawa Forestt, Registrations open NOW
What to expect
This is a “Family Shiny” trip into the Akatarawa Forest.
Non members are welcome to join us but must register to obtain details of start time and location.
Vehicles must have a low ratio gearbox and must not be a 4wd car, station wagon or van, and if a soft top must have a roll cage.
Visitor Registration- $20.00 per driver
There is no trip fee for this trip however non-members pay a “Day Membership Fee” of $20. This is payable in Cash to the Trip Leader on the day.
The trip should be relatively easy as it needs to cater for people just starting out and all types of 4wd vehicles – but a good way to see if you want to get into 4wding and a chance to meet some of our club members (if you are unsure if your vehicle is suitable just ask).
No Dogs Allowed sorry
Once you have completed 3 Family Shinys you can join the club but can only participate in Family Shiny or Touring Class trips. Once you have also done a Training Day and had your vehicle inspected by one of our approved inspectors you can come along on our other more adventurous trips. To find out more on how to join our club go to https://ccvcwellington.wildapricot.org/page-1725861.
Like our Facebook page to find out about more trips and club nights.

description:
Wahine In Jazz X The Listening Collective Collaborative Jam, Rooted in the values of connection, care, creativity and community, Wāhine in Jazz (AKL) and The Listening Collective (WLG) are two kaupapa-driven initiatives, aimed to uplift women and gender diversity in improvised musical spaces across Aotearoa. They invite you to join, improvise and collaborate this Wellington Jazz Festival.
The jam will weave influences from Wellington-based saxophonist, composer and educator, Dave Wilson’s model for improvisation; Finding Common Ground - fostering environments for musicians of all abilities to come together and improvise. Let this session invite you to a space where improvisation becomes a language of belonging.
Wāhine in Jazz is a Tāmaki Makaurau based organisation that advocates for and promotes the development of female and gender diverse jazz musicians in Aotearoa.
The Listening Collective is a Te-Whanganui-a-Tara based group of female and gender diverse musicians that aim to create spaces that uplift and empower individuals in the presentation of their creative work
Check out WIJ x TLC New Standards Collaboration:
https://events.humanitix.com/wahine-in-jazz-x-the-listening-collective-present-new-standards

description:
Paint Time with Rapunzel, Paint Time with Rapunzel
Join Rapunzel for a magical painting session where young artists will create their own flower-filled canvas masterpiece!

About this Event

Paint Time with Rapunzel
Let your creativity blossom in this enchanting art workshop for kids aged 5 and up! 🎨🌸🌼 Join Rapunzel for a magical painting session where young artists will create their own flower-filled canvas masterpiece inspired by her colourful tower garden.
While your artwork dries, enjoy whimsical games with magical prizes and take some fairytale-worthy photos with the princess herself!
Includes:
🌼 Guided painting on canvas
🌷 Fun games and activities while paint dries
👑 Meet & greet photos with Rapunzel
🎨 Take-home flower artwork

Perfect for young artists, fairy tale lovers and anyone who dreams in pastel! 🌸🖌️✨

Please note that we are not registered childcare providers, which means an adult responsible for each child must remain on the premises. The venue is also a café restaurant with other areas where parents can chill while the workshop is running.

description:
Fright Night + Screams & Shots Weekend Pass – Wellington 2025, Fright Night + Screams & Shots Weekend Pass – Wellington 2025
Double the nights, double the chaos. Dance, crawl & party across Wellington Halloween weekend. DJs, shots & finales ‘til 2AM!

About this Event


Fright Night + Screams & Shots Weekend Pass – Wellington 2025 👻🎧
Halloween weekend is built for the bold — and this pass is your all-access ticket.
The Fright Night + Screams & Shots Weekend Pass gets you into both nights of the city’s most electrifying Halloween parties. Friday kicks off with Fright Night, a citywide takeover where DJs, costumes, and neon lights set the stage. Saturday keeps the momentum alive with Screams & Shots, a high-voltage crawl of bars and clubs serving Halloween-themed shooters and nonstop beats.
This isn’t just a bar crawl — it’s a two-night music-fueled Halloween marathon. Think of it as your festival pass to the city’s nightlife: two different lineups, two massive finales, one unforgettable weekend.




WHY GRAB THE WEEKEND PASS?
⚡ Two Nights, One Wristband – Access to both Friday & Saturday events.
🎶 Festival-Level Energy – Back-to-back parties with DJs mixing EDM, hip hop, and Halloween remixes.
🍹 Exclusive Drink Deals – Spooky cocktails, shot specials, and themed drinks both nights.
🎭 Costumes Required – From glow-in-the-dark ghouls to full-on festival fits, the dance floor is your stage.
📍 Multiple Venues – 4+ stops each night, all within walking distance, ending in a huge late-night finale.


HALLOWEEN CRAWL INSTRUCTIONS
Check-In: Get your weekend wristband at the starting venue (7:30–10:30 PM each night).
Crawl the Clubs: Move between participating venues at your own pace from 8:30–11:30 PM.
Finale Blowout: Meet the full crowd at the closing party from 11:30 PM–2 AM.


YOUR WEEKEND PASS INCLUDES
🎟️ Entry to both crawls (Friday + Saturday)
🚫 No cover charges at any participating venue
📱 Access to the official crawl maps for both nights
🎶 DJs & live entertainment at every stop
🍸 Drink + shot specials exclusive to crawl attendees
🕺 Two grand finale parties — one each night




PARTICIPATING VENUES
The full lineup of bars and clubs will be released closer to the event. Expect high-energy DJs, themed rooms, and Halloween drink specials at every stop.

👻 Whether you’re chasing bass drops, showing off your costume on packed dance floors, or rallying your crew for back-to-back nights out, the Weekend Pass is your way to experience Halloween without limits.
🚨 Early bird passes start at just $25. Grab yours now before they sell out.



18 + EVENT / GOVERNMENT ISSUED ID REQUIRED


TIPS FOR OUR CRAWL
Pick Up Wristbands On Time: Collect your wristband(s) during the designated check-in time at the scheduled location before 10:30 PM. Late arrivals will not be accommodated — no wristband, no entry.
Assign a Proxy if Needed: Can’t make check-in? Have a friend pick up your wristband for you so you don’t miss out.
Check Venue Schedule: Each venue’s crawl time is listed in the Digital Bar List. Wristbands and drink specials are valid only during these scheduled times.
Day-Of Updates: Review the Digital Crawl Map on the morning of the event for any last-minute changes or venue updates.
_______________________________________


IMPORTANT DISCLAIMERS
Age Requirement: You must be 18+ years of age with a valid government-issued ID to participate in this event. No exceptions.
Wristbands: Your wristband is your key to entry. You must present your ticket or QR code at check-in to receive your wristband. Wristbands must be worn at all times to access participating bars and venues. Wristband pickup location and time are listed on the crawl map. If you do not pick up your wristband at the designated location and time, it may not be available, and you will not be able to access crawl venues. No wristband, no entry.
Ticket Policy: All sales are final—no refunds, exchanges, or transfers. In case of event cancellation without a rescheduled date, a refund (excluding fees) will be automatically issued. Event lineup, venues, and specials are subject to change without notice.
Admission & Venue Rights: Participating venues reserve the right to refuse service or entry to any attendee based on intoxication, dress code, inappropriate behaviour, or venue capacity. If refused entry at one venue, you may visit alternative crawl venues available at that time. No refunds will be given if you are denied entry for any of these reasons.
Capacity and Late Entry: Some venues may hit capacity during the event. If a venue reaches capacity or you arrive late, you may have to wait in line to gain entry. There is no guarantee of immediate access or entry to any specific venue once capacity is reached, and no refunds will be provided due to waiting times or access issues.
Self-Guided Crawl: This is a self-guided event with no host leading the group. You must use the digital crawl map to navigate between venues.
Venue Awareness: If bar staff are unaware of the crawl, you must contact the venue representative listed on the crawl map. If you cannot reach them, consider that venue unavailable and proceed to an alternative crawl venue open at that time. Nightlife venues may reach capacity or close early, and not all staff members may be aware of the crawl.
Drink Specials: Drink specials are offered by participating venues and may be modified or discontinued at any time without notice.
Event Time Restrictions: Your ticket is valid only for crawl venues during the scheduled crawl times listed on the crawl map. It is not valid for entry outside these times. If you arrive late or at the wrong venue, refunds will not be issued.
Security Checks: Wristbands do not entitle you to skip venue security checks. All attendees must comply with security screening before entry.
Costume Policy: Do not wear costumes that include items which could be considered or used as weapons. Highly offensive costumes are not tolerated and may result in denial of entry without refund.
Crawl Notifications: Sign up for crawl notification texts to receive updates about when to move to the next venue. There is no host to notify you in person.
Respect & Conduct: Treat others and the event venues with respect. Disorderly conduct, inappropriate behaviour, or damage to the venues will result in removal from the event without a refund. The participating bars reserve the right to refuse entry or remove attendees for inappropriate behaviour at any time.
Liability Waiver: By purchasing a ticket and participating in the crawl, you understand and agree that you are attending entirely at your own risk. You voluntarily assume all risks and dangers incidental to this event, including but not limited to: personal injury, illness, disability, property loss, theft, damage, accidents, death, alcohol-related incidents, and actions of other participants, staff, or third parties. You, on behalf of yourself and your heirs, executors, and assigns, hereby fully release, waive, and discharge Events Per Se, its owners, officers, directors, employees, contractors, volunteers, affiliates, sponsors, participating venues, and their respective representatives from any and all liability, claims, demands, actions, or causes of action whatsoever arising out of or related to any loss, damage, injury, illness, or death — whether caused by negligence, gross negligence, breach of contract, or otherwise — that may occur before, during, or after the event. You agree to indemnify and hold harmless Events Per Se and all released parties from any claims, costs, or expenses (including legal fees) brought by you or on your behalf, or by any third party as a result of your actions during the event. You acknowledge that you have read and understood this waiver, that you are participating voluntarily, and that this waiver is intended to be as broad and inclusive as permitted by applicable law.
Event Changes: Bars and venues may change, but the event will continue rain or shine. Always check the digital crawl map for the latest venue list and updates. Be sure to check your email for any last-minute updates.
By purchasing a ticket, you confirm that you have read, understood, and agreed to all disclaimers, terms, and conditions stated above, and accept full responsibility for your participation in the event.

description:
Get to Know Your Sony Camera, Join us for a relaxed evening in store with Sony Digital Imaging Advocate Rebecca McMillan and get hands on with the latest Sony gear.

Rebecca is Wellington-based professional photographer who has been shooting with Sony cameras for over a decade. As an award-winning, NZIPP-accredited, portrait and film stills photographer, she knows how to capture incredible images using Sony Alpha cameras and lenses!

Rebecca also runs events for the local photography community, including coffee meet-ups and photo walks.

Feel free to bring in your Sony gear on the night, or just try the equipment we have in store. Rebecca and the Photo Warehouse staff will be happy to answer any questions you may have.

Everyone who registers and attends this Scene Festival event will go into the draw to win a trip to Rome! There will also be Sony spot prizes given out during the evening.

description:
Stitch & Butch @ Blondini’s, Stitch & Butch @ Blondini’s!
A casual meet up of crafters within the rainbow community
New members welcome.
Bring your knitting/crochet/cross stitch/embroidery/crafting/art or just come and have a chat.
Feel free to come partway through the time or leave early as needed.
Stitch and butch is a playful twist on the stitch and b!tch name to reflect the queerness of the group. Attendees do not need to be in any particular subset of the queer community to be welcome.
Usually gathered around one of the tables in the lounge area upstairs. Often near the walls for the brighter lights to better see our stitches.
There is a lift as well as stairs and Courtenay place bus stops across the road.
Held on the 2nd and 4th Mondays of the month with a summer break.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Brant Bjork Trio, Brant Bjork Trio
In 2025, the trio heads to New Zealand for three exclusive shows celebrating their latest album, Once Upon a Time in the Desert. This is a rare chance to catch a true icon of desert rock live—an experience not to be missed.

Brant Bjork has spent over a quarter of a century at the heart of California’s desert rock scene. From cutting his teeth as the drummer and songwriter for Kyuss’s legendary early albums to carrying the torch for fuzz-driven rock with Fu Manchu from 1994 to 2001, Bjork’s impact is undeniable.

In 2024, Bjork re-formed the Brant Bjork Trio, teaming up with Michael Amster (Nebula, Mondo Generator) on drums and longtime friend—and desert rock pioneer—Mario Lalli on bass.

Joining them on all three dates are Australian rockers Full Tone Generator. Born on the beaches of Australia by Andy Fernando and brought to life in the Californian desert, Full Tone Generator brings the heat with a powerful blend of riff-heavy rock and raw energy.

School holiday fun at Toi Mahara, Bring your children and grandchildren down to Toi MAHARA between 10:30am–2pm each Tuesday, Thursday, Saturday or Sunday in the school holidays and make art together!

Saturday 27 September: Mahuru Māori — draw your own superhero inspired by the work of Robyn Kahukiwa

Upper Hutt Repair Cafe, Anyone can bring in their broken household items to be repaired for free or koha by volunteers, to help reduce landfill waste and poverty. Think the Repair Shop tv show.

Items we can help you repair: wooden, mechanical, electrical, bicycles, sewing, jewellery, frames, kids toys, porcelain dolls, clocks and everything in between.

description: St. Theresa's School Production 2025 - LEST WE FORGET, Set in both New Zealand and the narrow trenches of Gallipoli, Lest We Forget tells the powerful story of New Zealand civilians, soldiers and nurses who find courage, friendship and hope in the face of war. As letters from home arrive and battles rage on, they share laughter, sorrow, and dreams of returning to Aotearoa. This school production honours the Kiwi spirit and sacrifices made during one of our nation’s most defining campaigns. A moving tribute not to be missed.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
JETAA Wellington - Brewkaiwa August @ The Welsh Dragon, We will be having our August Brewkaiwa at The Welsh Dragon, a cosy and quirky pub nestled in the heart of the city. With its warm atmosphere, distinctive character, and range of drinks on offer, it’s the perfect spot to relax, chat, and connect.
Brewkaiwa is JETAA’s monthly casual meetup for anyone with any connection to Japan.
We’re a diverse group of people who have studied, worked, or lived in Japan or have been invited along by someone who has.
Come join us for a brew and stay for the kaiwa! Bring your friends!
***Japanese or alcohol consumption NOT REQUIRED!***
Brewkaiwaとは
一杯いかがですか？
JETAAがウェリントンで親睦会を開催するとどうなるのか？その結果、BREWKAIWA！
2020年に始まった、ブリューカイワは、ウェリントンの様々なバーで毎月開催されている飲み会です。大人気の国際交流グルップです！！！ 日本で働いたり、住んだり、旅行したことのある人達に人気のあるイベントです！！！お酒を飲んで、友達を出来、素敵なごちそうを食べ、おまけに異文化を知られます！
日本語が話せる外国人も良く参加しているので、日本語しか話せなくても全然大丈夫です！
是非来てください！
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Lindsay Keats – Documentary travel photography, Lindsay Keats – Documentary travel photography
Lindsay Keats is a very experienced commercial and editorial photographer based in Wellington, working on assignments as varied as food, product, aerial, editorial, corporate, and industrial. Shooting personal projects has been important and Lindsay loves to travel and he is well known for his travel photography. For tonight’s meeting, he will talk about documentary travel photography and show us some recent work. Lindsay is honoured to be an official Fujifilm X-Photographer and he will also bring along some of Fujifilm’s latest gear to show us.
Check out more of Lindsay's work here: https://www.lindsaykeats.com/index
August 28, Tararua Tramping Club (4 Moncrieff St, Mt Victoria), Doors Open at 7pm
If you're curious about the Wellington Photographic Society, you're welcome to attend two meetings for free before deciding whether to join. It's a great way to meet the community and see what we're all about!
https://wps.wps.org.nz/
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Aotearoa Interfaith Forum 2025, Aotearoa Interfaith Forum 2025
Please join us for our hybrid Interfaith Forum, with in-person meetings in Wellington, Christchurch, Dunedin, and further hubs!

Saturday, 13 September 2025 from 5:30 to 8:30PM


The Wellington Interfaith Council is hosting a hybrid online national forum for our community this year. We understand travel costs can be a barrier to in-person gatherings, so we're creating a unique way to connect!

The forum will be opened by two accomplished speakers. Then, each regional council will host their own in-person meeting, simultaneously linking up online for a shared discussion (kaupapa). This allows local interfaith members to gather in a convenient local location, connecting to the national screen and video via Zoom.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description:
Tahi New Zealand Festival of Solo Performance, 16 shows. 20 solo performances. ONE powerful celebration of storytelling.

TAHI returns 10-20 September to uplift, amplify and celebrate the powerful voices of Aotearoa NZ’s storytellers.

We’re proud to nurture bold new work, fresh perspectives, and the rich diversity of solo theatre across Pōneke and beyond.

Shows will be held at BATS Theatre and other supporting venues across Wellington.

For full programme and venue info, head to tahifestivalnz.com.
label: Festivals

description:
Magic: ANZ Super Series Qualifier #1 - Standard @ Cerberus Games, The ANZ Magic Super Series is for the Australian and New Zealand Magic communities. It is designed to bring the community together to run competitive tabletop Magic events and be a pathway for players to attain greatness by reaching the Pro Tour and beyond!
Here are the event details:
Entry Fee: $35
Format: Standard
REL: Competitive
Tournament Structure: 5 Rounds Swiss into a Top 4/8 cut
Maximum Players: 24
Decklists will be required. These can be filled out on paper in store or submitted digitally to: support@cerberusgames.co.nz
Prizes:
The winner of this event will qualify for the Cycle 11 Super Series Final held in Sydney.
1 Standard Play Booster Pack for entry.
1 Standard Play Booster Pack towards the top placers for each participant.
Promo cards will also be awarded to all participants.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Magic: Chaos Draft Event @ Cerberus Games, The latest Magic: The Gathering set has been incredibly popular leaving us with not enough packs to run a draft of it. As such, the format for the Friday draft this week is Chaos!
Chaos Draft is just like any other Magic Draft format: get together with seven of your drafting buddies and grab three packs of cards for each drafter. The twist is that instead of drafting a normal format the packs you will receive is chosen randomly from our store selection of packs!
Here are the details:
Start Time: 6:30PM
Entry Fee: $35.00
Format: 3-Pack Chaos Draft
Prizes:
Everyone will receive 3 packs (decided randomly at the time) to draft with. Any card you draft is yours to keep!
For each player, 0.5 standard Play Boosters are added into the prize pool towards top placers per pod. Additional Promos given out for attendance.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Magic Edge of Eternities Store Championship - Standard @ Cerberus Games, Store Championship is a structured, in-store tournament program that follows many major Magic: The Gathering releases. It is an opportunity to compete and earn commemorative promos.
Here are the details:
Entry Fee: $25
Format: Standard (3-5 Rounds Swiss. Top 4/8 cutoff)
Prizes:
For each player, 1 Play Booster will be contributed towards the Top placers prize pool and each participant will receive 1 Play Booster.
Store Championship Promos will also be given out as prizes for the Winner, Top 8 and Participation as follows:
Participation - Full-Art Promotional Bitter Triumph
Top 8 - Full-Art Promotional Slickshot Show-Off
Winner - Full-Art Promotional Fable of the Mirror Breaker
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Kapiti Spring Spin Disc Golf Pop-Up!, Kapiti Spring Spin Disc Golf Pop-Up!
Kapiti Spring Spin Disc Golf Pop-Up!

Celebrate spring with a spin! Whether you're a disc golf regular or just curious, this pop-up event is your chance to play, learn, and connect in one of Kapiti’s most scenic reserves.

🎯 What’s Happening:
All-ages, all-skill-level disc golf—no limits, just play!
Hire out gear and learn the basics from local players.
Relaxed, social vibe—bring friends, family, or come solo!

🧭 Where:
Pukekawa Reserve, Waikanae — a beautiful open space perfect for a casual round and springtime hangs.

🛠️ What to Bring:
Comfortable shoes
Water bottle
Your own discs (or hire some on-site!)
No toilet facilities currently available onsite.

💚 Support the Future of Disc Golf in Kapiti
Koha (donations) will be accepted on the day.
All contributions go directly toward building a permanent nine-hole disc golf course at Pukekawa Reserve.
A suggested koha of $20 or more helps make this vision a reality — but any amount is appreciated.

No registration needed — just show up and spin!
Follow this event for updates and weather info.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
A Casual Boil Up, Music and Food - the greatest combo in history.

Aotearoa Musician Casual Healing is finding a new way to share his music that gets the whole community involved. Heres some key information about this Casual Boil Up:
Tickets are available for a koha, this means you are able to choose the price of your ticket
This is an alcahol and drug free event
This is an all ages event
This is a Potluck event (bring a plate of kai to share if you are able, but you are more than welcome to come without any food)
Doors open at 4pm
There are 200 spaces available
We look forward to sharing this night of kai, music and togetherness with you 💛
label: Community & Culture

description:
Jazz Festival: Luca Ciarla solOrkestra, An exclusive concert for Wellington Jazz Festival at The Undercurrent.

Luca Ciarla redraws the borders of jazz violin with a loop pedal, his voice and a wise use of electronics. He performs the entire score of his band solo, playing the violin also like a guitar, a cello or a percussion instrument.

In this imaginative musical landscape Luca sings, whistles, plays other instruments or adds new improvisations; music is continuously evolving into a dazzling solOrkestra.

The program Jazz Violin 2.0 features original compositions and unusual arrangements of jazz standards.

“…his post-Coltrane approach to ‘My Favorite Things’ was a clever way to twit a jazz classic…” The San Francisco Examiner (Usa)

Featuring LUCA CIARLA on violin, vocals, live loops and electronics
label: Festivals

description: Local Government and Arts Funding Debate: A debate on public funding for the arts, with a focus on the role of local government in supporting Wellington's vibrant arts and culture sector.
label: Government & Politics

description:
NZBW After 5 Wellington 15.10.25, Let’s Party !!
BA5 Wednesday 15th October from 5.30pm for a 6pm start
Chamber of Commerce Level 3 / 15 Daly Street Lower Hutt
Come along and receive a complimentary Mocktail and Nibbles on arrival.
The evening includes how to
Make a fabulous Mocktail (the one your drinking)
Make your table and your home stylish for a party OR Christmas Party
Make great your home storage with an amazing range of homewares.
Your lovely hosts are
Andrea from Botanical Homeware
Carol from Foxy Teas
Lyndal from Little Lace Flower Company
 From Andrea
Discover fun and creative ways to use our decorative tins – from stylish storage solutions to thoughtful, unique gifting ideas. I’ll show you how these beautiful tins can be repurposed for every occasion, turning a simple container into a memorable gift or a charming piece for the home. I’ll offer 10% off for purchases made on the night and I’ll also have a raffle basket of tins. So, every purchase gets a raffle ticket.
From Carol 
Join Carol from Foxy Tea as she shares creative ways to enjoy herbal and fruit teas. Discover how to turn them into refreshing mocktails and explore simple, delicious ideas for using them in your cooking. I’ll offer a 15% discount for purchases on the night.
From Lyndal
In my presentation, I will show how you can create a range of stunning looks for your dinner table that won’t break the bank or involve hours of work. As I demonstrate how to put together each look, I will discuss some general planning and design ‘rules’ that make styling your table a breeze. Throughout the demonstration, I will use décor items that are available to hire from my hire stock - an easy, great value and eco-friendly option for decorating. For everyone attending the presentation, these items will be available for hire at a 30% discount (subject to availability). One lucky person will also win an $80 voucher to spend on décor hire for their next party or event.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Sing Sing Film Fundraiser - Arts in Corrections Network, Join Arts Access Aotearoa for a powerful evening of film and purpose as we screen the critically acclaimed movie Sing Sing — based on a true story of redemption, creativity and the transformative power of the arts within the prison system.
Sing Sing tells the story of incarcerated men who find hope and humanity through a prison theatre programme. It reflects the values Arts Access Aotearoa upholds: that the arts can break down walls, build confidence and create change, inside and out.
Tickets are $25 and proceeds support the Arts in Corrections Network.
Before the screening, you will hear from actor, playwright and musician Jamie McCaskill (of the Māori Sidesteps musical comedy group), and playwright and columnist Dave Armstrong. Together, they led a powerful theatre and storytelling course at Whanganui Prison, supporting and transformation behind the wire.
Come along and support us to continue this important work.
About Arts in Corrections
Arts programmes in prisons can be powerful pathways to healing and change. They help people restore their sense of identity, build resilience and develop skills that support rehabilitation and reintegration into the community. By nurturing creative potential and cultural identity these programmes foster personal transformation.
Arts Access Aotearoa leads a national network that supports Corrections staff and community educators and groups to design and deliver meaningful arts programmes in prisons and Community Corrections..
label: Film & Media

description:
Jewellery-making in 4 weeks on Sundays, Mixed levels - Wellington, This Sunday afternoon block is a short course on jewellery-making. It starts on Sun 24 August and runs for 4 weeks until Sun 14 September, 2pm - 5pm.
Beginners will practice the basic techniques in copper or brass and then move on to working in silver. An excellent first project for beginners in this class is to create a simple textured ring band - but once you have the basics down, it is fun to create earrings, pendants or other simple items. Learning to cut, heat, form and texture metal - to solder using a jeweller's torch and silver solder, and finally to polish your work up to a beautiful finish: these classes are super satisfying.
These blocks are also a nice way for existing students or more advanced makers to work on more challenging projects and join friendly classes in our well-equipped warm studio!
Basic materials are supplied and there are extra materials available to purchase as you need in class.
This block is great for teens and kids over 12 or so. NOTE: Anyone under 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver.
Our booking system asks for full payment to be made via credit card, Afterpay or PayPal on booking. If you do not have access to these payment methods or need to pay your course fee over time please email us to arrange this
Course fee $280, Early bird pricing $252 till 27 July.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
New Zealand Game Developers Conference, New Zealand Game Developers Conference
This is more than just a conference; it’s a celebration of Aotearoa’s amazing game dev community.

Our theme for this year is The People at the Heart of Games and is inspired by the well-known Māori proverb “He aha te mea nui o te ao? He tangata, he tangata, he tangata” (What is the most important thing in the world? It is people, it is people, it is people), emphasising the human side of game development.

It speaks to the importance of community, collaboration and the people who shape our industry - developers, storytellers, players, and cultural guardians.

We’ll have inspiring talks, engaging workshops, and vibrant panel discussions that highlight voices from all corners of our industry.

Whether you’re a veteran developer, an enthusiastic gamer, or just starting your journey, NZGDC 2025 is the perfect place to forge new friendships, exchange ideas, and ignite your creativity!
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Nationwide Guinea Pig Double Show 2025, Nationwide Guinea Pig Double Show 2025
🐹 New Zealand Nationwide Guinea Pig Double Show 2025 – Upper Hutt

Get ready for the cutest competition in New Zealand – the Nationwide Guinea Pig Double Show 2025 happening in Upper Hutt on Saturday 11th October 2025. This one-of-a-kind event brings together pet lovers breeders and guinea pig enthusiasts from across the country for a full day celebrating our much-loved cavies.
Hosted by North Canterbury Guinea Pigs in collaboration with the Capital Cavy Club the show features two major events in one day:
🏆 Pedigree Guinea Pig Show – showcasing the very best cavies bred to national standards.
🐾 Pet Guinea Pig Show – where family pets take the spotlight for their charm personality and cuteness.
Whether you’re a seasoned exhibitor a first-time participant or simply a guinea pig fan this is the perfect opportunity to:
✅ Meet and connect with other guinea pig owners and breeders.
✅ Learn more about cavy care breeds and showing standards.
✅ Enjoy a fun family-friendly day out in the heart of Upper Hutt.
✅ See some of New Zealand’s most beautiful and beloved guinea pigs.

📍 Event Details:
Date: Saturday 11th October 2025
Venue: Upper Hutt Uniting Parish 1 Benzie Avenue Upper Hutt
Time: 9:30am arrival for the main show | Pet Show starts at 2:00pm

Exhibitors from all cavy clubs across New Zealand are welcome with special sections for junior members and pet owners.
With support from Topflite and hosted by North Canterbury Guinea Pigs the Nationwide Cavy Show is one of the biggest guinea pig events in New Zealand – and one you won’t want to miss!
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Newlands Paparangi Tennis Club "Love Tennis" Free Event, Newlands Paparangi Tennis Club "Love Tennis" Free Event
Not long now until our club's big Love Tennis Weekend event!

If you have thought of trying tennis or want to get back into it, our local Love Tennis event is a great way to check out what is on offer at your local tennis club.

It's a great day for all ages with:
- fun games for the young and young at heart
- awesome prizes up for grabs
- free sausage sizzle
- discounted membership for folks who sign up as a new member on the day
- existing members also have a chance to go into the draw to win the cost of their membership back (or $170 off a family membership)!
- bring family and friends
Lock it in your diary. Share this post 🎾
Hope to see you there.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Nightlife & Horde Halloween Weekend Pass – Wellington 2025, Nightlife & Horde Halloween Weekend Pass – Wellington 2025
From rooftop beats to undead streets, the weekend is yours. DJs, shots & finales light up Wellington Oct 31 & Nov 1. One wristband.

About this Event

One weekend. Two worlds. Your Halloween story starts here.
The Nightlife & Horde Weekend Pass unlocks entry to both of Wellington’s wildest Halloween crawls:
Halloween Nightlife Crawl – Friday, October 31st
Zombie Horde Pub Crawl – Saturday, November 1st
Friday night is for the glam. Step into cocktail lounges, rooftop bars, and dance clubs with DJs spinning Halloween remixes and exclusive themed menus. Saturday night is for the horde. Join the undead as the city’s pubs transform into survival zones filled with zombie shots, blood-red cocktails, and a closing party where the living and the undead collide.
Two nights, two vibes — one wristband.





WHY BUY A WEEKEND PASS?
✨ Double the Halloween – Party both Friday & Saturday with one ticket.
🍸 Curated Drink Specials – Classy cocktails Friday, blood-soaked shots Saturday.
🎶 Non-Stop DJs – Hip hop, EDM, party anthems, and spooky remixes across both nights.
🎭 Two Themes, One Crowd – Dress to impress on Friday, then unleash your inner monster on Saturday.
📍 4+ Venues Each Night – From stylish nightlife venues to pub-packed streets, all within walking distance.


HOW THE WEEKEND WORKS
Check-In: Pick up your weekend wristband at the designated start venue (7:30–10:30 PM both nights).
Choose Your Path: Explore any participating bars, pubs, or clubs between 8:30–11:30 PM.
Final Party: Each night ends at a huge closing venue from 11:30 PM–2 AM.


WHAT YOUR PASS INCLUDES
🎟️ Admission to both Halloween Nightlife Crawl (Friday) + Zombie Horde Crawl (Saturday)
🚫 Skip the cover charges at all participating venues
📱 Digital crawl maps for both nights 🎶 DJs + live music at every stop
🍹 Exclusive Halloween drinks and specials each night
🕺 Two grand finale parties to close out the weekend


PARTICIPATING VENUES
Venue lists will be announced closer to Halloween. Expect a curated mix of upscale bars and clubs on Friday, and themed pubs and high-energy party spots on Saturday.
This pass is built for the ones who want it all: Friday for style, Saturday for chaos. Get your crew together, plan your costumes, and claim your spot for back-to-back Halloween madness in Wellington.
🚨 Early bird passes start at $25. Space is limited — secure yours before they’re gone.





EVENT TERMS & CONDITIONS
AGE & ID POLICY
Entry is strictly 18+. You must show a valid government-issued photo ID to join.
No ID = no entry, regardless of ticket purchase.
WRISTBANDS & CHECK-IN
Mandatory Wristbands: A wristband is required for venue access. You’ll receive it at the official check-in by presenting your Eventbrite ticket or QR code.
Check-In Deadline: Wristbands must be collected during the posted hours (before 10:30 PM). If you fail to check in on time, you lose access—no refunds.
Proxy Option: If you can’t arrive in time, you may send someone else to pick up your wristband.
VENUE ACCESS & CONDUCT
Schedule Restrictions: Wristbands and drink deals are valid only during the times listed on the Digital Bar List.
Use the Crawl Map: Always review the Digital Crawl Map Link on event day for updates, venue changes, or closures.
Capacity Limits: Some locations may reach max capacity. You may be required to wait or choose an alternate venue.
Venue Rights: Bars reserve the right to refuse entry based on intoxication, dress code, behavior, or safety concerns. Security screening still applies even with a wristband.
TICKETS & REFUNDS
Final Sale: All tickets are non-refundable and non-transferable. If the event is canceled with no new date, a refund (minus fees) will be issued automatically.
Rain or Shine: The crawl happens regardless of weather. Venue participation and specials are subject to change without notice.
Arrival Issues: Late check-ins or showing up at the wrong venue are not grounds for refunds.
COSTUMES & BEHAVIOR
Costume Guidelines: No items resembling weapons. Offensive or unsafe costumes may lead to denied entry without refund.
Respect the Crawl: Disorderly conduct, damage to venues, or harassment of staff or other guests will result in removal with no refund.
LIABILITY WAIVER
By purchasing a ticket and participating, you voluntarily assume all risks associated with the event, including but not limited to: personal injury, illness, property loss, theft, accidents, alcohol-related harm, and even death.
You fully and forever release and discharge Events Per Se, its owners, partners, contractors, sponsors, employees, volunteers, and all participating venues from any claims, liabilities, or demands connected to your participation—whether caused by negligence, gross negligence, or any other reason.
You also agree to indemnify and hold harmless all released parties from any expenses, damages, or legal costs arising from your actions or involvement.
By attending, you confirm you have read and accepted these terms and conditions. Your participation is voluntary, and this waiver is intended to be as broad and enforceable as the law allows.
label: Hobbies & Interests

This should be a fun event. Light refreshments - koha

description:
Paint and Wine Night in Waikanae Beach - Mothers Tulips, The concept is simple - take a brush in one hand, a drink in the other and let’s paint a masterpiece!

Join us for a creative night of drinking and painting in the heart of Waikanae! No previous painting experience necessary. Get your creative juices flowing and your brush strokes going!

Drinks: FIRST DRINK IS INCLUDED IN THE TICKET PRICE

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality canvas, acrylic paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). At the end of the night you will leave with your own painting ready to hang up on your wall.

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Climate Fresk Workshop in Wellington, Do you want to be part of the solution to tackle climate change but don’t have the time to become a climate scientist? Join us for a 3-hour interactive workshop to explore the causes and consequences of climate disturbances.
Based on the IPCC report and played by over 2 million people worldwide, this collaborative workshop allows you to understand the key issues of climate change to empower you to take action.
How it works:
The workshop is based on a 42-card game. Each card represents an element, a cause or a consequence of climate change.
In teams, guided by your facilitator, you are encouraged to find the cause-effect relationship between the different components of climate change. Collective intelligence will get you from one deck of card to the next!
This step-by-step reconstruction provides keys to understand the complexity and develop an overview of climate change.
Agenda:
Introduction, 15 mins
Fresk Card Game, 1 1/2 hours
Debrief and Actions, 1 hour 15 mins
Climate Fresk is an excellent opportunity to understand the key elements of climate change and what you can do to be part of the solution. No previous climate knowledge is needed.

Tea, coffee and snacks will be served during the short break. Workshop run by Climate Training Co. Ltd. Donations welcome!
label: Conservation & Environment

description:
One New Zealand Warriors ANZAC Weekend, The One New Zealand Warriors and Sky Stadium are proud to invite you to the Ultimate Weekend Warriors Experience.
This exclusive experience will give the biggest Rugby League fans a unique opportunity to get closer to the action than ever before as the One New Zealand Warriors return to Sky Stadium on ANZAC weekend 2026. With a jam-packed schedule of behind-the-scenes access, enthralling events, and an epic showdown on the Saturday, it’s bound to be a weekend you won’t forget.
What’s Included:
Friday Night Welcome
Kick off the weekend with some of the biggest Warriors fans in the country! Start in the Warriors changing room, feel the hype build, and then emerge through the players tunnel with pyrotechnics, smoke, lights and music - experience entering Sky Stadium just as the teams themselves do. The entourage will then move up to Sky Stadiums’ premium lounges for snacks, a cash bar, and a Q&A from some legendary ex-Warriors.
Saturday Match Day Hospitality
Enjoy the Anzac Day match and entertainment with fellow Warriors fanatics from the comfort of one of our premium lounges. Included is a premium food offering, private seats with epic views and dedicated bar facilities.
Hosted by Warriors Legends
Throughout the weekend you’ll also be in the company of some of the Warriors greats. You’ll have ample opportunity to ask questions, get insights, tips and tricks, or hear a play by play of some of your favourite Warriors action moments straight from the source.
Exclusive Prizes
Be in to win some exclusive signed Warriors merchandise and other spot prizes over the course of the weekend as a cherry on top of a fantastic Ultimate Weekend Warriors Experience.
Don’t miss out! We expect tickets to go quick, so call up your mates and lock it in today.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Omaka Wings & Wheels Open Day, Omaka Wings & Wheels Open Day
🚗✈ Wings, Wheels, and a Whole Lot of WOW! ✈🚗

Spring into Daylight Savings at the Omaka Wings & Wheels Open Day – Sunday, 28 September 2025!

📍 Omaka Aviation Heritage Centre
Get up close with a spectacular lineup of aircraft from throughout history and admire stunning classic cars. Take to the skies with joy flights from Marlborough Aero Club and Yak 3 Full Noise!

🍔 Refuel at the Omaka Café or grab a bite from Lil Orbits, Longacre Farm, DFC Food Company & more! Bring your picnic rugs, deck chairs, and make a day of it.

🎟 Your ticket includes entry to both of Omaka’s world-class exhibitions – an unbeatable value!
💡 Pre-purchase online for the best price and fastest entry.

Online:
Adults $25 | Youth (14–17) $12 | Children (5–13) $8 + booking fee

Gate Sales:
Adults $30 | Youth $15 | Children $10

description:
Michelangelo — A Different View, There’s no need to look up to see true greatness. The intricate beauty of Michelangelo’s Sistine Chapel ceiling will be on full display at Tākina over summer. Michelangelo — A Different View invites you to experience the genius of the sixteenth-century artist from an entirely new perspective. You get to be above and up close. 
Under license from the Vatican Museums, this exhibition offers a complete and authentic reproduction of over 50 stunning works. This once-in-a-lifetime exhibition allows you to experience the colour and detail of multiple works from just two meters away.

description:
Plimmerton Rotary Garden Tour 2025, Join us for a Springtime treat- a tour of ten gardens around the Pauatahanui Harbour.

The gardens are varied, from bijou suburban hideaways to a lifestyle block, and from an 1860s cottage garden to a modern design gem. They are testaments to the care and creativity of their owners.

Included is the iconic Heritage Rose Garden beside St Alban’s church in Pauatahanui, which features legacy and modern rose varieties around the burial ground.

Gardeners will be inspired by the experience - it will be an unforgettable day out.

Times - Gardens are open from 9.30 am to 4.30 pm on both days, except for the Pauatahanui Rose Garden/Burial Ground, which will be closed on Sunday morning until 1 pm.

Garden competition – A prize voted for by entrants for the “Best Garden” for Consultancy Services has been offered by Distinctive Home and Landscapes Limited to the value of $600. Other spot prizes will be drawn at the end of each day for entrants.

Ticket holders:


Note that when ticketing, select the Zone to start at: Camborne, Paremata/Aotea, Whitby, or Pauatahanui.

Preplan your garden tour from the map provided when tickets are issued, and have the plan available on the day.

Note that every effort is made to ensure gardens are as safe as practicable. All gardens are entered at visitors’ risk.

must obtain the garden owner's consent if you wish to take cuttings.

Note that the event will occur wet or fine, pets are not allowed, and no ticket refunds will be available.


This is a Plimmerton Rotary fundraiser for community benefit, and net proceeds will be shared by:


Gillies McIndoe Foundation, founded by Dr Swee Tan, benefits research work in developing accessible life-changing treatment options for brain cancer, vascular birthmarks and keloid scars through the use of affordable repurposed medications. https://www.gmri.org.nz/

“HAROLD” - North Wellington Life Education Trust - visits primary schools with an intriguing mobile classroom, furthering the Education of unique Life Skills for primary school children in the Porirua Johnsonville regions. northwellington@lifeed.org.nz


A special thanks to Titahi Bay Horticultural Society for their early support.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Debt Club EP Release Show W/ Model Home & Wiri Donna, Debt Club celebrate the release of their debut EP “Taste For Stout” with a special show in Pōneke, joined by friends and powerhouse live acts Model Home and Wiri Donna.
Formed in 2023, Debt Club have quickly made their mark with a dynamic, guitar-driven sound that blends anthemic hooks with thoughtful lyricism. Following the release of singles “Little Lines” and “Windows,” both featured on “Taste For Stout”, the band are set to mark this milestone with their biggest show yet.
Ōtautahi legends Model Home bring their kiwi take on midwest emo, earning massive attention with their 2023 debut album “…And Nobody Made A Sound” and a bunch of student radio hits.
Wiri Donna, led by Bianca Bailey, are a commanding indie rock force whose high energy shows and acclaimed EP’s Being Alone and In My Chambers have made them one of Aotearoa’s most exciting live acts.
San Fran holds a Supervised License. Minors are welcome to attend events at San Fran so long as they are accompanied by a legal guardian at all times whilst at the venue.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Partial Solar Eclipse - Free event, A rare Partial Solar Eclipse will take place as the Sun (Te Rā) rises on the morning of Monday 22 September. Aotearoa New Zealand is one the few places it will be visible. The last one we had was back in November 2012. At maximum, which takes place just after 7:00 am, 66% of the Sun will be covered by the Moon.
To make the most of this opportunity the Wellington Astronomical Society Outreach team will be at the Wellington waterfront with our solar scopes. Solar eclipse glasses will be available to purchase for $2 each. Please bring coins/cash.
Please DO NOT look at the Sun directly or even with sunglasses. You will damage your eyes. If you don't have access to solar glasses, use a pinhole projector or look at the shadows of leaves on the ground.
If you want to support our Society by becoming a member, please go to https://www.was.org.nz/join-us/

description:
Alexandr Misko - The International Guitar Sensation LIVE at St Peter's Village Hall | Paekākāriki, The international guitar sensation brings his groundbreaking stage show to New Zealand shores for the very first time!
May 30 at St Peter's Village Hall, Paekākāriki
7:00pm doors / 7:30pm show
Seated Concert
FAMILY FRIENDLY with $20 tickets for under 18s
Hailed as “the future of guitar” (Total Guitar), Misko is a globally renowned virtuoso known for his jaw-dropping technique, emotional depth, and genre-defying style. Fusing classical precision with elements of jazz, rock, and modern fingerstyle, his performances are both technically astonishing and deeply moving.
Misko’s self-taught, boundary-pushing approach has captivated millions online, earning him a massive global following and praise from some of the world’s top music publications. With lightning-fast fingerpicking, percussive tapping, and masterful arrangements, he transforms a single acoustic guitar into an entire musical universe — live and without loops.
A must-see for fans of instrumental brilliance, next-level guitar playing, and world-class musical storytelling!
WHAT THE PRESS SAY
“Misko is the future of guitar.” — Total Guitar
“A one-of-a-kind performance that will leave you speechless.” — The Guardian
“Alexandr Misko redefines guitar playing with every note he plays.” — MusicRadar
“A mesmerizing display of technical brilliance and raw emotion.” — Rolling Stone “A true guitar prodigy.” — Guitar World
“An artist who combines virtuosic technique with deep musical expression.” — Guitar Player
Tickets are VERY limited for these intimate concerts — don’t miss out on seeing live music at its finest!
St Peter’s Hall in Paekakariki is a welcoming community space that combines timeless charm with practical versatility. Its bright, open interiors and flexible layout make it perfect for a wide range of events—from concerts and theatre to meetings and celebrations. The main hall offers a stage area with quality sound and lighting, creating a comfortable setting for performances of all kinds. Additional rooms provide space for smaller gatherings or workshops, making the venue adaptable to many needs. Whether you’re attending a lively show or a community meeting, St Peter’s Hall offers a warm, inviting atmosphere that truly brings people together.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Pre-order my new book! Homegrown Fruit: A Practical Guide, Pre-order your copy of the book, then come along to Firebird on the 28th and pick it up. I'll sign it, and then we'll settle in for a book chat about 3.15.
Coffee + cake for sale.
Jason and I are so proud of this book! Were stoked to get this practical, useful information out there, and give you the tools to be an epic fruit gardener.
"A book for those who love growing their own fruit, or who want to learn how to do it or do it better – no matter your garden size. It covers it all – where to start, what to look for, what is suitable for your area, how to prep, how to look after and train – you name it, it is in here. A must have and a keeper." Fiona Eadie, author of 100 Best Native Plants for New Zealand Gardens
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Post-Match Dinner: 30th Anniversary of the Aldo Cuccurullo Memorial Trophy, TICKETS ON SALE NOW!
Tickets for the Post-Match Dinner: 30th Anniversary of the Aldo Cuccurullo Memorial Trophy are officially on sale as of today (1 August) until 1 October, unless they sell out prior. So don't leave it till the last minute!
Priority will be given to financial members of Club Garibaldi and Club Italia Nelson.
Non-members will be wait-listed in order of application date and confirmed after the 1 October cutoff.
The cost of the tickets are as follows:
Financial Club Members (from both Clubs):
- 12 years and over: $25.00pp
- 6–11 years old: $12.50pp
- under 5 years: Fre
Non-Members:
- 12 years and over: $50.00pp
- 6-11 years old: $25.00pp
- under 5 years: Free
Please email, text or call Rosina to secure your tickets now.
rosina.vanderaa@gmail.com
021-621-245
Once your FY25/26 membership status has been confirmed, Rosina will send you the bank account details.
A presto!
Disclaimer: Photo not taken at The Pines, but captures the essence of what we expect to the night to be like.. full of laughter.. and lots of loudness..
***
Aldo Cuccurullo Memorial Trophy
Each year Club Garibaldi of Wellington and Club Italia of Nelson interact through a soccer game between representatives of the two clubs.
The game is in memory of Aldo Cuccurullo, a young member of Club Italia who tragically died at a very young age.
Aldo was known as a gentle giant who gave of his time not only to play rugby league himself, but also to coach children.
The game, as you would expect of Italian football, is a tense one. Member supporters of each club travel to be at the game but the weekend is as much an opportunity to socialise and build friendships as it is to play football.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Private Cape Palliser Day Trip from Wellington, Escape to the Dramatic Coast: Private Cape Palliser Day Trip from Wellington
Are you looking for a unique and unforgettable day trip from Wellington?
Imagine yourself surrounded by breathtaking coastal scenery, watching playful seals in their natural habitat, and standing in the shadow of a historic lighthouse with panoramic ocean views.
As your dedicated travel and adventure tour guide, I offer exclusive, low-key private tours to Cape Palliser, perfect for individuals, couples, or families seeking a personalized and enriching experience.
What's in store for you:
Personalized Pick-up & Drop-off: Enjoy the convenience of being picked up and dropped off directly from your Wellington accommodation.
Scenic Coastal Drive: Relax in comfort as we journey through picturesque landscapes, including the stunning Remutaka Hill Road and the rugged Wairarapa coastline.
Marvel at the Putangirua Pinnacles: Explore the otherworldly rock formations made famous by "Lord of the Rings."
Encounter the Cape Palliser Seal Colony: Witness a thriving colony of New Zealand fur seals up close (from a safe and respectful distance).
Discover the Iconic Cape Palliser Lighthouse: Climb (or admire from below) the iconic red and white striped lighthouse and soak in the incredible views.
Flexible & Relaxed Pace: This is your private tour, so we'll move at a comfortable pace and can tailor the day to your interests.
Gourmet Options Available (upon request & additional cost): Elevate your experience with a pre-arranged gourmet picnic lunch or inquire about other bespoke dining options featuring local flavors.
Expert Guidance: Benefit from my local knowledge, insights into the region's history, geology, and wildlife, ensuring a truly engaging experience.
Perfect for Photography Enthusiasts: Capture stunning photos of dramatic landscapes and unique wildlife.
Who is this tour for?
This private Cape Palliser day trip is ideal for:
Individuals seeking a solo adventure.
Couples looking for a romantic and scenic escape.
Families wanting a memorable and educational day out.
Anyone who appreciates beautiful scenery, wildlife encounters, and a relaxed, personalized travel experience.
Those who value quality and are happy to invest in a private tour.
Date & Time: Flexible - Contact me to discuss your preferred dates and times.
Duration: Approximately 8-9 hours (can be adjusted slightly based on your preferences).
Price: Pricing is tailored to the number of people in your group and any additional requests (e.g., gourmet lunch). Please message me for a personalized quote.
Booking:
Send me a direct message to discuss your preferred dates, group size, and any specific interests you may have. I'm happy to answer any questions and create a bespoke itinerary for you.
Don't miss out on this opportunity to experience the magic of Cape Palliser on your own terms!
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Radio Hauraki 'The Big Show' • Beervana Warm Up Show, We’re going BIG to warm up for the BIGGEST beer weekend in the capital.
Next Thursday, @radiohaurakinz are bringing The Big Show to Lyall Bay - broadcasting their @beervananz Warm-Up Show live from Parrotdog Bar.
Roll in early to score one of 100 FREE Backbone Tees and hang with The Big Show crew. Then pull up a stump for a cold pint of Parrotdog, perfectly paired with dinner from two Wellington food icons – @oikoshellenic and @tommytomato.
@oikoshellenic will be serving charcoal-grilled chicken, slow-cooked lamb, and charred eggplant, all tucked into their house-made pita.
@tommytomato will be firing up the @gozney for slices of hot, crispy pizza.
On the sounds we have DJ Karl Gebbie.
On tap we’ll be pouring our brand-new Alcoholic Ginger Beer, alongside all the usual suspects.
See you next week!
#parrotdogbar #haurakinz #thebigshow #beervanawarmup #nice

description:
The New Zealand Institute of Driver Educator's Inc - 50th Annual Conference, New Zealand Institute of Driver Educators (NZIDE)
National Conference
HELD: James Cook Hotel - Wellington

The NZIDE Executive Committee is proud to have some fabulous speakers attending this year's conference. See below some of the speakers we have attending. We are looking forward to a great conference, awesome networking opportunities and having a laugh.

NZIDE is pleased to announce an exceptional lineup of keynote speakers for our upcoming conference. We are honoured to welcome Greg Murphy, Nathan Wallis, Julia Grace, Katrina Aubury, Sean Campbell and Sue Tyler - renowned voices who bring a wealth of experience, insight and inspiration. This promises to be a transformative event, offering thought-provoking perspectives and meaningful dialogue. We invite you to be part of a conference that is truly not to be missed.

----------------------------------------------------------------------

The New Zealand Institute of Driver Educators (NZIDE) annual National Conference. Pre-registration is essential and numbers are limited. Two days of amazing speakers, government guests, professional development and networking. Lunch both days. Annual general meeting (AGM) and Evening dinner function. The evening dinner function dress theme is Shimmer, sparkle and shine - it's a night of gold and glamour! Come dressed in your fanciest or silliest golden attire.
Member Conference price: $275.00 incl GST. Includes full conference / evening function
Non-Member Conference price: $350.00 incl GST. Includes full conference / evening function

description:
Pre-order my new book! Homegrown Fruit: A Practical Guide, Pre-order your copy of the book, then come along to Firebird on the 28th and pick it up. I'll sign it, and then we'll settle in for a book chat about 3.15.
Coffee + cake for sale.
Jason and I are so proud of this book! Were stoked to get this practical, useful information out there, and give you the tools to be an epic fruit gardener.
"A book for those who love growing their own fruit, or who want to learn how to do it or do it better – no matter your garden size. It covers it all – where to start, what to look for, what is suitable for your area, how to prep, how to look after and train – you name it, it is in here. A must have and a keeper." Fiona Eadie, author of 100 Best Native Plants for New Zealand Gardens

About this Event

Come join us for a fun-filled day of sewing and socializing at Karori Arts & Crafts! Whether you're a seasoned pro or just starting out, this event is perfect for anyone who loves to sew. Bring your latest project or start something new - either way, you'll have a blast chatting with fellow sewing enthusiasts. Bring your current project or get inspired by others' creations at our friendly gathering. Share tips, tricks, and stories while working on our projects together.
Don't forget to pack your sewing machine, fabric, and any other supplies you'll need. We can't wait to see what you create! You will need to bring your own machine and materials. Please bring an extension lead and multipoint box if you have one. (Don't worry, though—we have some in the centre, too!) We'll supply an iron and ironing board to share, as well as a table and relatively comfy chair each. There are also spare cutting-out tables at a taller height. You are welcome to come along and work on hand-sewing projects.
A kitchen is available on site and supermarkets as well as cafes are very close by.Parking is free and there are 3 dedicated spaces for the centre as well as others closeby.
Cost: Free for members of the Karori Arts Centre or $15 per person payable directly to KACC. (Membership of the centre is $105 annually and also gives you reductions on classes and access to other groups)

description:
September Shuffleboard Pairs Tournament, Come along to our monthly shuffleboard league!
Register here: https://www.meandoses.co.nz/shuffleboard
Shuffleboard pairs tournaments are 6pm to 9.30pm at the latest (usually earlier), the last Wednesday of each month.
Check out the league over at Challonge.com
https://challonge.com/communities/meanshuffle
Tournament Rules:
This is a double elimination format tournament. Teams must lose twice to be eliminated. Matches are played according to standard shuffleboard rules as can be read here:
https://www.theshufflehouse.com/.../how-to-play...
EXCEPT:
- There is a 10 MINUTE time limit each match.
- Matches are played FIRST TO TEN.
- In the event of a draw after the 10 minute time limit, a "Golden End" will be played. The winner of the Golden End wins the match.
- Pucks that do not pass the foul line are removed from play.
- The shuffleboard will be reset and resanded after each match.
- No sand will be added during a match.
- The final match is played first to 15 with no time limit - if time allows.
- Every "Hanger" is rewarded with a sweet treat!
PRIZES
1st place: $60 of Taproom Vouchers + 1st place ribbon + Your team name immortalised on the honours board
2nd place: $40 of Taproom Vouchers + 2nd place ribbon

description:
Spank 2025 - New Zealand's wildest fetish dance & play party, Spank 2025 - New Zealand's wildest fetish dance & play party
Get Ready for the Hottest Night of the Year at SPANK!

About this Event

Are you ready to unleash your wildest desires and dance the night away? Prepare for an electrifying experience that will push the boundaries of pleasure and indulge your senses like never before! SPANK, the ultimate kinky dance and play party, is back and it's bigger, bolder, and naughtier than ever!

What to Expect: 🎶 Groove to the Sensual Beats: our DJ will be spinning the sexiest deep house music all night long, setting the mood for an unforgettable evening of uninhibited fun.
🔥 Explore the Play Area and Darkroom: Dive into a world of sensory exploration with dedicated play zones and a tantalizingly mysterious darkroom.
🌈 Embrace Diverse Desires: A smorgasbord of sexualities, kinks, fetishes, and fantasies will come together for a night of unapologetic self-expression and connection.
Consent is Key: SPANK is a full permission safe space operating under the model of consent. We believe in empowering you to explore your sexuality freely, while respecting the boundaries of others. Remember, your desires are valid, but you must obtain explicit consent before engaging with others. Respect their boundaries and maintain a safe and enjoyable environment for everyone.
Unparalleled Experience: With our commitment to safety and enjoyment, we proudly offer you an electrifying event that promises to be both thrilling and secure. Join us for a unique Labour weekend celebration that will leave you breathless and craving for more.
Dress to Impress: 👗 Fetish Attire Compulsory: Dress up in your most tantalising kink and fetish costumes! Show off your unique style and embrace your inner desires. No jeans and jimmies allowed – this is your chance to shine and explore your fantasies.
🧥 Coat Check Available: Don't worry about your coats or extra clothing; we've got you covered with a convenient coat check service.
Join the Party: Are you ready to dive into a night of unbridled passion and wild dance moves? Sign up on the night with your name and email address to participate in the interactive play activity. Secure your spot for a night of unforgettable memories!


Please Note: We uphold a strict code of conduct and dress, and we reserve the right to remove anyone from the event at any time, for any reason, without a refund. We are dedicated to maintaining a safe and enjoyable environment for all attendees.

Don't miss out on this one-of-a-kind event where your desires are embraced and your fantasies come to life. Get ready to SPANK yourself into a world of ecstasy!


See you on the dance floor, The SPANK Team
Spank You Very Much!

description:
Stitch a Still Life, Create your own A4 size Still Life with a vase or a bowl containing three dimensional flowers, fruit and /or leaves.
Linen fabric will be available in a range of colours for you to create your own background textured with simple stitches.
A bowl or vase for your flowers and fruit will be appliqued.
Some threads and fabrics will be provided but if you have something special you would like to incorporate into the Still Life you are welcome to bring it along and we can discuss how to best use it. For example, the bowl for the cherries is from an old, embroidered doily and the cherries are red velvet. A piece of lace may look good on the table.
You may not finish completely, but you will have been taught and practised each step.
Advice and options for finishing your piece of work for display will be given.

description:
WJF - Andrew Faleatua Trio, The Wellington Jazz Cooperative opens its Wellington Jazz Festival Popup club with the Andrew Faleatua Trio. Featuring: Andrew Faleatua (piano, fahūfagu), Seth Boy (double bass), and Isitolo Alesana, who plays both ukulele and traditional Samoan percussion instruments.

Andrews' ensemble will present a series of original compositions developed during his time as the 2024 Jazz Composer-in-Residence at Te Herenga Waka—Victoria University of Wellington. These works reflect a compositional approach shaped by both the harmonic and improvisational sensibilities of contemporary jazz pianists such as Brad Mehldau, Robert Glasper, and Aaron Parks, and the rhythmic, melodic, and resonant qualities of indigenous Samoan music, drawn from my own cultural heritage. This synthesis seeks to articulate a distinctly Pasifika jazz sound. This performance marks the live debut of the full suite of compositions, which have been recorded and are set to be released later this year.

Stitch and butch is a playful twist on the stitch and b!tch name to reflect the queerness of the group. Attendees do not need to be in any particular subset of the queer community to be welcome.

There is a lift as well as stairs and Courtenay place bus stops across the road.
