description:
The Māori Sidesteps, Māori made mischief

Contemporary showband The Māori Sidesteps are serving crooning and comedic goodness. With soulful harmonies, satirical skits, and superb song parodies, these fullas have won rave reviews, alongside their hit webseries and TV show – and now you can catch them live on stage at Circa Theatre!

The Sidesteps flip comedic nostalgia on its head and weave stunning harmonies with theatrical play, skewering social idioms and shining a cheeky light on what it means to be Māori in 2025.

Celebrating connection and the richness of our differences, The Māori Sidesteps bring pride in identity, the strength of mana motuhake, and the reminder that joy is the best antidote to division. From government blunders to policies ripe for the picking, these top-notch entertainers take aim at the kaupapa of the moment. Expect fearless satire, wickedly subversive humour, and a refreshing dose of truth-telling disguised as hilarity.

If you’ve ever wished someone would sing what you’ve been thinking about the current political climate, The Māori Sidesteps are here to deliver Māori made mischief through waiata that wink!

Reviews:
“Never did satire and self-deprecation go hand in hand and so cleverly and entertainingly” Alan Scott – Theatreview
“A night of whakawhanaungatanga – aroha, not (too much) hōhā.” Flat City Field Notes

Tuesday 28th October – Saturday 1st November (5 shows only)
$25 – $49
Circa One
Age Recommendation PG
Audience Care: Occasional strong language & themes
Runtime: 95mins plus interval

Performances:

Wednesday 29 October 6.30pm
Thursday 30 October 6.30pm

description:
V.U Meditation Journeys, V.U Meditation Journeys
To book for a space in the bell tent- click here https://loveyourself.co.nz/events/p/bell-tent-meditations-
To book to do the journey over Zoom - Click here https://loveyourself.co.nz/events/p/journey-meditations-zoom

Every Tuesday night we welcome you into the magic of the bell tent. The tent is lovely during the day, but as it gets dark, it takes on a magical feeling. Fairy lights and crystals lit by gently changing coloured lights. We have the fire going if it's cold, the sky curtain pulled if it's a clear night.

The evening starts with us welcoming in the Elements, the Directions and the web of life, into our sacred circle. Arniya then dances the energy in with Celestial Energy Movement, for the group. This creates a vortex of Divine power into the middle of the tent. Each person is linked into this Divine power, and receives a "top-up" of Divinity.
We then have an opportunity for each person to hold the Talking Stick and send positive energy to their life, or current experience, or to ask the Divine for help. This is completely optional. Throughout the evening, you will have opportunities to choose oracle cards to support your guidance through life.

At 8pm the Zoom people join our circle. They will get to choose an oracle card and be connected into the vortex of power in the tent. This always creates an energy of expansion within the group.
Arniya then gives a wee run down of any current energies influencing the planet, before she leads everyone on a Journey Meditation. Some weeks we to the V.U soul plane. Sometimes we travel to our inner world. Sometimes the guardians take us somewhere else entirely. Each journey is channelled to support the needs of whoever is present.
After the meditation, we say goodbye to our Zoom friends, close the energy on the circle and give thanks. After this journey is complete, we have a cup of tea - time for a chat or playing with oracle cards, enjoying each other’s company in the uplifted space.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description:
The Festive Flyer, The Festive Flyer
Join us and celebrate Christmas with a delicious lunch and a day out on the train! Saturday 6th December 2025

Get into the festive spirit with Steam Incorporated—perfect for celebrating with colleagues, friends, and family!

Jump onboard our heritage train departing Wellington Station, and nestle down into your seats for a relaxing journey up the coast behind one of our heritage Da class locomotives.

After arriving at the private entry at Tatum, you'll take a short walk across the car park and follow the music into the Pavilion, where we settle in just in time for lunch!

Immerse yourself in a well-crafted meal, created by the talented chefs there. The menu is set to be a classic kiwi style Christmas buffet feast with all the trimmings!

There will be plenty to keep you entertained such as outdoor games, live music, and 2 dinner sittings, so there is plenty of time to tour Tatum, check out Tatum House, and relax in the gardens on the Tatum House Lawn with a drink. You will be advised of your sitting time prior to arrival.

Departing Tatum, climb on board, head to the Lounge Car, grab a drink from the bar and enjoy the journey home. This unforgettable ride hugs the dramatic coastline along the famed Kapiti escarpment, offering sweeping views of the Tasman Sea and rugged cliffs. It’s a rare chance to relive the golden age of rail in one of New Zealand’s most scenic rail corridors as the sun begins to set.

This excursion will be hauled by our 1955-built diesel electric locomotive, Da 1410, and consist of our steel carriages.

Fares (include your return train travel, meal and entertainment)
Adult 13+ yrs - $229
Child 2-12yrs - $189
Infant 0-2yrs - FREE

Thinking of a larger event, or your corporate Christmas Function?
We're pleased to be able to offer some fantastic packages for large groups, or corporate functions with our friends at Tatum. This all inclusive train ride and Christmas lunch combo is a great way to celebrate 2025 with your team! Please contact us via email or call us on 0800 783 264 for a personalized group package.

Please be at your boarding station minimum 10 minutes prior ready to roll, with your tickets, carriage letter and seating allocations at the ready.

Limited Mobility Disclaimer
Tatum does NOT have a platform. This means you must be able to board and disembark the train from ground level with little to no assistance.

Due to the age, design and nature of our heritage carriages, these are not suitable for passengers with limited mobility. If you have any concerns, please contact us on 0800 783 264 to discuss options with our bookings team!

All tickets and seating allocations are sent via email, within 48 hours prior to the departure of this excursion.

Prior booking is essential, make sure you reserve your spot now to avoid missing out on this experience.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
The Wellington Calling Open Mic: Daylight Savings Theme!, Wellington's premier event venue Whisky and Wood is hosting its 5th open mic event: Wellington Calling and we're looking for diverse acts to contribute!

Our last event event had 15 performers and we want you to contribute to the next!

Each performer gets the chance to have a six- minute set with a microphone, guitar and keyboard provided.

This is an originals only event. We want to encourage new creative voices to be heard.

“We want to provide a positive and encouraging environment for established and fledgling acts to shine in. It's a pretty inspiring place to perform,” says host Steven Hood.

Each performer will need to sign up in person before 7pm and registrations of interest need to be emailed to openwandw@gmail.com before May 25.

The feature act is Mustang a upcoming three-piece with dreamy harmonies. Their songs are emotional tributes to clarity, light and wonder. Expect to be moved!

description:
The Epic Zombie Bar Tour - Wellington, The Epic Zombie Bar Tour - Wellington
WELLINGTON's BIGGEST ZOMBIE BAR TOUR!

Join 150+ party-goers in freaky costumes as we crawl through the best party bars in town

About this Event

THE EPIC ZOMBIE BAR TOUR!
Saturday 1st November

Wellington’s BIGGEST ZOMBIE Bar Tour
Prepare yourself for a spine-chilling night like no other! Get ready to experience the ultimate Halloween thrill with 150+ party-goers, all dressed in their freakiest, blood-curdling costumes, crawling through Wellington's best party bars. This event will leave you shaking in your boots while having the time of your (undead) life!
The night kicks off at Vinyl Bar, where you'll be transported to a haunted 1980s retro-themed Halloween drink experience that will have your hair standing on end. Then we creep up Courtenay Place to the Saint Diablo for a Mexican "Day of the Dead" fiesta that will have your soul howling for more. From there, we'll descend into the darkness of Shady Lady, where the scariest surprises lurk around every corner.
But it doesn’t end there! The ghostly tour continues with a visit to El Barrio for another sinister "Day of the Dead" celebration. Finally, brace yourself as we crawl to our final destination, Eva Pub, for Wellington's BIGGEST Halloween Party, where DJ DKAV and special guests will be delivering electrifying beats that will raise the dead!
This will be one wild, spooky night that no soul will forget. But beware, LIMITED TICKETS are available, and this eerie experience WILL SELL OUT.
Join us... if you dare.*Crawl Includes 1 House Drink & Food

description:
Unity Book Club September 2025 | Flesh, About the book: 
A propulsive, hypnotic novel about a man who is unravelled by a series of events beyond his grasp.
Fifteen-year-old István lives with his mother in a quiet apartment complex in Hungary. New to the town and shy, he is unfamiliar with the social rituals at school and soon becomes isolated, with his neighbour – a married woman close to his mother’s age – as his only companion. These encounters shift into a clandestine relationship that István himself can barely understand, and his life soon spirals out of control.
As the years pass, he is carried gradually upwards on the twenty-first century’s tides of money and power, moving from the army to the company of London’s super-rich, with his own competing impulses for love, intimacy, status and wealth winning him unimaginable riches, until they threaten to undo him completely.
Spare and penetrating, Flesh is the finest novel yet by a master of realism, asking profound questions about what drives a life: what makes it worth living, and what breaks it.

Melissa and Eden will be hosting our monthly book club to discuss some of the excellent recently released books.

In September we will be discussing Flesh by David Szalay.

We have limited tickets available so grab a ticket sooner rather then later and tell your friends and whānau.

Drinks and snacks provided. If you have any specific allergies, let us know and send an email.

If you have any further queries send us an email to wellington@unitybooks.co.nz and address it to Melissa.

description:
WCC "Tequila and Salsa night!", Hello again bartenders from all walks of life! Brush up on your Tequila knowledge and your Salsa recipes because the next Wellington Cocktail Competition is just around the corner!
As to the theme for this WCC, it is “Tequila and Salsa food pairing” The hero spirit this time around will be a surprise tequila on the night, but I can tell you it will be a reposado. The catch is, you have to pair it with a salsa that you make yourself. There are no limits on the style of cocktail you want this time around, so get creative!
If you would like to participate, get in touch with me or Dan ASAp as we were running low on time to organize this time around.
Minimum 30ml of Tequila must be used in the drink and as always must be the hero spirit of the night.
You will be making two drinks for the judges to try and 5 minutes to make two servings of your cocktail and serve your salsa.
The judges may also be coerced with bribes and favours during your presentation.
The event will be on 28th of September and the competition will start at 6pm.
If you have any questions about the competition, please ask either me or Dan.
The main aim of this cocktail competition is to help those who may not have entered comps before, gain a bit of confidence and experience, or for people who haven’t entered a comp in a while, to shake off those cobwebs.
It also a chance to meet new people and introduce newcomers to the Wellington bar scene. Most of all the idea is to have fun!
Each competitor will have 5 minutes to make and present two servings of their drink.
All Tequila and corn chips for your salsa will be provided, but you will have to source your own ingredients including citrus and sugar syrup. Glassware and ice will be provided, you are more than welcome to bring specialty equipment and ingredients, however you will be marked on how easy your drink is to replicate.
The competition will be judged by a panel of 3 judges. While knowing your stuff is important, brand knowledge is not the key here. This comp is to engage bartenders in a fun comp environment, so drink and personality are just as important.
Competitors will be first come first serve, so message either me or Dan if you want to be entered, there are 10 spots for the night and there will be prizes for the winner.
There will be drink deals on the night, and make sure you bring your friends, workmates, parents ect ect to cheer you on and heckle the other competitors…
See you all there!

description:
WSKN Christmas Event / SKISL, WSKN Christmas Event / SKISL
Hi everyone - welcome to the WSKN Christmas SKISL / Paddle to Mana!

On Saturday 13th December we will have a Christmas event on Mana Island, departing Titahi Bay at 10am (so arriving at 9:30) getting to Mana around 10:40, keen ones can do stuff prior to lunch around 12:00, then there might be groups that head back at different time slots, but we can work that out on the day. Return could therefore either be 1:30 or 2:30 with the latest return to Titahi Bay being 3pm.

We've made this event later than the normal SKISL so that it's easier for folks to drive down from Palmerston North, and also because it is a lunch event.

The lawn on Mana is really nice, sheltered and pleasant and there are also good walks. Mana is of course a sanctuary so you must check your boats for any wildlife especially ants that may have gotten in past the hatches. Also we cannot have any fires

Plan B: If weather nukes Mana, we'll try for Green Point or Onehunga Bay in Whitireia Park by driving there.

Plan C: We will postpone to 21 December

description:
Steve Sinclair - public lecture, Steve Sinclair - public lecture
'fourth_space, beyond Architecture as a Narcissistic Entity'

LT2 at the School of Architecture and Design VUW.

About this Event

Steve Sinclair is co-founder and director of fourth_space, a practice that seeks to "rescue space to make places," to "recycle bits of left-over architecture," and to make Architecture as "a unifying discipline - politics, regulation, location, design, finance, construction and user experience - that should maintain social and artistic concerns."


https://cdn-az.allevents.in/events10/banners/b883d840-741c-11f0-867e-7d1fd93eb1fd-rimg-w1200-h597-dcd5d5d5-gmir.jpg

Steve studied at the Mackintosh School of Architecture and the Bartlett School before completing an MSc at the London School of Economics. He worked at Morphosis, Ron Arad Associates, FAT (Fashion Architecture Taste), and Harper Mackay (MAK), before joining Paolo Mozzato in 2004, and subsequently Huw Williams, to form fourth_space.
In addition to directing fourth_space Steve is a design advisor to the Hackney Estate Regeneration Design Group, teaches at the AA and is co-owner of award winning Ombra bar & restaurant - where the “Negroni_Talks...!” happen. Available on podcast, these events "promote looser, all-encompassing engagements with greater participation, as well as dispelling false authority and un-challengable ‘expert’ opinions.... "
Steve's lecture is hosted by Te Kāhui Whaihanga ~ New Zealand Institute of Architecture in association with School of Architecture and Design, Victoria University of Wellington ~ Te Herenga Waka and the Architectural Centre.

description:
Watercolour and Wine Night in Whangārei - Wild Viola, Turn wine into watercolour! Take a brush in one hand, a drink in the other, and let’s paint a watercolour masterpiece!

Join us for a beginner's watercolour painting event full of fluid colour mixing and delicate brushwork where you’ll craft your own bespoke watercolour artwork. One of our watercolour experts will guide step-by-step through the watercolour process and will encourage you to add your own unique touch.

Drinks: No drinks are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality watercolour paper, watercolour paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). All our events are in licensed venues, so you can purchase drinks to sip as you create! At the end of the night, you will leave with your own watercolour painting!

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website.

description:
ChoctoberFest, Porirua is the home of New Zealand’s favourite chocolate — Whittaker's. So it's only fitting it has a festival celebrating all things chocolate. During September and October, the city is serving up a range of tasty treats for ChoctoberFest, all featuring Whittaker’s chocolate.
More than 30 local businesses will be competing in the Whittaker’s Bake Off and Top of the Chocs. Head in to participating spots, and try unique chocolate drinks and amazing baked goods. You can then vote for your favourites.
Indulge your tastebuds and try special drinks such as a whipped white choc biscoff latte, or a coldbrew shot choc maltini. For a sweet snack, how about a molten embrace, kunafa chocolate croissant, or a banoffee flossy pie? There are plenty of options for all chocolate lovers, including vegan and gluten free items.
As well as voting for your favourite items, you can join the fan club, share reviews, and be in to win. Up for grabs are 100 Whittaker’s Peanut Slabs, an exclusive tour of the Whittaker’s factory, and ChoctoberFest vouchers for local cafes and bars.
The festival has been running since 2022, and is a highlight of the local hospitality scene.

description:
Wellington Frocktails 2025, Wellington Frocktails 2025
Frocktails: a night of sewcialising, cocktails, delicious snacks and fantastic me-mades!

About this Event

Wellington Frocktails, with our headline sponsor The Fabric Store, celebrates the making of garments. Whether you sew, knit, crochet or stitch, September 6th is the evening to show off your proudest make! Frocktails is a worldwide movement, celebrating me-mades for over 10 years.
Mingle with new sewing friends and say cheers over a shared passion of this craft. Whether you're an expert or beginner, this event is for you.
Included in the ticket price is a welcome cocktail (or non-alcoholic beverage), second beverage, light refreshments, a goodie bag and the chance to win one of the many sewing related prizes. A photographer will be on hand to capture the event and all of your wonderful me-mades! With exclusive use of the venue, the option to purchase other beverages will be available.
You will need to be 18+ to attend this event.

We will play various versions of tag games: such as Ultimate Tag (which involves multiple evaders), Flight Club (which involves king of the hill format), and Chase-Off (the team version, as seen in World Chase Tag competition videos).

description:
NZIFF: Young Mothers, The Dardenne brothers return with a deeply affecting drama exploring the lives of five teen mothers. Hopes and fears steer the young women towards bettering their lives for themselves and their children.

Young Mothers examines the lives of underprivileged teenagers as they come to terms with motherhood for the first time. Living together temporarily in a group home, they are taught how to care for their babies, while grappling with very different personal circumstances. The Dardenne brothers treat the characters with delicate respect while humanising the tumultuous reality that often comes with teenage motherhood.

Jessica, raised in an orphanage, cannot imagine abandoning her child and desperately seeks closure from her birth mother. Julie considers giving up her daughter for adoption, yet her own troubled mother wishes to raise the child to atone for her past mistakes. Brought up by an alcoholic mother, Perla dreams of a stable family, but her delinquent boyfriend wants nothing to do with her or their child. While Ariane has the privilege of a loving partner, both are recovering drug addicts which presents its own challenges.

This is a story of hope told through characters looking for a future free from their past. — Madison Marshall
label: Film & Media

description:
Financial Planning for Retirement, Financially successful people don’t achieve their wealth by accident – they make and execute clear plans. Your retirement is on the horizon and research shows you’re most likely nowhere near financially ready for the retirement you desire and deserve! Get a complete and utterly practical financial plan, so you can have the retirement you want.

Massey University's annual Retirement Expenditure Guidelines study (2019) found:

Just 40% of pre-retirees believed they were well-prepared for retirement, and 57% considered retirement to be a concern. They also confirmed, New Zealand Superannuation is not sufficient to fund the retirement most people want.
Ministry of Social Development (2020):

22% of all people receiving New Zealand Superannuation also receive additional support payments, with over 44,000 superannuants receiving additional accommodation support, and if you needed to obtain Government-assisted accommodation, at the end of March 2020, more than 16,300 households were waiting for state or social housing.

Living in a motel or boarding house with strangers (who may have other vulnerable backgrounds) is not an ideal or safe location to spend your retirement years. But for many, it is the only option they can afford.

If you have not planned for your retirement, then this course is you!

This course has been developed for people in their 50s or 60s that are looking at retirement and have no idea if they can financially survive it: what to do, what $’s they need, how or where they can generate additional income, or even where to go to get help.

It is targeted towards those that still have some time (for some - not much) to make adjustments, learn some basic financial skills, make some big decisions, and positively influence the quality of their pending retirement.

You will be introduced to a simple step by step guide to developing a financial plan for retirement.

You will work through a case study in class, and can then go away and repeat the process with your own data/details. You will be provided with comprehensive course notes to enable you to update the case study information with your own information.

At each step, key considerations and financial concepts will be defined, explained and discussed to help you understand the financial requirements of retirement.

Are you ready for the retirement lifestyle you hoped or dreamed of? If not, then this course is for you.

Disclaimer: The tutors are not financial advisors. No investments, products nor specific recommendations will be provided. A step by step planning process will be taught by working through a case study. Key considerations that should be used by the participants when looking at their own options to bridge the financial gap between what is available through superannuation and what is required to meet lifestyle goals will be provided and discussed. Product names may be used in examples and explanations to help participants understand the financial concepts and the planning process.

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

1 Day
Presented by Paul and Mary-Ellen Gadd.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Choral Connections, The New Zealand Choral Federation (NZCF) presents Choral Connections, a concert featuring two of New Zealand’s finest youth choirs – the acclaimed New Zealand Secondary Students' Choir, directed by Sue Densem, and the Aotearoa Academy Choir, directed by Rowan Johnston and Elise Bradley.

Set in the soaring acoustics of Wellington’s Cathedral of St Paul, this public concert forms the centrepiece of NZCF’s Choral Connect convention – a bi-annual professional development conference that brings together choral directors from around the country.

At the end of the concert, conference delegates with join with the two youth choirs to form a massed choir of over 150 voices to sing under the direction of international choral clinician Dr Pearl Shankuan.

New Zealand Secondary Students' Choir
Aotearoa's national choir for secondary school students, NZSSC gathers during school holidays to rehearse and perform across the motu. Each two-year cycle culminates in an international tour: in July 2024, the choir travelled to China, where they took part in the Shanghai Oriental Art Centre Chorus Exchange, the Chorus and Conducting Art Conference in Hangzhou, and the China International Chorus Festival in Beijing.

NZSSC is directed by Sue Densem, alongside Assistant Conductor and Accompanist Brent Stewart and Assistant Conductor and Vocal Consultant Ben Madden.

Aotearoa New Zealand Academy Choir
The Academy Choir was established as a pipeline for talented singers from across Aotearoa who are aspiring to join NZSSC or the NZ Youth Choir. In 2024, the Academy Choir received a Gold Diploma at the World Choir Games in Auckland.

The Aotearoa Academy Choir is co-directed by Elise Bradley and Rowan Johnston.

Dr Pearl Shangkuan is a highly sought-after conductor, lecturer and clinician who has led performances and workshops on six continents. She is the National President-elect of the American Choral Directors Association (ACDA), the chorus director of the Grand Rapids Symphony and Professor Emerita of Music at Calvin University in Grand Rapids, Michigan. She has conducted several times at Carnegie Hall and other major concert halls in the US. Her guest conducting engagements regularly take her to Europe, Asia, and across North America.
label: Music & Concerts

We aim to provide a platform that supports local artisans, allowing them to showcase their meticulously crafted, high-quality products. By bringing the market directly to the people, we hope to celebrate and promote the unique talents of our community’s skilled artisans.

Come support local at our monthly market in Wellington City on the Waterfront at Wharewaka O Poneke venue.

description:
Blenheim Gypsy Fair, Blenheim Gypsy Fair
The Gypsy Fair is a nationwide travelling event, bringing family fun, live music and an unbeatable vibe to each town we visit.🌞💜

Having been on the road for over 45 years, it’s safe to say our roots run deep. Our people are incredible, and house trucks/buses are pretty cool too! So don’t forget to check out our unique way of living while you’re here 🫶🌿🌻💜

Whether you’re just having a browse, letting the kids loose on our rides, parking up with some food or coffee, or checking out some funky handmade crafts, we would love to see you! Come and hang out for the day, we’re sure to bring smiles to your faces, and create lifelong memories💜

🌞Free entry for everyone🌞 We pride ourselves on being an affordable event for every family. With free entertainment all day, plenty of chill out zones, and loads of life size games laying around, we truely love to see the community getting amongst it all! Can’t wait to see you there🌞👣🐝🌿🌊

Follow us on Facebook – ‘Gypsy Fair’ for updates on our travels and creations! We’re always open to anyone who wants to come and live the dream, so please email us if this sounds like a bit of you. –

description:

description:
Cheesy Lovers by Le Marché Français, Calling all cheese lovers!
Looking for a fun and original night out for two? Whether it’s a romantic date, a chill evening with a friend, or a cozy family moment, our Cheesy Lovers workshop is the perfect plan
What’s on the menu:
Roll up your sleeves and make two fresh cheeses from scratch, step by step, with our expert cheesemongers
Discover the magic of artisan cheesemaking — milk, love, and a little bit of alchemy

Then, get creative and build your very own cheese platter for two — beautiful and delicious
A full spread of charcuterie, fruits, nuts, and condiments will be waiting for you, along with expert tips on pairing and presentation. And of course… tasting is highly encouraged
It’s an intimate, tasty, hands-on experience for anyone who loves good food, good vibes, and of course... cheese
Hosted in our cozy shop
Upcoming dates:
• Fri 1 Aug, 6pm – 7:30pm
• Fri 15 Aug, 6pm – 7:30pm
• Fri 22 Aug, 6pm – 7:30pm
• Fri 29 Aug, 6pm – 7:30pm
Limited spots available — don’t wait to book!
https://www.iticket.co.nz/.../2025/aug/vwoap-cheesy-lovers
Come for the cheese, stay for the memories!
label: Food & Drink

description:
Wow Train Vip Experience Ex Auckland: SOLD OUT, **SOLD OUT** - but limited tickets are still currently available for the Christchurch to Wellington WOW Train and Ferry Experience

Transcend the ordinary on a journey like no other, to a show like no other. This extraordinary experience brings you the Greatest Stages on Earth.

Departing 2nd October, 2025

Beginning in Auckland or Hamilton, you'll witness the unique landscapes of the North Island aboard the Northern Explorer WOW Train. A very special service, full of all things WOW, you'll be treated to a VIP welcome, special WOW garment appearances with accompanying commentary, a WOW goodie bag and full catering during your journey. In Wellington, your journey ascends yet further with premium 'Gold' seats at the World of WearableArt (WOW) Show. This is a WOW experience like no other!

You'll love this break
If you are looking for the ultimate WOW Show experience, then this is the ticket!

Indulge your senses with a unique WOW Train experience through the volcanic heart of the North Island on your way to our stunning capital, Wellington. There, you will continue your journey into the extraordinary with a Gold ticket to see the 2025 World of WearableArt Show.

This magical 3-day experience is set to be one of the greatest journeys of all time!

Inclusions
A 'Gold' ticket for the WOW Show performance on Friday 3 October and a WOW Show Programme
Exclusive WOW Train journey aboard the Northern Explorer on 2 October (where everyone on board will be going to WOW in Wellington!)
Onboard WOW entertainment and goodie bag
Morning tea, lunch, and afternoon tea aboard the train
2-nights accommodation including breakfast
Hotel transfer
Return flight with Air New Zealand

From NZ$1995 per adult

description:
Spy in the Wild, Step into a world of mystery, flavour, and espionage at The Green Man Pub on Wednesday, 23rd October.
Doors open at 6:00pm, with the main event kicking off at 6:30pm. You’ll be welcomed with a sealed mission envelope containing your assignment for the evening. In teams, you’ll work to crack codes, decipher tasting notes, and unravel clues inspired by Spy Valley’s wines and the stories behind them.
Along the way, enjoy five chef-crafted canapés, each perfectly matched with a hand-picked Spy Valley wine. Expect a captivating atmosphere enhanced by lasers and special effects, transforming the pub into a true espionage experience.
🎟️ Tickets from $50 – includes six canapés with wine pairings and your mission dossier. Places are limited, so secure your spot before this top-secret evening sells out.

description:
Erskine Chapel Market & Open Day, Erskine Chapel Market & Open Day
✨ Erskine Chapel Open Day & Craft Market ✨
📅 Sunday, 2 November 2025 | 10:00am – 3:00pm
📍 Erskine Chapel, 31 Avon Street, Island Bay, Wellington

Nestled high on the hillside in Island Bay, Erskine Chapel is a breathtaking and iconic landmark, with sweeping views across the hills and ocean, and a gothic charm that has captured hearts for generations.

Now in its third year, this much loved annual event returns as part of Heritage Month, celebrating the beauty, history, and cultural significance of one of Wellington’s most treasured buildings.

Foxtail Events and The Wellington Company are once again partnering to open the chapel’s doors for the community, inviting everyone to experience this remarkable space brought back to life.

Join us for a special Community Open Day and Craft Market, where you can:

* Explore a curated market of local artisans and makers
* Discover the chapel’s rich history and stunning architecture
* Enjoy live music, freshly brewed coffee, and delicious baked goods

Whether you're drawn by the history, the creativity, or the peaceful atmosphere, this is a day to celebrate local talent and honour the legacy of a true Wellington landmark.

🗓️ Mark your calendar and don’t miss this enchanting day at Erskine Chapel. A place of stories, memories, and timeless beauty, reawakened for a new generation to enjoy.

description:
Foxton Christmas Fair, Foxton Christmas Fair
🎄 Get Ready for a Foxy Christmas Market in Foxton! 🎄

The holiday season is here, and Foxtail Events is bringing the festive cheer to Foxton with a fabulous Foxy Market! 🎅✨

Join us for a fun-filled day with something for everyone:

🍴 Food Trucks – delicious bites to satisfy all tastes

And so much more! ✨

It’s the second year of this magical event, and we can’t wait to celebrate with you all again. Local artisans and craftsmen will showcase their handmade treasures, from stunning ornaments, jewellery, and candles to unique home décor and scrumptious holiday treats.

With the aroma of fresh coffee, tasty food, and the sounds of joyful chatter filling the air, the market will be transformed into a festive wonderland. It’s the perfect place to find that special gift and embrace the community spirit of the season.

Come join us and experience the magic of Christmas in Foxton! 🎁

description:
Our Beloved Indigenous Vegetation - Guided Walk, In this approximately one-hour downhill walk we will obtain a perspective on several native plants from the ubiquitous, such as our well-known cabbage tree, kōwhai and podocarps, to lesser-knowns such as shrubby toroaro/mingimingi, Bartlett's rātā, Three Kings kaikōmako and Three Kings vine/akapukaea. We will also discuss the phenomenon of species radiation exemplified by Hebe and Kauri.

Meet at the Cable Car Entrance Lookout, Upland Road, Kelburn.
Cost: $5 (cash only, please). or free for Friends.

This is part of the regular walks run by the Friends of the Wellington Botanic Garden, they run twice monthly throughout the year with a different topic every time.

Join the Friends for only $30 a year and all the walks will be free, as well as other great benefits.
label: Conservation & Environment

description:
Dear Gentlemen (Colombia), Dear Gentlemen (Colombia)
Director: Patricia Castañeda -

Genre: Drama

About this Event

Dear Gentlemen brings to light the little-known sufraggist movement in Colombia. Set in 1954, the film follows Esmeralda Arboleda, a fiercely intelligent leader who sparks a revolution in a society deeply rooted in patriarchal traditions - a revolution that culminates in a fierce and decisve debate. A women group embarks on a historic struggle to bring the issue of women's right to vote before the National Constituent Assembly. With bold marches, radio appearances, and a brilliant media strategy that puts them on the front page, they achieve their goal, but the real challenge begins during the debate, where they face fierce opposition. Esmeralda Arboleda must endure personal attacks from the assembly members, and just as she is about to speak, she receives a heartbreaking call: her son has suffered a serious accident. She is torn between her duty as a mother and her commitment to the cause, with an unfavorable outcome. Although all seems to be lost, her perseverance leads to a historic victory when women's suffrage is finally approved, marking a turning point in Colombia's history.
label: Film & Media

description:

Hutt City Night Market

📍 Location: Dowse Square, Laings Road, Lower Hutt
📅 Date: Thursday, 4 September 2025
🕓 Time: 4:00 PM – 8:00 PM
💥 Cost: Free Entry

🌙✨ Join us for the Hutt City Night Market – a new weekly night market bringing food, flavour, and fun to the heart of Lower Hutt!

Come down to Dowse Square every Thursday from 4–8PM, rain or shine, and enjoy a handpicked line up of local food trucks serving a delicious range of cuisines. It’s the perfect way to unwind after work, catch up with friends and whānau, and support small local businesses.

Expect:

🎶 Laid-back vibes and community spirit
🛍️ A weekly night out to look forward to

📢 We’ll be announcing weekly vendor line ups and tasty updates on our Wellington Street Eats Hub Facebook page — so be sure to like and follow us to stay in the loop!

#HuttCityNightMarket #LowerHuttEats #StreetFoodVibes #SupportLocal #NightMarketNZ

description:
Kapiti Wedding & Events Expo 2026, Kapiti Wedding & Events Expo 2026
Get ready for a day of love, celebration, and unforgettable inspiration at the Kapiti Wedding & Events Expo 2026 – the Kapiti Coast’s premier event for anyone planning a wedding, special event, or milestone celebration. Taking place on Sunday, 19 April 2026, from 10am to 3pm at the Paraparaumu Memorial Hall, this vibrant expo brings together over 40 of the region’s top wedding and event professionals, all in one beautiful space. Best of all? Entry is completely FREE!

From breathtaking florals and stunning venue styling to expert celebrants, creative photographers, world-class entertainment, and delectable food and drink offerings, this expo has it all. Whether you’re newly engaged, planning a birthday bash, organising a corporate event, or simply love all things celebration, the Kapiti Wedding & Events Expo is your one-stop destination for inspiration and expert advice.

This year’s expo promises an immersive experience packed with exclusive show-only offers, giveaways, and dazzling live performances on the Main Stage. Meet the creative minds behind Kapiti’s most iconic celebrations, explore dreamy decor ideas, and uncover the latest wedding and event trends that will help you bring your vision to life. Our hand-picked exhibitors are the best in the business, offering fresh ideas and tailored solutions to make your event truly unforgettable.

But that’s not all – your free ticket also unlocks exclusive deals across the Kapiti Coast. From boutique shopping and cosy cafes to scenic stays and local attractions, our Explore Kapiti program gives you access to fantastic discounts and experiences from our local business partners. Simply show your expo ticket to take advantage of these offers while you’re in town.

The Kapiti Wedding & Events Expo is proudly brought to you by Kapiti Castles, experienced event organisers who understand how to make moments magical. With a deep love for creativity, community, and connection, we’ve crafted this event to help you dream big and plan with confidence.

So don’t miss out – grab your free tickets today and join us for an extraordinary day of discovery, excitement, and inspiration. Whether you're planning a wedding, a party, or something truly unique, this is where your perfect celebration begins.
label: Markets & Fairs

description:
Hutt Japan Day 2025, Hutt Japan Day 2025
Hutt Japan Day is back!
Join us for a vibrant celebration of Japanese culture at the Hutt Japan Day festival, held at the Lower Hutt Town Hall, Dowse Square & Dowse Art Gallery on Sunday, 9 November.

Celebrating 30 Years of Friendship
This year's event is extra special, marking 30 years of partnership with Minoh City, our sister city in Osaka, Japan. The festival is organised by the Hutt Minoh House Friendship Trust, with support from the Hutt City Council and the Embassy of Japan.

What’s on offer?
• Be captivated by an array of Japanese performances and demonstrations
• Engage in hands-on activities and workshops
• Immerse yourself in the exhilarating rhythms of taiko drumming
• Indulge in delectable Japanese cuisine from one of our food vendors/stalls
• Explore our market area for unique Japanese treasures

Get Involved!
To participate in this special celebration as a performer, artist, cultural group, demonstration, market or food vendor, please visit our website for more details and registration forms: https://www.huttminoh.org.nz/participate-in-hutt-japan-day-2025

Save the Date - Sunday, 9 November 2025
Lower Hutt Town Hall, Dowse Square & The Dowse Art Museum

We look forward to celebrating the richness of Japanese culture with you!

description:
Kapiti Botanist Market, Kāpiti Coast, Get Ready – The Botanist Market is Coming to You!

Foxtail Events is beyond excited to bring the beloved Botanist Market to the Kāpiti Coast for the very first time — and we can’t wait to share it with you! Join us at the Paraparaumu Memorial Hall for a lush, leafy celebration of all things green, gorgeous, and garden-inspired.

Whether you're a seasoned plant whisperer or simply love beautiful spaces filled with botanical charm, this market is your perfect winter escape!

Expect a vibrant mix of:
* Indoor & outdoor plants
* Botanical art, fashion & homewares
* Ceramics, planters & garden decor
* Natural skincare & eco beauty products
* Seedlings, garden tools & plant accessories
... and so much more!

This is more than just a market — it’s a community of plant lovers, creatives, and eco-conscious makers coming together in one gorgeous space.

Come see why the Botanist Market has captured hearts across Wellington — and now, it's your turn, Kāpiti! Bring a friend, bring your plant wishlist, and don’t miss this brand new local gem.

description:
Khandallah Spring Market, Step into spring and join us at the twilight Khandallah Spring Market, hosted by Foxtail Events!

Nestled against the charming backdrop of Khandallah Town Hall, this vibrant market is the perfect place to explore an eclectic mix of arts, crafts, plants, and unique gifts.

Discover a wide variety of high-quality items from talented local stallholders, including:

• Beautiful plants, fresh flowers, and seedlings
• Handcrafted jewellery, clothing, bags, and accessories
• Cozy crochet and knitted toys, wool products, and homewares
• Scented candles, skincare, soaps, and wheat bags
• Pottery, ceramics, wooden products, and carvings
• Pet accessories, baby and children's items, and much more!

Come enjoy the evening sun, sample delicious local food, and get a head start on your holiday shopping!

Most stalls will accept cash or Eftpos, but it's best to bring cash as well.

We look forward to seeing you there!
label: Markets & Fairs

description:
Polymer Clay Jewellery Workshop, Step right up and join the magic of the Greytown Festival of Christmas with our whimsical,
carnival inspired creative workshops! 

Starting from the 28th of June and running through every weekend in July, these happy little workshops are your chance to make up to three beautiful handmade treasures—choose from unique jewellery from modern pieces to novelty, colourful bookmarks featuring dainty little books, charming pot plant pendants, or eye-catching pieces perfect for necklaces or key chains. With a palette of beautiful pastels and bright colours and materials to spark your imagination, this hands-on experience is perfect for adults of all skill levels.

Whether you’re looking to get crafty with friends, make meaningful gifts, or simply try something new, this is one festive activity you won’t want to miss. Spaces are limited and workshops will book up fast—so get in quick to secure your spot! All adults are welcome; Suitable for ages 10+ with a participating adult (separate ticket required for each attendee). Let the fun begin!

description:
Labour Weekend Market, Labour Weekend Market
There’s nothing more fun than a stroll around the Labour Weekend Sunday Riversdale Beach Market.
Visit a collection of local growers, bakers and producers and find unique, one-of-a-kind items.
So pop us on your Wairarapa playlist!

Want to sell you art, produce, plants or crafts? Stalls are limited to 40 spots and more than half are already booked again. Stalls are $20 each for a 3m x 3m spot.
Email to receive a booking form.
Be aware, this is the only way to reserve a spot - scammers will pretend to offer places.

Stall fees are donated to the Riversdale Beach Lifesaving Club.

PS Bring cash as there is no ATM at the beach.

#Wairarapa #RiversdaleBeachRocks #Market #Fun #Family #BeachLife #Gifts #ChristmasShopping

description:
Lightbody Jewellery Pop-Up at Copperfield Collective, Lightbody Jewellery Pop-Up at Copperfield Collective
✨ Lightbody Jewellery Pop-Up at Copperfield Collective ✨

Saturday 6th September · 11am – 2pm · Paraparaumu

For one day only, Lightbody Jewellery is journeying to Paraparaumu.

We’re honoured to be welcomed into Copperfield Collective, bringing with us a collection of our most sought-after treasures.

💫 Meet the maker – learn the stories and symbols hidden in every piece.

💫 Try on sacred treasures – jewellery alive with meaning, energy, and transformation.

💫 Feel the magic woven into silver and gold – creations that choose their keepers.

About Lightbody Jewellery

We are a small New Zealand brand, born from nothing but vision and persistence, built piece by piece, story by story. Lightbody Jewellery grew out of a desire to carry ancient symbols into the present, weaving spirit into matter so that jewellery could once again guide, teach, and protect.

Every pendant, ring, and talisman is handcrafted here in Aotearoa with intention. They are not made to follow trends, they are made to awaken, to empower, to transform.

What began as a spark has grown into a living brand carried by intuition, mystery, and craft. Each piece finds its keeper when the time is right.

This pop-up at Copperfield Collective is more than a display.
It’s a rare chance to meet the maker, hold the work, and feel which treasure has been waiting for you.

✨ Lightbody Jewellery Pop-Up
📍 Copperfield Collective - 17 Seaview Road, Paraparaumu Beach
📅 Saturday 6th September
🕚 11am – 2pm

description:
Hutt City Night Market - Dowse Square - 4 Sepember 2025, Hutt City Night Market - Dowse Square - 4 Sepember 2025
Hutt City Night Market

📍 Location: Dowse Square, Laings Road, Lower Hutt
📅 Date: Thursday, 4 September 2025
🕓 Time: 4:00 PM – 8:00 PM
💥 Cost: Free Entry

🌙✨ Join us for the Hutt City Night Market – a new weekly night market bringing food, flavour, and fun to the heart of Lower Hutt!

Come down to Dowse Square every Thursday from 4–8PM, rain or shine, and enjoy a handpicked line up of local food trucks serving a delicious range of cuisines. It’s the perfect way to unwind after work, catch up with friends and whānau, and support small local businesses.

Expect:
🍔 Tasty street food from around the world
🎶 Laid-back vibes and community spirit
🛍️ A weekly night out to look forward to

📢 We’ll be announcing weekly vendor line ups and tasty updates on our Wellington Street Eats Hub Facebook page — so be sure to like and follow us to stay in the loop!

This is just the beginning — we’ll be at Dowse Square for the first 4 weeks, before moving to our long-term home on Daly Street by the Riverbank Carpark with even more food trucks!

Bring your appetite, tell your mates, and we’ll see you there!

#HuttCityNightMarket #LowerHuttEats #StreetFoodVibes #SupportLocal #NightMarketNZ

description:
Pukeahu Archaeology Tour, What lies beneath Pukeahu?

The construction of Pukeahu National War Memorial Park revealed a wealth of archaeological discoveries, some expected, others surprising.

Join Principal Archaeologists Sarah Phear and Richard Shakles from Underground Overground Archaeology for a special guided tour of the park. Hear firsthand about the excavation process, uncover the stories behind the artefacts, and view a selection of conserved items unearthed from beneath Pukeahu.

The tour begins at the fountain below the Tomb of the Unknown Warrior.
This is an accessible tour. Bring clothing for the weather and any burning questions.

description:
Old St Paul's Craft & Curio Market, Discover Wellington’s Most Enchanting Market!
Set against the breathtaking backdrop of one of Te Whanganui-a-Tara’s most iconic heritage landmarks, the Old St Paul’s Craft & Curio Market is a boutique shopping experience like no other.
As part of this year’s Wellington Heritage Festival, the grounds of Old St Paul’s will be transformed into a vibrant marketplace filled with handpicked stalls offering treasures and treats you won’t find anywhere else. Explore lovingly crafted leather goods, upcycled garments, wellness creations, handmade chocolates, collectibles and curiosities, houseplants, dyed wool, children’s accessories, fine embroidery, jams and preserves, artisan breads and baked goods, Christmas decorations, candles, and so much more.
But it’s not just shopping – this is a day steeped in atmosphere. The lawn and forecourt will come alive with heritage-themed games and activities, alongside captivating live demonstrations from the Wellington Embroiderers’ Guild and the Wellington Combined Society of Bellringers.
With its central location just minutes from the Railway Station and bus hub – and plenty of on-street parking – this is your chance to enjoy a heritage day out that’s easy to get to, and unforgettable once you arrive.
Fun for the whole whānau, supporting the ongoing care of this national treasure.
Schedule:
Guided tours of Old St Paul's: 10.30am/11.30am
Wellington Combined Society of Bellringers demonstration: 12.00pm-12.45pm
Wellington Embroiderers' Guild stitching demonstration: 10.00am-2.00pm
Organ performance: 1.00pm-2.00pm
Koha entry. Refreshments available.

description:
Enjoy Singing? Open Night with Hutt City Chorale, Join us for a fun night of choral singing. Come along to our open night at St Marks Church, 58 Woburn Road, Lower Hutt. You will be very welcome to join us in our warm ups and singing.

We’ll provide you with music for the evening. Meet our fun and creative Music Director Jonathan Berkahn and talented pianist Phillip O’Malley plus our friendly choir, for an enjoyable evening of singing.

We start the evening with our vocal warm ups at 7.15pm, sing beautiful music together, stop for a delicious supper half way through, then continue singing until 9.15pm. If you would like to return, you can join us for up to four free visits. After that time, you can decide whether you would like to join Hutt City Chorale as a member.

We welcome new members and invite you to join us in 2025. Contact Prue, our chairperson, with any questions huttcitychorale@gmail.com or visit www.facebook.com/HuttCityChorale. We look forward to seeing you there and singing together. Join us for an enjoyable evening.

description:
Queensgate Night Market, What started as a humble food market in a suburban Auckland carpark has grown into one of New Zealand’s most popular evening destinations. The Auckland Night Markets bring together street food, community, and live entertainment - and from the 27th September 2025, Queensgate Night Market will be joining the family!
Our market offers a vibrant atmosphere, showcasing an ever-evolving mix of global cuisines, handmade goods, and live entertainment - from buskers to magicians and cultural performers. It’s this unique blend of flavour, fun, and family-friendly energy that’s helped us become a staple in the weekday and weekend plans of thousands of Kiwis.

description:
Aurora High Tea, A tribute to the Aurora Australis and the first flare of dawn. Ignite your senses and ascend through tiers of radiant, jewel-toned creations.
As Wellington embraces the creativity of World of Wearable Art®, indulge in a culinary journey unlike any other, perfectly complementing the magic of this year's show. Explore our menus below.
Booking is essential.
---
AURORA HIGH TEA
$60 PER PERSON

Goat’s cheese gougère
Salmon & horseradish roulade
Vegetable madras vol-au-vent
Crab finger sandwich
Brandy-soaked sultana scone & cream
Apricot macaron
Calamansi mille-feuille
Poached pear & frangipane tart
Forest berry delice

Served with bottomless T.W.G. Tea


Please note that our Aurora High Tea menu cannot be adapted to accommodate dietary or allergy restrictions.
Our Classic High Tea menu can be adapted to vegetarian, vegan and gluten-free diets.
---
CLASSIC HIGH TEA
$55 PER PERSON

Coronation chicken sandwich
Braised lamb vol-au-vent, feta cream
Parmesan-crumbed bacon hock croquette, apple purée, mustard fruits
Smoked salmon mousse, beetroot, buckwheat blini
Parmesan custard tart
White chocolate and raspberry profiterole, pâté de fruits
Macaron of the day
Rhubarb meringue tartlet
Pear scone with vanilla cream

Served with bottomless T.W.G. Tea

Our Classic High Tea menu can be adapted to vegetarian, vegan and gluten-free diets.
---

CHILDREN'S HIGH TEA
AVAILABLE FOR UNDER 12 YEAR OLDS | $25 PER PERSON


Ham and cheese slider
Fried chicken
Mini pizza
Oat cookie
Strawberry jam pop pie
Scone of the day

---

Terms and Conditions & Cancellation Policy
Our Aurora High Tea cannot be modified for dietary requirements. However, our Classic High Tea is available in a Vegetarian, Vegan and Gluten Free version. Please note, we are unable to accommodate dietary requirements without prior notice.
If not already stated and confirmed at the time of reservation, guest numbers must be confirmed 48 hours prior to arrival.
A credit card must be provided at the time of reservation to secure the booking.
High Tea reservations cancelled within 24 hours prior to arrival will incur a cancellation fee of 100% of the total booking.
No-shows will be charged a cancellation fee of 100% of the total booking.
Decreases in attendee numbers will not be accepted within 24 hours before arrival, and charges will apply based on the confirmed final count.

description:
The Mad Hatter's Market Express, The Mad Hatter's Market Express

Journey with Steam Inc on this return trip to the Woodville Mad Hatter's Market Day!

Bring the family up into the heart of the Manawatu on the steam train, and enjoy a fun filled day at Woodville's famed Mad Hatter's Market Day. Hauled by Ja 1271, our 1956 built steam locomotive. Join the train at Paekakariki, Paraparaumu, Waikanae, Otaki, Levin or Palmerston North. Upon arrival at Woodville, there is the option to walk up to the square, or travel by shuttle bus up.

Woodville 150th Mad Hatter's Day
Since 2017, the local Woodville community have hosted this special event in the heart of the township celebrating all thing's 'mad'! Bring the kids along for a children's tea party and old time games - with a particular focus on steampunk. Featuring live music, over 70 market stalls and most importantly - the annual Crazy Hat Competition! Last year, people on our train took away 1st place!

Spot prizes are to be given out throughout the day for best costumes and hats, and an array of vouchers will also be up for grabs!

Please be at your boarding station minimum 10 minutes prior ready to roll, with your tickets, carriage number and seating allocations at the ready.

Please note that if booking online, our booking system does add on a small percentage to the above fares. Steam Incorporated does not see this revenue.

Mad Hatters Menu
The wonderful team has put together an array of food trucks for all to enjoy at the market, and you can also support the local cafes of Woodville township. There will also be tea/coffee available on board the train, along with some alcoholic beverages and light snacks.

We can cater for larger group bookings - these are best dealt with directly through us by emailing admin@steaminc.org.nz or contacting 0800 783 264.

Book the Mad Hatters Market Express!
All seating is reserved and allocated on these special experiences. Prior booking is essential.

Limited Mobility Disclaimer
Due to the age, design and nature of our heritage carriages, these are not suitable for passengers with limited mobility. If you have any concerns, please contact us on 0800 783 264 to discuss options with our bookings team!

description:

Hutt City Night Market

📍 Location: Dowse Square, Laings Road, Lower Hutt
📅 Date: Thursday, 4 September 2025
🕓 Time: 4:00 PM – 8:00 PM
💥 Cost: Free Entry

🌙✨ Join us for the Hutt City Night Market – a new weekly night market bringing food, flavour, and fun to the heart of Lower Hutt!

Come down to Dowse Square every Thursday from 4–8PM, rain or shine, and enjoy a handpicked line up of local food trucks serving a delicious range of cuisines. It’s the perfect way to unwind after work, catch up with friends and whānau, and support small local businesses.

Expect:
🍔 Tasty street food from around the world
🎶 Laid-back vibes and community spirit
🛍️ A weekly night out to look forward to

📢 We’ll be announcing weekly vendor line ups and tasty updates on our Wellington Street Eats Hub Facebook page — so be sure to like and follow us to stay in the loop!

This is just the beginning — we’ll be at Dowse Square for the first 4 weeks, before moving to our long-term home on Daly Street by the Riverbank Carpark with even more food trucks!

Bring your appetite, tell your mates, and we’ll see you there!

#HuttCityNightMarket #LowerHuttEats #StreetFoodVibes #SupportLocal #NightMarketNZ

description:
Blossom Valley: Wellington's Cherry Blossom Festival, Blossom Valley: Wellington's Cherry Blossom Festival
Wellington's annual spring cherry blossom festival is back this September 🌸 A must-see event with 350+ cherry blossom trees creating a sea of pink 🌸

⭐ 'After Dark' evening light experience tickets now on sale.

📷 Capture gram-worthy photos and videos under the blossoms, and find our viral style photo spots including a giant living love heart, a swing, a boat (new this year!), a giant frame, and more

🛏️ Book a night in our chalet accomodation and wake up to a sea of pink 🌸

☕ Pre-purchase a delightful high tea alongside your ticket for the full experience (bookings required)☕

Weekends often sell out so make sure you have pre-purchased tickets online to secure your car park as spaces are limited. We hate to have to turn cars away when tickets are sold out so please do pre-purchase your tickets this year for weekends!! 🚗

🌸 New This Year - Flexi Passes
This pass allows you to come on whichever day you like. Not sure about the weather or at what level of blossom the trees are then this is for you. Purchase this ticket and come during the day on whichever day and time you like. (These tickets do NOT cover the After Dark experience).

Shuttles are available from Wellington, Palmerston North, Masterton or (anywhere!) with Capital Shuttles. With bookings available from 1 person, up to a 54 seater bus, they are the ideal way to get to and from Aston Norwood Gardens 🚌

Our in house photographer Lilia will be back again offering affordable professional photography sessions - perfect for family photos, couple photos, solo, friend groups, or even secret engagements! 📷

🌸 Blossom Valley is more than an event—it’s a fleeting moment of beauty, peace, and connection with nature. We can’t wait to share it with you. 🌸

-
In 1994, inspired by visits to Japan, owners Mark and Fiona Rammell planted over 350 Sakura Cherry Blossoms and are now seeing their dream burst into life each Spring.

Blossom Valley is an annual spring celebration sure to put the spring in your step as you explore the 14 acres of garden with New Zealand’s highest number and density of mature cherry blossom trees in the one place. For just a short amount of time each year at Aston Norwood Gardens in Kaitoke, Upper Hutt, hundreds of cherry trees come alive creating a canopy of pink blossom.

The event is carefully scheduled around the natural blossoming of the trees, with data from previous years informing the date selection. While the team at Blossom Valley do their best to ensure the ultimate blossom experience the timing of the bloom is up to mother nature.

description:
Comfy Concert 6 - The Chamber Pot Pourri Ensemble to benefit Kaibosh, Comfy Concert 6 - The Chamber Pot Pourri Ensemble to benefit Kaibosh
Comfy Concert Number 6 � Saturday 20 September, 4 - 6PM
� Enjoy Beautiful Chamber Music with a View �
Relax with a cuppa while listening to expertly curated chamber music from The Chamber Pot Pourri Ensemble, to benefit Kaibosh Food Rescue.

Helene Pohl (violin) and Rolf Gjelsten (cello) with Peter Gjelsten (violin) Nicholas Hancox (viola) performing:
GF Händel - Trio Sonata
Dmitri Shostakovich – Quartet No. 8
Niccolò Paganini - Selection of Caprices for Violin Solo
Felix Mendelssohn – Quartet Opus 13 in a minor

Tickets - at Humanitix link above:
$40 General Admission
$5 Under 18

Doors open from 3:30pm.
Please join us for a cup of coffee or tea and get comfy before the performance starts after 4pm. You can also meet Kaibosh team members on site, to ask them questions and learn about the food recue charity.

Location:
The Long Hall is a hidden gem - the intimate venue with the best view in Wellington! Couches, chairs, cushions… you choose your comfort level. The hall is on the hillside overlooking Point Jerningham with views of Te Whanganui-a-Tara / Wellington Harbour. See the Google map location. You can park on Maida Vale Rd or on Roseneath School tennis court and follow the signs. Or on foot or bike, use the footpath up from Carlton Gore Road or from Maida Vale Road near Roseneath School.

Wainuiomata Artisan Craft Market (20/09/25), Wainuiomata Artisan Craft Market (20/09/25)
The Artisan Craft Market is a premium handmade event that takes place across various locations in the broader Wellington region. This high-quality market is designed to foster a welcoming and friendly atmosphere.

Our vision at Artisan Craft Market is to make the market accessible to those who appreciate shopping locally. We aim to provide a platform that supports local artisans, allowing them to showcase their meticulously crafted, high-quality products. By bringing the market directly to the people, we hope to celebrate and promote the unique talents of our community’s skilled artisans while creating opportunities to engage with Wainuiomata’s community and identity.

description:
Wairarapa Farmers' Market, The Wairarapa Farmers’ Market is held every Saturday from 9am to 1pm (rain or shine!) at the Solway Showgrounds Masterton. Entry is off State Highway 2 or the by pass, onto Judds Rd. There is plenty of car parking and a camping ground for NZMCA Members

Picnic tables are situated underneath the majestic Redwood Tree for you to sit and enjoy a coffee and something to eat while listening to live music. Plus you get to take home quality, delicious produce grown seasonally within the Wairarapa region. It makes for a great morning's outing.

Enjoy breakfast, brunch or lunch and pick up your dinner items with locally produced coffee, eggs, meat, berries, bread, jam, fruit, olive oil, pastries, pies, pickles, slices, cakes, soup, vegetables and more. Shop for plants, seedlings, seaweed, artisan goods including wood turning, Māori weaving, children’s and baby clothes, aprons, peg aprons, tea towels, knitted and crochet toys and hand dyed knitting wools.
Sign up for our regular Wairarapa Farmers' Market newsletter here https://mailchi.mp/d99e1ad65a18/newsletter-sign-up or join us on Facebook to get updates on all the Market goodness! Dogs are welcome to the market and a dog bowl can be provided. See you on Saturday!

"From Paddock to Plate Since 2006"

description:
Wellington Botanist Expo, Wellington Botanist Expo
🌿🍻 Wellington, get ready for the ultimate green-meets-brews experience!

The Wellington Botanist Expo is hitting Brewtown, Upper Hutt on Sunday, 26 October 2025, and it's going to be a bloomin’ brilliant day out! 🌼✨

Whether you’ve got a jungle at home or you're just starting your plant parent journey, this is THE botanical event you don’t want to miss. Set in the heart of Brewtown, with its buzzing vibe and family-friendly fun, it’s your one-stop destination for plants, pints, and pure inspiration.

🌿 Here’s what’s waiting for you:
🪴 A paradise of indoor & outdoor plants, seedlings, seeds & greenery galore
🛍️ Gorgeous pots, planters & plant accessories to style your space
🌸 Stunning dried flower arrangements & botanical crafts
🎨 Eye-catching garden sculptures, outdoor art & furniture ideas
🎁 Unique creations from local artists & plant-loving crafters

🍻 And yes – it’s Brewtown, so there’s plenty of craft beer and good vibes to enjoy while you shop!

🚆 Getting here is easy – hop on the train from Wellington City and arrive right at the venue, hassle-free.
🚗 Ample FREE parking also available for drivers.
🍔 Food, drinks & licensed venues onsite
👨‍👩‍👧‍👦 Family-friendly fun for all ages!

📅 Save the date: Sunday, 26 October 2025 | 9am – 2pm
📍 Location: Brewtown, Upper Hutt

✨ Come for the plants, stay for the brews, and leave totally inspired.
It’s the botanical event of the season – don’t miss out! 🌿🍺

#BrewsAndBotany #WellingtonBotanistExpo #BrewtownMarkets #FoxtailEvents #PlantLoversParadise #SupportLocalNZ #UpperHuttEvents

description:
Film Talks at Aratoi presents The Mummy (1932), Film Talks at Aratoi presents The Mummy (1932)
Get ready for a night of cinematic chills and festive frights! This year, Film Talks dives into 1930s Hollywood Gothic Horror with the legendary Universal Classic Monsters series.
Part two of the trilogy is The Mummy (1932) — starring Boris Karloff in one of his most iconic roles. With its haunting tale of ancient curses, forbidden love, and timeless terror, this Gothic classic remains a spellbinding piece of Hollywood horror history.
Venue: Aratoi, 12 Bruce Street, Masterton
Doors open: 6:45 pm | Film starts: 7 pm, Tuesday 28 September
Running time: 73 minutes
Recommended: Ages 9+
Reserve you seats. Koha welcome — suggested $5. Your contribution helps keep Film Talks alive and accessible for our community.
Presented by Film Talks, in association with Aratoi Museum of Art and History.
Step into the shadows… and uncover the timeless horror of The Mummy!

description:
Climate Action Week Marlborough 2026, Climate Action Week 2026 - Agenda
Dates: February 2026 - 23rd - 27th February
Theme: Leading by Doing: Local Businesses, Local Solutions, Collective Action
Each day features:
Morning: Local Business Story Sessions (Curated stories for our business community to get inspired with raw, honest and authentic stories)
Midday: Action Design Workshops (Crafting Plans & Solutions)
Afternoon: Immersion Experiences and Hands-On Field Visits (Applied Learning & Practical Support)
Day 1 - Water, Risk and Resilience 
Morning: Marlborough businesses facing water risks (horticulture, viticulture, manufacturing, nature, tourism) share adaptation stories: irrigation shifts, stormwater projects, water reuse innovations.
Midday: Business-specific water risks and trials of resilience-building solutions.
Afternoon: Immersion experiences to diverse water initiatives across the region
Day 2 - Circular economy & waste
Morning: Circular leaders (including wine, food and beverages, building, construction, fisheries, nature) show how they have reduced waste, repurposed byproducts, or created new revenue streams from "waste."
Midday: Waste Challenge Mapping: Identify business-specific waste streams + select 1 trial action for next 6 months.
Afternoon: Immersion experiences to waste initiatives and innovative approaches across the region
Day 3 - Nature and Biodiversity 
Morning: Farmers, viticulturists & landscapers share regenerative planting, biodiversity corridors, and ecosystem services initiatives.
Midday: Biodiversity on Your Site Toolkit Workshop — Co-design biodiversity plans for business properties (guided by local ecologists & farming leaders)
Afternoon: Immersion experiences to nature, land and biodiversity initiatives across the region.
Day 4 - Energy & Carbon
Morning: Businesses share their real decarbonisation journeys: EV transitions, renewable installations, process efficiencies — including the unexpected savings, costs and impacts.
Midday: Carbon Reduction Sprints — Design quick-win carbon actions + long-term projects with support from energy consultants and local peers.
Afternoon: Site visits to Carbon and Energy initiatives across the region
Day 5 - Taking the courage to act
Morning: Businesses share how they initiated climate actions, including failures, lessons, and unexpected wins.
Midday: Climate Action Map Workshop — Business leaders build their tailored action roadmaps (guided by peers + facilitators).
Afternoon: Immersion to unique businesses focussed on climate resilience
Immersion Experience Hosts Confirmed
Yealands Estate Winery
Carbonscape
Wineworks
Climate Action Marlborough has had the support of Yealands Estate Wines from its inception and we are super grateful to have their support for Climate Action Week Marlborough 2026. They are committed to influencing the Marlborough business community, driving collaboration that impacts climate resilience, education, health and wellbeing of a thriving region and growing our regions expertise.
label: Conservation & Environment

description:
Jazz in Martinborough 2025, Big Band Brings Back the Swing
Jazz in Martinborough 2025

Jazz in Martinborough is thrilled to be bringing you the Royal New Zealand Airforce Jazz Orchestra as our feature act on Saturday at the festival for 2025.

“We’re delighted to be able to fill the stage with a full-sized big band of fabulous musicians, and the Town Hall with the fantastic sounds of the big band era,” says Jazz in Martinborough Music Director Lee Quayle.

Jazz in Martinborough is back for their 13th edition during the first weekend in September with ticketed shows on Friday 5th and Saturday 6th and other gigs around town as usual. “The RNZAF Jazz Orchestra will be one of our ticketed gigs, featuring on the Saturday evening,” says Lee. “And on Friday night we invite you to Be Transported back in time to a speak easy club with the superb swing and blues combo that is April’s Fools,” adds Lee.

Staying true to the tradition of swing and improvisation the RNZAF Jazz Orchestra draws on their own rich history dating back to the original ‘swing era’. The Orchestra is a national trailblazer in big band history and features New Zealand compositions, and a classic repertoire from the golden era of big band swing jazz of Ellington and Basie.

The band benefits from a depth of talent that most military bands around the world would only dream of and is made up of Wellington’s most exceptional musicians.

“The line-up will be a who’s who of the Wellington jazz scene,” says Lee. “It’s a while since we had a big band at the festival, so we’re elated to have the Airforce Jazz Orchestra back with us again. They last played at the festival in 2014. Many of the band members have been here since, but not as part of a big band,” says Lee.

Be Transported by April’s Fools
Imagine stepping back in time to a speak easy club. A smoky, dimly lit room where the anticipation is electric but the vibe is laid-back and relaxed. . .

From the stage a jazz swing and blues band begins to play, their instruments blending seamlessly in a harmonious symphony of sound. The rhythm section, with its upright bass and snare drums, lays down a groove that's impossible to resist, while the saxophone punctuates the air with soulful notes.

At. the forefront stands a captivating female singer, her voice rich and velvety, weaving tales of heartache, joy, and everything in between. Her vocal prowess brings both swing and blues to life, effortlessly moving from sultry, slow blues ballads to energetic, foot-tapping swing numbers.

This band doesn't just play music; they create an experience that transports the audience to another era, where the essence of jazz and blues reigns supreme.

Welcome to an evening of superb swing jazz and blues brought to you by the band that is April’s Fools. “We’re absolutely wrapt to be bringing this ultra-talented and experienced combo to the festival,” says Music Director Lee Quayle. “Whenever, and wherever this group of musicians have played reviewers have to search the thesaurus for new superlatives to describe the show, and audiences leave reluctantly, but happy.”

April’s Fools are April Phillips (vocals), Greg Crayford (drums), Zak Dikvert (guitar), Nicholas Bauke-Maunsell (saxophone), Miles Crayford (keyboards) and RoryMacartney (bass). They will be playing at Jazz in Martinborough on Friday 5 September 2025 as the opening of the ticketed festival gigs to be held in the Town Hall.

description:
Albi & the Wolves, Gate opens 7pm Music Starts 7.30pm Wednesday 1st October 2025
Auckland based Albi and the Wolves set fire to stages and fill hearts with hope with their energetic and relatable alternative indie folk songs. Proud albino frontman Albi (Chris Dent), Pascal Roggen and Michael Young have crafted a stage show brimming with energy yet with pauses for reflection. The trio has a huge sound created simply by acoustic guitar, electric violin, double bass and three voices. Since 2014, Albi & the Wolves have gone from strength to strength touring Australia, New Zealand and Rarotonga. In 2018, they took home the Best Folk Artist Award at the NZVMAs.
What makes the band special is their sense of community. Whether it’s connection through dance, singing or laughter, their performances inspire audiences to keep coming back for more. Just love them!
Come along and enjoy their great gig in our special space, up close and personal.
Not for profit, supporting our dedicated musicians. Suggested donation $40
Teas, Coffee and Snacks provided. You're welcome to bring anything you'd like to eat or drink.
Parking available in the Coupon zones of Upland Rd & Glasgow St free after 6pm weekdays, and free all through the weekends. The Wilson Carpark at the top of the Cable Car charges 24/7.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Altared States | Electronic Soundscapes in a Divine Place, Wellington’s iconic Old St Paul’s will play host to a transcendent new series in August, partnering with the Pyramid Club to present Altared States, a unique electronic music experience.
Set beneath the exquisite stained-glass windows of one of Te Whanganui-a-Tara’s most exquisite landmarks, this series promises an immersive sonic experience that invites audiences to explore sound in a deeply personal and transformative way.
Altared States is inspired by Brian Sweeney’s New York-founded Ambient Church, an initiative dedicated to collaborating with artists to create transformative audio performances in architecturally significant spaces. This series will immerse attendees in soundscapes that transcend the ordinary, offering a chance to disconnect for a moment from the modern world.
Each of the evenings will bring a different electronic vibe, conjured by some of Wellington’s most innovative artists. The series lineup includes:
August 1: Ludus
August 8: Stephen Gallagher with David Long and Jules Desmond
August 15: Oghum
August 22: Dream Chambers
Set within the chancel at the altar of the venue, each artist will perform a 60-minute immersive sound experience that redefines ritual in a contemporary light.
Tickets are available from Wednesday 18 June, with limited capacity of 50 for each show of this intimate series.
About the Artists
Ludus
is the captivating musical venture curated by Emma Bernard. Her creative inspiration spans across the worlds of electronic music, audio engineering, sound design, and the written word. Bernard’s artistic journey explores the deep connection between soundscapes and the natural world, with a focus on evoking emotional responses to the environments we inhabit. She is also co-founder of the Pōneke-based collective Tonic.
Stephen Gallagher
is an Emmy award-winning composer and music editor who has worked on an extensive range of projects, from global blockbusters to television and contemporary dance. Most recently, he completed the score for The Lord of the Rings: The War of the Rohirrim, directed by Kenji Kamiyama. Gallagher’s work spans collaborations with Peter Jackson, Brian Eno, Ed Sheeran, Nick Cave, and many more.
David Long
is a composer, performer, founding member of The Mutton Birds, and member of easy listening noise band, Teeth. His career has spanned over 40 years and seen him work on numerous projects to commercial and critical acclaim. In his own words he likes to “mash shit up”, creating orchestral scores that utilise “not only classical instruments but all sorts of things”.
Jules Desmond
is an experimental musician from Wellington who has played in bands including Letterbox Lambs, 1/3 Octave Band, Bachelor of Architecture and Black Boned Angel.
Oghum
is the interstellar duo of Nell Thomas (Orchestra of Spheres, Cookie Brooklyn and the Crumbs) and Jonny Marks (All Seeing Hand, Mean Bones), performing on Synthi AKS, theremin and other assorted items. Oghum blends electronic sounds from times past with an array of acoustic and found sounds, using nuanced improvisation to create detailed and tangible sonic environments, invoking memory and transporting the listener through narrow gaps into wide open otherworldly spaces.
Jess Chambers
is a composer, musician, and educator currently based in Aotearoa New Zealand, and working under the moniker Dream Chambers. From her beginnings as a folk singer to her current explorations in electronic music, she experiments with sound as a practice of attention: to a room, an outer world, an inner feeling. It’s in that space of beholding where transformation and connection occur, and Chambers is a master alchemist, likening that stretch of attention in music to growing a garden: “There’s a lot of searching, reaching and eventual blossoming in my music – it feels like coming up from underground, like a tulip bulb.”
The Pyramid Club, located on Taranaki Street, is an artist-run space dedicated to experimental music and sonic arts, providing a home for innovative sound exploration.
label: Music & Concerts

Since 2014, Albi & the Wolves have gone from strength to strength touring Australia, New Zealand and Rarotonga. In 2018, they took home the Best Folk Artist Award at the NZVMAs.
What makes the band special is their sense of community. Whether it’s connection through dance, singing or laughter, their performances inspire audiences to keep coming back for more. Just love them!
Come along and enjoy their great gig in our special space, up close and personal.
Not for profit, supporting our dedicated musicians. Suggested donation $40
Teas, Coffee and Snacks provided. You're welcome to bring anything you'd like to eat or drink.
Parking available in the Coupon zones of Upland Rd & Glasgow St free after 6pm weekdays, and free all through the weekends. The Wilson Carpark at the top of the Cable Car charges 24/7.
