description:
Celebrate the Fabric, Exquisite pieces of needlework are on display and in use every day at Wellington Cathedral of
St Paul: beautifully decorated fabrics that hang at the front of the altars, spectacular robes and
stoles worn by priests at services, and fine linens used at every service of Holy Communion.

You’ll learn much about this remarkable fabric artistry when Jo Dixey talks to the Friends of
Wellington Cathedral of St Paul and guests on Wednesday, 24 September at 10.30 am.
Jo is an internationally regarded professional embroiderer who graduated from the Royal
School of Needlework and now lives permanently in New Zealand. She teaches, exhibits and sells
her work, as well as accepting commissions from churches, fashion designers and private
individuals. She has also had contracts from the film industry, working on the Disney film Mulan
and most recently on season 1 of Lord of the Rings TV series. Jo’s collection of embroidered
3D viruses, created during the 2020 Covid lockdown, are now on display in The Museum of
New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa.

Venue: Loaves and Fishes Hall, Wellington Cathedral of St Paul.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description:
CTRL_ALT_DEL, CTRL_ALT_DEL
Can we CTRL ourselves? ALT our reality? Or must we DEL everything else?

About this Event


Strap in for this emotional rollercoaster! Let voice, music and movement take you through a journey of resilience and self-discovery, to a wild, high-energy house party, to a powerful exploration of love, grief, and revenge. Three stories; one powerful connection.

Note to God - Jjohn Nickle
Note to God follows five individuals in therapy, each facing personal struggles. As they bond through shared pain, healing begins — until a twist tests their trust. A moving musical about connection, resilience, and finding hope in life’s darkest moments.
My House - Olivia Watts
My House is a high-energy show that takes you on a Saturday night and shows the heart of a house party. From the first guest to the final beat, experience explosive choreography, unforgettable characters, and music that moves your soul. It’s more than a party, it’s My House.
No Way Back? - Bryce Blackmore
No Way Back? explores one man’s experience with loss and what it means for his humanity. When everything is ripped away, how do we respond? In the wake of tragedy, we all face a choice: confront the pain and move forward or let it consume us.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description:
the Jesus Lizard, After initially calling it a day in 1999, the Jesus Lizard officially return full time to save us from the current state of musical mediocrity with their latest album, Rack. A blistering resurgence of the so-called ‘noise rock’ they helped define alongside contemporaries Big Black, Flipper, The Birthday Party, with their previous and most noted albums Head, Goat and Liar. For those of us who live in fear of the reunion album and subsequent tour, the Jesus Lizard thankfully display not only the same chaotic and dark nihilism of their earlier careers but also the maturity and seasoning of a band riding a wave of renewed and reinvigorated form.

Once slated by famed engineer Steve Albini as “the greatest band I’ve ever seen’ the Jesus Lizard not only lived up to this lofty praise in their prime but continue to do so in their advancing years. David Yow still leads the charge as the maniacally possessed frontman entering crowds with reckless abandon and a stamina that much younger vocalists would kill for. The original rhythm section of David Wm Sims and Mac McNeilly further continue to prove why they were and are the best bass & drum combo since Jones and Bonham, anchoring the ship as Captain Yow and first mate Denison navigate the wild seas of their songs. And while he may not always feature (as he rightly should) on many modern music journalists ‘best guitarists lists’, Duane Denison could perhaps be the most innovative and idiosyncratic punk rock guitarist EVER. However, each member is a sum of their parts but combined they are as Albini also once said “the purest melding of the sublime and profane.”

Whether you are a longtime disciple of the Jesus Lizard, seeing them when last here in ‘98, or perhaps your fandom is more recent and have only seen videos of their legendary live performances, you will know that these shows are not to be missed.

Saturday 11th October 2025 - The Tuning Fork, Auckland (All ages)

Sunday 12th October 2025 - San Fran, Wellington (R18 unless accompanied by your legal guardian)
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Temporal Aria, Temporal Aria
A breathtaking contemporary circus spectacle exploring the profound tension between control and surrender.

About this Event


WINNER - Momentous Movement Award (NZ Fringe 2025)
WINNER - Take Your Breath Away Award (Reykjavik Fringe 2025)

Step into a world where gravity bends and the boundaries of the human body are redefined. Temporal Aria is a breathtaking contemporary circus experience that fuses the ancient art of hair suspension with acrobatics to explore the profound tension between control and surrender.
Inspired by performer Nicole Maisey’s recent ADHD diagnosis, the show becomes a deeply personal exploration of distractibility, executive dysfunction, and the pursuit of inner peace. Through feats of extraordinary strength and vulnerability, Nicole transforms struggle into artistry, expressing a journey toward balance and self-acceptance.
At its heart, Temporal Aria is about learning to release control and accept support, a powerful shift from isolation to connection. As Nicole navigates the physical and emotional extremes of her art, she discovers that surrender is not weakness, but a pathway to strength, resilience, and unexpected grace.
Set to a mesmerizing soundscape, Temporal Aria is both a spectacle and a meditation. a poetic intersection of circus, emotion, and identity. It’s not just about the act of letting go, but about what we discover in the process: joy, contentment, and the redefinition of success as peace within.
Prepare to be captivated by a performance that truly takes your breath away.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Coffee, Cake, and Chat, Coffee, Cake, and Chat
Last December 25 parishioners gathered for Cake, Coffee and Chat – the idea to reconnect with fellow parishioners.
Feed back was “let’s do this again and soon” no formality – gathering in a relaxed atmostphere, the Cathedral Foyer.
An easy date to remember - the first Friday morning of the month 10.30pm – 12.m.d. do come and meet one another – no need to respond- we will post a reminder each month in the Cathedral Connection – if you are free come and say ‘hello’.
All parishioners are very welcome, the more the ‘chattier’. If you would like to note the first Friday dates they are below.
7 February, 7 March,4 April, 2 May, 6 June, 4 July, 1 August, 5 September, 3 October
7 November, 5 December.

description:
From Source 2025, From Source 2025
From Source
A space to activate and remember your innate, divine connection to Source. This is an invitation to access your unique blueprint and align with what is required for your evolution. Through alchemical technology, sound vibrations, and breathwork, we inspire a divine collaboration within the cells of your mind, body, and soul.

Our last event was an incredible success, and due to the deep transformations that unfolded, we are bringing it back in October 2025 for another powerful gathering.

We are honored to have an incredible lineup of contributors, each weaving their threads of wisdom and magic to co-create a weekend of deep activation and restorative integration. The modalities and offerings will include:

✨ Triple Cone Orgonite Technology, Merkabar Activation & Sound Healing – Jason Hotton

✨ Voice Activation & Live Medicine Music – Joydah Mae

✨ Breathwork & Meditation – OM Shanti Shanti

✨ Crystal Bowls – Lucine Sounds

✨ Cacao – Awa Aroha

✨ Nourishing Food – Anthea Carr

✨ Space Holder – Leah Pomeroy

Together, we will journey through these realms of wisdom—let’s see what Source has in store for us this weekend.

Event Details
📅 Two-Day Immersion – Your ticket includes both days
🕚 Saturday, Oct 11 | 11:00 AM - 8:00 PM
🕙 Sunday, Oct 12 | 10:00 AM - 4:00 PM

Ticket Tiers
🎟 First Round – $222 (15 passes only) - SECURE ASAP
🎟 Second Round – $333
🎟 Final Round – $444

What to Bring
✅ Yoga Mat
✅ Cushion/Blanket
✅ Journal
✅ Water Bottle
✅ BYO Cup for Cacao
✅ BYO Plates, Bowls & Cutlery for shared meals
✅ A plate of nourishing kai to share at the end of Saturday as we ground together

Please Note
This event is designed for deep inner work and integration, making it unsuitable for young children and no dogs are permitted in the hall. We encourage you to take this time for yourself to fully immerse in the experience.

💌 Any questions? Email us at
📍 Stay connected – Follow us on Facebook (@FromSource) for updates!

We can't wait to share this sacred space with you once again. 🌿✨

description:
Light Language Healing Transmission, Light Language Healing Transmission
Susan Crystal Diamond is inviting you to join her circle for a sound and light language multidimensional transmission that will guide you to a deeper inner alignment through channeled light codes and wisdom to receive more peace and love.

In this sacred seated space you will be guided through gentle breath opening you to receive source energy, practice a fun intuitive exercise, choose an oracle card, receive a channeled light language activation to either release, activate, expand or heal for your highest good.

Experience this journey with Susan, which will support your inner strength and invite you into a state of divine neutrality. This relaxing, uplifting experience is designed to help you navigate the changes we are all facing offering a new template for peace and balance and return to your true nature.

Please note this is a seated event however you are welcome to bring a mat and blanket to lay down for the transmission, wear layered clothing for comfort and bring a water bottle.

Energy exchange $30 021 608913 To book
Transfer payment to 06-0773-0271726-00

Susan is a seasoned practitioner and channel of light with decades of experience in the healing arts bringing experience, wisdom and compassion to her work. Over the last 10 years Susan has refined her unique gifts of light language which she brings through for private clients and in group sessions. Her light language is a powerful tool working on subtle energetic levels to assist individuals in transforming on a cellular level and connecting to their higher selves. Paired with sound instruments Susans sessions are always unique and intuitively guided.

Susans’ commitment to guiding souls with humility and compassion has made her a trusted source of support and wisdom in the healing community. Allow her to help you navigate your own journey with grace and light.

In the circle we will weave our unique soul essence together to experience the oneness of our new earth frequency.

Namaste

description:
Wankernomics — Just Touching Base, At work, do you struggle with simple tasks like using the phrase “circle back” in every email? Have you never used the word “synergies” in a LinkedIn post? You might be a failure at office life and need a pep talk. Luckily, some Australian satirists have a solution. ‘Wankernomics — Just Touching Base’ live at The Opera House reveals the secret to workplace success through the ancient art of being annoying.   
The shows are hilarious and include many ‘oh-my-god-that’s-exactly-what-happens-at-my-workplace’ moments. You’ll get a demonstration of the buzzwords, bureaucracy, banality, and baloney of modern working life. You’ll get tips on how to speak at work, how to look like a genius in meetings, and how to get promoted by simply dropping the phrase ‘360 degree all-hands ideation session’ into an email to your boss. 
So, pop some time in the diary for an outcomes-focused, value-added, best-practice, deep-dive into the realities of the working world.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Mexican Prehispanic Experience at AWHI, Join Claudio in his Mexican project called Xochipilli´s Eye. Xochipilli (Pronounce: Zo-chee-pee-lee) is the Mexica god of music, flowers, arts, and sacred plants.
Claudio´s last trip home to Mexico was full of inspiration, reconnecting him to his ancestral roots in Mexico City. He was fortunate to meet a prehispanic musician and instrument maker who plays and crafts beautiful traditional instruments. Claudio returned to NZ with many special new instruments; and continues to be inspired and guided by the cultural wealth, wisdom, and knowledge of the ancient cultures of the Americas.
This event will be extraordinary and unique. You will learn about Mexican prehispanic cosmology and spirituality. Experience simple and powerful rituals together with unique musical instruments used by Olmecs, Toltecs, Aztecs, and Mayans. The instruments include clay flutes, clay drums, medicine drums, ocarinas, wooden flutes, shells, and shakers skilfully arranged to create magical shamanic atmospheres.
We will be sharing Cacao which is an energetic traditional Mexican prehispanic drinks that help open the heart, reconnect with the earth element, ignite your fire, and get you up and moving.
What to expect:
Cleansing copal and herbal welcoming.
Talk about the use of music in the ancient times.
An opening ceremony to acknowledge the Tlalmanalli (offering and altar) with the deep sound of the conch shell in the four directions.
Cacao ceremony: Claudio will offer the cacao drink as a connection with the earth, to yourself, and the moment.
Live music that invokes many emotions and imagery, from contemplative natural and mystical environments to uplifting and empowering rhythms. You are free to project and explore within and/ or express and liberate projecting outwards.
We will finish with a shamanic atmosphere relaxation and close the event with a traditional chant.
No previous experience is required.
What to bring:
Wear comfortable clothing! Bring an open heart and a mind ready to learn and receive. You are also welcome to bring a fruit and or a flower to contribute to the altar.
Date & Time: Saturday, April 13th, 6-7:30pm
Location: AWHI Yoga & Wellbeing, Level 2, 15 Johnston Street, Wellington Central
Investment: $55

description:
Letting Go: A ritual for fresh starts, Letting Go: A ritual for fresh starts
If you’ve been through a redundancy, restructure, or a big shift in your working life - or if you’ve been out of work for a while and are looking ahead to something new - this gathering is for you.
We’ll spend an hour outdoors (weather permitting) in a gentle, guided ritual to help you release some of the heaviness that comes with change and open up to what’s next. You can expect moments of quiet reflection, light movement, and simple nature-based activities designed to connect you with yourself, the land, and a sense of possibility. There’s no chanting, costumes, or anything too out-there - just a safe, thoughtful space to mark what you’ve been through and welcome in the next chapter.
The ritual will be hosted by Tamara Buckland - Leadership Strategist, Chief People Officer, and Druid - who blends leadership wisdom with nature-based practices to create meaningful, accessible experiences for people in transition.
After the ritual, we’ll wander to Picnic Café for coffee or tea (you’ll just need to cover your own drink) for those who’d like to keep connecting.
Details
📅 Friday 29 August (rain date: Friday 5 September)
🕛 12:00–1:00pm ritual
☕ 1:00pm coffee/tea at Picnic Café
💸 Free (pay for your own drink at the café)
📍 Wellington - location shared on registration
This is for anyone ready to put down some of the weight they’ve been carrying, connect with nature and themselves, and make space for the next chapter.

Psychic Readings l Divination l Energy Healing l Hands-on Healing l Spiritual + Wellbeing Supplies l Crafts l Giftware

Holistic Wellbeing & Spiritual Expo

Divine Connections is a holistic wellbeing and spiritualism event that offers psychic readings, spiritual + wellbeing supplies, handcrafted creations, giftware and various energetic and hands-on healing modalities.

Our events are about community, connection and wellness. They facilitate a space for like-minded lightworkers to connect with the public and offer their amazing gifts. Hauora is addressed on all four dimensions through our stallholders' many offerings; the physical, the mental, the spiritual and of course family. We are a family friendly event, so you can take this opportunity to connect with yourself or your loved ones on this plane as well as the next!

So come along, support a good cause and bask in the awesome atmosphere and aroha created by our collective of talented lightworkers!

We also love to support our regular stallholders and their upcoming ventures. If anyone is interested in participating as a stallholder please message Divine Connections Expo on Facebook.

description:
Palmistry: Exploring Planetary Energies, Palmistry: Exploring Planetary Energies
Learn the art of palmistry and enjoy a plant-based dinner afterwards - all included in your ticket!
In this workshop, we’ll explore how the mounts of your hand reveal the influence of different planetary energies, such as Jupiter’s connection to ambition and Saturn’s role in discipline. Each mount reflects unique qualities and patterns of behaviour, offering insight into your personal traits and how you navigate challenges.
By the end of the session, you’ll have a good understanding of how these planetary energies can be identified and interpreted in your own hands. You’ll leave with practical tools to start reading these energies, providing a deeper appreciation for how planetary forces shape different aspects of your life
Whether you're new to palmistry or looking to broaden your knowledge, this workshop will offer valuable insights into the planetary dimension of palm reading.
Plant-based dinner included in your ticket!

description:
REMEMBRANCE- Somatic Dance, REMEMBRANCE
A somatic dance journey
Join embodiment facilitators Jenna Joan & Sonic Sutra for an evening of connection, ceremonial cacao, freeform movement, and live soundscape.
🌑 Saturday 13 September
🕕 6–8.30pm
📍 All Saints Church Hall, Hataitai
🎟️ $40–$50
✨ Sober · Non-judgemental · All welcome · No experience needed
No door sales - tickets must be purchased online prior to the event.
As the season turns to spring, we gather in remembrance—an invitation to embody the strength within and feel how ancestral wisdom moves through us. When we connect to our inner foundations, we touch the support of those who came before and deepen our sense of belonging to life itself.
We’ll begin with ceremonial cacao, then drop into a guided movement journey with live soundscape. There are no steps to learn, no performance—just presence, curiosity, and letting your body move as it feels. Barefoot and phone-free, you’re invited to drop deep into free-form movement, awakening parts of you that you may have forgotten.
Come as you are.
Move with what you feel.
Leave feeling empowered, connected, and alive.
Somatic dance is a guided movement practice that helps you tune into your body’s wisdom and move from the inside out. Unlike ecstatic dance, which is typically an open, DJ-led space with no facilitation, somatic dance offers gentle guidance to support you in exploring sensation, emotion, and embodiment in a safe, intentional way. You’re not learning steps or performing—you're being invited into presence, curiosity, and feeling. With a focus on nervous system regulation, personal expression, and inner listening, somatic dance creates a nurturing space to come home to yourself.
Your Hosts...
Jenna Joan | Embodiment Facilitator
Jenna Joan is a somatic therapist, yoga teacher, and group facilitator who has been leading movement spaces for over 15 years. With a background in yoga, somatic dance, and therapeutic embodiment, her work blends play, authenticity, and deep nervous system awareness. Jenna is also a cacao alchemist and ceremonial facilitator, known for creating safe, soulful spaces that invite freedom, connection, and inner exploration. She has been hosting workshops, retreats, and community events for nearly a decade, and also works 1:1 in more therapeutic settings.
Sonic Sutra | Somatic Dance DJ
Sonic Sutra is a sound artist and somatic dance DJ who creates immersive musical journeys designed to support authentic movement, emotional release, and deep embodiment. With a focus on somatic dance and therapeutic soundscapes, their sets are intentionally curated to guide dancers through an inner experience—honouring the body’s natural rhythms and the intelligence within. Their offerings create safe, accessible spaces for people of all bodies, backgrounds, and experience levels to explore movement, presence, and connection. Rooted in play, precision, and deep listening, Sonic Sutra brings music that moves beyond entertainment—into healing and transformation.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description:
Sound Bath Experience: Ngā Wā o te Tau, Sound Bath Experience: Ngā Wā o te Tau

Experience Sound Bath Experience: Ngā Wā o te Tau, a journey through the seasons inspired by the natural rhythms of Aotearoa. “Ngā Wā o te Tau” means “The Seasons,” and this sound bath, guided by Smita and Peter with the rich tones of taonga pūoro and waiata, invites reflection on the cycles of nature and our connection to the world around us.

This immersion takes you from winter’s stillness, through spring’s blossoms, summer’s warmth, and autumn’s release, attuning to the changing energies of each season. Unique sounds encourage reflection, connection, and inner calm, while gentle karakia and mindful intention weave the journey together, creating a meditative space to pause and breathe.

After the sound bath, enjoy a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert included in your ticket — a wholesome way to close the evening in good company.

Meet your hosts & musicians, Smita & Peter, Smita (Ngāi Te Rangi) was born and raised in Aotearoa. From a young age she was drawn to music as a means for reflection and self-expression. During her music studies at university, she was introduced to taonga pūoro, and this sparked a personal journey of reconnection to te ao Māori and her own whakapapa. Following university, she lived in an ashram for several years where she was introduced to the wonderful practice of bhakti yoga. She now lives with her husband in the Wellington region, where they regularly participate in kirtan (mantra music meditation) at Bhakti Lounge.

Peter is Pākehā, with grandparents from England and Ireland, and has been on a four-year journey learning the art of taonga pūoro — the traditional Māori musical instruments of Aotearoa. Guided by the wisdom and generosity of expert makers and players, he has learned both to craft and to play these unique instruments. For Peter, taonga pūoro offer a way to connect deeply with sound, story, and the natural world, and he is excited to share their voices as part of this sound bath experience.

What’s on the menu?
Jackfruit Rendang

Satay Seitan Skewer

Gado Gado salad with peanut sauce

Rice

Banana cake with caramel sauce

Hot "chocolate"

description:
Sound Healing Experience with Claudio Escutia, Sound Healing Experience with Claudio Escutia
Immerse Yourself in a Journey of Sound & Stillness

Join us for a special evening of harmonizing pure sounds, inspiring music, and deep relaxation at our beautiful space. Let the transformative power of sound guide you into a state of peaceful awareness and inner connection.

- 5:00 PM – 7:00 PM, Saturday, 4th of October
- Investment: $49
- Book here: https://www.wellnessliving.com/rs/event/wild_wellbeing?k_class=100000004277

What to Expect
Give yourself the gift of stillness as you surrender to the healing vibrations of:
- Gongs • Tibetan & Crystal Singing Bowls
- Native American Flutes • Harmonium • Sitar & Esraj
- Bells • Mantra chanting • Sacred Silence

Claudio’s high-quality amplification ensures you *feel* the sound as much as you hear it, creating a fully immersive experience. Allow the waves of resonance to:
- Release physical, mental & emotional tension
- Guide you into deep meditation & heart-centered awareness
- Restore balance & invite inner peace

How to Prepare
- Bring a pillow, blanket, or anything to ensure comfort
- Come with an open heart and an intention (optional)
- Wear loose, cozy clothing

About Claudio Escutia
A 3rd-generation multinstrumentalist from Mexico City, Claudio’s journey spans classical guitar, jazz, and global spiritual traditions. Trained in Indian classical music and Tibetan sound healing (studied in Nepal and India), he brings over a decade of expertise as a Sound Healing practitioner. His music is a bridge between ancient wisdom and modern therapeutic soundscapes.

description:
Light Language Healing Transmission, Light Language Healing Transmission
Susan Crystal Diamond is inviting you to join her circle for a sound and light language multidimensional transmission that will guide you to a deeper inner alignment through channeled light codes and wisdom to receive more peace and love.

In this sacred seated space you will be guided through gentle breath opening you to receive source energy, practice a fun intuitive exercise, choose an oracle card, receive a channeled light language activation to either release, activate, expand or heal for your highest good.

Experience this journey with Susan, which will support your inner strength and invite you into a state of divine neutrality. This relaxing, uplifting experience is designed to help you navigate the changes we are all facing offering a new template for peace and balance and return to your true nature.

Please note this is a seated event however you are welcome to bring a mat and blanket to lay down for the transmission, wear layered clothing for comfort and bring a water bottle.

Energy exchange $30 021 608913 To book
Transfer payment to 06-0773-0271726-00

Susan is a seasoned practitioner and channel of light with decades of experience in the healing arts bringing experience, wisdom and compassion to her work. Over the last 10 years Susan has refined her unique gifts of light language which she brings through for private clients and in group sessions. Her light language is a powerful tool working on subtle energetic levels to assist individuals in transforming on a cellular level and connecting to their higher selves. Paired with sound instruments Susans sessions are always unique and intuitively guided.

Susans’ commitment to guiding souls with humility and compassion has made her a trusted source of support and wisdom in the healing community. Allow her to help you navigate your own journey with grace and light.

In the circle we will weave our unique soul essence together to experience the oneness of our new earth frequency.

Namaste

description:
Sound Journey - RAUMATI SOUTH, KAPITI, Sound Journey - RAUMATI SOUTH, KAPITI
This powerful experience is like a soundtrack that is crafted to go with your life.
Something between an ancient ceremony and a movie soundtrack.
Please bring a yoga mat, pillow and blanket. Be prepared to drop into a deep space.
Door sales will be available if there is space. Advanced booking is recommended.
Sika's Sound Journeys are truly unique. They are sonic explorations that feature didgeridoos, drums, flutes, voice and orchestral elements.�A collection of foraged sounds from objects he has recorded in nature, add even more textures. Many of his sounds are completely unrecognisable and abstract. Immersed in this cocoon of abstract sound, we can find ourselves in the most surprising places in our mind. In this timeless realm, beyond the normal limitations of rational reality, anything is possible.
An epic adventure deep inside yourself.
Journey to worlds within worlds on incredible sound waves.
Sika creates a safe space to relax deeply and connect with our inner guidance. This Sound Journey begins and ends with a short guided visualisation.
There will be two journeys with an interval. Most people choose to lie down, so once again, please bring a yoga mat, pillow and blanket to get really comfortable.
A journal is also recommended.

description:
Sound Healing Experience, Sound Healing Experience
Sound Healing Experience with Claudio Escutia

It’ll be a transcendent evening of Sacred Harmonic Sounds, where multi-instrumentalist Claudio Escutia will guide you through a deeply restorative sonic experience. Plus - there will be an amazing plant-based dinner & dessert included in your ticket!

Let the vibrations of Gongs, Crystal and Tibetan singing bowls, Native American flutes, and other ancient instruments wash over you—melting away tension, quieting the mind, and opening a doorway to inner stillness.

With Claudio’s masterful soundscapes, you’ll not only hear the music but feel it resonating through your body, inviting profound relaxation and a reconnection to your heart. No prior meditation or yoga experience is needed—just come as you are and let the sound carry you into a space of deep peace.

What to Bring?
Yoga mats, blankets & cushions are provided but you are also welcome to bring your own yoga mat and any extra cushions or any other comforts for the ultimate experience!

Why You Won’t Want to Miss This

A rare opportunity to experience Claudio’s unique fusion of world music traditions and healing sound

A deeply immersive, meditative experience—perfect for relaxation and renewal

Limited spaces

Meet Claudio Escutia, your host
Born into a musical family in Mexico City, Claudio’s lifelong passion for sound has taken him across the globe—from studying jazz in Montreal to mastering Tibetan singing bowls in Kathmandu. His music weaves together classical training, world instruments (Sitar, Esraj, Harmonium, and more), and a deep reverence for sound as medicine.

Ready to unwind and recharge through the magic of vibration?

description:
Resilience and Emissions Reduction Workshop for Not-For-Profits | Blenheim, Ready your not-for-profit for the future
Do you know you need to take action to address climate change but don’t know where to start?
Do you want to strengthen your organisations’ planning and readiness for change?
Do you want practical tools and support to measure, assess, and report on your organisations’ impact?

In partnership with Rātā Foundation, our Earth+ Resilience and Emissions Reduction programme has been designed to flip the script on climate change, centering your organisation as agents of change and kitting you with the tools, support and community to make a difference; and it’s free of charge!
About the programme
With the support of the Terra Nova team and other programme participants, you will be guided to identify how your organisation is uniquely placed to contribute to the resilience and wellbeing of people and planet, and the opportunities and obstacles to creating positive change.
The programme is accessible and suitable for everyone, from those just starting on the journey, to those who have steps in place but are looking to gain access to further resources. This programme is not intended to add extra workload or deliverables for your organisation, it is an offer of support to integrate an Earth+ approach into your BAU; an answer to the question “what can we do about climate change?”
We know that every organisation’s capacity is different, so our support is available for you to utilise it when you need it until the end of 2025. This includes:
Access to a dedicated online community where you can connect with the Terra Nova team, other Rātā grantees and specialised partners. Ask questions, find resources and share your journey.
A toolkit of resources and impact sessions to develop your knowledge and connect you with the expertise and support to build resilience and tackle change in a range of impact areas.
Complementary access to the Cogo carbon emissions measurement tool, providing you the ability to quantify and report on your emissions impact and providing recommended actions for emissions reduction and cost savings, in an easy-to-use format.
It begins with a 1-day interactive workshop to kick things off. By the end of the workshop, you will walk away:
Feeling more empowered about the future, with a deeper understanding of resilience and climate change as it relates to your organisation’s context.
Having explored how you can make change positive and achievable, centered on the needs of your community and team. 
With free access to Cogo carbon manager, an emissions profile, report of your carbon footprint and practical action you can take to reduce your emissions.
Having built a network of support and gained free-to-use practical tools and templates.
Note: we will be running multiple workshops throughout the year; you only need to attend one workshop to join the programme. If you prefer an alternate date, please head to our Humanitix profile to find the corresponding event. 
The programme is fully funded for not-for-profit organisations and registrations are now open for 2025! Register for the programme and secure your spot in a workshop through this Humanatix event, and a member of the Terra Nova team will be in touch to confirm your enrollment. For more information about the programme and workshop, visit the Terra Nova website.
We look forward to welcoming you into our community of changemakers!

description:
Brew Year's Eve!, Brew Year's Eve!
REGISTER NOW FOR THE EARLY BIRD SALE!
Get exclusive access to Early Bird pricing on Tuesday 9th September, with tickets just $65!
Register via ticketing page.

Wellingtons biggest New Years Eve party is back at Brewtown.
Celebrate Brew Years Eve with the ultimate party night of legendary Kiwi anthems, wall to wall bangers and classic 80s hits on a night where the dancefloor never stops.

The Soundtrack to Your Night:
Our epic lineup will take you back in time with all your classic favourites:
+Dragon — get ready for timeless anthems like April Sun in Cuba and Rain.
+The Jordan Luck Band — Kiwi sing-alongs like Why Does Love Do This to Me and Victoria.
+The Automatic 80s — taking you back with the biggest 80s dancefloor hits.
+The Blueprint — Wellington's best rock covers band taking you through to midnight.

Say goodbye to 2025 with a bang — party with us as we transform Brewtown's covered Greenspace into a full-blown New Year’s Eve Party, packed with live music, massive party vibes, and all the magic to make your countdown unforgettable.

📅 Wednesday 31st December
📍 Brewtown, Upper Hutt
R18

🎟️ Tickets:
$65 Early Bird tickets on sale September 9th (one day only). - Register now for exclusive access!
General Admission on sale September 10th.
👉 https://brewtown.flicket.co.nz/events/b728f83c-d139-454c-9ddb-b7c78e0bed4e

This isn’t just another night out — it’s Wellington’s biggest party of the year!

So round up your crew, grab your tickets, and get ready for confetti blasts, big sing-alongs, and festival-scale fun as we count down to midnight together.

description:
Get to Know Your Sony Camera, Join us for a relaxed evening in store with Sony Digital Imaging Advocate Rebecca McMillan and get hands on with the latest Sony gear.

Rebecca is Wellington-based professional photographer who has been shooting with Sony cameras for over a decade. As an award-winning, NZIPP-accredited, portrait and film stills photographer, she knows how to capture incredible images using Sony Alpha cameras and lenses!

Rebecca also runs events for the local photography community, including coffee meet-ups and photo walks.

Feel free to bring in your Sony gear on the night, or just try the equipment we have in store. Rebecca and the Photo Warehouse staff will be happy to answer any questions you may have.

Everyone who registers and attends this Scene Festival event will go into the draw to win a trip to Rome! There will also be Sony spot prizes given out during the evening.

description:
Te Huarahi Passionfest, Te Huarahi: The Pathway of Faith + Justice
Te Huarahi Passionfest is a grassroots festival for young adults chasing after Jesus and justice in Aotearoa. It’s about camping under the stars, worship and kōrero, music and art, shared kai and whanaungatanga.
We want to form a new generation of Jesus-followers who care deeply about people and creation. Alongside you will be families and older adults who’ve walked this path for decades — cheering you on and sharing the journey.

description:
The Greatest Story - A Group of Wise Teachers Returning, Public Talk & Workshop

Throughout history, especially at times of crisis, great spiritual teachers have emerged to show humanity the next step forward.

According to British artist, author and esotericist Benjamin Creme, a group of such spiritual teachers is now living in the modern world. Maitreya, the World Teacher, and his group The Masters of Wisdom are here - not as religious teachers - to inspire all people to create a civilisation based on sharing, justice and peace; and for humanity to act to do the work to share and save our world.

Humanity at spiritual crossroads

Humanity is at crossroads. One path into the future leads to increasing social and economic division, environmental destruction, war and planetary peril. The other path leads to increasing social harmony, economic and environmental balance, and a golden era of peace.


Maitreya’s priorities

To help humanity in its task of global transformation, Maitreya has formulated certain priorities. They cover the essential needs of all people, every woman, man and child: an adequate supply of food; housing for all; healthcare and education as basic universal rights. Other top priorities include the restoration of the environment and the establishment of peace.

The key to achieving these goals requires a major shift of present mind-set and thinking, structures and systems – and more equitable sharing of the world’s food and resources. To realise humanity is one global family and the planet is a living being. According to Maitreya: “Without sharing, there can be no justice; without justice, there can be no peace; without peace, there can be no future.”

~ followed by short Transmission Meditation session ~

Share International New Zealand. Contact (021) 261 2749
Access - entrance from Raumati Road/ walk - drive past Te Raukura ki Kāpiti / Kāpiti Performing Arts Centre

description:
Wellington CBD Outreach & Evangelism, Join an experienced team of Young Adult leaders from local churches & Catalyst Movement for some Friday Night evangelism in the heart of Wellington
Meet at 8pm at Te Aro Park (Pigeon Park). We'll start with some outdoor worship & prayer together and then head out in pairs to talk with people about Jesus on Cuba & Courtenay
These times are always tonnes of fun and really fruitful. We'll pray for people, invite people to church on Sunday, and have some all round wholesome yarns. If never done evangelism before and want to give it a go, this is your chance! We'll walk through some basic training content and have a big experienced crew to partner off with. See you there!

description:
VISIONING DAY RETREAT FOR WOMEN, VISIONING DAY RETREAT FOR WOMEN
Come and join Bryony from Heartsong Healing for a powerful Vision Board and Voice Empowerment workshop as we move through the energy of the Celtic festival of Beltane!

This is a Women's Retreat.

This workshop includes powerfully transformative Voice and Energy practices which support manifestation of your dreams and visions.

New dreams, new possibilities and celebrations, all seen within the light and power of this late Spring full moon. Invoke the Source of healing, growth and positive change and new beginnings.

#vsionboard #creativity #healing #specialtimes #transformation

JOIN US FOR A DAY OF DEEP CREATIVE DIVING INTO OUR VISIONS - with specially chosen and composed healing songs, chants, conscious sound practices.

These are enjoyed alongside intuitive drawing, collage and fully guided vision board creation. All of this will be held within a sacred space of Spiritual connection, ritual and energy work.

We will make this sacred space in our lives to explore, clarify and strengthen our visions for our lives, for our selves, for our fullest and highest embodiment on this beautiful and precious Earth.

Sunday 9th November 2025 10am-4.30pm

This special day retreat will draw on the strong astrological energies available at this time, connect with our Spirit teams and Angelic forces and channel in the creative and opening force of Blessing, Balance and Alignment.

Through valuing what we are harvesting in our lives we make space for the next step, the new direction, the new possibility.

Supported by meditation and a guided practice we will each create a new image or personal vision board to focus us and assist us in drawing new energies into our lives as we move further into the new year. We will then use wonderful voice and extremely powerful energy practices, and healing songs, to strengthen and empower them and bring them closer to manifestation.

The day includes a powerful group Reiki healing session, Specialized Voice exercises, supporting materials and follow up resources and support. You will be nourished with a delicious, healthy, fully organic lunch and refreshments

Full day experience investment - $233 (limited number of concessionary places available).

BOOK HERE -

description:
Wesley Huff | Leaders Lunch | Wellington, Wesley Huff | Leaders Lunch | Wellington
This September Wesley Huff is joining Thinking Matters for the Truth Matters Tour in Dunedin, Christchurch, Wellington and full-day Conference in Auckland.

While in Wellington, he will be doing his only Christian Leaders Lunch.

Proceedings
Doors will open 11:15 am
11:30 am - the event will begin with a short powhiri/mihi whakatau
11:50 am - Kai
12:20 pm - Wes will present his talk and do q and a
1:30 pm - Conclusion of event
About Wesley Huff
Wesley Huff was born in Multan, Pakistan, and spent a portion of his childhood in the Middle East. After being diagnosed with a rare neurological condition at the age of eleven that left him paralyzed from the waist down, Wes experienced a miraculous recovery for which the doctors themselves had no medical explanation. This experience, along with a great deal of study and soul searching in his later teen years, solidified his interest in faith and in engaging the beliefs and worldview perspectives of others. He spent his high school years in Northern Ontario and currently lives in Toronto, Canada, with his wife and three children.

Wesley is currently the Central Canada Director for Apologetics Canada and has been a guest on a variety of public platforms, from The Joe Rogan Experience and Piers Morgan Uncensored, to Apologia Radio and Daily Dose of Wisdom. He has participated in numerous public dialogues, debates, and interfaith events on issues of belief and religion globally.

He holds a BA in sociology from York University, a Masters of Theological Studies from Tyndale University, and is currently doing a PhD in New Testament at the University of Toronto’s Wycliffe College.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description:
simple animal, Wellington favourites simple animal are set to light up the stage with their signature mix of raw emotion, funky rhythms, and irresistible energy.

Featuring many Wellington musicians who have long been at the heart of the capital’s music scene, simple animal has roots in bands such as The Hulamen, funk outfit The Tombolas, and the Holidaymakers, best known for their chart-topping single ‘Sweet Lovers’.

Singer/songwriter John McDougall is joined by keyboard maestro John Niland, guitarist Steve Jessup, bassman Murray Costello, drummer Tim Robinson, and powerhouse vocalist Annie Ruddock, to draw on that influence with songs that span heartache, protest, love, and silliness, reflecting the wide, wild, and weird lives we live. They’ll also be revealing new tracks like ‘Things Are Looking Up,’ ‘Hate Is The Question – Love Is The Answer,’ and ‘I Love Whisky (And Whisky Loves Me).’

description:
Aotearoa Interfaith Forum 2025, Aotearoa Interfaith Forum 2025
Please join us for our hybrid Interfaith Forum, with in-person meetings in Wellington, Christchurch, Dunedin, and further hubs!

Saturday, 13 September 2025 from 5:30 to 8:30PM


The Wellington Interfaith Council is hosting a hybrid online national forum for our community this year. We understand travel costs can be a barrier to in-person gatherings, so we're creating a unique way to connect!

The forum will be opened by two accomplished speakers. Then, each regional council will host their own in-person meeting, simultaneously linking up online for a shared discussion (kaupapa). This allows local interfaith members to gather in a convenient local location, connecting to the national screen and video via Zoom.

description:
Mangaroa Farms Open Day 2025, Mangaroa Farms Open Day 2025
It’s that time again whānau - Open Day is back at Mangaroa Farms 🙌🏽🌻☀️

Join us Saturday 1st November from 9am - 3pm for a full day of music, kai, community, and whenua. Our last Open Day saw over 1500 people through the gates - this time we’re aiming for even bigger.

FEATURING:
- Garden tours with Cam & team (these always sell out so book your spot on our website
- Permaculture orchard tours & explore our first polyculture maze
- Live music from Casual Healing & friends
- Farm-fresh kai featuring our famous smoked lamb buns, sausages, veggies & more
- Market stalls, Coffee cart & other artisan producers
- Farm demos, including sheep dogs, ponies & more
- Kids zone, crafts & a range of activities
- Access to our full 4km Farm Trail Loop

General entry is FREE.
Garden tours $20 (kids come free).

So bring along the whole whānau, meet the animals, soak up the vibes, and enjoy a real day on the farm.

Volunteer spots are open too. If you want to get involved, email or head to the link in our bio.

Our Farm Shop will be open all day from 9am - 5pm, with fresh produce, local goods, and regenerative meat from our pastures.

Register here https://store.mangaroa.org/products/mangaroa-farms-open-day-sat-1st-november

📍 Visit us at Mangaroa Farm Shop / Kete Kai, 98 Whitemans Valley Road, Upper Hutt

#mangaroafarms #openday #regenerativeagriculture #whanau #upperhutt #farmshop #soilhealth #localfood

The Lion Foundation Young Enterprise Scheme National Awards evening is a showcase and celebration of the entrepreneurial successes of our students, bringing together the top YES companies from across New Zealand.
Join us at the awards dinner as we hear from the next generation of business leaders, changemakers and disruptors, where we’ll find out who will take home a share of more than $20,000 in prize money and tertiary scholarships and who will be named YES Company of the Year.
Pre-dinner drinks and product display from 5:45pm with the evening events commencing at 6:30pm.
The evening will include a 3-course menu and complimentary mocktail on arrival. A cash bar will be available throughout the night.
Dress code: Business/cocktail
If you would like to cover the cost of one of our fabulous YES students attending this year awards, we have included a Gift-a-Ticket option in our ticket section. 

Tickets can be purchased by credit card or by invoice at checkout

Any other queries can be directed to support@youngenterprise.org.nz

description:
Track Day- 2025, Track Day- 2025
🚗💥 START YOUR ENGINES! 💥🚗

We are beyond excited to announce Forged Development's First Ever Track Day at Manfeild Motorsport Park-Circuit Chris Amon!

📅 SAVE THE DATE: 27th September 2025!

In celebration of our founder and owner, Sameer Kumar’s 40th birthday, we’re kicking things into high gear with an action-packed PlayDay on Track event!
Forged Development, in collaboration with PlayDay on Track, we’ve been working tirelessly to deliver an unforgettable track experience. Whether you're a seasoned track enthusiast or just looking to enjoy a fun day on the tarmac, we’ve got you covered.

What’s in store:

A thrilling day on the iconic Manfeild Motorsport Park.

Designed for all skill levels, with three distinct Speed Groups to ensure a safe, exciting experience for everyone.

Maximum track time with minimal racing traffic, so you can make the most of every lap!

Track Entry Tickets now available:

Show and Shine Entry: Now Live

Spectator entrance free!


Competitor Information:

WOF or Reg aren't required, however 3rd Party insurance is preferred as Forged Development Limited and PlayDay on Track takes no liability for any damages or loss at the event.

What you need to bring: (You will not be allowed on track without the minimum safety requirments)
- Driver’s license
- Overalls (minimum 1 layer Cotton)
- Closed top shoes
- Helmet

Not mandatory however highly recommended:
- Neck Restraints/Hans device
- Fire extinguisher

No passengers unless a full MSNZ approved caged. (Expect in familiarization laps for non-caged vehicles)
Passengers wishing to go in a caged car must sign an indemnity form available from the documentation/registration area.

Garage sheds are on a first come, first serve basis.

Pitlane Garages are available for hire, limited available for purchase along with your ticket.

Vehicle Safety:
Participants are responsible for ensuring their car is safe. This includes:
- No fluid leaks (oil, fuel, coolant, brake fluid)
- Brakes in good working condition with sufficient pad material
- Tires in good health
- Lug nuts torqued to spec; all must be present
- Battery securely mounted
- Seat belts or harnesses in working condition
- No loose items inside the vehicle (tools, bottles, etc.)
You will be asked to sign a self-tech form during registration.

On-Track Rules:
- Passing allowed only in designated zones (straights) and with ownership on the driver overtaking to execute a safe pass.
- No hard-overtaking under braking/corners.
- Yield to faster vehicles; use mirrors frequently.
- If you spin or leave the track, rejoin only when safe or return to the pits.
- When on track, do not leave your vehicle unless if fire.
- Aggressive driving, unsafe behaviour, or reckless manoeuvres (e.g., drifting, tailgating) will result in ejection from the event.
- Obey all flag signals and track officials immediately.
- Pitlane Speed limit: 10 kph
- No tire burnouts, speeding, or aggressive driving in paddock/pit areas.

Weather Policy:
- Track day runs rain or shine unless deemed unsafe by organizers.
- Participants must adjust driving style to suit conditions.

Liability Disclaimer:
- All participants must sign a waiver of liability.
- You are responsible for any damage you cause to your vehicle, other vehicles, or track property.
- The track and organizers are not liable for injuries, mechanical failures, or accidents.

Refunds:
There are no refunds but you can transfer your entry to someone else (You can do this via contacting us directly)

Advertising release:
As a condition of entry, each entrant for themselves, as agent for accompanying adult and as parent or guardian for an accompanying child, grant the event promoter, Forged Development Limited, the exclusive right to photograph, video or film, or portrayal without names or credits as the event promoter may in their absolute discretion think fit.

description:
Eastbourne Garden Show, Step into a world of six acclaimed private gardens each a living canvas of colour, design and inspiration from lush natives to sculpted landscapes. Each garden tells a story and provides a visual image of wonderful creations.
One garden, allegedly with the best vista, has not been opened to the public before. One garden has previously featured in the House and Garden magazine. The tour (self-guided) will begin with lunch and an opportunity to buy potted plants in the tranquil St Alban's church garden, 11 Ngaio St Eastbourne, Lower Hutt, Wellington. The tour will end with hors d'oeuvre, wine and live music in the last garden.
This is a chance not just to visit amazing gardens but support the earthquake strengthening of St Alban's historic church and hall for a rejuvenated community hub.
St Albans church garden
The six private gardens all lie within a less than 100 m walk of the 83 Metlink Marine Parade bus route, but a car or bicycle would be more convenient.
A glimpse of the six separate gardens (a-e).
a
a
b
c
d
e
f
f
The garden show is in support of earthquake strengthening of the de Jersey Clere designed St Alban's church and adjacent hall to remake this a community hub.
For the last hundred years and more, this beautiful church designed by acclaimed architect Frederick de Jersey Clere has been the heart of Anglican parish life for people in the eastern bays of Wellington. People have rejoiced, prayed and wept in it through happy family milestones and sad occasions, through two world wars and countless celebrations and crises. Along with its parish hall and tranquil garden, it has been the base for social and community services and outreach, and its memorial wall houses the ashes of local residents.
But in 2016 the congregation had to suddenly leave the church, which was deemed an earthquake risk.
Since then, the parish has explored alternatives for continuing its life and service to the people of the eastern bays. In that process it has kept its ministry and worship going through borrowed premises in local schools and other churches. Now, however, the parish has decided it needs to go back to its original base and strengthen both St Alban’s Church and the parish hall so it can continue to serve the community from its heart and home in Ngaio Street, for the next hundred years and more.
Detailed plans for strengthening the church and hall to meet acceptable safety standards have been drawn up, and fund-raising is under way. The parish is a registered charity (CC22188) and tax-deductible receipts will be issued for all donations.
Postponement by 1 day to 30 Nov if weather were to dictate and would be announced on this web site.

description:

Join cake expert, Lina, for a hands-on cake building and decorating workshop where creativity meets craftsmanship!
With over 20 years of experience in the culinary and hospitality industries - from managing restaurants across Europe and Asia to running her own cake design business - Lina brings not only technical expertise, but also a genuine passion for sharing the joy of decorating.
Known for her friendly, engaging style and eye for detail, Lina will guide you through each step of the process - from building cakes and decorating including palette knife and  gum-paste techniques, to using buttercream and creating a centrepiece.
Whether you're a complete beginner or simply want to sharpen your decorating skills, you'll leave with new techniques, confidence, and of course, your own edible masterpiece.
Let’s make something beautiful - and delicious - together!
You will leave with a tall 6” decorated cake in its own cake box to take home and enjoy. All ingredients included in course fee - just bring an apron and a couple of teatowels.

description:
Rory Lowe: NZ Tour, Award-winning Australian comedian Rory Lowe is bringing the chaos to New Zealand!
Fresh from sold-out tours across Australia and Asia—and with his first comedy special about to be filmed—Rory hits NZ for the very first time with an hour of wild stories, razor-sharp crowd work, and unfiltered laughs.

From getting arrested for terrorism, to snitching on a meth head, to getting married and failing miserably at quitting the party life, Rory’s real-life tales are as ridiculous as they are hilarious. Expect raw, real, and unpredictable comedy from one of the most exciting voices in stand-up today.

Critics and audiences can’t get enough:

★★★★★ – What’s On In Adelaide:
“Comedy at its finest! Lowe draws us in with his unique stories and larger-than-life personality… absolutely guarantees a f*&#ing funny hour of laughs!”


★★★★½ – Fourth Wall Media:
“Rory Lowe is absolutely killing it in the comedy scene… Fast-paced and non-stop, the jokes are funnier every year and the crowd interaction is spot on.”


★★★★ – The AU Review:
“Time flies when watching Rory, a non-stop comedian, with ready-made jokes and quick wit to keep the crowd on its toes.”

With over 2.2 million YouTube subscribers as part of YeahMad, 475K TikTok followers, and a reputation for high-energy, off-the-wall shows, Rory Lowe is ready to take New Zealand by storm.

One man, one mic, and an hour of absolute mayhem—get ready for Rory Lowe unleashed.

description:
International Day of the Girl - 2025, You are Invited to our inaugural International Day of the Girl Fundraising to celebrate the work of Heartprint Cambodia.

The AquaPura Project is raising funds for a new Safe Water installation, and an Emergency Rapid Response Kit for Heartprint in Cambodia.
Heartprint is wholly aligned with AquaPura's mission to educate and provide technical training for girls to be safe water system installers and maintenance leads, so they are provided an opportunity to succeed in a male-dominated industry of essential water provision services.

The theme of International Day of the Girl Child 2025 is:
"The Girl I Am, the Change I Lead: Girls on the Frontline of Crisis". 

This theme was developed in consultation with girls' organisations, UN partners, and girls themselves.

This theme emphasise the leadership potential of girls and their role in driving positive change, particularly in the face of crisis. 

The International Day of the Girl, observed annually on 11th October, aims to highlight the challenges girls face globally, and promote their rights and empowerment. 

The 2025 theme specifically acknowledges the unique experiences and contributions of girls during times of crisis, recognising them as agents of change. 

This fundraiser will be led by Girls, who deeply understand the importance of delivering Safe Water for Every Child.
Heartprint is a not for profit organisation committed to improving living standards of underprivileged families in Cambodia. Heartprint takes a holistic approach to charity by building the Heartprint Community Centre. They are able to provide the support that looks at the whole family structure, not just the basic living needs, but also addressing their overall physical, emotional, social, and spiritual wellbeing.

description:
Sound Journey - WELLINGTON, Sound Journey - WELLINGTON
This powerful experience is like a soundtrack that is crafted to go with your life.

Something between an ancient ceremony and a movie soundtrack.

Please bring a yoga mat, pillow and blanket. Be prepared to drop into a deep space.
Door sales will be available if there is space. Advanced booking is recommended.

Sika's Sound Journeys are truly unique. They are sonic explorations that feature didgeridoos, drums, flutes, voice and orchestral elements.�A collection of foraged sounds from objects he has recorded in nature, add even more textures. Many of his sounds are completely unrecognisable and abstract. Immersed in this cocoon of abstract sound, we can find ourselves in the most surprising places in our mind. In this timeless realm, beyond the normal limitations of rational reality, anything is possible.

An epic adventure deep inside yourself.

Journey to worlds within worlds on incredible sound waves.

Sika creates a safe space to relax deeply and connect with our inner guidance. This Sound Journey begins and ends with a short guided visualisation.

There will be two journeys with an interval. Most people choose to lie down, so once again, please bring a yoga mat, pillow and blanket to get really comfortable.

A journal is also recommended.

description:
✨ Chiron: The Wise Centaur – Myth, Medicine, and Sky WELLINGTON, ✨ Chiron: The Wise Centaur – Myth, Medicine, and Sky
Discover the story of Chiron, the immortal centaur unlike any other: healer, teacher, prophet, and guide to heroes from Achilles to Asclepius. We’ll explore Chiron’s legendary skills in medicine, music, hunting, prophecy, and ethics, and why ancient storytellers remembered him as the gentlest of the centaurs.Follow the centaur’s path through your own chart in this astrological gathering of thought-provoking discussion, exploration and discovery.
About The Planet Mechanic (aka Sousa)
Sousa is the only New Zealand graduate of Kepler College of Astrological Arts & Sciences in the USA. With 30 years experience, she is a passionate and insightful interpreter of the signs and seasons of the sky. www.theplanetmechanic.co.nz
New to Astrology?
Consider taking the Crash Course in Astrology - a one day event of self-discovery studying the fundamentals of your astrology chart. This is available online, taught in small groups of ten or less participants. https://events.humanitix.com/crash-course-in-astrology-online

description:
V.U Meditation Journeys, V.U Meditation Journeys
To book for a space in the bell tent- click here https://loveyourself.co.nz/events/p/bell-tent-meditations-
To book to do the journey over Zoom - Click here https://loveyourself.co.nz/events/p/journey-meditations-zoom

Every Tuesday night we welcome you into the magic of the bell tent. The tent is lovely during the day, but as it gets dark, it takes on a magical feeling. Fairy lights and crystals lit by gently changing coloured lights. We have the fire going if it's cold, the sky curtain pulled if it's a clear night.

The evening starts with us welcoming in the Elements, the Directions and the web of life, into our sacred circle. Arniya then dances the energy in with Celestial Energy Movement, for the group. This creates a vortex of Divine power into the middle of the tent. Each person is linked into this Divine power, and receives a "top-up" of Divinity.
We then have an opportunity for each person to hold the Talking Stick and send positive energy to their life, or current experience, or to ask the Divine for help. This is completely optional. Throughout the evening, you will have opportunities to choose oracle cards to support your guidance through life.

At 8pm the Zoom people join our circle. They will get to choose an oracle card and be connected into the vortex of power in the tent. This always creates an energy of expansion within the group.
Arniya then gives a wee run down of any current energies influencing the planet, before she leads everyone on a Journey Meditation. Some weeks we to the V.U soul plane. Sometimes we travel to our inner world. Sometimes the guardians take us somewhere else entirely. Each journey is channelled to support the needs of whoever is present.
After the meditation, we say goodbye to our Zoom friends, close the energy on the circle and give thanks. After this journey is complete, we have a cup of tea - time for a chat or playing with oracle cards, enjoying each other’s company in the uplifted space.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description:
Resilience and Emissions Reduction Workshop for Not-For-Profits | Blenheim, Ready your not-for-profit for the future
Do you know you need to take action to address climate change but don’t know where to start?
Do you want to strengthen your organisations’ planning and readiness for change?
Do you want practical tools and support to measure, assess, and report on your organisations’ impact?

In partnership with Rātā Foundation, our Earth+ Resilience and Emissions Reduction programme has been designed to flip the script on climate change, centering your organisation as agents of change and kitting you with the tools, support and community to make a difference; and it’s free of charge!
About the programme
With the support of the Terra Nova team and other programme participants, you will be guided to identify how your organisation is uniquely placed to contribute to the resilience and wellbeing of people and planet, and the opportunities and obstacles to creating positive change.
The programme is accessible and suitable for everyone, from those just starting on the journey, to those who have steps in place but are looking to gain access to further resources. This programme is not intended to add extra workload or deliverables for your organisation, it is an offer of support to integrate an Earth+ approach into your BAU; an answer to the question “what can we do about climate change?”
We know that every organisation’s capacity is different, so our support is available for you to utilise it when you need it until the end of 2025. This includes:
Access to a dedicated online community where you can connect with the Terra Nova team, other Rātā grantees and specialised partners. Ask questions, find resources and share your journey.
A toolkit of resources and impact sessions to develop your knowledge and connect you with the expertise and support to build resilience and tackle change in a range of impact areas.
Complementary access to the Cogo carbon emissions measurement tool, providing you the ability to quantify and report on your emissions impact and providing recommended actions for emissions reduction and cost savings, in an easy-to-use format.
It begins with a 1-day interactive workshop to kick things off. By the end of the workshop, you will walk away:
Feeling more empowered about the future, with a deeper understanding of resilience and climate change as it relates to your organisation’s context.
Having explored how you can make change positive and achievable, centered on the needs of your community and team. 
With free access to Cogo carbon manager, an emissions profile, report of your carbon footprint and practical action you can take to reduce your emissions.
Having built a network of support and gained free-to-use practical tools and templates.
Note: we will be running multiple workshops throughout the year; you only need to attend one workshop to join the programme. If you prefer an alternate date, please head to our Humanitix profile to find the corresponding event. 
The programme is fully funded for not-for-profit organisations and registrations are now open for 2025! Register for the programme and secure your spot in a workshop through this Humanatix event, and a member of the Terra Nova team will be in touch to confirm your enrollment. For more information about the programme and workshop, visit the Terra Nova website.
We look forward to welcoming you into our community of changemakers!
label: Conservation & Environment

description:
2025 Road Relays, 2025 Road Relays
The ultimate team run is back! 🏃‍♀️🏃‍♂️💨

Welcome to the 2025 New Zealand Road Relay Championships, a high-energy, baton-passing, van-cheering, team-powered race through the beautiful backroads of Manawatū.

Whether you’re chasing the podium or enjoying the journey with your crew, there's a relay for you:

🚩 Seven-Leg (66km) – The senior championship race with hills, gravel, and serious bragging rights
⚡ Six-Leg (35km) – Social runners, clubs, workplaces – this one’s for everyone
🚶 Five-Leg Walk (31km) – Scenic, social, and seriously fun
🔥 Four-Leg (17km) – For our U16 legends and 70+ warriors

The journey starts at the Feilding Clocktower and ends at the Halcombe Rugby Grounds, but the real magic happens in between.

Grab your crew. Pack the van. Let’s go racing.
🗓️ Event Date: Saturday 4 October 2025
📍 Location: Manawatū, NZ
🔗 Full event info & Registration: https://athleticsevents.co.nz/out-of-stadia-events/nz-road-relay-championships/

description:
A good time to sing!, There is so much going on in the world right now, and that can be overwhelming! Now is a good time to sing. A good time to get together and feel the power of community and connection through singing.
Sing for renewal and hope. Sing for harmony, joy, and inspiration. Sing for healing. Sing to regain your strength and empower others.
Spend the day at the serene sanctuary that is the Home of Compassion in Island Bay and restore yourself.
We will breathe together, listen, create beautiful sounds, let go of our worries, and lift each other up to a sense of fulfillment and joy.
And for the perfect finishing touch, a delicious lunch and morning tea are all included. All you need to do is come along!
Jonathan Berkahn and Lala Simpson have been working together, leading workshops and performing for many years. They are both highly skilled song leaders that lead from the heart and joyfully share their gifts. You will be in safe hands.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description:
Jazz Festival: Alex Trask Quartet - Imaginary Folksongs, An exclusive concert for Wellington Jazz Festival at The Undercurrent.
Alex Trask’s ‘Imaginary Folksongs’ blends Earth folk music with a speculative style from an imaginary place. Inspired by bluegrass, Scottish folk music, and jazz performance practice, the tunes have a simplicity in common. Free improvised sections contrast carefully arranged melodies, allowing creativity and structure to coexist. The fiddle-esque melodies and straightforward harmonies create an open and inviting sound that changes depending on the musicians on stage. Performing this music as a group invites each member to paint their private imaginings, creating a unique collective folklore. The quartet will also perform a selection of tunes that inspired the music, including songs by Brian Blade, Gordon Lightfoot, and traditional melodies.

Alex Trask – saxophone
Duncan Haynes – piano
Elijah Mulheron – bass
John Rae – drums

Drinks and nibbles supplied.

description:
Kiss Me Deadly, Details
Directed by Robert Aldrich
Starring Ralph Meeker, Marian Carr, Albert Dekker, Paul Stewart
70th Anniversary

--- One evening, private detective Mike Hammer picks up a hitchhiker who's standing on the highway wearing only a trench coat. They're stopped farther on by strangers who knock out Mike and murder the young woman. Although warned not to investigate by the police, Mike and his girlfriend and assistant, Velda (Maxine Cooper), become ensnared in a dark plot involving scientist Dr. Soberin (Albert Dekker) and Christina's terrified roommate, Lily (Gaby Rodgers). ---

This is a TEA TIME TALKIE screening where a delicious Devonshire Tea* awaits for upgraded tickets holders (a cup of tea and traditional homemade scones with cream and jam). This is served upstairs in the Grand Lobby during the intermission.

Admit only tickets are available for $15 or you can upgrade to include a Devonshire Tea for $24.

*No dietaries catered for.

Schedule:
2:20pm – Cinema doors open
2:30pm – Feature starts
3:15pm – Intermission, Devonshire Tea available for collection upstairs in the Grand Lobby
3:30pm – Feature resumes

description:
(Now on Sunday) Planetary Parade - Free event, Due to a heavy cloud forecast on Saturday morning, we have changed the date for this event to the following morning, Sunday 24 August.
A rare cosmic event where six of the seven planets are in dawn sky during this final Planetary Parade for 2025. Matariki is also visible at this time close to the line of planets.
Come down to the Wellington waterfront at dawn and see the planets Pareārau (Saturn), Kōpū/Tāwera (Venus), Hine-i-tīweka (Jupiter), Whiro (Mercury), and Matariki (Pleiades) in our skies. Rangipō (Uranus) and Tangaroa (Neptune) are also in the sky but they will be too faint to see. Matawhero (Mars) follows after Te Rā (the Sun) rises so it won't be seen in the sky.
If you want to gaze in wonder at Saturn, Jupiter, Venus, look through our amazing telescopes! We can show you where to find Matariki, but binoculars at better so if you have a pair bring them along. The event is child friendly and free!
If you want to support our Society by becoming a member, please go to https://www.was.org.nz/join-us/

The Lazy Seals Freediving Club is proud to host the AIDA Freediving New Zealand Pool Nationals 2025 at Te Ngaengae Pool, Wellington

Dave the dates for competition, sign up will open shortly.

Don't want to compete? Volunteers are always welcome, as is billeting, get int ouch if you can help with these.

The competition will comprise three sessions over three days:

Friday 19 September: Statics (STA), with athelete's briefing in the morning

Saturday 20 September: Morning Dynamic with Fins (DYN/DYNB) in the 50m Main Pool

Sunday 21 September: Morning Dynamic No Fins (DNF) in the 25m Main Pool

FNZ Club Members
Recreational Grade – $115 Early Bird / $150
AIDA Grade – $130 Early Bird / $165

Non-FNZ Club Members
AIDA Grade – $155 Early Bird / $190

description:
Bunnings Warehouse NPC: Lions v Bay of Plenty, Bunnings Warehouse NPC: Lions v Bay of Plenty
Don’t miss this one! The Wellington Lions face Bay of Plenty in a rematch of last year’s epic final, this time at Porirua Park. With their last two clashes locked after 80 minutes, this round robin match is bound to be a ripper!


GATES OPEN: 1:00pm
KICK OFF: Wellington Lions vs Bay of Plenty - 2:05pm


SHUTTLE BUSES: Skip the parking hassle and jump on our FREE Rambler shuttle bus to the next three Lions home games at Porirua Park. Take the bus and be into win awesome golf spot prizes from The Morgans Golf Course & Judgeford Golf Club. Buses will run from the eastside of the Porirua train station to Porirua Park commencing at 1:00pm, 1:20pm and 1:40pm. Buses will loop from Porirua Park to Porirua train station for one hour following the game.


GIVEAWAYS: The first 150 kids at the Lions game (from 1pm) will receive 6x FREE player trading cards! Also for giveaway are 2024 Lions Championship Posters, Lions flags available for giveaway.


ENTERTAINMENT:
Pre Game Activations
• NPC Trophy photo opportunity with Leo the Lion

Halftime
• Rick Rolls ROAR n Race


POST-MATCH HANGOUT
After the game, keep the good times rolling! Join us at The Supply Room (105 Mana Esplanade, Paremata) and meet the team.

- $25 - Adults
- $14 - Students
- Kids 15 years and under free.

Wellington – My Home, Our Lions

What if you could choose the songs at a Nirvana concert… and then watch them come to life on stage?

🎤 For the first time ever, Nirvana Tribute is putting the show in the hands of the fans. Audiences across Australia and New Zealand will vote on the songs they want to hear. This isn’t just a tribute. It’s a show 𝗯𝘂𝗶𝗹𝘁 𝗯𝘆 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗳𝗮𝗻𝘀, 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗳𝗮𝗻𝘀.

description:
Antü Mārama, The Undercurrent presents Antu Marama!
Wellington band Antü Mārama brings you the vibrant evocative folk music of Latin America, with traditional tunes and original compositions. From Chile, the UK, New Zealand and the Canary Islands the group's ethos is represented by the name - Antü is the Mapudungún word for sun, while Mārama is the Te reo Māori word for Moon.
The group combines both the life-giving energy and vitality of the sun with the deeper emotions and more reflective energy of the Moon. Antü Mārama is a synthesis of the group's diverse backgrounds and musical experiences, united by a love of playing music, and a desire to share the rich folk tradition of Latin America with a local audience.
Watch them perform here:
https://www.instagram.com/reel/DHcrQc2Rf0O/?igsh=bGV5cHdpeTVqMzB2⁩
Saturday 6th September

description:
Dear Gentlemen (Colombia), Dear Gentlemen (Colombia)
Director: Patricia Castañeda -

Genre: Drama

About this Event

Dear Gentlemen brings to light the little-known sufraggist movement in Colombia. Set in 1954, the film follows Esmeralda Arboleda, a fiercely intelligent leader who sparks a revolution in a society deeply rooted in patriarchal traditions - a revolution that culminates in a fierce and decisve debate. A women group embarks on a historic struggle to bring the issue of women's right to vote before the National Constituent Assembly. With bold marches, radio appearances, and a brilliant media strategy that puts them on the front page, they achieve their goal, but the real challenge begins during the debate, where they face fierce opposition. Esmeralda Arboleda must endure personal attacks from the assembly members, and just as she is about to speak, she receives a heartbreaking call: her son has suffered a serious accident. She is torn between her duty as a mother and her commitment to the cause, with an unfavorable outcome. Although all seems to be lost, her perseverance leads to a historic victory when women's suffrage is finally approved, marking a turning point in Colombia's history.

description:
Kaukau Skyline Traverse, Olympic Harriers and Athletics Wellington proudly present the Second Edition of the Kaukau Skyline Traverse, incorporating the 2025 Wellington Mountain Running Championships.
The races will take place on the western hills of Johnsonville along the Skyline Track over Mt Kaukau.
Races start and finish at the northern end of the Skyline Track heading south along the ridgeline to Mt Kaukau and beyond. All races are ‘out and back’ each with a turn-around point. The long course includes an additional challenging loop (clockwise) before turning around.
Race distances and approximate ascents are:
· Race 1: 11:00am Long course 12.15km (600m)
· Race 2: 11:10am Medium course 8.75km (400m)
· Race 3: 11:20am Short course 5.75km (220m)
· Race 4: 11:30am Sprint course 1.75km (70m)
Championship runners must be registered with an Athletics Wellington club, wear their club uniform and run in the correct race according to their age grade. Non-championship runners can run in any race. You must be 18 years or older to run in races 1 or 2.
On a good day running the Skyline with views across Wellington and the South Island are amazing! And on a bad day…exhilarating !!!!
Enter Here = https://eventplus.net/2wm25
More Info= https://www.olympicharriers.nz/listcalendar/?eid=3957

description:
Free Status, Free Status is a jazz fusion band, drawing melodic inspiration from iconic artists like Herbie Hancock and 70s jazz/funk legends with electronic flair inspired by artists like Moby.

At the heart of Free Status is Tommy David on keys, an accomplished musician/composer in the early stages of his career. He has earned recognition in numerous jazz competitions and supported legendary rock acts such as Dire Straits Legacy Band, Nazareth, Hello Sailor, and plays with popular rockabilly band, Recliner Rockers. With composition at the center of his artistry, he can’t wait to share the exciting and genuine compositions he has created.

The rhythm section features Behzad Karakia (drums) and Tyler Diprose (bass), both veterans of performances with many of New Zealand’s jazz greats.

On lead alto sax is James Dawes, recently selected for an international touring band on a year-long cruise. His versatility extends well beyond jazz.

On keys is Sam Voyle, whose primary instrument is tenor saxophone. Performing with Tommy since their school days, he has built a strong musical bond that has led to major appearances, including the America’s Cup main stage and high-profile corporate events.

On vocals is Melody Lui-Webster, an award-winning singer and accomplished musical theatre performer and actor, with numerous professional stage and television roles.

Thank you for watching!
