description:
Spring Céilí Dance with The Great Beag Céilí Band, Spring Céilí Dance with The Great Beag Céilí Band
Spring has sprung, the days are getting longer, the rain is falling sideways. Must be about time we had another céilí! Join The Great Beag Céilí Band at St Michael’s Hall in Kelburn for a rousing evening of dancing to foot-stomping celtic tunes. Our Autumn céilí sold out so make sure you get your tickets early!

If you’ve never been to a céilí (or ceilidh) before, fear not - céilí dancing is very easy! No fancy moves or any previous experience required: our caller will explain each dance, and we’ll all walk it through a couple of times before adding the music.

This is social dancing so bring all your friends! No need to bring a specific partner - there’ll be lots of friendly people to dance with.

Discounted online tickets are available on Humanitix until midnight on September 26th: $24 / $16 concession
https://events.humanitix.com/beag-ceili-spring-ceili-2025

Some door sales may be available on the day: $30 / $20 concession (cash only)

—

Doors open 7:30pm

Adults and age 10+ welcome. Under 16s accompanied by an adult.

Light refreshments will be available. We recommend bringing a water bottle to grab a quick drink between dances - hydration is key!
This is an alcohol-free event.

Getting here: St Michael’s Hall is located at 81 Upland Road in Kelburn Village, just behind the church.
There is very limited on-street parking in the village. We recommend public transport: the 4, 18, 21, and 22 buses stop regularly right outside coming up from Te Aro or down from Northland and Karori.

Be safe online: Tickets are only available online from the Humanitix event. Do not buy tickets from other sources such as Facebook comments or resale sites - these are always scams. If you can no longer attend, please contact us via Humanitix, our socials, or email to discuss refunds.

Health notice: Céilí dancing is a great way to meet lots of people. If you are feeling unwell then please stay home and rest this time, we will see you at the next one.

description:
Welly Green Thinks - Spring Edition, Although architecture is a confluence of styles, cultures, amenity, and technical delivery, it is the ‘site’ which buildings are most vehemently shaped by, and yet the land they are located on often loses touch with critical pathways to solving systemic sustainability issues. Tina will discuss this proposition, her observations in practice and what decisions get prioritised, and how we can be more conscientious about land use.  

Tina Williams is a NZ registered architect and current chair of Te Kahui Whaihanga – NZ Institute of Architects Wellington Branch, and has worked on numerous residential and community projects.
Be part of the conversation that aims to shape sustainable and resilient futures for our communities.

description:
Tap for Healing Trauma & the Nervous system, Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars
Tap for Healing Trauma & the Nervous system
Our nervous system is shaped by more than just big life events — hidden wounds and micro-traumas from childhood can leave lasting imprints that show up as stress, anxiety, and repeating relationship patterns. When triggered, these unconscious “programs” hijack our reactions, leaving us feeling stuck even when we want to move forward. In this workshop, we’ll explore how trauma influences the nervous system and why awareness alone isn’t enough to create lasting change.
In this 75 minute workshop, you’ll discover how trauma impacts the nervous system and learn FasterEFT tools to release triggers, reframe old memories, and reset your stress response. You’ll walk away with simple, science-backed practices you can use every day to build resilience and emotional freedom.
“This is an interactive workshop where you’ll connect with others. It’s a powerful reminder that, beneath the surface, we generally share the same challenges and struggles—and that healing becomes easier when we explore them together.”
Meet your host, Krishnaloka
Introducing Krishnaloka, who is driven to help others overcome their issues within their mind and pyschology. As a mind technician trained in eutaptics (Faster EFT), she employs the fastest and most powerful method to create lasting change by addressing the root causes of issues rather than just the symptoms. Her warm and caring nature makes every interaction with her both comforting and transformative.


6.15pm Tuesday 7th of October
End the session on a high note with a delicious plant-based dinner, dessert, and good conversation.
Tickets available here~ bit.ly/eventTickets

These groups are a safe space for family and whānau to share their experiences, their challenges, their triumphs, and to learn from each other in an open and 100% judgement-free environment. description:
Embrace the Breath, Embrace the Breath
Join Sarah for an evening of mindfulness, breathing and meditation.

Breathwork is a conscious manipulation of the breath to bring about a change in consciousness.

The doors open at 7.15pm (when you arrive, please wait in the waiting room at the entrance, Sarah will come and get you when the studio is ready), with the journey beginning promptly at 7.30pm, with mindfulness, a 45-60 min journey with the breath, followed by connection and sharing.

Sarah Bradnock is a local multi-modality practitioner of energy, bodywork, plant medicine, now working utilising the the breath with SoulSide Breathwork.

Book your space today! Only 10 available.
$55 per person
bring a friend (2 tickets) $100

Registration closes on Wednesday 23 September, if not sold out before then!

What do you need to bring:
- yoga mat or other mat to lay on
- bolster (optional)
- eye pillow
- socks
- jersey or warm top
- water bottle
- journal and pen

If you've never participated in breathwork before, here are a few contraindications:
Physical Contraindications
-Cardiovascular issues
-Glaucoma
-High blood pressure (Over time, if untreated, it can cause health conditions, such as heart disease and stroke) Deep-breathing lowers blood pressure.
-Epilepsy
-Detached Retina (Retinal detachment separates the retinal cells from the layer of blood vessels that provides oxygen and nourishment).
-History of strokes or seizures
-Aneurysm or family history of aneurysm. (Burst blood vessels in the brain).
-Blood thinning medication. (Unfortunately, the blood thinners used to prevent such blood clots can increase the risk of bleeding in the brain, a cause of hemorrhagic stroke).
-Pregnancy or possible pregnancy
-Asthma
-Mental Contraindications
-Substance dependence & addiction (Deep breathwork journeys are not always appropriate for those who are still addicted to a substance, as it tends to raise suppressed or repressed material for processing. However, if you’re currently in recovery, this can be extremely healing, and help you discover the deeper patterns that gave rise to this addiction. (Grof, 1985: 267 – 268).
-Bipolar disorder, schizophrenia or psychosis
-Hospitalisation for emotional crises in the last 10 years
-Psychological conditions and diagnoses, which preclude safe emotional release.

If you are affected by any of the above, please inform Sarah.

*Tickets are non-refundable, but are transferrable with 24 hours notice required.

description:
Burnout to Breath: A Somatic Reset for the Nervous System, Burnout to Breath: A Somatic Reset for the Nervous System
If you’re running on fumes, stuck in overdrive, or feeling wired and tired, this session is for you. Even if you’ve tried resting, you might still feel tense, foggy, or emotionally flat. This session is designed for high-achieving women ready to reconnect to their body, regulate their nervous system, and rediscover their energy.
You might notice these signs:
Waking up tired, even after a full night’s sleep
Overthinking decisions and feeling emotionally reactive
Craving peace but feeling disconnected from your body
Often feeling “on” and unable to fully relax
Workshop Details:
Through guided somatic breathwork, gentle movement, and nervous system education, you’ll be supported to safely release stored tension, calm your system, and access clarity from within.
What to bring/prepare:
Comfortable clothing for movement
Water bottle and journal
Yoga mat provided
Optional: blanket, eye pillow, essential oils
Arrive: 5–10 minutes early to settle in
Unwind further with a wholesome plant-based dinner and dessert, a nurturing way to ground yourself and enjoy a sense of calm and connection after the session.
Contraindications for Breathwork:
Breathwork can be a powerful tool but may not be suitable for everyone. Please consult your healthcare provider before participating if you have:
Cardiovascular issues (e.g., high blood pressure, heart disease)
Respiratory conditions (e.g., asthma, COPD)
A history of seizures or epilepsy
Diagnosed mental health conditions (e.g., schizophrenia, bipolar disorder)
Pregnancy (some breath patterns may need modification)
Recent surgery or physical injuries that limit movement
You are always welcome to participate in the somatic and movement elements without engaging in deep breathwork—your safety and well-being are our priority.
About Lynofuro:
Lynofuro is an Integrative Somatic Coach and Breathwork Facilitator who helps intuitive, high-performing women overcome emotional burnout and restore energetic balance. Her work blends somatics, breath, and energy alignment to support lasting transformation.
What past participants say:
“I walked in overwhelmed and walked out feeling like myself again.”
“This was the first time I felt fully present and peaceful in weeks.”
hi@lynofuro.co.nz |
www.lynofuro.co.nz

Slow down, settle in, and let the gentle rhythm of the ocean carry you inward.
This calming evening will centre around the deeply restorative practice of Yoga Nidra—a guided meditation designed to bring your body into a state of deep rest while your awareness gently drifts between waking and dreaming. Known to activate the parasympathetic nervous system and reduce stress, Yoga Nidra supports emotional balance, mental clarity, and a profound sense of ease.
This ocean-themed session invites you to immerse yourself in the tranquil energy of the sea—its steady waves, expansive horizons, and peaceful depths—a time to soften, release, and simply be.
After the practice, we’ll be sharing a nourishing plant-based dinner together. It’s included in your ticket and is a lovely way to gently transition back, connect, and enjoy wholesome food in good company.
Comfort note: Mats, cushions, blankets, and eye masks are provided, but feel free to bring your own for extra comfort and coziness.

description:
Men's Group Tuesday 4 Nov, To join this community, and book your Tuesdays - please sign up here first, and we will email you the event access code. (our venue address will be emailed with your ticket).

This is a space for men to talk honestly, listen deeply, and figure some things out together. It’s not about having it all sorted. You don’t need to be a certain type of guy. Just show up as you are, with no pressure to speak or share.
Open group: new faces are welcome
Flexible: book to come when it suits you. Each Tuesday is a new event. Most will try for fortnightly.
Small groups: 8 men + 2 experienced hosts
Inclusive: all ages, backgrounds and identities (18+)
It's about connection and showing up, instead of going it alone. It makes time for meeting our various challenges, while learning and growing us into better friends, partners, dads, sons and humans. 
It isn’t a boys or bros club, therapy or a self-help seminar, religious or new-age. No fixing, preaching, or pressure. It’s not a crisis service or a substitute for professional care. The sign-up form explains this in more detail.
You can expect to:
Practice listening and learn communication skills for life
Discover greater integrity and self-accountability
Be supported in building your emotional intelligence
Become a part of a hearty and diverse community
Have a good time - it’s often uplifting and inspiring.
Joseph and your team of hosts have all been in regular men's groups for many years. The group sometimes offers simple and proven inquiries that draw on NVC, MBSR, active listening, gratitude and more.

We’re super excited to be collaborating with the lovely Radha Iveta from Heart Awakening. Plus - there will be an amazing plant based dinner included in your ticket!
This will be insightful, down-to-earth and inspiring.
It’s the art of aligning with the natural rhythms. And see how your wellness takes shape with just a few simple adjustments. It’s the small things that compound to develop your wellbeing!
This workshop is an introduction to Dinacharya, the Ayurvedic practice of daily self-care routines that harmonise mind, body, and spirit.
In the workshop, we will cover:
Understanding Dinacharya: What it is and its importance in Ayurveda.
Morning Routine: Simple, effective practices to start your day with balance.
Evening Routine: Techniques to wind down and promote restful sleep.
Eating & Digestion: Ayurvedic recommendations for meal timing and digestion.
Self-Care Practices: How to incorporate oil pulling, tongue scraping, and more into your day.
Seasonal Adjustments: How to tweak your routine according to the seasons.


Meet Radha, your host
Radha Iveta is a meditation and yoga practitioner, certified teacher, Ayurveda practitioner and therapist, cacao lover, and the founder of Heart Awakening and True Nature Ayurveda. Her work was born out of a profound love for these teachings and her desire to invite others on a journey toward more meaning and fulfilment, guided by the direct experience and knowledge that Love is our true nature.
Her heart is invested in helping people reconnect to their hearts and reveal their true nature by bringing sacredness and simplicity into all aspects of life.

A free workshop for the General Public: Dying to Know about Dying Matters?, Please note, this is a FREE workshop availble to the public and is not designed for health professionals to attend.
Many people find it difficult to talk about dying, yet dying is an important stage of life and is inevitable.
We plan for the birth of a child, yet when it comes to the end of life, we don’t often want to think , or talk about it.
Come along to our workshop and find out more about dying matters, how an Advance Care Planning (ACP)can benefit you and your family/whānau and what to expect at the end of life.
Having a plan outlines our care preferences for the future. Having an Advance Care Plan (ACP) that aligns with our beliefs and values, is a gift that we can give to our family / whānau.
We will explore:
Why is it hard to talk about death and dying?
What to expect when someone is dying
Supports available
Advance care planning processes

description:
Teaching Well - A supportive school for a well staff - Wellington (TWS2025/04), Growing attention to staff wellbeing has resulted in many workplace mental wellbeing initiatives. Nevertheless, the concept of staff wellbeing is rarely well-defined, with programs focusing on either work-related stressors or staff wellness approaches.

As part of a well school, it is just as essential to have a well staff as it is to a well student body. Don't miss out! Discover the key principles of wellbeing and build a sustainable, impactful plan for your staff.

Join this workshop tailored for schools & kura, exploring how to promote staff wellbeing in 2025. Learn the theory and practice of promoting wellbeing in staff!
From Remedial to Sustainable Action
Providing resources or assistance programmes to help staff manage job stress is a single element of an extensive staff wellbeing plan. Schools commonly start at the remedial end of the wellbeing continuum, creating welfare or wellness plans. Learning the differences between welfare, wellness, and wellbeing approaches, including their strengths and weaknesses, is important.

Meta-evaluations reveal that many workplace mental wellbeing programmes lack efficacy due to not addressing organisational and systemic factors that impact wellbeing. Effective staff wellbeing programmes must respond to staff needs and reflect the school's cultural values and character.
Utilizing collective impact, transformational change theory, and Te Whare Tapa Whā, we introduce a conceptual model outlining the eight pillars essential for a staff wellbeing plan. This model's strength lies in its specificity to different settings or occupations, necessitating an in-depth analysis of work nature, dynamics, and inter-relationships.
Based on insights from past workshops and participant feedback, this workshop now provides a comprehensive template for developing staff wellbeing plans.
This workshop does not offer a pre-packaged wellbeing programme. Research indicates that externally imposed wellbeing programmes have limited efficacy in schools. Effective staff wellbeing plans must be rooted in insights gained from reflective analysis and staff consultations. Notably, the consultation process itself is a key wellbeing activity.
Take the opportunity to hear from an award winning wellbeing specialist about:
the wellbeing continuum and the difference between mental illness prevention and wellbeing approaches
the key determinants that impact on staff wellbeing
effective strategies to respond to fatigue, burnout, depression and trauma
why one size doesn't fit all and how to scope and design a staff wellbeing programme responsive to the specific needs of your school
developing a staff wellbeing programme based on proven wellbeing outcomes
making informed decisions on your school’s staff wellbeing policy and activities
Workshop Format:
The content will be delivered over two workshops.
In-Person 1 day workshop in Wellington
Friday 31 October 9am to 4pm
On-Line Workshop
Wednesday 3 December 1 - 3.30pm

Topics covered in this practical workshop:
what is meant by wellbeing and its role in addressing stress and mental distress in staff;
the difference between a welfare and a wellbeing approach;
staff wellbeing as an industrial relations / conditions of employment issue
resilience, coping, thriving? - identifying desired wellbeing outcomes
the interface between personal and professional stressors and distressors
the impact on staff wellbeing from exposure to trauma and poor mental wellbeing within the student body
the key determinants that facilitate wellbeing in the teaching environment
what does and what doesn’t contribute to a supportive environment where staff thrive
the key components that should be in a staff wellbeing programme
designing, implementing and evaluating a staff wellbeing programme
School Group Participation
Schools are encouraged to have more than one staff member participate in the online workshops. Past workshops has shown that having more than one staff member has maximised the benefit of the workshop activities which can then been continued post-workshop. To promote school group participation, there is a 20% discount off the total registration fee when three or more participants per school are registered.
Who should attend: 
Senior leadership team members (especially those with responsibility of staff wellbeing)
OHS representatives or union delegates
Heads of Departments
Boards of Trustees representatives
School Counsellors / EAP providers
In-House Delivery:
This workshop can also be delivered in-house, school clusters, or organisations such as prinicpal assocations or unions. Post workshop consulting services such as mentoring the development of or reviewing a staff wellbeing plan can also be provided.
Post Workshop Consult:
Schools and Kuras have the option of a 90 minute consult with Barry in 2026 to review their staff wellbeing plan.
AN OPPORTUNITY FOR LEARNING WITH INTERNATIONALLY RESPECTED AND AWARD WINNING MENTAL WELLBEING PRACTITIONER AND SUICIDOLOGIST, BARRY TAYLOR
Barry has worked in mental wellbeing promotion and suicide prevention/postvention for 37 years at the local, national and international levels.  His extensive experience includes sitting on state and national government advisory committees; designing, implementing and evaluating suicide prevention programs; writing suicide prevention guidelines, training packages and community resources; providing technical advice to community based and national mental wellbeing and suicide prevention programs.  He has worked extensively with schools both here and overseas supporting management and staff in the event of a suicide. He wrote the first suicide postvention guidelines for schools in 1990, developed the first national suicide prevention guidelines for schools in Australia in 1999 and reviewed and updated the NZ guidelines in 2010.
He has led multiple ‘firsts’ in mental wellbeing both in Aotearoa New Zealand and overseas.  In recognition of his outstanding contribution to mental wellbeing and suicide prevention, he was awarded in 2016 the NSW Mental Health Commissioner's Community Champion Award.
Barry has lectured on wellbeing both nationally and internationally and been appointed to numerous government advisory committees on mental wellbeing and suicide prevention.  He brings to this workshop extensive experience in advising communities and government on post-disaster recovery in terms of both mental wellbeing promotion / community resiliency and suicide prevention.
As a Health Sociologist and Public Health practitioner, Barry has a long-term interest in the social and cultural determinants of wellbeing, especially the role of gender and he brings a wealth of knowledge and passion for promoting wellbeing in men. He has examined the impact of discrimination, internalised stigma, social exclusion or inclusion on mental wellbeing along with the role of human rights as an enabler of wellbeing.
He embraces a holistic understanding of wellbeing and has an interest in the role spirituality and ecology contributes to a person's wellbeing. He uses a population health and systems change approach, drawing on transformational change theory and collective impact.
After a number of years overseas, Barry is living back in New Zealand and is passionate about building the knowledge base, competence and capability within our country to promote well whānau, workplaces and communities and for the incorporation of wellbeing principles in public policy and social outcomes such as education, training and employment.
WORKSHOP DETAILS
WORKSHOP PLACES ARE LIMITED. REGISTER EARLY TO AVOID DISAPPOINTMENT
Places in the workshop are limited. If the workshop is full please register your name on the waitlist
Group Booking Discount: Book 3 or more participants in one booking and receive 20% discount off each registration
School & Kura Discount: Enter SCHOOLKURA20 to the Discount Code box at the beginning of the registration process for a further 20% discount off the registration fee.
Payment: Payment is by either:
Credit Card (Visa or Mastercard) or 
Instalment payment (ZIP and Afterpay)
Invoice - Schools and kura have the option to pay by invoice. At payment method click on Invoice,
Terms for Payment By Invoice
By selecting to pay by invoice the organisation agrees to the following conditions:
1.  Your place in the workshop is not confirmed until payment has been received. Payment of the invoice must be made within seven days of registering to avoid having your registration cancelled. Late payment fees apply.
2.  A Tax Invoice from TaylorMade Training and Consulting will be sent to you separately which will contain bank details for payment.  
3.  By registering for the workshop, you agree to the cancellation and policy. (refer below).  Organisations who cancel within seven days of the workshop and have not paid the invoice for the outstanding registration fee are still obligated to pay the outstanding debt.

Cancellation and Refund Policy
Workshops can fill quickly. If you are no longer able to attend the workshop please cancel your registration as soon as possible. The following refund policy is strictly adhered to.
Cancellation up to seven days prior to the commencement of the workshop:  Full Refund less $35+GST admin fee
Cancellation within seven days prior to the commencement of the workshop: No refund but registration can be transferred to another person. To transfer your registration log on to your registration and update the name and contact details to the new person attending.
Non attendance:   No refund

description:

description:
Habits mastery series: Buy Back Your Time, Habits mastery series: Buy Back Your Time
Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars
You don’t need more hours in the day — you just need to stop spending them on the wrong things.
You’re busy. I get it. There’s just no time for the things that you really want to do, right?
"Buy Back Your Time" is a 1-hour interactive workshop for anyone who wants to reclaim their time, energy, and focus — without burnout or hustle culture.
In this session, you'll learn:
Why time management is really attention management
How to shift from reacting to designing your days
Practical tools to create space for what actually matters
How to identify & eliminate your biggest time-wasters
You’ll walk away with a simple plan to buy back your time — and start investing it in your goals, your growth, and your life.
Meet your host, Nava
Nava’s natural interest in studying physics blossomed into metaphysics when she arrived in the land of the long white cloud. Originally from Germany, Nava was travelling on a quest to find purpose and answers to the mysteries of life. Did she find anything on this quest? Yes! After four exciting years of inquiry, practice, and being immersed in the wonders of bhakti yoga, she is still fully inspired by what she has discovered. Mesmerized by the depth and broad-mindedness that a yoga lifestyle offers, Nava is keen to share with you that wisdom and love, along with her experiences on the road of life. Nava is also an expert vegan chef who specializes in European cuisine and baking, and she is busy spreading that kind of love around Bhakti Lounge too!
6.15pm Tuesday 26th August
End the session on a high note with a delicious plant-based dinner, dessert, and good conversation.
Tickets available here~ bit.ly/eventTickets
Bhakti Lounge 1/175 Vivian Street, Te Aro, Wellington. http://www.bhaktilounge.org.nz

description:
The Check-in Men's Group Tuesday 30 Sept, To join this community, and book your Tuesdays - please sign up here first, and we will email you the event access code. (our venue address will be emailed with your ticket).

This is a space for men to talk honestly, listen deeply, and figure some things out together. It’s not about having it all sorted. You don’t need to be a certain type of guy. Just show up as you are, with no pressure to speak or share.
Open group: new faces are welcome
Flexible: book to come when it suits you. Each Tuesday is a new event. Most will try for fortnightly.
Small groups: 8 men + 2 experienced hosts
Inclusive: all ages, backgrounds and identities (18+)
It's about connection and showing up, instead of going it alone. It makes time for meeting our various challenges, while learning and growing us into better friends, partners, dads, sons and humans. 
It isn’t a boys or bros club, therapy or a self-help seminar, religious or new-age. No fixing, preaching, or pressure. It’s not a crisis service or a substitute for professional care. The sign-up form explains this in more detail.
You can expect to:
Practice listening and learn communication skills for life
Discover greater integrity and self-accountability
Be supported in building your emotional intelligence
Become a part of a hearty and diverse community
Have a good time - it’s often uplifting and inspiring.
Joseph and your team of hosts have all been in regular men's groups for many years. The group sometimes offers simple proven inquiries that draw on NVC, MBSR, active listening, gratitude and more.

description:
Advice for Modern Life - meditation course, Advice for Modern Life - meditation course
Advice for Modern Life - meditation course
with Kadam Birgit

By keeping Atisha’s Advice in our heart, we can maintain a peaceful happy mind, our human nature and good qualities will improve, we will be able to show a good example for the people of our troubled world and we will quickly attain full enlightenment.

As Venerable Geshe-la says, ‘Simply putting this Advice into practice we will naturally become a Bodhisattva, a holy compassionate being who is the object of everybody’s love and respect’.

On this half day course Kadam Birgit will share teachings given at the International Summer Festival 2025 on Advice from Atisha’s Heart.

Although it was composed many centuries ago, this much-loved Buddhist scripture is full of practical advice to help us deal with the challenges of modern living, and transform our life into an authentic path of inner development.

Everyone welcome.

WHAT TO EXPECT
These classes are based on Buddha’s teachings on the mind, but you do not need to be a Buddhist to attend, or to benefit from them. There is no physical exercise involved and you can choose to sit either in a chair or on a cushion. These classes are suitable for all levels of experience.

Registration starts at 9:30am. This course includes a vegan, wheat-free morning tea (we cannot guarantee gluten-free).

Nestled within a sacred Sanctuary under the starlit skies of Paraparaumu, you are invited to enter the realm of Ether — the invisible thread that weaves all of life. Here, the boundaries between body, breath, and spirit begin to dissolve into the spaciousness of the cosmos.

Cradled by silence, expanded through breath, and elevated by sound, this ceremony is a subtle, sacred transmission — a remembrance of your soul’s celestial origin.

𝗕𝗟𝗨𝗘 𝗟𝗢𝗧𝗨𝗦 𝗥𝗜𝗧𝗨𝗔𝗟

Blue Lotus, known as the Flower of the Heavens, has been revered in ancient Egyptian and Eastern traditions as a plant of intuition, divination, and deep heart awakening. As you connect with the energy of Blue Lotus you are invited to soften your edges and expand your awareness into dream-like states — where insight, creativity, and emotional release naturally unfold. She is the guardian of the liminal realms, ushering you gently into etheric remembrance.

Nestled in the hills beside the Lotus Yoga Centre rests a sacred Meditation Sanctuary
a place where many come to reconnect, find inner stillness, and bathe in peace.

Built in 1999, this Sanctuary serves as the spiritual heart of the Centre’s activities.
The location itself was chosen with great care, resting at the meeting point of powerful ley lines, its energy deeply aligned with Kapiti Island and the Maungakotukutuku ranges to the east.

The octagon-shaped structure is crafted from natural timbers, crowned with a glass pyramid roof that amplifies and channels healing energies. Around its frame, tinted windows radiate the seven colours of the rainbow—each one carrying a unique healing ray. On a bright day, the play of colours is nothing short of spectacular, filling the space with a living rainbow of light.

description:
90-Day Business Plan Workshop - 24/9, Create Your 90-Day Business Plan
Are you a small business owner, unsure of where to focus your efforts, possibly feeling overwhelmed by the tasks ahead?
Introducing the 90-Day Business Planning workshop
📅 Wednesday 24/9/25 From 9:00am-1:00pm At 3/15 Daly Street, Lower Hutt
If you’ve been thinking that you need to start working ON your business
(rather than just IN the business), or maybe you are feeling unsure of
where to focus your efforts, or perhaps you are even becoming
overwhelmed by the tasks ahead - You're not alone.
Many entrepreneurs face this struggle.
This lack of direction is not only frustrating - it's a huge roadblock.
Introducing the 90-Day Business Planning Experience
In just half a day, you will be creating and walk out with a ready-to-execute 90-day plan that will give you the clarity and focus you need to move forward with confidence., and then at 30-day and 60-day online follow-up session to keep your progress
What You'll Walk Away With:
A Clear Strategy: Get into the right mindset for success as you connect your passion and goals to a focused 90-day plan that moves your business forward.
An Actionable Plan: Breakdown your big goals into clear, doable weekly steps, making it easy to stay on track and see real progress.
Inspiration & Connection: Learn, share, and grow alongside other business owners, gaining fresh insights, motivation, and a powerful networking opportunity.
Why You Need This Now:
Without a business plan, you are more likely to miss opportunities, waste time, and burn out.
Businesses with formal plans are more likely to succeed and achieve long-term growth.
The time to act is now - this session is your key to getting your business forward successfully.
Stop Going in Circles: 
Invest just half a day, where you’ll be able to create a 90-day business plan that’s ready to execute.
You'll feel empowered to move forward with purpose and clarity as you get to connect with other business owners at the same time.

description:
Procurement & Contract Myths – The Good, The Bad & The Ugly., Procurement & Contract Myths – The Good, The Bad & The Ugly.
At MOX, we're a small, family-run business based in beautiful Aotearoa, New Zealand. Founded and led by two partners who've shared life's journey for over 25 years, we bring a unique blend of personal commitment and professional expertise to every interaction.

We're not your typical consultants. Instead, we're hands-on experts in procurement and contract management, driven by a desire to create real, lasting change. Our mission is to empower businesses of all sizes, helping you secure the best deals, avoid pitfalls, and gain the kind of commercial protection usually reserved for the big players. We believe in enabling your success by ensuring your contracts and purchasing processes truly work for you.

Procurement & Contract Myths – The Good, The Bad & The Ugly.

Procurement Case Studies - The Bad: How things can go wrong and cost you $$$.
Contract Myth Busting - The Ugly: Why we should embrace contracts; they aren’t “ugly”.
Best Practice - The Good: How good procurement & contracts will “save the day” and protect your business.
Contract Counselling: Tell us about your “bad(s)”. We will guide you on how you can make it “good”.
We have an amazing new innovation that we want to introduce at the session (during the Best Practice part) called Kitset Contract. Kitset Contract is going to empower sole traders & small to medium sized enterprises to truly be able to create and use their own contracts; Allowing them to better protect their business and their hard earned $$$.

Everyone who attends the session will receive a discount code meaning their first contract will be only $49.99 (a $100 discount).

RSVP Here: https://www.kapitichamber.org.nz/events#!event/2025/8/5/l-d-procurement-contract-myths-8211-the-good-the-bad-the-ugly

description:
After 5: Bunnings Warehouse - Lyall Bay, What does the future hold for local businesses in Aotearoa - and how can you take advantage of the opportunities on your doorstep? Join us for a special After 5 at Bunnings Lyall Bay, where we’ll look at new ways to grow, train, and connect as a business community.

You’ll hear about the exciting potential of the 2026 New Zealand Trade Expo, designed to open doors for business investment and international partnerships. You’ll also learn how the MBIE Management Capability Development Voucher Programme can provide funding and support to build your business skills and capability.

From a local perspective, we’ll showcase how Bunnings partners with businesses, schools, and community organisations - and how Chamber members can unlock exclusive savings and benefits with the Bunnings Power Pass.

Popular suppliers including Ryobi, AEG, and Ozito will also be in-store to answer questions and share product advice, making this session a rare and practical opportunity to get info that gets you ahead.

Most importantly, this After 5 is a chance to network with fellow Chamber members in a fresh setting, and take away practical opportunities to strengthen and grow your business.

description:
The Workplace Rituals Deck Facilitator Masterclass, Build culture by design, not by default - one ritual at a time.
Facilitate meaningful culture change and create connection through the power of workplace rituals.
This masterclass is for people who want to build stronger, more connected workplace cultures — and are ready to turn values and intentions into real, daily action.
Whether you're a leader, culture champion, facilitator, or change consultant, this training will give you the tools and confidence to run your own Workplace Rituals Workshops using the WRD (Workplace Rituals Deck).
Led by the co-creators of the deck, Lotty Roberts and Lorissa Garcia, this is a hands-on learning experience rooted in emotional culture, intentional design, and purposeful leadership.
In this Masterclass, you'll learn:
What rituals are and why they are important
Why rituals matter in workplaces
The difference between habits and rituals
Indepth knowledge of each of the 4 parts of the deck and why they are important
How to use our PARR model to craft rituals that stick
How to run the Rituals Audit
How to guide groups through ideation, crafting and action
Lotty & Lorissa's tips and tricks for using the deck first hand, along with the story and background behind the deck.
You'll walk away as a Certified Workplace Rituals Deck Practitioner, with confidence to run rituals sessions with your own teams or clients.
What's Included:
3.5 hour in person masterclass
Co-led by the WRD creators: Lotty Roberts & Lorissa Garcia
Certification as a WRD Practitioner
Digital Toolkit
Option to purchase with or without a deck.
Who it’s for:
Leaders & Team Managers
Culture Champions
Small business owners wanting to create an intentional culture as they scale
HR, OD, and Change Practitioners
Leadership Development Consultants
Facilitators & Coaches
Anyone who wants to turn values into action and create emotionally intelligent, connected teams and workplaces
Why Join? Because culture doesn't live in a document. It lives in the small, intentional things we do every day. This masterclass gives you the tools and confidence to help others design those moments — and build workplaces where people feel connected, seen and supported.
Culture happens with or without you - rituals help make it intentional.
Presented by the WRD Co-creators:
Lorissa (founder of Assembly Culture) and Lotty Roberts (founder of MiND.U) met through their shared work in emotional culture, leadership, and change - and quickly became friends as well as collaborators.
After years of working with teams and leaders, they kept noticing the same thing: workshops sparked insight, but translating that energy into everyday action was where things fell short.
So they created The Workplace Rituals Deck - a practical, human way to close the gap between knowing and doing. It’s full of simple, powerful rituals to help teams shape a culture that’s not just talked about, but genuinely felt.
Ticket Options:
Masterclass Only – $299 NZD
Masterclass + WRD Deck – $529 NZD (Deck provided on the day at in-person events.)
Will refreshments be provided during the workshop?
Coffee, tea, water and some light snacks will be available during the morning tea break.
Date and time
29th October 2025
9:00 AM – 12:30 PM NZST
Location
Willeston Conference Centre

15 Willeston Street

What's the refund and cancellation policy?
Unfortunately we do not offer refunds for this workshop.
However, you may send someone else in your place to this workshop if you cannot attend for any reason.
You must notify the host that you will not attend the workshop and the name of the person that will attend in your spot.
If you cannot attend the workshop and have purchased a deck we will send that to you along with the digital toolkit.
If the Workshop Host cancels this workshop, you will be transferred to the next available workshop. You can contact the Workshop host for a refund if you cannot attend the revised workshop date.

description:
NZ Make Tomorrow Chapter Summit, 𝗡𝗭 𝗠𝗮𝗸𝗲 𝗧𝗼𝗺𝗼𝗿𝗿𝗼𝘄 𝗖𝗵𝗮𝗽𝘁𝗲𝗿 𝗦𝘂𝗺𝗺𝗶𝘁
The Educate Plus NZ Chapter is thrilled to invite you to our 2025 Summit taking place on Tuesday 19 & Wednesday 20 August at Victoria University of Wellington for the 𝗠𝗮𝗸𝗲 𝗧𝗼𝗺𝗼𝗿𝗿𝗼𝘄 𝗖𝗵𝗮𝗽𝘁𝗲𝗿 𝗦𝘂𝗺𝗺𝗶𝘁. This professional development opportunity will bring together Advancement Practitioners from across New Zealand, in Tertiary Institutions and Schools, all dedicated to shaping the future together.
The Summit, with sessions in Admissions, Alumni & Community Relations, Fundraising, Marketing & Communications, Leadership and People & Culture, will be more than just a learning experience—it will also be an opportunity to connect, collaborate, and share insights with professionals who, like you, are passionate about building a better tomorrow.
Through these engaging sessions, meaningful conversations, and shared ideas, you’ll gain the tools and inspiration to create the future you envision, supported by the collective wisdom and energy of the New Zealand Chapter community.
Don’t miss this opportunity … Let’s Make Tomorrow —together.

description:
Women in finance lunch, with speaker Christina Leung, CFA, Welcome to the Women in Finance Lunch event! Join us for an inspiring talk by Christina Leung, CFA at Forsyth Barr. This in-person event will bring together women in the finance industry to network, learn, and empower each other. Don't miss this opportunity to hear from a successful professional and connect with like-minded individuals. Reserve your spot now!
We're pleased to invite our members and CFA candidates to another Women in Finance lunch, this time with guest speaker; CFA charterholder, Christina Leung, CFA, Deputy Chief Executive & Principal Economist, NZIER
About our presenter
Christina Leung, CFA is Vice Chair of the CFA Society New Zealand and Deputy Chief Executive (Auckland) and Principal Economist at the NZ Institute of Economic Research (NZIER), where she looks after economic forecasts and analysis of the Quarterly Survey of Business Opinion. Christina also works with many clients looking at topical issues, including the wider economic impact of particular industries and investments. She previously worked at the Reserve Bank of New Zealand and ASB. Christina holds a Bachelor of Commerce with first class honours in Economics.
Christina will talk about her career journey and share her experiences of being a woman in the world of economics and finance.
Bring a friend
We invite members and candidates to bring along a colleague, please register for catering purposes.
Men are very welcome too!
As with previous events, we understand you're busy. It's okay to arrive late, or leave early, we'd just like to see you.
Many thanks to Forsyth Barr for hosting this event.

description:
Behind the Scenes with VicASA: BDO Wellington, 🔥 Behind the Scenes with VicASA x BDO 🔥
Exams are coming - so why host events now?
Because your future doesn’t wait for finals.
Exams test your memory, but these events sharpen your career. While exams last weeks, the connections you’ll make at BDO last a lifetime.
Here’s the truth: top firms don’t just recruit; they provide support, advice, and insider tips to help you thrive as a student and future professional. These events aren’t distractions - they’re an investment in your success.
Therefore the VicASA exec made sure these events (just like the rest) are taking you beyond the lecture halls and giving you exclusive access inside the most influential firms in the accounting world. And yes, it’s all completely free.
Wednesday 24 September – BDO Open Office & LinkedIn Headshots from 2:30pm to 3:30pm! Arrive at 2:15pm to get the full experience!
Join us for an hour long experience to talk one-on-one with the most professional bodies from both the capital and international offices. And of course, 🍴 free food — because good conversations happen best over kai.
✨ What makes this event different from any other?
Most student events stop at surface-level networking. This goes further:
At BDO, you’ll step into an open-office tour led by BDO reps, chat one-on-one with professional buddies, and even get a professional LinkedIn headshot for free by selecting the "BDO - LinkedIn Headshot" option alongside your ticket (first in, first served!) to boost your personal brand.
⚡ Why you can’t miss this:
First-in, first-served — spaces are extremely limited
Genuine behind-the-scenes exposure you won’t find at standard info sessions
Practical takeaways: real answers, real connections, and a polished LinkedIn profile
💡 These are not your average student events. They’re designed to give you an authentic inside look at the top firms, preparing you for your next steps in a way that’s practical, personal, and powerful.

description:
The Moonlit Market at The Atom - A playful experiment in entrepreneurial leadership, Date: Wednesday 15 October
Time: Doors open 5pm, adventure begins 5:30pm sharp. We’ll wrap up around 7:30pm.
Location: The Atom, Rutherford House, Victoria University, Wellington
Cost: Free (but only 25 places - first in, first served)
Step into a fantasy world where business plans mingle with strange enchantments and the market is never what it seems.
This event is designed with entrepreneurial leadership in mind - for anyone curious about the messy reality of building ideas and leading through uncertainty. If you’ve ever wondered what it really takes to test, fail, and adapt on the fly, you’ll feel right at home.
You’ll take on a fantasy character and join a small team of fellow entrepreneurs-in-disguise. Together, you’ll:
Interview strange and unpredictable NPCs to gather intel.
Dream up bizarre products that might just make you rich.
Build your idea with limited time and energy tokens.
Roll the dice and see what magical mishaps or unexpected opportunities change your fate.
The market is chaotic, the customers are fickle, and your product could become a cult sensation - or a village-wide joke.
This playful experience is more than just fun and games. You’ll get a taste of:
Leading through uncertainty
Making decisions with incomplete information
Collaborating under pressure
Turning setbacks into opportunities (or at least good stories)
No business experience required - just bring your imagination, your sense of humour, and your willingness to play.

description:
Impactful Leadership, Impactful Leadership:
What do horses, mules and the All Blacks have in common? Hear a true expert break-down what really works when it comes to impactful leadership.
Welcome to the final conversation in our Women in Business series: four events that bring you important conversations led by Women in Business and heard by everyone. In partnership with Forsyth Barr, this bar-setting series is bringing hard-hitting topics into the conversational spotlight.
What good leadership looks like has changed, but many of the methods we rely on to deliver it haven’t. This conversation will showcase what horses can teach us about impactful leadership in modern workplaces, and how anyone can turn those lessons into action that delivers.
Why be part of this conversation?
In this thought-provoking session, BBC journalist-turned-leadership coach Janine Sudbury will share how she discovered what really works in leadership development, and why traditional approaches often fall short.
You’ll take away insights including:
The three secrets of the horse whisperer that unlock authentic, presence-based leadership
How to overcome Imposter Syndrome and People Pleasing to lead with clarity and confidence
Why horses give the most honest feedback—and how that feedback creates lasting breakthroughs
Who’s the speaker?
Janine Sudbury is the founder of Impact Leadership and the creator of a truly unique experiential leadership programme that swaps the boardroom for the paddock. specialises in helping women overcome Imposter Syndrome and People Pleasing Syndrome to lead with more confidence, clarity, and authenticity.
With powerful insights and unforgettable stories, including her work with former All Blacks coach Steve Hansen, Janine invites you to lead with more purpose, presence, and impact.
What’s in-store:
5:15-5:30pm – Arrival/networking
5:30-6:15pm – Janine Sudbury speaks
6:15-6:30pm – Q&A
6:30-7:30pm – Networking with drinks & canapes
Business card prize draw:
Attend the event and go in the draw to win a “New BMW for a Weekend” and a “New MINI for a Weekend” from Continental Cars BMW and Wellington MINI Garage.
This event is part of the Women in Business chapter from our “Join the Conversation” series - 4 events that spotlight important topics through conversation, led by the amazing women driving change within them.
Attend other events in the series:
17 July: Making money in the mess - How every woman can financially thrive in messy economic times
7 August: Strengths & Superpowers - Personal branding isn’t showing off - it’s taking ownership over how you’re perceived. Join a Masterclass in making yours standout among the rest
20 August: 3 Gals, One Beehive – live! - Hear three leading women take a week in politics, and turn it into the unfiltered commentary that you wish you’d hear on the 6 o’clock news.

description:
Poroporoaki for Rosalie & Welcome to Elizabeth & Shaquille, Kia ora e te whānau EHF,
You're invited to a very special evening!
Join us on Wednesday 27 August at 5:30pm for a heart-filled poroporoaki, a chance to celebrate Rosalie Nelson, and to officially welcome our new Co-Executive Directors, Elizabeth McNaughton and Shaquille Shortland.
📍 Te Wharewaka Function Centre, Wellington
🕔 Doors open at 5:00pm | Welcome begins at 5:30pm sharp
🕢 Event concludes by 7:30pm
👔 Dress: Business casual
To RSVP (button)
To register to join online (button)
This will be a joyful evening of reflection, reconnection and looking ahead. Whether you're joining us in person or online, we’d love to have you in the room (or on the screen!) as we mark this milestone in the life of the Fellowship. You are also welcome to bring your partner.
In te ao Māori, a poroporoaki is more than a farewell; it's a ritual of transition and gratitude. A moment to steady the waka, acknowledge the hands that have guided it, and prepare together for the voyage ahead.
We’ll honour Rosalie’s contribution, and we’ll raise a glass to Elizabeth and Shaquille as they step into their new roles. Expect warmth, good company, big-hearted kōrero and a few surprises too.
If you're planning to attend in person and haven’t yet booked travel, now’s a good time to do so.

Ngā manaakitanga,
The EHF Board

description:
Build your Professional Board of Directors, You’ve got colleagues to vent to, friends to debrief with, and maybe a podcast or two for inspiration… but when was the last time you had an intentional conversation about your career? It’s time to change that. 
While coaching and courses get all the attention, there's another powrful tool that often gets overlooked: a Professional Board of Directors. The women who navigate pivotal career moments best? They don't do it alone.
Just as companies need a board to guide them, you deserve a trusted circle to help with career decisions, fresh perspectives, and ongoing accountability.

This interactive 2-hour session is for women at every stage - from new graduates to senior leaders. Over a few drinks and snacks, you’ll:
Learn: What a professional board of directors is, how they work and why they’re so impactful.
Connect: We’ll pre-match you with 4-5 others at a similar stage and situation. This will be your board for the evening!
Experience: Your first board meeting. We'll provide instructions and a simple agenda.

Bonus: Your ticket comes with a free 3-month Powrsuit membership (worth $147). Designed for busy people, Powrsuit combines bite-sized learning, peer coaching, and micro-networking in one all-inclusive membership. With weekly live events and on-demand access through our web and mobile apps, you will make step-by-step progress in your career, on your terms.
Note: While all genders are welcome in the Powrsuit network, this event is for Women+. Want to join as an Ally or learn more about what we do? Get in touch.
label: Business & Networking

description:
TENZ Conference 2025, TENZ Conference 2025
TENZ invites you to our 2025 Conference - Inspiring Ākonga Empowering Kaiako, to be held at Wellington East Girls' College, 131 Austin Street, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011.

The conference is designed for teachers and researchers at all levels of technology education and will provide opportunities to connect with, and learn from, other members of the community as well as get up to date with new products, tools and opportunities that support students’ learning in technology.

Register here: https://tenz.org.nz/2025-conference/

With over 50 sessions spanning the full spectrum of technology education - from food, textiles, DVC, and STEAM to digital, vocational, and emerging tech - there’s something for every kaiako, at every level. Dive into workshops on AI, AR, and rockets; explore neuro inclusion, culturally sustaining practice, and curriculum integration; get practical with tools like Minecraft, WorldPainter, and Brisk; or collaborate on pathways, assessment, and cross-curricular design thinking. Whether you're refining your NCEA practice, reigniting creativity, or discovering new ways to inspire ākonga, these sessions are designed to spark ideas, deepen confidence, and empower you to lead change in your classroom and community. This is your chance to connect, create, and be part of shaping the future of technology education in Aotearoa.

description:
Employment Law Session - Casual Employment & Trial Periods | Marlborough, Following on from our Disciplinary Process Workshop in 2024, we are pleased to bring you another practical and informative session designed to support employers in navigating the complexities of employment law. Join us for Employment Law 101, where we’ll cover the essential elements of starting the employment relationship on the right foot. 
This workshop will provide clarity around: 
When and how to use trial periods lawfully 
What defines casual employment and how to manage it correctly 
Best practice for offering employment and ensuring your documentation is spot-on 
Common pitfalls employers face in the hiring process and how to avoid them 
This session is ideal for business owners, managers, and anyone involved in hiring or managing staff. Whether you're new to employing or just need a refresher, you’ll walk away with greater confidence and a clearer understanding of your obligations.
The workshop will be delivered by Tim Blake, General Counsel for Hospitality New Zealand, and includes time for questions and discussion.
Don’t miss this opportunity to strengthen your employment practices and stay on the right side of the law.

description:
The Power of Successful Cross-Sectoral Collaboration: A Real-World Example, From Pilot to Powerhouse: The BEATS Research Journey
Presented by Dr Sandra Mandic
In a world where complex challenges demand bold collaboration, the BEATS Research Programme stands as a beacon of what’s possible when sectors unite with purpose.
Join Dr Sandra Mandic as she shares the remarkable 10-year journey of BEATS—an award-winning, interdisciplinary initiative that brought together academia, local government, schools, and communities across Dunedin. From its humble beginnings in 2013 to its international recognition by 2023, BEATS exemplifies the transformative power of shared vision, strategic leadership, and cross-sectoral teamwork.
In this session, you’ll discover:
🔍 How BEATS advanced scientific knowledge while serving real-world needs
🤝 What made its partnerships thrive across disciplines and institutions
🧭 Key lessons in leadership, adaptability, and long-term sustainability
🚀 Insights to inspire your own collaborative projects and research endeavours
Whether you're in education, policy, research, or community development, this talk offers a compelling blueprint for building impactful, resilient collaborations.
Explore the full story at AGILE Research – BEATS Programme
About Sandy
Dr Sandra Mandic, PhD, PMP is a transformational leader, innovator and award-winning researcher and author. Sandra’s personal and professional journey spans nine cities across five countries and three continents – including Europe, Canada, United States and New Zealand. She speaks four languages and has experience of working in academia, government and business sectors. Sandra was the founder and lead researcher on the award-winning BEATS Research Programme (2013-2023). She is also the founder and the director of the research consultancy AGILE Research Ltd. and the creator of the Compass Guide Research Training resources which currently include four books and over dozen research training and project management courses.
More information about Dr Mandic’s background and the link to her brief curriculum vitae:
https://agileresearch.nz/about-the-author/

description:
Epigenetics Congress, Sciinov Group is elated to announce the Epigenetics Congress, scheduled as a hybrid event on October 23-24, 2025, in San Francisco, CA, USA.

The Epigenetics Congress 2025 is set to be a transformative international conference, bringing together a distinguished group of researchers, scientists, clinicians, and industry professionals to explore the rapidly evolving field of epigenetics and gene regulation. This prestigious event will serve as a collaborative platform for exchanging innovative ideas, discussing groundbreaking discoveries, and fostering interdisciplinary partnerships that drive scientific advancements and therapeutic innovations.

With a focus on cutting-edge research, emerging technologies, and translational applications, this congress will cover key topics related to epigenetic mechanisms, chromatin dynamics, DNA methylation, histone modifications, non-coding RNAs, and their implications in human health, aging, cancer, metabolic disorders, neurodegenerative diseases, and regenerative medicine. Attendees will gain insights into how epigenetic modifications influence gene expression and disease progression and explore novel therapeutic strategies, biomarker development, and precision medicine approaches based on epigenetic profiling.

description:
Ruamahanga Farm learning day, At this Toru Trail, we look forward to a day of planting, learning and creativity at Ruamāhanga Farm. Just outside Martinborough, Ruamahanga Farm Foundation are bringing the local community together to help restore wetlands and provide greater access to the awa. The restoration is a foundation for Te Reo o te Wai, an arts and conservation programme for local primary schools.


Our hosts Jane Riddiford and Rod Sugden will share the story of the land and the conversion of a traditional stock and crop farm into a regenerative, community oriented venture. They will involve us in some of the experiential ways they are helping children and young people connect to hidden places along the Ruamāhanga. The day will include planting trees and grasses along a new wetland walk combined with nature based story telling, art and creative writing. We will have a shared lunch by the awa or under canvas if it is wet.

description:
Manawa Karioi Working Bees, Our track maintenance and planting working bees are focussing on plant species diversity rather than large planting quantities. We have ordered 500 special trees from the Berhampore Nursery. We are in this for the long haul and a forest that contains a wide range of plant species will, in turn, attract a wider range of birds, lizards, and invertebrates. A wider range of plant species also allows for the forest to naturally regenerate and helps prevent weed species from establishing.
Tools are provided, bring sturdy shoes and a water bottle, Working bees are held every Sunday in June (except June 1st - Kings Birthday Weekend) and August 2025.
Meeting at the Information Shelter in the Tapu te Ranga Marae car park at the end of Danube Street in Island Bay. Children are welcome with parents or guardians.

description:
Scaling Sustainably with Brianne West, founder of Ethique and Incrediballs, Part of the Pegasus Startup World Cup and Sustainable Spring Series
 Globally recognised environmentalist and entrepreneur, Brianne West, redefined industry norms with her bold vision and innovation, transforming a kitchen experiment in Christchurch into a global beauty revolution.
Ethique was the world’s first zero-waste beauty brand and named in Time Magazine’s Best inventions of 2020. It expanded rapidly, saving millions of plastic bottles from landfill in over 20 countries.
Brianne has won many awards including being an Obama Foundation Leader (AsiaPac), Exporter of the Year (American Chamber of Commerce), and NZ EY Young Entrepreneur of the Year, and was a finalist in the 2024 Kiwibank New Zealand Innovator of the year award.
In this workshop, Brianne will share her incredible journey on scaling, and later exiting a purpose driven, sustainable business. Learn about her current venture, Incrediballs which is set to disrupt the beverage industry, and gain practical insights on how to enter new markets while remaining true to your values.
In this workshop, Brianne will share her remarkable journey of scaling - and ultimately exiting, a purpose-driven, sustainable business. She’ll introduce her latest venture, Incrediballs, poised to disrupt the beverage industry, while offering practical insights on breaking into new markets without compromising your values.
Brianne West is a judge for the Pegasus Startup World Cup held on 9 October 2025 at Te Raukura ki Kāpiti. Learn more and book a ticket to the Pegasus Startup World Cup here.
Snacks provided, if you would like to order a coffee, please arrive earlier to avoid noise.

description:
Tree Planting at Mangaroa Farms, Tree Planting at Mangaroa Farms
Our native riparian plantings from 2023 have really started to thrive this winter, visible as you drive past the farm, or walking the local farm trail loop.

These native seedlings planted alongside the river, act like living sponges, slowing any farm runoff, filtering nutrients, anchoring soil and shading the water so that beneficial invertebrates & life forms can thrive. Creating cleaner water, richer habitat and less flooding downstream.

Keen to get involved? We have a few tree planting events coming up this season:

🌳 TREE PLANTING DAYS
- Sat 16th Aug 10am - 3pm
- Sat 6th Sep 10am - 3pm with @forestandbirdwellington

EVENT DETAILS
- Meet at 10am, 298 Whitemans Valley Road, Upper Hutt.
- We will walk 5-10mins to our planting site near te Awa o Mangaroa / the Mangaroa river.
- Come for a short time, or a long time, and join us for a kai and refreshments at 2pm after the mahi is complete.

BRING WITH YOU
- A Jacket and warm clothes - be prepared for a range of weather
- Boots or stout shoes
- Gloves - if you have them
- A spade if you have one
- Water bottle

Register at https://store.mangaroa.org/collections/events

#treeplanting #mangaroafarms #riparianplanting #nativetrees #volunteer #alwaysbeplanting

Landfills are designed to last 1,000 years! In this chaotic time of consumerism and climate change, we are facing some big challenges that we need to start facing head on! You can do nothing, and nothing will change, or you can be an imperative cog in the machine that works towards a healthier planet. description:
October Just Sew, Join us for our Just Sew - October edition!

Got a tear, a missing button, or a hem that’s come undone? Don’t toss it - fix it! Our monthly Just Sew sessions are all about giving your clothing and textile items a second life. This is a great way to take climate action in your own life – and learn new skills along the way.

Book online and bring along 1-2 clothing or lightweight household items (cushion covers etc) for repair. We will have sewing machines, needles, thread, and a selection of patches and buttons ready for you. If you have something special you would like to use, feel free to bring it along.

Our skilled volunteers will be here to help with repairs such as holes, tears, hems and missing buttons. Whether you are completely new to sewing or just need a bit of guidance, we will support you through it.

These sessions are held at Te Aro Zero Waste on the first Saturday of every month, from 1-4 pm.

Bookings are prioritised, but we will do our best to fit in walk-ins if there’s space.

As well as caring for our coasts and oceans, it’s all about community! Join us at any of our cleanup locations for a morning of litter collection and family fun.

WHEN
We kick off at 10:30am on the 13 September. We host clean up sites at 12 locations between Owhiro Bay to Breaker Bay on the Wellington South Coast. All rubbish will be gathered up around 12.15pm and taken to Lyall Bay by the playground to form one huge rubbish mountain that will be collected by the council.

Pitch in for a rubbish pile up at 12:30 at Lyall Bay playground where we will mound up our rubbish and admire our collective efforts! Then we will head to Parrotdog for a drink / kai after!

WHERE
Our fantastic friendly volunteer groups will be scattered along the coastline between Owhiro Bay and Breaker Bay. You can turn up at any of our volunteer sites:

Site 1 - Owhiro Bay hosted by Project Jonah
Site 2 - Dive Wellington hosted by Dive Wellington
Site 3 - Island Bay West hosted by Mountains to Sea and Island Bay Residents Association
Site 4 - Island Bay Snorkel Trail hosted by Friends of Taputeranga

Site 7 - Lyall Bay West hosted by Underwater Club Wellington

Seaweed and ocean-inspired artworks by Explore Your Coast Founder Nicole Miller will be on show at the 2025 South Coast Arts Trail in Island Bay, 13 & 14 September 2025 (10am to 4pm).
Nicole will be at the Presbyterian Church both days with the immersive 360° video tours of Wellington's Blue Belt and Taputeranga Marine Reserve. Come along, experience Wellington's underwater world, and be inspired to dive into our local marine reserve!

description:
Conservation Week, Skink and Gecko Live Show Reino Grundling will talk and show slides illustrating the mostly unrealised role that lizards (skinks and geckos) had in our pristine ecosystems, with some 130 or more different species! And what makes this presentation so marvellous is that he will have a number of living examples there for all to see! Great for the kids!

Conservation Colouring Competition The Masterton Library is celebrating the importance of conservation with a colouring competition—and there are some great prizes up for grabs. There will also be an informative display featuring conservation-themed resources you’re welcome to take home with you.

Dr Marie Doole Biodiversity Funding Talk Dr Marie Doole will discuss the pros and cons around nature/biodiversity credits, an emerging option for funding the protection of biodiversity, particularly on private land, by investors, whether corporate or philanthropic. Worth attending if you've been following the media hype.

Think Like a Forest Film Forest and Bird are showing this film, starring Sam the Trap Man, in three locations. The Regent have generously offered to show it where it will have the most effect—on the big screen! The film is produced by Pure Advantage who have an aspirational programme around landscape-scale restoration of native forests called Recloaking Papatūānuku.

Kōkako Morning Hikoi Join us for a special one-off tour and experience the magic of the kōkako at Pūkaha. Follow our expert guide to a kōkako hotspot and enjoy the rare opportunity to possibly see and hear kōkako. After your walk, return to the centre for a hot drink and morning tea.

Waihinga Bridge Planting Morning Ruamāhanga Farm Foundation is hosting a morning of planting and a celebration of children's voices at the start of the soon to be opened Waihinga Bridge Walkway. Tools will be provided and all ages and abilities are welcome!

Exploring Ngahere Under Story and Campfire Talk The Tramping Gently Club Art Collective (TGCAC) takes up temporary residency at Te Whare Whakapapa Raranga to explore human-centred warning systems and ngahere's role in mitigating danger. Join us in bringing the understory into te whare through kōrero and creative exploration.
label: Conservation & Environment

description:
Future Architecture of the Network (FAN) Conference 2026, Kia ora!
Electricity and electrification are seen as the significant enablers for decarbonisation of our nation. The Future Architecture of the Network (FAN) | Te Whatunga Hiko programme aspires to meet the challenges the electrical power system will face as we journey towards sustainable decarbonisation.
Our vision is to provide an infrastructure paradigm through a hybrid AC/DC transmission and distribution system that meets the needs of tomorrow’s efficient, low-carbon, reliable and resilient electrical power system.
Funded as part of the New Zealand Government’s Strategic Science Investment Fund (SSIF) on Advanced Energy Technology Platform (AETP), the research team is investigating what the future electrical power system might look like.
Hear about the team’s latest achievements as we approach the final phase of the programme.
Attendance is in person at Victoria University Wellington.
Ngā mihi nui,
Prof. Neville Watson,
Science Leader
The detailed programme will be circulated closer to the event.
 More information on the research can be found at https://www.fan.ac.nz/
If you have any questions, please contact futurearchitecturenetwork@canterbury.ac.nz
label: Conservation & Environment

description:
Our Beloved Indigenous Vegetation - Guided Walk, In this approximately one-hour downhill walk we will obtain a perspective on several native plants from the ubiquitous, such as our well-known cabbage tree, kōwhai and podocarps, to lesser-knowns such as shrubby toroaro/mingimingi, Bartlett's rātā, Three Kings kaikōmako and Three Kings vine/akapukaea. We will also discuss the phenomenon of species radiation exemplified by Hebe and Kauri.

Meet at the Cable Car Entrance Lookout, Upland Road, Kelburn.
Cost: $5 (cash only, please). or free for Friends.

This is part of the regular walks run by the Friends of the Wellington Botanic Garden, they run twice monthly throughout the year with a different topic every time.

Join the Friends for only $30 a year and all the walks will be free, as well as other great benefits.

description:
Manu Park Site Viewing, Manu Park Site Viewing
Meet us and find out how you can build your dream home in a new subdivision that combines outstanding natural beauty and a real sense of community.
The agent is on-site at the end of Karuhiruhi Street every Sunday between 10.00am - 11.00am.
Since its establishment in 2018, Manu Park has become a highly sought-after community, with Stages One and Two fully sold out. Don’t miss your chance to secure a piece of this paradise in Stage 3, where only 8 sections remain.
Manu Park isn’t just a place to live—it’s a place to belong. Designed with families in mind, it offers a safe and welcoming environment where kids can ride their bikes down quiet streets, explore nature on their doorstep, and grow up knowing their neighbours. Centrally located near Waikanae township it offers expansive open spaces and a strong sense of community; Manu Park is a neighbourhood where friendships flourish and families thrive.
Nestled within protected native bush, Manu Park offers breathtaking surroundings, generously sized sections, and the opportunity to build a home tailored to your vision and lifestyle. Named after the Māori word for bird, it sits beside the renowned Nga Manu Nature Reserve, close to Waikanae’s excellent schools and amenities, just minutes from the beach, and under an hour from Wellington city.
Teaming up with local building companies, Manu Park offers House and Land packages for a seamless home-building experience. Visit Manu Park to explore Design and Build opportunities to create a home that perfectly fits your lifestyle.
Don’t miss this rare opportunity to be part of a vibrant community where nature and modern living come together. Visit manupark.nz to learn more and secure your section today
label: Conservation & Environment

description:
Denniston - a place worth fighting for., The Denniston Plateau is one of Aotearoa's most unique landscapes and is rated by the Department of Conservation as a key ecologically valuable site. It is a unique ‘lost world’ ecosystem home to a remarkable array of life. A fast-track application to mine 20-million tonnes of coal in the area is expected to be filed this year.
Join us for an engaging session to:
Hear from experts about Denniston Plateau’s extraordinary biodiversity and ecology.
View a photo exhibition by West Coast photographer Neil Silverwood capturing the Plateau’s beauty.
Learn about the proposal to expand coal mining in the area
Wine, beer and appetisers are provided. You may be asked to show proof of identity upon arrival.
label: Conservation & Environment

description:
Winter Planting at Paekawakawa Reserve, It's our favourite time of year - tree planting!
We have planted thousands of trees in Island Bay's loveliest little nature reserve since 2013, but there's more work to do. We have around 500 plants that need help to settle into the forest in the next couple of months.
Come to one planting bee, or come to all - we love helping hands.
If planting it not your thing, come for some weeding, or just to give encouragement to the planters and the cup of tea afterward.
Bring:
Decent shoes, there is often planting on the slope
Gardening gloves
Water
A friend
label: Conservation & Environment

description:
Climate Kōrero Pōneke - Storytellers Night # 3, Join us for Climate Kōrero #3!

After our first two sold-out events, we are thrilled to invite you to the third installment of Climate Kōrero - an evening dedicated to celebrating the inspiring mahi of individuals and organisations driving climate action in our communities.

We'll hear from four passionate speakers who will share their journeys, insights, and practical ways you can get involved. The event follows the Pecha Kucha format - each speaker presents 20 slides, with each slide shown for 20 seconds. This fast-paced visual format is a great way to share stories and keeps everyone on their toes! After each presentation, you’ll have the chance to kōrero directly with the speakers, so bring your questions and curiosity.

Why should you come along?
* Get inspired by changemakers in the climate action space
* Free kai to enjoy while you listen and connect
* Meet like-minded people and grow your climate action network
* Discover opportunities to get involved, including funding through the Climate and Sustainability Fund

Our speakers:
* Gareth Hughes – Wellbeing Economy Alliance
* Ellie Clayton – Kaicycle
* Emma Osborne & Gareth Jardine – EkeRua Rebicycle
* Orini Rokx-Taratu & Santino Morehu – Future Unity

Event details:
* 5:00–5:30pm – Arrive, grab some kai, and explore info on climate action in Pōneke
* 5:30pm – Welcome and first two speakers
* Intermission – More kai and kōrero
* Final two speakers – Then wrap-up and mingling

Whether you're new to climate action or already involved, this is a great chance to connect, learn, and be inspired.

Come and kōrero with us!
label: Conservation & Environment

description:
Global Climate Leadership: UK–NZ–UN Collaboration Navigating Global Climate Leadership: UK–NZ–UN Perspective, f🌍 Global Climate Leadership: UK–NZ–UN Collaboration
Hosted by UNANZ Wellington in partnership with the British High Commission, Wellington
Join us for an engaging evening of insight and diplomacy as we explore how the United Kingdom, New Zealand, and the United Nations are working together to drive global climate leadership.
This timely event brings together perspectives on international cooperation, policy innovation, and the urgent challenges of our climate future. John Pearson, Deputy British High Commissioner at the British High Commission, will deliver a keynote speech followed by an open Q&A, offering a unique chance for attendees to ask questions and be part of the conversation.
Whether you're passionate about sustainability, international relations, or meaningful dialogue, this event offers value, inspiration, and connection.

description:
Designing Tomorrow: The SDG Blueprint for Built Environment Futures, Designing Tomorrow: The SDG Blueprint for Built Environment Futures
📅 Wednesday, 1 October 2025
🕔 5:00–7:30 PM (Networking from 5:00 PM | Panels 5:30–7:30 PM)
📍 Te Aro Campus, Faculty of Architecture and Design Innovation, Victoria University of Wellington (139 Vivian Street)
The built environment is at the heart of Aotearoa’s response to the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals SDGs). The way we plan, design, and construct our cities influences how we live — and how we tackle challenges such as climate change (SDG 13), sustainable cities and communities (SDG 11), affordable housing and equity (SDG 10),
responsible consumption and production (SDG 12), and partnerships for action (SDG 17).
This event is part of SDG Action Month 2025, a global campaign that highlights how communities, institutions, and industries are accelerating progress toward the 2030 Agenda.
For Aotearoa, the conversation is urgent: how can planning, design, and construction shape a sustainable, equitable, and climate-resilient future?
The evening will open with a keynote address that sets the stage with global perspectives on sustainability and the role of the built environment in achieving the SDGs.
Two panels will then explore critical themes:
• Planning + Place + People — equity, housing futures, cultural identity, indigenous leadership, and policy alignment.
• Materials + Methods + Innovation—construction technology, green standards, digital tools, and carbon-conscious practice.
Alongside the discussions, attendees can view a Student Showcase from the School of Architecture and the School of Design Innovation, and contribute to a Blueprint Wall by writing their own pledges on SDG Commitment Cards, ensuring the event concludes with collective action as well as ideas.
📌 Free to attend | Open to all | RSVP required
